attributes.name: Armorsmith Extended v4.6-2228-v4-6-1550963207
attributes.shortDescription: This mod does so much awesome stuff that the description doesn't come anywhere close to fitting here.

attributes.author: Striker118x
attributes.customFileName: (AutoTOP) Bat for Fallout 4 - Texture Optimization Project by torcher installation - AutoTOP_BAE
attributes.description:
I did not realize that Shambles1980 created a mod like this until I finished and was about to publish mine. I recommend you check his out to see if that is what you would prefer it.
Shambles1980 bat - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/24315/?tab=description]Bat File installer for Fallout 4 - Texture Optimization Project by torcher[/url]
After looking into what his bat did, I determined that my code was different allowing me to publish. The primary difference is that my code will work with anything Archive2 does, not just Fallout 4 while also avoiding folder permissions altogether. This is because Shambles1980's bat works with TOP and Fallout 4's internal Data folder making the install even easier than mine and you don't have to touch Archive2 because it does that step for you.
attributes.modName: (AutoTOP) Bat for Fallout 4 - Texture Optimization Project by torcher installation
attributes.name: AutoTOP_BAE-28795-1-5
attributes.shortDescription:
The autoTOP is a batch (.bat) file that will make installing Fallout 4 - Texture Optimization Project by torcher easier.

This easy install is accomplished by automatically running the required programs and commands leaving the user to select the correct files.

Any texture optimization can be used if you prefer something else.<

attributes.author: Rylasasin Zzyxzz
attributes.description:
[center][b][size=5]Better Locational Damage - Robot Edition[/size]﻿
[/b][/center]


[size=3]Do you enjoy Zzyxzz's Better Locational Damage? Or at the very least, his "Ghoul Edition" on its own? Do you wish robots also were leveled up? Do you find it odd that blowing a robot's arm up causes it to just die like it was some sort of squishy organic being? Do you find it odd that robots that have been wandering around 200 years can go down with a few pipe pistol shots? Want Sentry Bots to be the monstrous machines they were meant to be?

This mod is for you. 

This "unofficial" addition to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/8515543]Zzyxzz[/url]'s "[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815]Better Locational Damage[/url]" does to robots what "Ghoul Edition" does for ghouls, but much differently. 

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Robots now operate on a sort of "Mechwarrior" type system: Robots no longer take health damage simply by shooting at their arms, legs, and head. [u]They only take damage if you shoot at the torso (where the reactor is). [/u]However, doing so will still cripple them, and blowing their arms off will still cause them to self-destruct. In some cases, it may actually be MORE beneficial to destroy their limbs than it is to destroy the core itself.[/size]
[*][size=3]Affects Protectrons, Handies/Gutsies, Assaultrons, Robobrains, Sentries, and (Gen 1/2) Synths.[/size]
[*][size=3]Robots are tougher to destroy in general. After all, they've been operational for over 200 years in most cases, a raider with a pipe pistol or the stray molerat isn't going to do much to them.[/size]
[list]
[*][size=3]Protectrons and Handies/Gutsies are still bottom of the barrel, but are still tougher than they are in vanilla. You will find it rather difficult to destroy one with a pipe pistol.﻿ [/size]
[*][size=3]Assaultrons are military-grade melee robots. You'll need concentrated fire to take one down.[/size]
[*][size=3]Robobrains are very strong enemies now.[/size]
[*][size=3]Sentry Bots are almost deathclaw-tier level threats. ﻿﻿[/size]
[*][size=3]Synths are a bit stronger than protectrons, but FAR weaker than assaultrons. Keep in mind that they also love to travel in packs. You'll quickly see why the commonwealth farmers fear these things so much.[/size]
[/list][/list] ﻿[font=Tahoma][size=2] ﻿(Keep in mind that in the case of Automatron Robots, a robot's "race" is determined by their [u]legs[/u], NOT by their torsos. A Robot that has a protectron head, a robobrain body, assaultron arms, and sentry bot legs counts as a sentry bot, not as a robobrain or protectron. I know this is weird, but that's something hard-coded into vanilla, there's nothing I can do about this sadly.)[/size][/font]
[list]
[*][size=3]Pulse Grenades/Mines and the Lightning Gun are more effective against robots now.[/size]
[*][size=3]Just to make sure Automatron isn't a complete nightmare, Rust Devil and Mechanist robots take a bit more damage.[/size]
[/list]
[size=4]I recommend you run this with my other mod, [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/39552][size=4]Automatron Randomized Bots[/size][/url][size=4], as well as the aformentioned "Better Locational Damage" mod. [/size][size=3]Neither are necessary, however.

[/size][size=6][b]FAQ:
[/b][/size][list]
[*][size=3][b]"What about Turrets, Eyebots, and Vertibirds? Are those effected too?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]No. They are not effected. Turrets and Eyebots are too weak to be worth the bother. As for Vertibirds, that has its own mod I just released, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41919]Better Vertibirds - A Vertibird Overhaul[/url]﻿. [/size][*][size=3][b]"Are the robots I create affected too?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Yes, yes they are. [i]Keep in mind that as mentioned above, a robot's race (and therefore the amount of protection they get) is determined by their [u]LEGS[/u], not by their torso.[/i][/size][*][size=3][b]"Why do I need Far Harbor?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Because Far Harbor has its own version of the Robobrain race. [/size][*][size=3][b]"Can I use this without Better Locational Damage?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Yes, you can. While it is meant to compliment that mod, just like that mod's "Ghoul Edition," this mod can be used stand alone, so you can use it with something like Unbogus if you wish, or just by itself.[/size][*][size=3][b]"Are there any scripts?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Nope. No scripts.[/size][*][size=3][b]"Load Order?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]On the bottom. It's a ES(L)P, so it will not take up ESP space. Just a bare minimum of ESL space.[/size][*][size=3][b]"Can I port this to Xbox/PS4/Beth.net?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Yes, you can. I do not care. [u]Keep in mind that if I do update this, you are responsible for keeping it updated. [/u][/size][*][size=3][b](Zzyxzz only) "Can I include this in the main Better Locational Damage as an addon?"[/b][/size]
[size=3]Yes, you can.[/size][/list]
attributes.name: BLD- Robot Edition-41922-1-11-1577177802
attributes.shortDescription: Changes the way robots take damage. Robots now operate on a mechwarrior-like system instead of an overall health system.

attributes.author: shad0wshayd3
attributes.customFileName: Baka ScrapHeap - Script Memory Limit Expander - Baka ScrapHeap
attributes.description:
This mod is primarily a fix for a problem with Sim Settlements, and other incredibly script heavy mods. However, many people have reported increased stability and performance with it, so feel free to try it for yourself. Having a larger sample size to report their experience with it can't hurt anything.

The plugin is version independent and should work with any version of Fallout 4 that has an [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/47327]Address Library[/url] available.

[size=4]FAQ:[/size]
Q: What's the problem Sim Settlements causes?
A: The game allocates ~70mb of memory when reading script properties and normally that's more than enough for the vanilla game, but Sim Settlements eats a ton of that, and with too many city plans, the game won't load saves anymore. This plugin doubles, triples, or quadruples that memory allocation to ~130mb, ~200mb, or ~270mb.

Q: Will this mod help with x, or fix x?
A: I don't know, maybe? This patch will affect many things, and I don't know the full of extent of what it'll affect, and whether it'll cause problems or fix existing ones. Let me know how it works for you, if there are problems I can look into them, and if there aren't- that's great.

Q: Source?
[url=https://github.com/shad0wshayd3/BakaScrapHeap]GitHub[/url].
attributes.modName: Baka ScrapHeap - Script Memory Limit Expander
attributes.name: Baka ScrapHeap-46340-1-3-1603929984
attributes.shortDescription: A version independent F4SE plugin that expands the default size of ScrapHeap allocations.

attributes.author: Moonracer
attributes.description:
Better Bloatflies adds the bloatfly larva syringe effect to bloatfly projectiles. If an NPC is hit with a bloatfly projectile and dies within 90 seconds there is a chance their corpse will spawn a new bloatfly. I've also increased the base damage and radiation damage of bloatfly projectiles slightly.

This mod does not edit bloatflies directly (just it's "weapon") or change how the bloatfly larva syringe works so it should be compatible with most mods. Taged as an esl light mod as it is very small. Not compatible with Lunar Fallout Overhaul as this is already in that mod.

This makes bloatflies a little more interesting as they can have much more of an impact in random encounters against other NPCs. It also means the bloatfly larva syringe can cause a cascade effect if you get lucky. You can imagine that these insects aren't just attacking but laying eggs on(in?) potential hosts. This mechanic is just a sped up interpretation of their reproductive cycle.
attributes.name: Better Bloatflies-44117-1-1585419705
attributes.shortDescription: Better Bloatflies adds the bloatfly larva syringe effect to bloatfly projectiles. If an NPC is hit with a bloatfly projectile and dies within 90 seconds there is a chance their corpse will spawn a new bloatfly. I've also increased the base damage and radiation damage of bloatfly projectiles slightly.

attributes.author: Zzyxzz
attributes.customFileName: Better Explosives Redux
attributes.description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/V3rmny6.png[/img]

[font=Verdana][b][size=4]Damage types [/size][/b]
[size=3]are now tied to their real resistances instead of the plain energy resistance.[/size]

[size=3]Fire is now tied to fire resistance.[/size]
[size=3]Cryo is now tied to frost resistance.[/size]
[size=3]Electric is now tied to electrical resistance. [/size]
[size=3]What does that mean? [/size][size=3]Well, if you have, for example, no fire resistance, fire will hurt. For you and your enemies.[/size][/font]


[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Radius[/b][/size]
The game has two types of radius.

[list]
[*][font=Verdana][size=3][b]Inner radius[/b][/size][/font]
[/list] ﻿Within the inner radius, the explosion will deal full damage.
[list]
[*][font=Verdana][b][size=3]Outer radius[/size][/b][/font]
[/list] ﻿From the end of the inner radius, to the end of the explosion the damage gets reduced till you receive no damage.


[/font][size=4][b]MCM[/b][/size]
[size=3]Allows you to configure several things.[/size]

[list]
[*][size=3][b]Bear Trap [/b]  ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ [/size]
[/list][size=3]A bear trap will cause fatal limb damage, when enabled.[/size]

[list]
[*][size=3][b]Molotov Fear Effect  [/b] ﻿[/size]
[/list][size=3]Enemies caught in flames run away.[/size]
[b]
[list]
[*][size=3][b]Molotov Strength [/b]-[b] [/b]Raw damage, before fire resistance is applied:[/size]
[/list][/b][size=3]Vanilla - 4 damage per sec. for 20 seconds[b]
[/b]Medium - 8 damage per sec. for 20 seconds
High - 12 damage per sec. for 20 seconds[/size]

[list]
[*][b][size=3]Bear Trap Break Chance[/size][/b]
[/list][size=3]Chance of a Bear Trap to break, after triggering.[/size]


[size=4][b]Damage[/b][/size]
[size=3]The damage has been greatly increased. And explosives are now able to kill things. Use explosive objects now to your advantage. Lure your enemies to them and watch them explode. But damage is not all. It's all about [b][u]utility[/u][/b]. [/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/Zsn7mDg.png[/img]

[size=3]They are no longer an instant area of effect damage. Instead they are now a burning effect. They are very effective in killing your enemies. Watch them slowly burn and die. Molotovs now are also able to ignite yourself. Yes this a new thing, by now.
If enabled, burning enemies will flee.
[/size]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/kQYN855.png[/img]

[size=3]Fragmentation grenades and mines stay classic. Grenades deal more damage and a higher inner radius and outer radius to make them more effective vs multiple enemies.
Mines deal more damage and have an increased inner radius to make them more effective vs running targets. Outer radius is unchanged.
Force has been greatly reduced. So nothing fancy here.
(If you trigger a mine, run.)[/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/LjfIN14.png[/img]

[size=3]They are now much more effective against robots and have a bigger radius than before. They are also able to stun Synths, Radscorpions, Turrets and giving you more time to destroy/kill them or escape from them.[/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/Kc4SEj5.png[/img]

[size=3]Fatmans and Nuka Nuke grenades, except their very high explosive damage and high radius, now leave a radioactive area after explosion, like in previous Fallout games.[/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/056Um2D.png[/img]

Cryo grenades and mines have been reworked. They are now able to deep freeze(immobilize) Insects (Bloatflies, Bloodbugs, etc.), Ghouls, Mirelurks (Crabs), Dogs, Humans and other enemies that are small to medium sized. You are not able to deep freeze a supermutant or a deathclaw. You will figure it out by playing, what is possible and what not. While the effect takes place, they suffer additional cold damage overtime for the duration of the effect.


[img]https://i.imgur.com/Ofdb3Wi.png[/img]

[size=3]Deal high energy damage to burn your target to green goo.
( or to skeletons, if you are using CROSS Crit Gore-verhaul - https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23780/ )
The inner radius has been increased, to make the physical damage slightly more effective, but the main damage is done by the energy burn effect.
Plasma mines now have a custom explosion with a smaller radius. (They shared the same explosion before.)
Force has been greatly reduced.
Sound level has been reduced from very loud to normal.[/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/j7usWlt.png[/img]

[size=3]Is now the improved Molotov version. It features a blue flame, explosion and burn effect. It deals more damage than Molotovs and do not explode on contact.[/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/e49ubdA.png[/img]

[size=3]Now deal very effective limb damage. Bear traps are now dangerous for you and your enemies. You can trigger your own traps and perks won't save you. If you put your feets into them, it will hurt and cripple your limbs. Bear traps are very effective in crippling legs.
Caltrops now deal increased medium limb damage and can also easily cripple your enemies. The poisoned version, has a reworked poison effect. It will slowly deal damage, but after some seconds it will take full effect and deal much more damage.[/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/Aew0cvH.png[/img]

[size=3]Your environment is now more deadly than before. Use it to your advantage. Car explosions deal much damage. Oil traps will burn you alive. Always check for hidden bombs and watch your steps. 
Killed a robot and want to loot it? You may want to check if it's going to explode, before trying that.[/size]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/NmiOcyw.png[/img]

[size=3]Flamer and similar weapons have their base damage element changed to their correct type and modifications have been adjusted too.


[img]https://i.imgur.com/RzBefHG.png[/img]﻿
[list]
[*][size=3]Perk adjustments[/size]
[*][size=3][s]Nuka Quantum Grenade leveled list injector[/s] (My other mod Better Locational Damage already has that option in the holotape https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815 ) Done[/size]
[*][size=3]New fancy effects[/size]
[*][size=3]New custom grenades (maybe)[/size]
[/list][/size]



[center][size=5][b]Want to support me?[/b]
[/size]
[url=https://www.patreon.com/Zzyxzz][/url][url=https://www.patreon.com/Zzyxzz][img]https://i.imgur.com/kjUWbXi.png[/img]﻿[/url]﻿

[url=https://ko-fi.com/zzyxzz][img]https://i.imgur.com/thNBDs3.png[/img]﻿[/url]﻿[/center]
[center][url=https://discord.gg/bBMDQUfuMu][img]https://i.imgur.com/xsWPvks.png[/img][/url]﻿﻿[/center]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/sFGsjux.png[/img]

[size=4][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815]Better Locational Damage[/url]
Most realistic damage overhaul you'll find on the whole nexus. Promised.
Features: Scripted headshots, scripted dismemberment, bleedings, stagger ,stab 
your enemies from behind, Shotgun knockback and more! Balanced melee and
range combat. Settings holotape and MCM available to tweak features to your 
liking or completely disable them!

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13193]Give me that bottle[/url]
Ever wondered that you drink a beer for example and the bottle is magically gone? With the new survival mode you could use the bottle to 
get some water! But how to get this bottle!? Give Me That Bottle fixes 
that and gives a bottle in return! This mod adds new water bottles and 
cooking recipes to turn your dirty water into purified water

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3648]Better Explosives[/url] (Previous version of this and no longer be updated, but still valid)
Better Explosives overhauls explosives in Fallout 4.
The aim of this mod is to make explosives deadly, more fun and make them differ from each other.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33759]Game Configuration Menu[/url]
GCM allows you easily set many game settings without the need of additional ESPs or console commands. [/size]
attributes.name: Better Explosives Redux-37572-1-2-0-1557062909
attributes.shortDescription:
Rebalances the damage, radius and force of explosions. Making them more effective & realistic.
Features the revamped Nuka Quantum Grenade. It works similar to a molotov but more effective and new visuals.
Cryo-nades can now deep freeze your target. Pulse grenades are very effective vs robots and can stun Synths. And much more.

attributes.author: xandarori
attributes.description:
[center][font=Verdana][img]http://i.imgur.com/R62tgQc.png[/img]
[youtube]_FauNUcyX80[/youtube]

[/font][/center][font=Verdana]

[size=4][b]Stuff this mod sorts
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/b][/size]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/irVJBXW.png[/img]

[size=3]The different tags ( ), [ ] and { } changes the order they show up at in the sorting.

Some head items in game that are being sorted can contain mods but as it was only around 4 items i let it slide (not counting railroad mods)[/size]

[/font][center][/center][font=Verdana][b][size=4]Stuff it doesn't sort atm[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]At first I couldn't sort the prefixes the mods created on armors and weapons as it would ruin the sorting.
But that is now possible with the help of mods that changes the order mod prefixes show up in the item names, like these mods [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5605/?]"Better Armor and Weapon naming and sorting"[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4878/?]"Armor Tag Sorting"[/url]
[/size][/font][font=Verdana]

[/font][b][size=4]
[font=Verdana]Compatibility[/font][/size][font=Verdana][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/font][/b][font=Verdana]
[size=3]The .esp version will conflict with other .esp mods that changes the same FormIDs, depending on load order they will overwrite each other.
The .STRINGS version is compatible with other .esp mods unless they change the item names as those changes are loaded into the fallout4.esm file directly but if a .esp mod changes the item names those changes will override the string files. I have included some compatibility string versions for FDI (you don't need those if you use the .esp version)[/size]
[b][size=4]
[/size][size=4]Translations
[color=#1e84cc]================================
[/color][/size][/b][/font][font=Verdana][size=3]Press the "TRANSL" Button under the "TOTAL D/LS Counter" to see a list of translations.[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5867/?]
[/url][/size]
[b][size=4]
Installing[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]
[b][color=#ff7700]With NMM:[/color][/b]
[b]ESP Version:[/b]
1. Download with the manager and chose the .esp version you want.
2. Make sure the files are being loaded.

[b]STRINGS Version:[/b]
1. Select the Strings version you need either default BIS or one with FDI compatibility (Install this after FDI).
2. Overwrite any files if needed.

[color=#ff7700][b]Manually:[/b][/color]
[b]ESP Version:[/b]
1. Place the .esp files you want in the data folder and make sure they are being loaded.

[b]STRINGS Version:[/b]
1. Place the strings file you need in the Data\Strings folder. (Install this after FDI if you used a compatibility version)[/size]


[b][size=4]Uninstalling[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3][b][color=#ff7700]With NMM:[/color][/b]
ESP Version:
1. Right click in the mod list and chose uninstall, or deselect the file(s) from the mod load list.

STRINGS Version:
1. Uninstalling with the manager.

[b][color=#ff7700]Manually:
[/color][/b]ESP Version:
1. Remove the .esp file(s) from the data folder, or deselect it/them from the mod load list.

STRINGS Version:
1. Replace the mods string file with the original one found in the mod archive or on the file section.
[/size]
[size=3][b]
[/b][/size][b][size=4]Feedback[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]Constructive criticism and tips are welcome, reporting bugs would be appreciated just make sure you have installed everything correctly and it's my mod that causes the bug. Also compatibility problems with other .esp mods aren't really bugs as it's in the nature of .esp mods please don't report those as bugs.[/size]


[b][size=4]Credits[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]Thanks to:
McGuffin that made the tool [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/215/?]Fallout 4 Translator[/url]
Stryke131 that made [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1504/?]Fallout 4 String Patcher
[/url]Delta4873 for pointing me in the right direction in learning how to create .esp files.
[/size]
[color=#00ff00]
[size=4][b]Latest Update 2.6.1[/b][/size][/color][size=4][b]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/b][/size]
[/font][size=3][font=Verdana]Fixed some bugs.
Added String file versions to the installer.

The small 2.6.1 fix was to update the .esp files to match the changes the latest fo4 update did to the fallout4.esm file.

[/font][/size][b][size=4][color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b][b][size=4]
Thanks to the people that donated! <3
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b][size=3][font=Verdana]

[b][size=4][b][color=#dd7e6b]Frequently Asked Questions[/color][/b]
[color=#1e84cc]================================
[/color][/size][/b]Q: Can you add new sorting options like sort by newest items?

A: No i can't add new sorting modes, only change the item names to let the games built in alphabetical sorting change the order.

Q: Does this work with other languages?

A: This mod would turn the sorted items into English, If you translate this file please credit me :)[/font][/size]
attributes.name: Better Item Sorting NMM Installer-897-2-6-1
attributes.shortDescription: Adds prefixes to some item names to make the sorting better e.g. (Note), (Holo), {Key}, (Chem), [Food Rad]. The installer contains different sorting options and a .esp version as well as a .STRINGS file version for compatibility.

reference.id: String Patches for Full Dialogue Interface-41659-1-5-1591028041

attributes.author: Wrathmaniac
attributes.description:
[u][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#00ff00][size=6]Welcome to Better Manufacturing![/size][/color][/font]
[/u]
[size=5]This mod adds a TON of stuff for manufacturing! New builders, scrapping machines, item extractors, conveyor pieces, lifts, and general improvements to help you setup the ultimate Fallout 4 factory! [/size]

[size=3]I [/size][b]strongly [/b][size=3]recommend [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15429]Manufacturing Extended[/url][size=3] in Tandem with Better Manufacturing. Kenington did an amazing job and added some really cool stuff. Better Manufacturing was designed around anything MISSED by the Contraptions DLC or Manufacturing Extended, [/size][u]NOT[/u][size=3] as a replacement.[/size]

[size=5]If you like Better Manufacturing please endorse. It will help other people find it too. :)[/size]

[size=5]============================[/size]

[b][color=#3d85c6][i][size=5][u]New Devices[/u]

[/size][size=3]========================[/size]
[u][size=5]Extractors:
[/size][/u][/i][/color]
[/b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Component Extractor[/color][b][color=#3c78d8] Only Linked[/color] [/b]
[/b][/size][b][size=2]Breaks down junk from the workshop's inventory, then outputs components onto its conveyor belt. You can specify which components to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines and when toggled only pulls from those linked settlements.[/size][/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Object Extractor [b]Only Linked [/b][/color]
[/b][/size][b][size=2]Pulls items from the workshop. You can specify which items to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines and when toggled only pulls from those linked settlements.

[/size][/b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Type Extractor[/color]
[/b][/size][b][size=2][b][size=2]Adds a brand new type extractor! That's right a "Type" Extractor! Put an object of a certain type in and this baby pulls all objects of that type out of the local workbench onto a conveyor. Pretty cool eh? [b][size=2][b][size=2][color=#00ff00]WARNING[/color][/size][/b][/size][/b] [color=#00ff00]MUST READ: This Machine required a very heavy operation involving the Workbench Inventory (One of the reasons it does not link). Because of that the machine actually LOCKS the workbench when powered on and running a SEARCH. If you attempt to access the inventory while it's processing all items will "Appear" to be missing. They are not, the workbench is just locked. [b][size=2][b][size=2][color=#00ff00]You will also be unable to access the building menu during that time.[/color][/size][/b][/size][/b] I recommend one per settlement max (trust me, that's all you need). There is a setting in the holotape that will "shut down" the extractor and prevent any more searches until reactivated.[/color][/size][/b][/size][/b][b][color=#3c78d8][b][color=#3d85c6][i]
[size=3]========================[/size]
[u][size=5]Scrappers:[/size][/u][/i][/color][/b][u][size=5]
[/size][/u]
[size=4]Weapon Disassembler[/size][/color]
[/b][b]Removes/scraps mods from a weapon and [/b][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]the weapon to scrap components, I.E. Steel, Screws Ect. Can also scrap explosives![/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Armor Disassembler[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Removes/scraps [/b][b]mods[/b][b] from armor or power armor and [/b][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]the armor to scrap components, I.E. Steel, Screws Ect.[/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Mod Scrapper[/color]
[/b][/size][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]loose mods to scrap components, I.E. Steel, Screws Ect. DISCLAIMER: The mod scrapper has a UI bug where it only shows 2 of the required perks. There is a third perk "Scrapper 2" that is needed to unlock the machine.[/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Ammo Scrapper[/color]
[/b][/size][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]ammo down to[/b][b] scrap components. Amount configurable in a connected terminal. Options for 25, 50, 75, and 100. I.E. Steel, Lead Ect. NOT-RECOMMENDED AMMO: Gamma, Flamer Fuel, Fusion Cells

[b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Body Decomposer[/color]
[/b][/size][b][b][b][b]Only in manufacturing extended patch! [/b][/b][/b]Basically just the butcher and robot disassembler from Manufacturing Extended combined. Also comes in the Large Hopper variety. You know the one with the BIG open top. Nice suggestion [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2398140]Zeroteg[/url]! [/b][/b][b][color=#3c78d8][b][color=#3d85c6][i][size=3]
========================[/size]
[u][size=5]New Builders: [/size][/u][/i][/color][/b][u][size=5]
[/size][/u][/color][/b][/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Full Suit Armor Forge[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Builds full suits of armor instead of one piece at a time. Includes all vanilla armor and power armor. The recipes have been increased significantly. A one in all machine that removes the tedious procedure of building armor pieces one at a time.[/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Chem Building Machines[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Two machines that build chems. A Drug Builder and a Chem Utility Builder. Between the two, builds Addictol to X-Cell. Machines and recipes come with appropriate perks.[/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Ammo Component Builder[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Only in the Weaponsmith Extended Patch! Adds new Ammo Component Builder that builds all WSE ammo components and two BM casing kits. The kits are ingestible items that give you weaponsmith bullet casings. When used the ingestible allows you to select a casing from your inventory and  create 1000 casings of the type selected.[/b]

[b][b][b][b][color=#3d85c6][i][color=#3c78d8][size=4]========================[/size][/color]
[size=5][color=#3c78d8][u]General Contraptions Improvements:[/u][/color][color=#3c78d8] [/color][/size][/i][/color][/b][/b][/b][/b][size=5]
[/size]
[b]
[color=#3c78d8][size=4]Workshop Menu Organization[/size][/color]
[color=#f4f4f4][size=2]Completely reorganized the building menu for Manufacturing objects. Now manufacturing objects are split into further categories making them easier to find and build.[/size][/color]

[color=#3c78d8][size=4]Builder [/size][/color][/b][color=#3c78d8][size=4][b]Improvements[/b][/size][/color]
[b]With the new Better Manufacturing Holotape builders have quite a few new features that gives you whole new ways to setup your building. You can adjust the amount of recipes a builder will output, options for 1, 2, 5, and 10 items at once. There is also a new Cycle feature allowing you to change all builders to be on a cycle rather than one selected recipe. They can also be set to a "Power-Off" state that pushes any items out of their inventory and halts building.[/b]
[color=#3c78d8][size=4]
[b]Better (Faster) Hoppers[/b][/size][/color][b]
Vacuum hopper pulls components from stored containers much faster than the standard one.  Can be changed in a linked terminal to select the amount of components pulled each cycle. [b]Large hoppers are also affected by Hopper Terminal settings.[/b][/b]
[size=4] [/size]
[size=4][color=#3c78d8][b]Converging Conveyors[/b][/color][color=#3c78d8][b]
[/b][/color][/size][size=2][b]Now with all necessary Converging Conveyors by  [/b][url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/2308173-hans199/]hans199[/url][b]! That includes Left/Right C turns, a wire fence to help keep objects on conveyors and converging straight belts. Thank you hans! Please go endorse his mod as well! Full details [/b][u][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#00ff00][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16007]here[/url]﻿.[/color][/font][/u][b]  [/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
"Y" Branch Joining Conveyors[/color]
[/b][/size][b]New Conveyor Belt Y Joiners to combine conveyor lines. In vanilla you could split lines and with these you can reconnect them.[/b][b]Two for directions Left and Right, one elevated, one on the floor. [/b][/size]

[size=4][color=#3c78d8][b]Conveyor Belt [/b][/color][color=#3c78d8][b]Improvements[/b][/color]
[/size][b]Includes the ability to modify the speed and direction of all basic conveyor belts at a linked terminal. However, if you are having bugs my first suggestion is to store and replace the belt and/or connected terminal. I have noticed issues with already placed conveyor belts. [/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Upwards Conveyor Belt[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Belts that go up! I can't believe this wasn't added in vanilla. Goes well with the speed increase to get stuff up them. A little buggy but they work. [/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Downward Lifts & Lift Improvement[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Lifts that take items from the top and move them to the bottom effectively taking items down floors. Two for each direction (forward, backward. left and right), one elevated, one on the floor. All lifts are improved and move items much quicker.[b][b][b][b][b]
[b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Left Facing Sorters & Type Sorter
[/color][/b][/size][b][size=2]Left facing sorters for when you want to go, you know, left...... One for each flavor, regular, components, or by type. The type extractor by  [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2652197]steamcanuck[/url], Thank you steamcanuck! Please go endorse his mod as well! Full details [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16966]here[/url]﻿.[/size][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][b][b][u][i][size=5]

[color=#ff7700]New Fat Dynamic with Constructable items [/color][/size][/i][/u][/b][/b][size=2]

[size=2][b]Completely Optional! The feature can be turned on in the Better Manufacturing holotape. Animal Fat can only be found on Dead Animals and through butchery if you have Manufacturing Extended. [/b][/size][b]Adds new recipes to the Chem station and a new Component Animal Fat. Some new recipes are the Blood Draw Kit, Acid Bottle, Ballistic Fiber Roll, Antiseptic Bottle, Large Oil Can and Leather roll. 
Note: It is possible to turn on fat through console. To do that you need to change two Global Variables. [/b][/size][b][left]To find the Globs its "help fat 3"
To make it active you need to set both values. The fat chance value is in reverse, this is very important! It is chance for none. So 100 is 100% chance there is none and 0 is a 0% chance there is none.
The commands are:
set GLOB_BM_Fat_Active to 1
set GLOB_BM_Fat_Chance_Val to 0[/left][/b][size=2][b]
[/b][/size]
[size=4]============================[/size]
[size=5][u]Special Notes:[/u]
[/size]
[size=4]This mod is inspired by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/1179663]Kentington[/url] author of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15429]Manufacturing Extended[/url]. Special thanks Kenington![/size]

[size=4]Special thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2652197]steamcanuck[/url] for allowing me to include his mod, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16966]Equipment Sorter[/url]! Please go endorse his mod as well.
[/size]
[size=4]Special thanks to [/size][b][size=4] [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/2308173-hans199/]hans199[/url] [/size][/b][size=4]for allowing me to include his mod, [/size][u][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#00ff00][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16007][size=4]Converging Conveyors[/size][/url][/color][/font][/u][size=4]! Please go endorse his mod as well.[/size]

[size=4]Also, video making is not my strong suit. I'd love to add a video showcasing Better Manufacturing and will eventually. If there is someone who is willing to do that I would be extremely grateful. Please message me if you are interested![/size]

ME: To the nexus community and all my supporters I want to say thank you! The community is astounding! Your feedback, suggestions and general attitude helped shaped Better Manufacturing to the mod it is today. Knowing that my mod is liked and appreciated makes it worth it!  I may reopen this mod with some of the excellent suggestions I have been receiving, so keep it up! 


[b]==========================================[/b]

[b][u][size=5]General Warnings:[/size][/u]
[/b]
[size=5]Must have [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url] installed. If you are having trouble there are many youtube videos out there to assist you.[/size]

[size=5]Must have Automatron, Nuka World, Far Harbor and of course Contraptions DLCs installed! [/size]

[size=5]As with any mod on the Nexus, I suggest you backup a save before testing any new mod. The usual location is C:\Users\"YourUsername"\Documents\My Games\Fallout4\Saves .[/size]
[b][u][size=5]
[/size][/u][/b][b][size=4]==============================
[/size][u]Compatibility:[/u][/b]
[size=4]
[font=Tahoma][u]Versions 3.0 - 3.2.1:[/u] Minor conflicts with any mods that change, Large Ammo Types, and MISC Object Weapon/Armor [u]mods[/u]. If there are any mods that you want a patch for please don't hesitate to ask.[/font][/size]

[size=4]============================[/size]
[size=5][u][b]Version Update Warnings:[/b][/u][/size]
[size=4] 
Fat is off by default and needs to be turned on in the holotape. Fat will NOT disappear if you already have it. This only removes fat from animal drops and hides all constructable items. 

Version 3.0 changes all builder scripts. If you have issues with ANY contraptions machines I suggest you store them into the workshop and replace them.
[/size]
[size=4]============================[/size]
[u][b][size=5]Mods Worth Mentioning
[/size][/b][/u]
[size=4]Check out this [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4042]Legendary Modification mod[/url], it's excellent!

A great mod for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/19317]storing all junk[/url] that goes nicely with hoppers and containers.

A small mod of mine that improves the Loads Caliber Switchers. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27381]Better Loads Switches[/url].[/size]
[b]

==========================================
[size=4][b][b][size=5][u]Future Plans[/u]:[/size][/b][/b]

I am officially done with this mod! If any major issues or bugs pop up I will fix them. Also, suggestions are still welcome! If you have an awesome idea and I like it I may still add to this mod. Cheers! 

If you are looking for a patch for a weapon mod I suggest looking into basic modding yourself. Take a look at this [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/544/?]Article[/url] I wrote explaining how to add weapons to the scrapper correctly. Everything else should scrap without conflicts unless the Mod Author did not tag them with the vanilla keywords.
[/size][/b]

[b]==========================================
[/b]
[u][color=#cc4125][b][size=5]Version Notes[/size][/b]
[/color][/u]
[color=#00ffff][size=4][u][color=#ffff00]All versions below 2.0.4[/color][/u][color=#ffff00][u] :[/u] I recommend you read through the Version notes in Yellow below. There was a major bug in the disassemblers and scrappers that you need to be aware of. [/color]

[u]Versions 1.5 - 1.9.4:[/u] I highly recommend you update to later versions! See version log in Light Blue and message below for more info.[/size]
[/color][size=2]
[size=2][size=2]v.3.3- Bug fixes, tweaks, and new features
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Fixed the WSE patch to change all the misc mods to use the ModCrate nif model not the modbox.nif due to the issues with that nif model blocking conveyor lines[/size]
[*][size=2]Reduced the scrap out for the ammo scrapper. I felt is was too much compared to average build recipe.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added in Hans's Lef Sorter nif model to fix the conveyor issue. Now the sorting conveyor moves in the correct direction Thanks again Hans![/size]
[*][size=2]Fixed the ammo builder bug in the builder script for too many output items when the builder amount was changed in the holo tape.[/size]
[*][size=2]Changed the Weaponsmith Ammo Component builder to create the actual components making it easier to use. Meaning primers and gunpowder come directly out of the machine ready to be used.[/size]
[*][size=2]Changed the way the Casings kit work to be more useful. Now they will create 1000 of a specific selected case in the inventory[/size]
[*][size=2]Two separate kits. One for shotgun ammo one for standard brass ammo.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adjusted the Casings Ammo Kit recipe to reflect the amount of casings received.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added items to the terminal display to display locked recipes with missing perks requirements. This effectively un-hides locked recipes and allows users to see what perks are missing.[/size]
[/list]v.3.2.1- Menu Organization Option and new Patch
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Added in the menu organization as an option in the installer. This will fix any compatibility issues with other manufacturing mods.[/size]
[*][size=2]Also adds another patch for Crafting Framework.[/size]
[/list]v.3.2- New features, requirement changes, and small tweaks
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Removed the AWKCR dependency! I was able to accomplish the scrapping with just vanilla keywords on items.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adjusted the Constructable Objects recipes to use 1 less Purified Water.[/size]
[*][size=2]Removed unneeded references from esp.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added new help item in the Holotape for Object Extractor-Only linked to help Users understand exactly what it does.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a new setting to the Holotape for builders to "Turn-Off" building and output inventory. This is so users can effectively empty the Builders of components and objects.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a new Setting to the Holotape to "Turn-Off" Component/Object Only-Linked extractors. This goes nicely with the builder "Turn-off" function. WARNING: Does not work with Manufacturing Extended Component/Object Extractors![/size]
[*][size=2]Merged in Converging Conveyors. Thanks Hans119![/size]
[*][size=2]Added more organization to the conveyors. After adding in converging conveyors the menu ingame seemed cumbersome. Now there are 4 categories in conveyors. Elevated, floor, Lifts, Misc.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.3.1- Bug fixes, increased code stability, and some new patches[/size]
[list]
[*][size=2] Completely, fixed the Armor and Disassembler slow down issue. Now the machines will function just like the mod scrapper and ammo recyler outputting many components quickly. [/size]
[*][size=2]Made all builders more reliable when outputting large items. For some reason even the DLC was missing the necessary pieces of information to properly handle outputting large items. Now the builders will check the LargeItemFormList and output items appropriately. Also added a delay for building large items to prevent items from being thrown.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added better checking in the disassembler code to prevent papyrus errors. Also changed the way the disassemblers disposed of items. Now it is using a much more reliable method of removal and deletion of objects.[/size]
[*][size=2]Took another pass at the Armor FormList to ensure more items are correctly scrapped. With the new Code for the Armor Disassembler it will scrap ANY peice of armor, if the armor is not identified it will provide default scrap.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added Metal, Combat, and Synth helmets to full Armor forge.[/size]
[*][size=2]Modified the response for the cycle turn off to include more information with selected recipes.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a patch to the installer to fix Soylent Green Issues with new BM organization.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a patch for Manufacturing Extended Expanded[/size]
[/list]v.3.0- Large Update with new features and improvements
[list]
[*][size=2]Removed All keywords added to melee weapons and added all Melee weapons through AWKCR keywords meaning there are Absolutely 0 possibilities for weapon conflicts with Better Manufacturing![/size]
[*][size=2]Reworked the Mod scrapper code to be more adaptable. Now uses similar code structure to Weapon and Armor scrapper. Modified the default scrap output for Weapon/Armor mods from other Nexus Mods.[/size]
[*][size=2]Reworked organization of Machines in build menu. No more long scrolls left or right searching for your machine. Now things are better organized for easier building.[/size]
[*][size=2]Ammo recycler now has a terminal link to change the total amount of bullets scrapped at once. Settings for 25, 50, 75, and 100 bullets at a time.[/size]
[*][size=2]With the new Settings holotape Fat is 100% optional! Just make sure to turn it on if you update![/size]
[*][size=2]Animal fat is now injected into the Leveled Lists in a Quest script. Removing any compatibility issues with other mods that change Animals Leveled Lists.[/size]
[*][size=2] Modified fat to appear less often on animals and scale with the extra meat perk.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a settings holotape: Can be built at Chem Stations and should be added the first time you run the game after install. It has some nice features for manufacturing and the mod.[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: You can change the number of output items for builders.Settings for 1, 2, 5, and 10[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: There is also a new cycle feature for builders. When "on" the cycle will ignore the selected recipe from the terminal and build anything possible from it's list of recipes in a cycle. [/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: Can completely disable the "Fat" feature with build-able items. Effectively removes the "Fat" feature along with the constructable items.[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: Added an option to "Power off" the Type Extractor to help with the workbench being locked.[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: Added a general help page[/size]
[*]With this latest update Better Manufacturing is almost Compatibility issue free! Possible Compatability issues: Large Ammo Types, Other DLC Contraptions Overrides, and MISC items for Guns/Armor mods.
[/list]v.2.2.3 - Conflict fixes and small scrap tweaks
[list]
[*][size=2]Fixed any issues related to AWKCR and Weaponsmith updates that were not included causing some minor conflicts. Mostly with melee weapons.[/size]
[*][size=2]Changed value to fat to make it so it isn't farmed for caps and used more for crafting.[/size]
[*][size=2]Tweaked Ammo Scrap out to include fertilizer as that is common for explosives and crafting recipes for ammo.[/size]
[/list]v.2.2.2 - Some small user requested changes
[list]
[*][size=2]Changed the in-game description for the Ammo Scrapper, Weapon Disassembler, Faster-Hopper, Drug Builder, Chem/Utility Builder[/size]
[*][size=2]Ensure more simularity to weaponsmith Extended output for ammo types being scrapped. That means Nukes, Missles and regular ammo will be better to scrap in the ammo scrapper and are closer to what users would want/expect.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added crystals to good weapons, mods, and armor output to balance the scrap out.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added the hack to the Weapon and Armor scrapping scripts that pfarthing6 pointed out to speed up the weapon and armor scrappers. Thanks for the Assist pfarthing6![/size]
[/list]v.2.2.1 - Some small user requested changes
[list]
[*][size=2]The weapon and armor scrappers now run on a shorter timer. This change is to speed up the scrapping process (Due to a possible engine error with Papyrus, not as fast as I would like). [/size]
[*][size=2]The main "Better Manufacturing.esp" is not tagged as an esm file and will operate like a standard esp file.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added back the standard Cutting Fluid recipe.[/size]
[*][size=2]All "Gun" weapons no longer require the BM keyword "IsMachineScrapable", making them far less likely to have any conflict with other mods.[/size]
[*][size=2]Made some small fixes to the type extractor to ensure it operates correctly. Ammo did not work correctly so I removed the ability to add that type altogether.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.2 - Huge Patch. Adds quite a bit.
[list]
[*]All disassemblers' scrap output has been adjusted to equalize the new armor scrap output. With the great extent of items it was very tedious to make the scrap out for each specific item. What I did instead was create generic scrap recipes and add randomization to them to add variation to scrapping and balance. Before, weapons and armor all scrapped to very close to normal vanilla scrapping on a workbench WITHOUT any randomization. Now they all have a low chance to double up on certain valuable resources, along with other random balances. 
[*]The Armor Scrapper is now full functional on ALL items in the ARMOR category, that includes clothing, hats. facemasks, ect. I even got all of the armor from ArmorSmith extended since I'm using AWKCR keywords including the Jetpacks and weapon aesthetics! 
[*]Armor pieces will also scrap without a BM keyword, meaning ANY other Mod that adds armor should be compatible with the Disassembler WITHOUT fo4edits (As long as they are tagged with AWKCR keywords or Vanilla Armor Keywords). 
[*][color=#3c78d8]There is now a new Scrapper for Ammo! Due to the complexity of ammo scrapping, I had to add a separate machine. It scraps 25 of ANY ammo at a time, with the exception being large ammo items such as mini nukes. missiles, ect. [/color]
[*]Adds a brand new type extractor! Put an object of a certain type in and this pulls all objects of that type out of the local workbench onto a conveyor.[color=#ff0000] [/color][color=#00ff00]MUST READ: This Object required a very heavy operation involving the Workbench Inventory (One of the reasons this thing does not link). Because of that it actually LOCKS the workbench when this thing runs its search. If you attempt to access the inventory while it's processing all items will "Appear" to be missing. They are not, the workbench is just locked. I recommend one per settlement max (trust me, that's all you need)! [/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8]Adds the Equipment Sorter by steamcanuck.[/color]
[*]I also add Left Facing Sorters (All included)! These things are great and allow you to sort left as well. No more weird factory right only setups, or upward lifts everywhere! I also overwrote the scripts to use the BM Faster Hopper Script and tagged them to the Faster Hopper Terminal. That means they are now linked to your faster hopper terminal settings. 
[*]I noticed downward lifts were not grabbing items correctly due to the Trigger point being too high. This patch fixes those so they have lower trigger points on ALL lifts. 
[*][color=#3c78d8]Combined the Butcher and Robot Disassembler into one machine called the Body Decomposer and added a Large Hopper version as well! You know the one with the Huge Open top to make butchering easier. [/color]
[*]Added a bunch of missing items to the LargeItem Form List from the Contraptions DLC . This is aimed at fixing any hopper and builder when outputting large items. I even added Weaponsmith extended Large Items if you get that patch. 
[/list]v.2.1.3 - Small Bug fixes.[color=#3c78d8] Adds ME Power Armor Kits to the Full Armor Builder[/color]
[list]
[*][u]BUG_FIX:[/u] Fixed the missing component value on Fat Scrap. 
[*]This also significantly reduces the weight of fat scrap. From 10 a pound to 100 a pound. 
[*][color=#3c78d8]Adds the ME Power Armor Frame Kit to the Full Armor Builder.[/color]
[/list]v.2.1.2 - The Real 2.1 Release! Adds improvements to the disassemblers and scrappers. New[color=#3c78d8] Ammo Component Builder[/color]. Small tweaks and fixes.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Another fix to the Dissassemblers and Scrapper. This is the best system yet! With the previous version items would disappear well before they were scrapped. Now, items will only disappear right as they are scrapped, this ensures that the machine works as intended. [/size]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Ammo Components Builder is added to the Weaponsmith Patch. It creates new Items called "BM Ammo Kits" that on use create casings, primers, and gunpowder. This is a way to automate creating ammo components so you don't have to press "e" a thousand times! ;)[/size][/color]
[*][size=2]Separates the lifts and Hoppers again. Adds the Big Open Top Hopper to the faster vacuum hopper control. Changes the lifts to drop more items per cycle to speed them up. Lifts CANNOT be changed in the terminal.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adds fix for Blood Draw Kit with Valdacil Patch.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.1.1 - Small fixes and some new Addons.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Fixes 2.1 broken installer.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adding small fix to armorsmith patch and manufacturing extended patch. There was some unfixed conflicts.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adding explosives to the Weapon Disassembler Machine! Can now scrap Mines and Grenades. [/size]
[*][size=2]Removes DLC's as an option in the installer. All DLCs are now included.[/size]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Add a new Constructable Object Adhesive Bottle to the Chem station and the Chem Utility Builder.[/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.7 -Finishes the Weaponsmith Extended Patch for v2.382 (2.4 Beta 35)
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Now every weapon in the version above will scrap in the machines.[/size]
[*][size=2]Also changes the keywords used for weapon scrapping with Non-Melee weapons. This patch removes all of the weapon scrap keywords for those weapons as they are not needed.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.6 - Bug fixes. Added terminal configuration support to the lifts. Weaponsmith Extended Patch.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b][u]BUG_FIX[/u][/b]: Fixes the issue where items could be lost if processed through the disassemblers or mod scrapper. I replicated the issue on my end and with this version it is fixed.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adds terminal support to the lifts to help speed them up. It is combined with the faster hopper terminal. Also adds some changes to the nif models to pick up items better. [/size]
[*][size=2]Adds a first swing at weaponsmith extended patch. This first patch really just aims to fix any overwrite issues with the two mods. I plan to add full support in the future. That means that for now ALL new (or mod created) weapons are not supported.[/size]
[*][size=2]Tagged "BetterManufacturing.esp" as an esm.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.5 - Another update to the Disassemblers and Scrapper scripts.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b][u]BUG_FIX[/u][/b]: Due to the way papyrus handles removing in arrays the queue would slowly shrink. This was a weird find because I expected Array.remove() to just effectively NULL the element but it actually shortens the array. This patch fixes that.[/size]
[*][size=2]Items can now be added directly into the machines and no longer NEED to be belt fed. [/size]
[*][size=2]In the previous version if the queue was full, any items added afterwards would be added to the machine and pushed out, unscrapped. Now even if the queue fills the items will be processed.[/size]
[*][size=2]Increases the output speed of components to speed up the scrapping process when doing large scrapping jobs. The machines now output 4 components per cycle. [/size]
[/list][size=2][color=#ffff00]v.2.0.4 - Update to the Disassemblers and Scrapper scripts. [/color]
[/size][list]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2][b][u]BUG FIX:[/u] [/b]Fixes bug with Disassemblers and Scrappers where items could be lost if too many items are processed at once. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]After updating I suggest storing and replacing the Disassemblers and Mod Scrapper just in case.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]After some testing I discovered a MAJOR issue in the Disassemblers and Scrapper objects. If you setup a conveyor and started pushing items in eventually the queue could fill up and any items pushed before the queue has space will be lost. [/size][/color]
[*][size=2][color=#ffff00]This fix adds a[/color][color=#00ffff] [u]FAIL SAFE[/u][/color][color=#ffff00] to prevent any objects from being lost. That[/color][i] [u][color=#00ffff]FAIL SAFE[/color][/u][/i][color=#ffff00] is that if the Queue is full any items that are pushed through will just be added to the builder and pushed out through the other side unscrapped. [/color][/size]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]I also increased the queue size to max (128 is the Max). That means if objects that SHOULD BE scrapped are not scrapping it is because the machine is full. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]I observed this behavior after running my own objects through in my Local game. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]IF YOU already scrapped all your items it is unlikely you would be able to even observe this behavior and probably thought everything was okay. I apologize for any items lost, I was so busy pushing out changes I did not get a chance to fully test for issues and some slipped through. I suggest you revert saves because you probably lost items. [/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.3 - Fixes the Drug Builder. Adds some new recipes to the Builders.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]The Drug builder had a bug where good recipes (such as x-cell, med-x, daddy-o, ect) were completely inaccessible due to bug in the terminal where the perk conditions were incorrect.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a description to the Blood Draw Kit.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adds Skeeto Spit to the drug builder.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adds the robot repair kit to the Utility Builder in the DLC patch.[/size]
[*][size=2]Changes the terminal for the Chem Utility Builder from "Chem Aid Builder Control" to "Chem Utility Builder Control".[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.2 - Small bug fixes
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]The Left Floor joiner conveyor animation was incorrect.[/size]
[*][size=2]As of version 1.9.7, the chem utility builder was broken. Will HAVE to update to this version to fix it.[/size]
[*][size=2]Reduced the timer in the disassemblers and mod scrapper to reduce the delay on getting scrap output.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added the DLC Patch as a header to the Valdacil DLC patch to ensure the correct load order.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.1 - Version 2.0 Was missing correct keywords on [b][u]Loose[/u] [/b]mods for DLCs, this fixes that.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]All Robot mods were treated as weapon mods in 2.0. This adds more variation to the mod scrapper by adding robot mod specific keywords and scrap out.[/size]
[*][size=2]All standard weapon mods were scrapping too much for DLC weapons because they were not tagged as being standard, this affected the Weapon disassembler as well.[/size]
[*][size=2]DLC Armor mods were not tagged appropriately and were treated as weapon mods.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0 - Adds Legendary Modification support and full DLC support!
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Legendary mods are now supported in the disassemblers if the option is selected in the installer. MUST HAVE [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4042]Legendary Modification mod[/url] installed![/size]
[*][size=2]Adds every weapon and armor piece form the DLC's I could find to the disassemblers. [/size]
[/list][color=#3c78d8][size=2]v.1.9.8 - Adds the new Conveyor Lifts and Joiners.
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Adds 8 new conveyor lifts. One for each direction Forward, Backward, Left, and Right, with a set for the floor and an elevated set.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Adds 4 new Conveyor "Y" Joiners. One for left and one for right, with a set for the floor and an elevated set.[/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]v.1.9.7 - This is a major update many changes below.[/size][list]
[*][color=#00ffff][size=2]WARNING: If updating from ANY previous version you must store and replace any and all BM machines. This update moves ALL scripts to a new location causing any and all existing BM (Better Manufacturing) Machines to be broken. That includes conveyors as well. This ONLY affects BM machines so vanilla and other mods should be fine. [/size][/color]
[*][size=2]Merges craftables into the main file and removes the option in the installer. Craftables are now just part of BM! [/size]
[*][size=2]All craftables now added to the Chem Aid builder which was renamed to "Chem Utility Builder". Also adds vegetable starch and Cutting fluid :)![/size]
[*][size=2]Added Fat support to the Component Extractor and the Manufacturing Extended Component Extractor. [/size]
[*][size=2]Changed the builders to have a more diverse array of colors. That includes the dissasemblers and mod scrapper. [/size]
[*][size=2]DLC support is now in one file, no option for separate DLC support. Right now only supports Far Harbor and Nuka World for animal fat.[/size]
[*][size=2]Valdacil now has an option for Weightless or standard version[/size]
[*][size=2][u][b]BUG FIX:[/b][/u] All loose mods with the nif model "Props\ModsPartBox\ModBox.nif" were changed to "ModCrate.nif" to fix the loose mod bug where some loose mods were not being picked up by contraption machines. NO IDEA WHY that happens but this should fix it.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.9.5 - Hot fix for script overwrite issue. Scripts DLC05WorkshopConveyor.pex and WorkshopBuilderScript.pex [/size][list]
[*][size=2]Conveyors and the drug and food builder MUST BE stored and replaced.[/size]
[*][size=2]This replaces any objects that used the overwritten scripts with new custom scripts.[/size]
[*][size=2]This is also the beginning of the project cleanup of script locations. This was the beginning effort of 1.9.6 of moving EVERYTHING to the correct structure.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.9.4 - Dissassembler Backend Overhaul
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Recombined the Power Armor and Armor Dissassemblers[/size]
[*][size=2]This change makes adding custom weapons and armor to the dissassemblers much easier than before. To make an item scrappable they only need to be tagged with the appropriate keywords.[/size]
[*][size=2]This change also fixes the slow down and blockage problem, by introducing a far more efficient system than before. [/size]
[*][size=2]It also has small fixes to scraping mods in the machines, where scrap output wasn't behaving as intended. [/size]
[*][size=2]Because it is more efficient, I was able to add every vanilla armor piece and weapon I could find. I hope I got them all this time :)! The armor machine only scraps objects tagged with ObjectTypeArmor or ObjectTypePowerArmor (this means anything that is considered something other than armor is not included.)[/size]
[*][size=2]Also adds some merged files to the installer to reduce the amount of ESP's on install. [/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.9.3 - DLC Support for Animal Fat. Small bug fixes.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]This adds animal fat to fallen creatures in both Far Harbor and Nuka world if the option is selected in the installer[/size]
[*][size=2]Cleaned up the installer a bit[/size]
[*][size=2]Fixed bug with Item Overhaul - Valdacil patch not synced with craftables correctly.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.9.2 - Split the Armor Disassembler into two machines. One for Armor. One for Power armor
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]This fixes the raider power armor bug as well. [/size]
[/list][color=#ff7700][size=2]v.1.9.1 - Adds an option to the installer to add new constructable items
- Adds a new component animal fat that can only be obtained from killing animals (and butchery if Manufacturing Extended is selected)
- Adds new recipes to the Chem station and modifies a few. [b] [/b]
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Blood Draw Kit - Damages and dehydrates user. Gives user a blood pack.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Acid Bottle[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Ballistic Fiber Roll [/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Antiseptic Bottle[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Large Oil Can[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Leather roll[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Buffout[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Changes Cutting Fluid to use Fat instead of Acid[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Adds Psycobuff & psychotats recipes[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Changes mentats to use the raw components of abraxo cleaner instead of the junk item[/size][/color]
[/list][color=#ff7700][size=2]- Manufacturing Extended Butchery changes 
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Adds Mirelurk Queen specfic butchery[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Adds mirelurk eggs to all mirelurk butchery[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Adds animal fat to butchery for all animals[/size][/color]
[/list][color=#3c78d8][size=2]v.1.9 - Added the Better Armor Forge Machine
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Builds full suits of armor at a time, rather than one piece.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Builds all vanilla armor and power armor[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Machine unlocks with perks Science 2 and Armorer 2[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]T-60 unlocks with perks Science 3 and Armorer 3[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]X-01 unlocks with perks Science 4 and Armorer 4 [/size][/color]
[/list][color=#3c78d8][size=2]v.1.8 - Added the Mod Scrapper machine
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Scraps all loose mods tagged with the LooseModKeyword.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Unlocks with perks Armorer & GunNut 3 and scrapper 2[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Now adds a lot of new keywords to loose mods causing potential compatibility issues with other mods that change the MIsc Item loose mod, such as sorting mods. Do have Valdacil support option in the installer.[/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]v.1.7.2 - Added  compatibility patch for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3877][b]Valdacil's Item Sorting.[/b][/url]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]For all versions 1.6.5 - 1.7.1 you will have a bug related to loose mods, if you have a UI mod that relies on Valdacil's Item sorting or just the sorting mod itself. [/size]
[*][size=2]One mod will overwrite the other depending on load order. [/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.7.1 - Added perks to the Chem Builders.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Chemist and Medic perks were uses. Some things are not unlocked until late game with level 4 perks. [/size]
[*][size=2]Fixed bug in description of the chem builders.[/size]
[/list][color=#3c78d8][size=2]v.1.7 - Added the Chem Machines.
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Aid Chem Builder: Creates all aid type chems. Stimpaks, glowing blood packs, ect[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Drug Builder: Creates all vanilla drugs. Day Tripper, Daddy-O, X-Cell, Med-X, ect[/size][/color]
[*][size=2]If there was a recipe for the item, I used it. If not I tried to make something up that seemed reasonable. X-Cell is really good and as such really expensive and you'll probably laugh when you see the recipe. No spoilers ;)[/size]
[*][size=2]Made Dissassembler toggle message shorter.[/size]
[/list][color=#3c78d8][size=2]v.1.6.6 - Added the upwards ramp. Fixes some bugs with the conveyors.  
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Now has an upwards conveyor belt![/size][/color]
[*][size=2]Fixes bug where users could go to a terminal and click forward and it would toggle the direction to reverse.[/size]
[*][size=2]Fixes terminal bug with changing conveyor speed., ect[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.6.5 - Fixes Bug for 1.6.4 where the ESP was wrong causing the weapon disassembler to output too many resources.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]This essentially replaces 1.6.4 in functionality[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.6.4/v1.6.5 - Disassemblers can now scrap mods or remove them[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Can now toggle the dissassembling of mods or scrapping of mods using a connected terminal[/size]
[*][size=2]Added some randomization to the scrap output with mods to make for better balance[/size]
[*][size=2]After some testing, scrap output seems fair and balanced, however there are a lot of weapons, armor and exponentially more mods for those items, so I did not test everything. That's where you guys come in. Feel free to make some suggestions on output if you feel something is unbalanced. If you do make a suggestion please be specific. [/size]
[/list][size=2]v.1.6.3 - Fixed Conveyor Bug
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Conveyor Terminal did not work correctly. Setting speeds 4, 5, and 6 would set to 10. [/size]
[*][size=2]Had incorrect value on downward ramp direction, on newly created ramps.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v 1.6.2 - Renaming the Mod from "DLC Contraptions - Expanded " to " Better Manufacturing".[list]
[*][color=#ff0000]WARNING: If you are updating from version 1.6.1 or earlier this will remove all existing built machines in your save. Also, be sure to delete the "DLC Contraptions " version [b][u]BEFORE[/u][/b] installing the new version. I would also suggest backing up a few saves, they can be found at C:\Users\"YourUsername"\Documents\My Games\Fallout4\Saves [/color]
[/list]v 1.6.1 - Added appropriate perks to Disassembler machines.
[list]
[*]Weapon: ArmorSmith 2 and Scrapper 2
[*]Armor: GunNut 2 and Scrapper 2
[/list][color=#3c78d8]v 1.6 - Added the Armor Disassembler
[/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8]CAUTION: Will eat legendary armor pieces if they are vanilla based! You have been warned :)[/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][s]Armor to be disassembled must be fed through the front of the machine, meaning adding anything to the machine inventory will just be output to the other side. [/s][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8]The machine will DESTROY the armor piece, output all attached mods and output scrap components similar to scrapping the base armor (this seems fair as normally you would have to make base mods sometimes to remove the better mod). [/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8]Some items may scrap exactly the same as on a workbench and some will be different. I will not list them out, there's a lot.[/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8]If you do have a bug or issue please let me know.[/color]
[/list]v 1.5.1 - Update to the Weapon Disassembler 
[list]
[*]Added support for most, if not all, of the vanilla weapons (excluding explosives). I believe I got them all but I may have missed one or two. 
[*]Now scraps melee weapons including the ripper, baseball bat, pipe wrench ect
[*]Before this version it was only guns. 
[/list][/size][list]
[/list][color=#3c78d8][size=2]v 1.5 - Added the ability to change speed and direction of conveyor belts at connected terminals
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Due to my lack in understanding for animations I was not able to get the animation to play in reverse. The direction does change, the animation will not show it. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]If you seem to be having issues with already placed conveyor belts try to store and replace the belt, it should fix any issues.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]I would expect this speed change to impact performance in large factories USE WITH CARE.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]If you do have a bug or issue please let me know.[/size][/color]
[/list][color=#3c78d8][size=2]v 1.4 - Added the Weapon Disassembler
[/size][/color][list]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]CAUTION: Will eat legendary weapons if they are vanilla based! You have been warned :)[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2][s]Weapons to be disassembled must be fed through the front of the machine, meaning adding anything to the machine inventory will just be output to the other side. [/s][/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]The machine will DESTROY the weapon, output all attached mods and output scrap components similar to scrapping the base weapon (this seems fair as normally you would have to make base mods sometimes to remove the better mod). E.G. 10mm with standard mods 5 Steel, 2 Screws, 1 Spring from scrapping at a workbench. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Some items may scrap exactly the same as on a workbench and some will be different. I will not list them out, there's a lot.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]If you do have a bug or issue please let me know.[/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]v 1.3 - Added Dandy Boy Apples and Bubblegum to the Food Builder. 
[color=#3c78d8]v 1.2 - Added the Object Extractor Only linked
v 1.1 -Adds the Component Extractor Only Linked and the Faster Vacuum Hopper.[/color]
[color=#00ffff]
For a deeper explanation of the problem read notes below:

WARNING: If updating you must store and replace ALL machines in an existing save. If you don't it can cause crashes and bugs as the machines are now using different scripts essentially an the ones already placed have no script to point to. This affects ANY and ALL BM machines and conveyors. I realize the hassle this presents and I apologize. These are things I am just now learning. 

If you downloaded any versions 1.5 - 1.9.4 you have a potential for problems with conveyors and builders that had more than 16 recipes. You will probably not see any immediate issues and maybe none at all but it is bad practice to overwrite a Vanilla Script and use that instead of creating your own script. The reason is that it introduces multiple versions  of the same script in your deploy directory. One in the BA2 file and one in Scripts/DLC05. As you can see that is not good, and the only reason it works is because the Scripts/ directory overwrites BA2's. I'm terribly sorry for this mistake, I'm still learning myself and these things happen. I fixed this in 1.9.5, please download the latest version ASAP. Cheers![/color]

[/size]
[size=4]Requirements:
----------------------------
[b][u]Absolute Must Haves:
[/u][/b]
[u]MUST HAVE[/u] All DLC's installed.
[u]MUST HAVE[/u] [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url] installed correctly.[u]
[/u]
[b][u]Optional Additions (based on selections in the installer):[/u]
[b]All of these are strongly recommended as they add cool stuff using these mods.[/b]

[/b]Manufacturing Extended if selected.
[size=4]Legendary Modification if selected. 
Crafting Framework if selected
[/size]Weaponsmith Extended if selected.  

[u][b]Compatability Patches:[/b][/u]
[b]These are just Compatibility patches for the mod so they play well together 
[/b]
Valdacil's Item Sorting if selected.
[/size][size=4]LOADS if selected.
Soylent Green
Manufacturing Extended Expanded[/size][size=4]

[size=4][size=4]Installation
[size=4]----------------------------[/size][/size][/size]
With NMM (highly recommended): 
1. Download the Archive
2. Open Nexus Mod Manager
3. Open the "Mods" tab at the top left corner
4. Click on the green "+" sign near the top left corner.
5. Open the Better Manufacturing archive, after some Loading time it will appear in the mods list under "Better Manufacturing".
6. Right click on the mod and in the list select "Install and Activate"
7. It should pop-up the normal install window. Select the appropriate options and click finish.

Without NMM: 
1. Download the file manually.  
2. Then use your favorite .7z, .zip, .rar program to extract the desired modules from the Data folder in the archive to your Data folder ie: C:\Program Files (x86)\steam\steamapps\common\fallout 4\Data.
3. Then in the Fallout 4 launcher select the hidden plugin manager and select the modules to activate them.

Uninstallation
[size=4][size=4][size=4]----------------------------[/size][/size][/size]
With NMM:[/size]
[size=4]1. Deactivate/Uninstall the mod in NMM

[/size][size=4]Without NMM:
[/size][size=4]1. Delete any file named "Better Manufacturing-*.esp" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.
1. Delete any file named "Better Manufacturing-*.ba2" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.[/size]


[size=4]Versions 2.1.1 and before:
[/size][size=4]1. Delete any file named "Better Manufacturing-*.esp" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.
2. Delete any Folder named "Item Overhaul" or "BetterManufacturing" from folders:
[list]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Meshes[/size]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Materials[/size]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Textures[/size]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Scripts[/size]
[/list]
Versions 1.6.1 and before:
1. Delete any file named "DLC Contraptions-*.esp" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.

[/size][size=4]Recommendations: [/size]
[size=4]----------------------------[/size]

attributes.name: Better Manufacturing-26375-3-3-1-1583682573
attributes.shortDescription: General manufacturing tweaks, scrapping machines for weapons/armor/mods/ammo, new builders, improved conveyors, and conveyor lifts. Too much to list here! If you want to better your manufacturing setups you have to come check out this mod. Also contains support for other mods such as Crafting Framework and Weaponsmith Extended!

attributes.author: shavkacagarikia
attributes.description:
[b][color=#00ffff][size=4][center][url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4019243]Now Available For Xbox One[/url][/center]
Update 1.6
[/size][/color][/b]-Added new options in Configurator like Oswald teleport effect from Nuka-World. (DLC is NOT required as it uses effect from vanilla game)
-Optional land animations now work only in third-person as they were needless in first person
-Fixed issue when player was able to shoot Blink Grenades in VATS.


[b][color=#00ffff][size=4]Update 1.4
[/size][/color][/b]-Added the unique version of blink grenade - "[color=#00ffff]Infinity[/color]", which returns back to player inventory after throw, but drains action points per throw. Can be crafted on Chemistry station under Grenades section. (Action points Cost can be changed from Configurator)
-Added custom textures for Blink Grenades
-Other Minor fixes
[color=#00ffff][size=4][b]
Update 1.2[/b][/size][/color]
[color=#efefef][size=2]-Fixed permanent falling animation issue (Big Thanks to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/1675697/?]Jojash[/url] for simple and elegant fix suggestion and help, also to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/4405062/?]KataPUMB[/url] for help and figuring out what actually was causing that problem)
[/size][/color]-Added a Configurator, which allows you to control some aspects of the Blink Grenades, like changing teleport animations (three land animations added), sounds, effect e.t.c. Configurator will be automatically added to your Pipboy/misc section once you complete the quest from this mod (If you have already completed it the Configurator will be automatically added to you when you start your game)
-Blink Grenades now don't have an impulse so they won't damage or alert any NPC in any way.
-Now you can also buy Blink Grenades from Synth merchant in the Institute (after finishing the quest from this mod)(Grenades were added in leveled list by script so there won't be any issues with other mods that edit the same leveled list.
-Other small fixes


[color=#00ffff][size=4][b]Description:[/b][/size][/color]
The mod Adds a new type of grenade which teleports the player to its throw location.
[color=#00ffff][b]
How To Use:
[/b][/color]Use them as normal grenades. Throw a grenade and you will be teleported where it lands.

[img]http://i.imgur.com/cf6Wjel.gif[/img]

[b][color=#00ffff]Where To Get:
[/color][/b]To be able to craft them, you have to complete a small miscellanous type quest (which starts automatically and was made just for immersion). Then Blink Grenades will be available to craft on Chemistry station under Grenades section.
