attributes.author: Sensei Shisha
attributes.description:
[size=4][center][b]Description[/b][/center][/size]
Explosion Knockdown changes the behaviors of ballistic explosions so they send their targets flying. Grenades can be used now to interrupt your foe movement, incapacitate them for a while, or just used to see how they helplessly go through the air while you do some target practice on them. As in version 1.3 and above, Explosion Knockdown features support for Canary Save File Monitor.

[center][size=4][b]Features[/b][/size][/center]
To prevent silly situations like a cherry bomb throwing a behemoth all across the Commonwealth, I created three tiers of explosion forces:

[b]Small explosions[/b] only knocks off [b]normal-sized NPC without power armor[/b]. They now provide a excellent tactical distraction against a group of foot soldiers.
[list]
[*]Frag Grenade/Mine, ...
[*]Oxygen Tanks, Small Cars, Turret Explosions, ...
[*]Gauss Impact Explosion
[*]Power Armor Explosive Vent
[/list]
[b]Medium explosions[/b] can also ragdoll [b]Power-Armored NPCs[/b], but not large enemies (Yao-Guais, Behemoths and such). Now those Brotherhood mooks will never dare to disturb you anymore while you chill out with your buddy Danse!
[list]
[*]Missile, Broadsider
[*]Large Vehicles, Vertibird Crash, ...
[*]Behemoth Slam and Stomp
[/list]
[b]Large explosions[/b] knock [b]all NPCs[/b] down, including those normally immune to staggering. Use these if you really need to loose that Deathclaw that is chasing you for the last ten minutes.
[list]
[*](Mini) Nukes, Nuka Grenades, Quantum Thirst Zapper
[*]Artillery and Homing Beacon (which uses the Fat Man Explosion)
[/list]
Energy explosives like Pulse and Plasma Grenades, but also the Molotov, aren't affected by Explosion Knockdown, since they don't seem to exert an excessive force on the victims (for me, at least).

Optionally, you can enable knockdown for the player via MCM, and change whether wearing Power Armor should make the player immune to knockdowns. This is not recommended though since the camera forces to 3rd person on every knockdown, potentially causing problems like stuck camera (at least on my end). You can also turn off the knockdown effect anytime and adjust the knockdown chances of each tier (they're 100% by default).

As in update 1.5, you can turn off friendly fire against non-hostiles (they will respond to your explosion though and turn hostile) and your companions in the MCM.

Watch the videos to get an idea how the mod works in-game!

[b][center][size=4]Compatibility[/size][/center]
[/b]Conflicts with mods that edits the same explosion records. Mod added explosions also need patching. The base plugin only covers vanilla explosions. Patches for the following mods are included in the FOMOD:
[list]
[*]Better Explosion Redux
[*]Wasteland Imports
[*]Remote Explosives 
[*]True Frags
[*]RPG-7V2
[*]M79 Grenade Launcher standalone
[/list][u]All plugins are marked as ESL. [/u]

To patch custom explosions yourself, fill the object effect field with one of the knockdown enchantments (or add the knockdown magic effect to the existing enchantment) and fill the Placed Object field with one of the temporary xmarkers.

[center][size=4][b]Known issues[/b][/size][/center]
None currently. Any bug reports and/or improvement suggestions are welcome! Just leave a note in the corresponding sections and I'll try to answer :)
attributes.name: Explosion Knockdown FOMOD-47195-1-5-1609357835
attributes.shortDescription: Explosives now can knock enemies off their feet.

attributes.author: reg2k and Neanka
attributes.description:
[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ About ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

In the vanilla game, player dialogue requires exactly four response options - the game would not accept any more, nor any less. This system also shoehorned most dialogue into one of four types: Yes, No, Neutral and Question. As you might imagine, dialogue doesn't always fall neatly into these categories!

The [b]Extended Dialogue Interface[/b] ([b]XDI[/b]) is a community framework that removes the hardcoded 4-option limit on dialogue and adds engine support for any number of player dialogue options.

Mods can now create new dialogue experiences that emphasize player choice and have dialogue options that truly reflect their intent.

XDI does not modify vanilla dialogue on its own but will display full-text for vanilla dialogue choices.

Interestingly, in several vanilla scenes, Bethesda themselves have additional dialogue options recorded! In many cases, these are not wired up correctly for XDI (no associated responses, etc.) so they cannot simply be turned on globally. However, it is possible for modders to modify such vanilla dialogue scenes to wire them up correctly and expose additional voiced dialogue lines that are already part of the base game.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Features ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*] [b]Full dialogue text[/b]. View your dialogue options with full certainty of what you're going to say.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Dialogue cues[/b]. A question icon can be optionally displayed for dialogue options that do not advance the conversation. No more accidentally making a choice when all you wanted was to get more information. Options that end the conversation will have a door icon displayed beside them.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Flexible dialogue options[/b]. Modders: have less than four things to say? Have just two options, Or add as many options as you'd like.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]No player voice, no problem[/b]. Skyrim and New Vegas didn't have a voiced player either! XDI makes engine modifications to overcome this. For unvoiced player dialogue, NPC dialogue starts right after option selection. The dialogue camera is hot-patched to keep focus on the NPC instead of (in vanilla) looking at the player's unmoving mouth. No more awkward pauses.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Configurable via MCM[/b]. XDI comes with a MCM menu for easy configuration.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]No hacks[/b]. These changes are integrated into the engine - no need for workarounds, 'blank voice files', patching STRINGS files, etc.
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Who's using XDI? ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

XDI is proud to power dialogue for the following large-scale quest mods currently in development:

[list]
[*]Fallout Cascadia ([url=http://www.falloutcascadia.com/]website[/url]﻿, [url=https://discord.gg/FalloutCascadia]discord[/url]﻿)
[*]Fallout 4: New Vegas ([url=http://www.moddb.com/mods/fallout-4-new-vegas]moddb[/url]﻿)
[*]Fallout 4: Capital Wasteland ([url=https://capitalwasteland.com]website[/url]﻿)
[*]Fallout 4: E Pluribus Unum ([url=https://falloutepu.tumblr.com/]website[/url]﻿)
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Installation ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder and activate XDI.esm.

Make sure that you start the game with the F4SE loader.

If you get an error about the XDI plugin not being loaded, double-check that you have [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url] installed and running!

When installing XDI, make sure there is no DialogueMenu.swf file in your Data\Interface folder. This file is provided in XDI's BA2 archive. Any loose interface file in that folder will take priority and override XDI's file.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Requirements ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Fallout 4 game version 1.10.50.

[url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url], 0.6.0 or higher.

The [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497/]Mod Configuration Menu[/url] (1.2 or higher) is highly recommended if you want to configure XDI in-game. Alternatively, you can modify XDI's INI file manually at [code]Data\MCM\Settings\XDI.ini[/code].


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Compatibility ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

XDI replaces the DialogueMenu.swf interface file and is not compatible with mods that do the same. (This means the Full Dialogue Interface mod is incompatible.)

Other than the menu, XDI does not modify any vanilla forms or dialogue and will not conflict with other mods.

XDI dynamically retrieves full text dialogue from the game and is automatically compatible with all DLCs and mods that add dialogue - no patches are required.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Team ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/17152929/]registrator2000[/url] - F4SE plugin and backend work
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/6719842/]Neanka[/url] - Dialogue menu interface and additional class decoding


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ More ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Check out the Articles tab for more information!
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/551/]Background Information[/url] describes the motivation behind the creation of XDI.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/552/]Guide for Modders[/url] is a modders' guide to XDI.

Suggestions? Thoughts? Join the XDI Discord here: [url=https://discord.gg/BSSm9m9]https://discord.gg/BSSm9m9[/url]

Source code:
[url=https://github.com/reg2k/xdi]Github[/url] [C++] (F4SE plugin)
[url=https://github.com/Neanka/DialogueMenu]Github[/url] [AS3] (Dialogue menu interface)


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Acknowledgements ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Many thanks to the xSE team, for F4SE.
Thanks to the [url=http://www.falloutcascadia.com/]Fallout Cascadia project[/url] for initial ideas and suggestions.

attributes.author: Akhanami
attributes.description:
[center][b][size=5][img]http://i.imgur.com/QdGYyNR.png[/img] [/size]
[size=5] [/size][size=3]Extended weapon mods
[size=5][b]..[/b][/size][/size][size=3][size=5][b]..................................................................................[/b][/size][/size]

[size=6]NOTICE FOR 1.7[/size]

[size=5]I've decided to remove the pipe machine gun.[/size] I will be working on redoing the mod completely in the upcoming months meaning redoing all the meshes etc. I've still got my SPAS-72 mod on my backlog but I'll try to work stimultaniously on both mods.
STAY TUNED.




[size=5]Video by The Triple S League[/size]
[youtube]IfCPf3fWjAU[/youtube]


[/b][size=5][b][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2255593][/url][/b][youtube]01e70ICYzYk[/youtube]
[size=5][b]
A preview by [/b][/size][size=5][b][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2255593]BenderSKR[/url][/b][/b][/size]
[size=3]
[/size][u]Description[/u]
[size=3]This mod features a couple of new craftable mods including a stock which con[/size][size=3]verts a 10mm pistol into a rifle with new meshes and stats added to them.
So far, weapons that have new mods are Combat shotgun, Combat rifle, 10 mm pistol, .44 revolver and the submachine gun.
This mod is still a work in progress so expect updates regurarily.[/size]
....................................................................................
[u][/u]
[size=5][b][u]Updates:
1.6 - added a minigun drill barrel, minigun shotgun barrel, new weapon - pipe machine gun with a few mods for it, sledgehammer mods, pipe revolver sniper/rifle mods.



[size=4]V1.5- Some bug fixes and an autmatic receiver with drum mag for double barrel shotgun (this was a fun experiment but I don't know if I'll keep it ) .
[/size][/u][size=4]
V1.4- Some fixes to the hunting rifle damage issue, serrated blade with spiked kuckle, triple barrle shotgun, super double barrel shotgun (inspired by Doom), Mannlicher hunting rifle stock, ring sight for hunting rifle, laser receiver for .44 and a double reciever with a double barrel for .44 .
[/size][u]
[/u]
[size=3]V1.3- Hey guys, I'm back on the project, sorry for the long period of absence. Anyway, the update is includes a new weapon, a flare gun converted to a grenade launcher (Grenadegun which uses special ammo called FlareGrenade, the weapon is super early but wanted to play around with it). Also, the new Classic scope which doesn't really do anything but changes the look and has the stats of the short scope for the hunting rifle and an Anti Material Rifle stock and barrel.
That's about it, once again, apologies for the lack of updates. Expect more soon.

v1.2 - Assault hunting rifle added ,a completely new weapon , but it's a bit buggy (to obtain it do 'help assault 4' in console), UMP attachment set for the submachine gun and 2 stocks and a barrel for an assault rifle. Also an axe mod for the baseball bat.[/size]
[size=3]
V1.1- added a few more attachments for combat shotgun, submachine gun and .44[/size][/b][/size]


[u]NOTICE:[/u]
To avoid unwanted issues with some weapon clipping in FPS when using Lowered Weapons I suggest you using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6364]http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6364[/url] instead. It makes the lowered weapons [u]TOGGLEABLE[/u].

[u]Installation[/u]
[size=3]To enable modding you need to add the following lines to FO4 ini files:

Fallout4Prefs.ini
[Launcher]
bEnableFileSelection=1

Fallout4Custom.ini
[Archive]
bInvalidateOlderFiles=1
sResourceDataDirsFinal=

After that, copy all of the folder/files to their respected directories[/size]
[size=5][b]....................................................................................[/b][/size]
Reccommended mods:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4760/?]Better Weapon Mod Descriptions by [b]Takaru Minari[/b] and his compatibility patch[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16397/?]German translation by [/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/33146561]PhilippHe[/url]






[u][size=2]

Special thanks to:[/size][/u]
[size=2][url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/546441-frogs345/]frogs345[/url] for helping me out on this[/size]





[/b][/size][/center]

attributes.author: skyquest
attributes.description:
[size=5][color=yellowgreen]FO4 NPCs Travel[/color][/size]

Video by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/33197756]Koubitz[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/32558820]JrMods[/url](2:28), [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/36026330]TheWhiteCollarPlayers[/url](7:00), [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/20790749]LadyLilia[/url]:
[youtube]d8WubsmcAnc[/youtube] [youtube]I3hb9goErbI[/youtube]
[youtube]qTRzMXeE5dw[/youtube] [youtube]JVNo4S8YQzs[/youtube]

I rely on machine translation because I am not good at english.

Adds over 300 NPC's who traveling the Commonwealth, Far Harbor, Nuka-World.

Travel extensively and encounter in various places.

Travel destinations are determined randomly.

Travel destinations is more than 400 places.

Some travel destinations are unlocked by quest achievement or specific conditions.

12 Wastelander
- Default 6.
They are tradable.

6 Hunter
- Default 3.
Hunter will travel with a dog and sell items obtained by hunting, such as animal meat.

6 Scavenger (Not hostile)
- Default 3.
Scavenger will travel with a robot and sell mainly junk items.

3 Mercenary squad
- Members: Leader, Doctor, Mercenary, Robot. Default 1.
Mercenary doctor is a doctor and dealing with medical supplies.

3 Minuteman patrol
- Members: Leader, Minuteman, Minuteman, Dog or Eyebot. Default is 1.
Unlocked the first minutemen patrol if the over 6 settlements and the castle has been owned by player. The second is 12. The third is 18. Except DLC.

3 Brotherhood of Steel patrol
- Members: Leader, BoS, BoS or Dog, Mr Gutsy. Default 1.
Unlocked after the brotherhood of steel arrives in the commonwealth.

3 Synth patrol
- Members: Leader, Synth, Synth, Synth. Default 1.
Unlocked after completing the "Unlikely Valentine" or "Road to Freedom" or "Call to Arms" quest.

3 Gunners squad
- Members: Leader, Gunner, Gunner, Robot. Default 0.

3 Group of Raider
- Members: Leader, Raider, Raider, Attack Dog. Default 0.

3 Group of Super mutant
- Members: Leader, Super mutant, Super mutant, Mutant Hound. Default 0.

3 Group of Feral ghoul
- Daytime: 6 to 8, Nighttime: 10 to 12. Default 0.

3 Deathclaw
- Random: 1 to 2. Default 0.
Sleeps by day and hunts by night.

3 Yao guai
- Random: 2 to 3. Default 0.
Sleeps by day and hunts by night.

3 Behemoth
- Members: Behemoth, Super Mutant Suicider, Super Mutant Suicider. Default 0.
Unlocked after kill five giant creatures. This is the same condition as achievement "...The Harder They Fall".

Robot. Default is all disable.
- Protectrons: police, fire brigadier, medical, utility
- Assaultron and Mister Gutsy
- Sentry bot
- Mister Gutsy and Sentry bot
- 2 Protectron
- 2 Mister Gutsy
- 2 Assaultron,
- Assaultron and Sentry bot

Swarm of Bloatfly, Bloodbug, Stingwing (2 groups each)
- Random: 3 to 5. Default 0.

All NPC will affected by the [iHoursToRespawnCell, iDaysToRespawnVendor] of game settings.

In addition, all NPC will reset after a elapse of 10 days.

The mod start after the escape from vault 111.


Automatoron

Unlocked after rescued the robot with "Mechanical Menace" quest.

3 Mech Bot patrol
- Members: Leader, Mech Bot, Mech Bot, Mech Bot, Mech Bot. Default 0.

3 Rust Devil patrol
- Members: Leader, Rust Devil, Robot, Robot, Robot. Default 0.


Far Harbor

Unlocked after the Walk in the Park quest's "Defend the Hull".

2 Harbormen patrol
- Members: Leader, Harbormen, Harbormen. Default 1.
Unlocked after the Echo Lake Lumber is owned by player.

2 Church of the Children of Atom patrol
- Members: Leader, CoA, CoA. Default 1.
Unlocked after player joined Church of the Children of Atom.

3 Group of Trappers
- Members: Leader, Trapper, Trapper, Trapper. Default 0.

2 Group of Feral ghoul
- Daytime: 6 to 8, Nighttime: 10 to 12. Default 0.

2 Group of Super mutant
- Members: Leader, Super mutant, Super mutant, Mutant Hound. Default 0.

2 Wolf pack
- Random: 2 to 5. Default 0.

2 Fog Crawler. Default 0.
They usually stick to the deep fog.


Nuka-World

Unlocked after completing the "Taken For A Ride" quest.

2 Disciples patrol
- Members: Leader, Disciple, Disciple. Default 0.

2 Operators patrol
- Members: Leader, Operator, Operator. Default 0.

2 The Pack patrol
- Members: Leader, Pack, Pack Dog. Default 0.

5 Wasteland Traveler
- Default 0.
They are tradable.

2 Scavenger (Not hostile)
- Default 0.
Scavenger will travel with a robot and sell mainly junk items.

Unlocked after completing the "Open Season" quest.

2 Minuteman patrol
- Members: Leader, Minuteman, Minuteman, Dog or Eyebot. Default 0.
Requirement: The castle has been owned by player.

2 Brotherhood of Steel patrol
- Members: Leader, BoS, BoS, Mr Gutsy. Default 0.
Requirement: The brotherhood of steel arrives in the commonwealth.

2 Synth patrol
- Members: Leader, Synth, Synth, Synth. Default 0.
Requirement: Completing the "Unlikely Valentine" or "Road to Freedom" or "Call to Arms" quest.

2 Gunners squad
- Members: Leader, Gunner, Gunner, Robot. Default 0.


The following features can be configured in the [NPCs Travel Config]:
- Number of NPC
- Relations with Player
- NPC Service
- Settlements visit
- Ignore Location
- Fast Respawn
- Large Group
- Holotape settings

The [NPCs Travel Config] is holotape that will be automatically add to inventory after the mod start.
If holotape is not added for some reason, please craft it at the chemistry station. Then the mod will start in real time within one minute.

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/16987-0-1473429927.png[/img]

attributes.shortDescription: Adds over 300 NPC's who traveling the Commonwealth, Far Harbor, Nuka-World.

attributes.author: m8r98a4f2
attributes.description:
[color=#e69138][size=5][b]FallUI - Map[/b][/size][/color]

Overhaul of the Fallout 4 map. Added list of locations and workshops including text search. Add favorite locations to fast travel with one click. Many
Quality-Of-Life features like disabling the popup on empty map space click, better map zoom steps, travel and arrival time. Colored marker support. Including high-res map texture support.

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Features[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Multi-language (All languages included)
[*]List of marker locations.
[*]List of workshop locations.
[*]All lists are searchable by text input (Feature requires F4SE)
[*]Calculation of estimated travel time and arrivel time (approximately - should match time +/- 15 minutes )
[list]
[*]Including modded fast-travel-speed and game timescale support for adjusted travel time calculation
[*]Arrivel time will be displayed in the new action popup menu
[*]Times can be displayed in 12h am/pm or 24h format.
[/list][*]Allows fast travel without confirmation dialog
[*]Configurable favorites
[list]
[*]Setup up to 5 locations to your favorites! Your favorites will be shown as buttons in the interface, allowing quick access to fast travel.
[/list][*]Colored map markers. (Requires PipboyFX to be disabled)
[list]
[*]Three pre-defined color sets included: None, Colored and Colored (pastel)
[*]Support for custom color sets you can change by yourself or shared by others.
[/list][*]Configurable max allowed zoom-in and zoom-out range.
[*]Disables the annoying popup when clicking on an empty space in the map. Replacing it with a one-click set marker action. Click twice to remove marker. (Fully configurable)
[*]All click actions can be configured in the MCM configuration to like show a menu, instantly fast travel, show location on map etc.
[*]Much more intuitive logarithmic zoom steps. Allowing consistent and smoothly zooms from farest to nearest.
[*]Full support for high-res map texture mods. (Recommendations for setup values are visible in MCM menu.)
[*]Gamepad support (keys for lists, use dpad to move map)
[*]Fully configurable over MCM (Configuration in english - use a translation mod for locale translation in configuration)
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Required Mods[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface [/url]﻿
[/list]
[b][color=#e69138][size=4]The [size=5]FallUI [/size]series[/size][/color][/b][list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48958]FallUI - Confirm Boxes [/url]- Beautiful message boxes. Unique designs and styles for every box type. Including skip option!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51813]FallUI - HUD[/url]﻿ - Highly configurable HUD for Fallout 4 with in-game HUD Layout Manager.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface [/url]﻿- Just better interface for all inventories
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49920]FallUI - Map[/url]﻿ - Better map for Fallout 4. Including list of locations, colored marker, high-res-support and more!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49070]FallUI - Sleep and Wait[/url]﻿ - Enhances the sleep/wait menu by many quality-of-life features like target hour buttons and daytime graph.

[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49300]FallUI - Workbench[/url]﻿ - Just better crafting, with more display size, more data, and a tag icon picker!
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Recommended[/b][/size][/color][color=#e69138][size=4][b] Mods[/b][/size][/color][list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497]Mod Configuration Menu[/url]﻿ - Allows you to configure all settings of FallUI - Map in-game.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8989]Satellite World Map[/url]﻿ - High-res map texture mod with satellite world map (Uses ESP for extending outer map area)
[*]or: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9414]Satellite Color World Map Combo[/url]﻿ - Extended High-Res map. Dont need a ESP. Optional POI/magazines/bobblehead/road locations.
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface[/url] (Min. version [b]1.12.1[/b])
[*]Install this mod with any ModManager
[*]Done.
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Load order[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*](Anywhere) FallUI - Inventory Interface
[*](Optional) High-res map texture mod
[*]FallUI - Map
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Savegame safety[/b][/size][/color]
Absolutely safe. Does not change or modify anything in your game or savegame data. You can install and uninstall it at any time.

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Credits[/b][/size][/color]
Bethesda
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/46870918]MasterLix[/url] and his whole discord server for the big support and beta testing
The NEXUS community!
attributes.name: FallUI - Map-49920-1-0-3-1612765697
attributes.shortDescription: Overhaul of the Fallout 4 map. Added list of locations and workshops including text search. Add favorite locations to fast travel with one click. Many Quality-Of-Life features like disabling the popup on empty map space click, better map zoom steps, travel and arrival time. Colored marker support. Including high-res map texture support.

attributes.author: m8r98a4f2
attributes.description:
[color=#e69138][size=5][b]FallUI - Workbench[/b][/size][/color]

A optimized Fallout 4 workbench interface for PC.

Overhaul of the workbench for PC. Contains visual updates, functionial updates as well as more data displayed. Full support for FallUI inclusive.

[b][color=#e69138][size=4]Features[/size][/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Full support for FallUI
[list]
[*]Also full compatible with any other def_inv/dev_hud compatible Item Sorter Mod
[/list][*]Multi-language (All languages included)
[*]Covers the weapon and armor workbench as well as cooking and chemistry station.
[*]Greater display size for inventory list, mod list and other displayed panels.
[*]Added data columns to the inventory list, slot list and mod list.
[*]See comparison of all modules compared to your current installed mods in a well-arranged table sight
[*]Fancy item tag icon menu, which allows you to directly click on the icon you want to have for your weapon/armor! (Renaming function)
[*]Multi-craft button: Craft a item up to 10 times with a single button without confirmation (Key: M)
[*]Filtermode: Only show craftable recipes (Key: Q)
[*]Text search in recipe and mod lists (Requires F4SE. Key: F)
[*]Widescreen support (Universal aspect ratio correction available via MCM - support all resolutions)
[*]Customizable interface coloration
[*]Can show up to 8 requirement perks (Some mods use more than 2 requirements)
[*]Optimized the workbench script for a much better performance
[*]Autobuilding of zero-cost modules (like standard modules) is automatic now! (Skipping the senseless confirm box)
[*]Nicer graphical look of whole workbench interface.
[*]Drastically increased max. allowed characters for item names.
[*]Works smoothly together with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22105]Rename Anything[/url]﻿, allowing you to rename any item with item icon tag picker. (Install before FallUI Workbench)
[*]If you have FallUI installed, it will automatically use FallUI style configuration where applicable
[*]Includes MCM configuration menu for more individual settings (English version included, use a translation mod for a translated configuration)
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Use a Mod Manager to install.
[*]Optional but recommended: Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface[/url]﻿.
[*]Optional but recommended: Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48958]FallUI - Confirm Boxes[/url]﻿ to get icons in the "Make" and "Scrap" boxes (or to just skip them)!
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Load order[/b][/size][/color]
[spoiler]
[list=1]
[*] [Any mod you have modifying the workbench]
[*](Optional) [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758?tab=files]FallUI[/url]
[*]FallUI Workbench
[/list][/spoiler]

[b][color=#e69138][size=4]The [size=5]FallUI [/size]series[/size][/color][/b][list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48958]FallUI - Confirm Boxes [/url]- Beautiful message boxes. Unique designs and styles for every box type. Including skip option!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51813]FallUI - HUD[/url]﻿ - Highly configurable HUD for Fallout 4 with in-game HUD Layout Manager.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface [/url]﻿- Just better interface for all inventories
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49920]FallUI - Map[/url]﻿ - Better map for Fallout 4. Including list of locations, colored marker, high-res-support and more!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49070]FallUI - Sleep and Wait[/url]﻿ - Enhances the sleep/wait menu by many quality-of-life features like target hour buttons and daytime graph.

[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49300]FallUI - Workbench[/url]﻿ - Just better crafting, with more display size, more data, and a tag icon picker!
[/list]
[color=#6d9eeb][b][color=#e69138][size=4]Thanks[/size][/color]
[/b][/color]Bethesda
Neanka
FO4Edit team
The whole Nexus community (you are the best!)
attributes.name: FallUI Workbench-49300-1-2-4-1619238510
attributes.shortDescription: Better workbench interface optimized for PC. Bigger display size. Data columns. Comparision columns for mods. Item icon tag support. Icon menu for choosing your icon tag. Item subtitles. Autobuilding modules with zero cost. All languages included.

attributes.author: Cancerous1
attributes.customFileName: Fallout 76 C.A.M.P. placeable - moveable - workbench - settle anywhere - player home - Fallout - 76 - C.A.M.P.
attributes.description:
[b][size=6][i]Build your C.A.M.P. now! 
[/i][/size][/b]
Now you can carry placeable workbenches and throw them down and settle wherever you want to! take over any building and make it a player home, or stake your claim on a good spot outdoors with a view! -Nukes are not included-

This mod started when I was just "fixing" player homes that were missing the workshop quest for my crop growing mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14835]Fruitful Labor[/url]. When I saw the trailer for Fallout 76 I knew this had to happen.

Isnt this mod like XYZ... ? No -  this is totally unlimited, no cap on how many places you can settle. The only limit is that due to the mechanics of the game only one workshop will be active per location in game. You can settle indoors, outdoors, the middle of the Institute, the Railroad, Museum of Freedom, the Prydwyn, use your imagination! 

Does this mod include campfires, backpacks, coffee, quests, backrubs - NO - there's other mods for that.

You can craft them in the chem station under grenades, you place them in the world like mines, you can pick them up and move them if you want to correct placement or just dont like quite where you put it down (hold E)  And you can scrap extras if you accidentally place 2 in the same location. 

That's it, no more instruction is needed, no complicated systems or mechanics, just toss it out and you're good to go.

I never really thought about it before but I've had the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3528]build higher mod[/url] installed pretty much since Fallout 4 launched, I recommend using it with this.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3528]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3528[/url]

[center][youtube]pDZMc9rfJLY[/youtube]
( a video review from [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCB7Q7U-eIVX8PxM8-oj5gYA]DiscoGnome [/url]﻿)

[youtube]GAPbRn1xzds[/youtube]
Video from Westname

p.s. Send me some screenshots of cool places you settle in buildings or outdoors![/center]

attributes.author: crosenblum
attributes.description:
Tired of having to manually check for latest versions of F4SE, to download and extract to your Fallout 4 folder?

I was too, I wanted to automate it, so that it can be set as a scheduled task once a month or run as needed.

This is a batch file, but requires the following programs to be run effectively:

Wget is a command-line website downloader, parser, etc
http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/wget.htm
https://eternallybored.org/misc/wget/
Or if you use Chocolatey as I do. you can install that from here.
https://chocolatey.org/packages/Wget

This also requires the installation of 7zip. Which you can get from the following sites
http://www.7-zip.org/download.html
or
https://chocolatey.org/packages/7zip

Once you have those installed, you need to modify the folder paths inside the batch file to point to the correct folders for each required file and for Fallout 4 itself.

There is also a logging feature, if you wish to enable it to help diagnose any issues this batch file may have.
attributes.name: Fallout 4 Script Extender Updater-20942-1-00
attributes.shortDescription:
Tired of having to manually check for latest versions of F4SE, to download and extract to your Fallout 4 folder?

I was too, I wanted to automate it, so that it can be set as a scheduled task once a month or run as needed. This is a simple but useful batch file to help automate the mundane process

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16423]Fusion City Rising [/url]must be installed after [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22431]Eli's Armour Compendium[/url]. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309]HUD Framework[/url] needs to be installed after [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654]DEF_UI[/url].

[i]
[Archive][/i]
[i]bInvalidateOlderFiles=1[/i]
[i]sResourceDataDirsFinal=[/i]

[i]
[Launcher]
bEnableFileSelection=1
[/i]
Add the following lines to your "Fallout4.ini" file located in "Documents\My Games\Fallout4":

[i][Archive]
sResourceDataDirsFinal=STRINGS\, TEXTURES\, MUSIC\, SOUND\, INTERFACE\, MESHES\, PROGRAMS\, MATERIALS\, LODSETTINGS\, VIS\, MISC\, SCRIPTS\,
SHADERSFX\[/i]

MAKE SURE YOU CHECK EACH MOD YOU USE TO CHECK TO SEE IF YOU NEED TO ADD ANYTHING ELSE TO YOUR INI FILES!

[color=#6d9eeb]Q & A.[/color]
[color=#b4a7d6]Q: There is a mod I use, that is very popular and is used to fix bugs. Why is it not in this build?[/color]
A: Unfortunately, I found that the mod you are talking about, seems to conflict with many mods. It was one of the primary reasons I would CTD. I have used the mod many times and never had a problem with other builds. However, when putting the mod under the microscope there is a problem. Does the author know about the problem? It's either a fatal error leading to CTD or a false flag. Without dissecting the mod, I have noway to know for sure. So, I just removed it. If you really want to use the mod, I recommend you make sure it's at the top of the load order.

[color=#f1c232]Q: Are all the mods listed above required? [/color]
A: No. The only mods required are the ones that are listed in the requirement section under "[color=#ff7700]Required Mods and their Load Order[/color]" You will notice that some of the mods I require are not required by the File Header of my patch. You can remove some mods that are not tied to the file header, but by doing so, some of the edits in my patch are based on using all of my Required Mods. By not using all, you increase your risk of CTD.

[color=#dd7e6b]Q: I loaded your required mods, started a new game and it's just sitting at the load screen.[/color]
A: Sometimes when using mods and starting a new game, Fallout 4 will sit at the load screen. The screen will be black with the green little icon doing it's business on the bottom right. Hitting enter a couple of times seems to fix this. Not sure why this works, but it seems to be a bug in Vanilla not the mods.

[color=#c27ba0]Q: My favorite mod is not on the list[/color]
A: I went through all trending files of all time and of the last six months. I removed anything that had critical errors when put under the microscope. Then I removed all mods that had minor errors. Minor errors usually doesn't mean CTD, but, it ups the probability. I was left over with about 300 mods. I kept changing the orders around and found that some mods just don't play nice with others. I removed them and got the list above.

[color=#76a5af][color=#ffe599]Q: I really want to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4472?tab=description]True Storms[/url]. Is there a way?[/color]
[color=#efefef]A: Yes. You need to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15908?tab=description]Weather Synergy[/url]. Make sure you use VividPriority. Follow their suggested load order and it will work. Giving you the best of both worlds.

Q: [color=#00ffff]Can I use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2139]Fr4nsson's Light Tweaks[/url] with this build?[/color]
A: Yes, just make sure [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2139]Fr4nsson's Light Tweaks [/url]is loaded before [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13596]Enhanced Lights and FX[/url].

[color=#ffff00]Q: Why are some enemies just heads or invisible?[/color]
A: Most likely you are using a mod that requires[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25] Bodyslide[/url] and you didn't build the meshes as required. You can use a search engine to find tutorials on using [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25]Bodyslide[/url].
[/color][color=#e06666]
Q: I prefer [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2139]Fr4nsson's Light Tweaks[/url] over [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13596]Enhanced Lights and FX[/url]. Is there a way to use Fr4nsson's?[/color]
[color=#efefef]A:. Yes. Load [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2139]Fr4nsoon's Light Tweaks[/url] after [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13596][color=#efefef]Enhanced Lights and FX.[/color][/url]

Q: Can I add mods I like[/color]
A: Sure, but I can't guarantee it will be a stable build then.

[color=#93c47d]Q: What do you mean stable?[/color]
A: I did a speed run through to see if it crashed constantly. I would return to places that it would crash a lot and find the mods that were responsible. I removed them. I would then do a stress test spawning anything I could to see if it would CTD after awhile. If so, I would try to find the mod that might be responsible and remove it. I would load mods during a save game and see what that did. I would make sure I could at least start the main quests and important side quests. After several months of this and rebuilding the patch, this is what is left over.

[color=#e06666]Q: Is there a certain way to install graphical mods?[/color]
This usually varies by user but I prefer manual. I don't mind my mods overwriting some hi-rez textures. I would prefer low-rez in certain places and stability, then hi-rez and CTD. To try to get the best performance per look, that's a little trickier. Recommended Guide.

Q: I really want to cheat[/color]
A: Use console commands.

[color=#45818e]Q: I want unlimited build limits and build as high as the sky.[/color]
A: Great, prepare for many CTD

[color=#cc4125]Q: Why Sim Settlement but not Horizon?[/color]
A:[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17374] Horizon[/url] is a fantastic mod. However, it does not play well with others and should only use the mods that the author created patches for. I highly recommend you do a play through with Horizon. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21872]Sim Settlements[/url] because you don't need to use it if you want. You can still build the old fashion way or use many great features Sim Settlements has to offer.

[color=#93c47d]Q: Anything I should know about your build?[/color]
A: Yes. Some graphical glitches, most likely due to the engine and not the mods. Fallout 4 is prone to CTD in Vanilla. Even knowing this build is for Survival game-play, I still use Quick Save manager. [url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_fallout4.htm]ENB[/url] settings can be used. I recommend using the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/332]ENB Memory Patch[/url]. How you use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4640]Spring Cleaning[/url] can cause some weird graphical glitches. If you are using [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/28599]Rise of the Commonwealth[/url]. I recommend you don't use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4640]Spring Cleaning[/url] until after you assign a leader and you don't use it on grass. Just clutter, trees and junk. When downloading a mod that I require, always pick the non script level list version when given a choice. For compatible mods, always pick script level list version when given the choice.

[color=#3d85c6]Q: What is the files in the brackets above?[/color]
A: Some mods install more than one esp. What's in the brackets is to let you know what other files I used besides the core file. If you don't see the esp above when you install a mod that has multiple plugins, it's because it's not necessary after you use my patch or the other esps had issues, while the core file didn't.

Q:Does [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12511]Conquest[/url] work with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21872]Sim Settlements[/url]?
A: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12511]Conquest[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21872]Sim Settlements[/url] can coexist but they don't work together due to how [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12511]Conquest[/url] is scripted. When using [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12511]Conquest[/url], you will need to build the settlements the old fashion way.

[color=#dd7e6b]Q: I want to use different settings then you.[/color]
A: Just rename the esp. For example, Live Action Handy - With GlowMap.esp will need to be renamed to Live Action Handy.esp

[color=#ffe599]Q: My settlers keep getting killed, this is BS.[/color]
A: I think it adds a more immersive gameplay. However, there is a workaround. You are going to need [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/18978]Forcefiled Protection[/url] which is a required mod and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12390]The God Pistol[/url]﻿. Use the console command, "help field 4" and pick the Mark 7 non power armor version. Use the console command again, "help god 4", and get the weapon ID number. Then use the "player.giveitem (id number) 1" or whatever. You can mod the gun to make it even more powerful. Give your settlers the gun and forcefield. They should be unstoppable then. Don't forget to have your settlers equip the items.

[color=#ffe599]Q: Will you be adding more mods and other patches?[/color]
A: Yes, working on another one as we speak

[color=#e06666]Q: I've done everything you asked. Download all the mods. Have the load order similar to yours. Used you patch and still constant CTD. [/color]
A: That sucks. I don't mean to be callous but there are so many reasons for this. Your graphics setting are too high. One of the graphical packs you installed had a bad install, texture, mesh, etc... Something  that you are running in the background like a virus protection program is eating up all your memory. Or, and you know it's coming, you are using another mod that is not on the list, hell bent on using it and it's not playing well with the others but don't want to tell me, hoping I will problem solve it for you.

[color=#b4a7d6]Q: I have a super computer! How dare you mention the above, like my graphics settings are too high. [/color]
A: Maybe your computer doesn't like me and doesn't want my patch to work on your computer. I would recommend you have a talk with your computer and get to the bottom of it!

[color=#00ff00]Q: No, I swear, I have done everything you asked and still constant CTD. [/color]
A: When using ESP and ESM, the game can only handle 256 mods. If you installed every mod that you could that is compatible with this patch, you might have exceeded your limit. If that is not the case, try to load without my patch and see if that helps. If yes, then your load order is messed up or you just got a bad download. Re-download the patch. If none of that helped, most likely you forgot to add something to your INI file as requested by this mod and others, or you forgot to download something that is required by the mods above.

[color=#00ffff]Q: Still getting CTD is there anything else I can do?[/color]
A: Yes, it's a tedious process but the best process to get rid CTD's for good, or severely limit them. You will need [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737]F04Edit[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/38413]The Manual[/url]. It's an older manual but the rules still apply. So, it will be helpful. You are going to clean every mod. How to clean mods is described in the manual. This must be done one by one and the last mod on the list is the one you are always cleaning. Meaning, you need to actually load each mod one by one and clean them.

For example, you would load the game, the DLC then Mod 1. Clean mod 1, save and move on. Load the game, DLC, Mod 1 and Mod 2. Clean mod 2, save and move one. Keep doing this until all your mods have been cleaned. DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT load all your mods and then clean them all in one session. This will just create more CTD and ruin your build.

After all this, if you are still experiencing high CTD. You just have a bad build. You can check mods for errors. Once again, the manual explains how. All problematic mods should be removed. To clean DLC or not to clean DLC, that is the question. This is personal preference. I never have, but some people swear it helps stabilize the game. Make sure you follow someone's load order or you have [url=https://boss-developers.github.io/]BOSS[/url] or [url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] do your load order for you. Not having the right load order is one of the biggest culprits for CTD.

[color=#cc4125]Q: Help, I removed mods and added some others and now my save game is bugging out.
[/color]Fallout 4 seems to be the worse Bethesda game when it comes to changing or even upgrading mods with a current save game. It's extremely annoying but you have two options. Open the Sim Settlement management screen. Go to Tools --> Configuration Tools and then click on Rebuild Local Data. This will reset your mod scripts. After three in game days, you game has a good chance of no longer bugging out. If that doesn't work.

If you know which mod(s) might be bugging out. Remove said mods, enter you game, move to a new location. Save. Remove and reinstall the problematic mods. Load your game, move to a new location and save. After three in game days, you game might not bug out anymore.

attributes.author: Mark Fairchild
attributes.description:
Black Lives Matter. People are being killed out there. Help if you can.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________


Before you do anything, I highly recommend checking these pages:
﻿[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/2006]Modding 101
[/url]﻿[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23556]Fallout 4 Mod List and Load Order Guide
[/url]﻿
Please support mod authors! Endorse their mods, send them some coffee money if you can afford it. It motivates them to keep producing quality work and to stick around and fix bugs, which makes tools like this unnecessary.

If you ask for help and it turns out you're installing sketchy modpacks, I will laugh at you (I may still try to help anyway).

Fallout 4 Special Note!!!
Unattached Instances are a normal part of how Fallout 4 operates. I recommend you NOT clean them until I figure out how to distinguish between the ones that are still in use and the ones that are not.

[size=4][b]FallrimTools
[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]This software is free and open source, and always will be.
[*]Thank you to everyone who has been testing the tools and reporting their issues!
[*]Special thanks to flexcreator -- the creator of Script Scalpel -- for writing such a great tool and giving me access to the Script Scalpel source code.
[*]It includes ReSaver - the savefile cleaner.
[*]It included other tools in the past, and may do so again in the future.
[/list]
[size=3]Requirements[/size][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][list]
[*]Java is a requirement -- ReSaver is written entirely in Java.
[*]Mod Organizer 2 is strongly recommended for managing your mods and savegame directories.
[/list]
[size=3]What you can do to help[b]
[/b][/size][list]
[*]Test the tools! Report any problems! Report any annoyances!
[*]Try cleaning a few savegames with ReSaver, see it the new tool works at all.
[*]Play with the tool, try to get it to crash in exciting ways. Let me know how you crashed it.
[*]Find problems or annoyances with the user interface.
[/list]
[size=3]Donations[/size]
[list]
[*]If you would like to donate, Steam gift cards are good, or donations through Nexus or Paypal.
[*]Really, I'll accept anything. :-)
[*]Seriously, I'll take a high-five, or a photo your cats. An envelope full of used bandaids? Sure!
[*]But it's not necessary. I wrote these tools because I love Skyrim and Fallout. I require no compensation.
[*]PayPal, if you're so inclined: https://www.paypal.me/MarkDFSoftware
[/list]___________________________________________________________________________________________________
[b][size=4]ReSaver - the savefile cleaner[/size]
[/b]
ReSaver is a new savegame editor, based loosely on the excellent user interface of SaveTool. It works with Skyrim Special Edition, Skyrim Legendary Edition, Skyrim Legendary Edition + Crash Fixes, and Fallout 4.

There are already two Very Good savegame editors out there; Save Game Script Cleaner (aka SaveTool), and Savegame Script Scalpel. I use them both and they are fantastic. They do have their problems though. Script Scalpel has a difficult UI and is a bit slow. SaveTool has quite limited filtering options. And at the time I'm writing this, neither of them can load savegames from Skyrim Special Edition or that use the new file format introduced in Crash Fixes 10. And they can't handle Fallout 4. ReSaver is intended to correct those problems while adding useful new features for cleaning saves.

[size=3]Features[/size][b]
[/b][list]
[*]Reads and writes Skyrim SE, Skyrim LE, and Fallout 4 savefiles
[*]Reads and writes the new Crash Fixes savegame file format
[*]Displays a TONS of useful information
[*]Edits script data
[*]Terminates threads (right-click on an ActiveScript and pick "Terminate")
[/list][i]Mod Parsing[/i]
[list]
[*]Reads your ESM/ESP/PEX/BSA files looking for information that will help
[*]identify which parts of the savegame are the ones that you're looking.
[*]Just pick "Parse" from the File menu.
[*]Works best if you use Mod Organizer.
[/list][i]Filtering
[/i][list]
[*]Filter using regex (regular expressions)
[*]Filter by plugin (right-click on a plugin)
[*]Filter by mod (right-click on a plugin)
[*]Filter to show what would be deleted by each cleaning operation
[/list][i]Cleaning[/i]
[list]
[*]Deletes unattached script instances (in the "Clean" menu)
[*]Deletes undefined elements (in the "Clean" menu)
[*]Cleans formlists
[*]Deletes plugin data
[/list][i]Not yet implemented[/i]
[list]
[*]Exporting and importing savegame data
[*]Cleaning of Havok data
[*]Filtering scripts with invalid data
[*]Analyzing mods managed by Nexus Mod Manager or Wrye Bash
[/list]
ReSaver is quite stable and I use it myself. I have hundreds of mods, including dozens of major quest mods. I NEED a serious save editor. That's why I wrote one. I can't promise that it's perfect. It's possible that it will ruin your savefile, hard drive, childhood, and kidneys. In other words, there is no guarantee of fitness for any particular purpose, etc. But it's pretty good.

[size=3][b]Instructions[/b][/size]
See the Videos section on the Skyrim Special Edition page for more detailed instructions.[i]
Getting started:[/i]
[list=1]
[*]Unzip the FallrimTools archive somewhere.
[*]Double-click on ReSaver.exe.
[*]Choose your savefile.
[*]You should see a tree structure that has all of the save's script elements.
[*][b]The #1 thing that most people need is to remove script instances that are not attached to anything.[/b]
[*]Go to the "Clean" menu and select "Show Unattached Instances". This will filter the list and show only the script instances that aren't attached to anything.
[*]Go to the "Clean" menu and select "Remove Unattached Instances".
[*]Save to a new file.
[*]Load your savegame in Skyrim/Fallout and make sure it's working properly.
[/list]

attributes.author: Ghostfc3s
attributes.description:
[size=3]I highly recommend using this towards end game or game saves in which you have been playing a long long time or on survival play through to help combat save bloat. 

Q: What is save bloat?
A: In open world games were everything is moveable the game needs to create a record of that move. For example your in a fire fight and you miss and hit a beer bottle sending it flying. The game with then keep a record where that bottle landed so the next time you enter that cell it will still be there that record is save until there is a cell reset. Every time you build something in your settlement it keeps a record of that. ANNNNDDDD every time you kill something it keeps a record of that. F04 has built in scrubbers to remove dead bodies and cell change records after a period of time. Default is 24 ingame hours for bodies and Cells (world spaces) for non survival is 7 in day games survival is 80 I believe.
As the f04 builds records of all your activities the save file gets larger and larger.  If you have modified time scale and respawn/cell reset mods, save times get even larger.  I use Zombie Walkers mod which is always spawning zombies, (or if you use fo4 76 mod) you will end up with alot of dead bodies quickly resulting in long save time + 3-5 minutes per save. With this activated my save time drops down to under 5 seconds. 

My current save is 2400 hours survival with large settlement builds time scale at 10 and zombie mods, ﻿with this activated my save time drops to under 5 seconds for hard saves.  The only downside is to make sure you loot bodies right away.



This mod is light weight and only changes the iHoursToClearCorpses from 24 hours to 1.

How to use, Install with nmm or Manual install. I suggest dropping it at the bottom of the load order to fight dirty edits. Activate it. Go to a interior cell wait 2 hours then save. When you return to cells that you have previously had engaged in combat and left piles of dead bodies they will now be gone.   

For the change to be effective you must leave the cell wait 2  in Game Hours. If you return before 1 ingame hour is up, fo4 will reset the timer and the bodies will remain.

I included a txt/bat file in the zip archive for people not wanting to increase there mod list. 

Drop the .txt file into your main fo4 directory (not your data directory) start the game open the console type Bat corpse it will activate. You should only need to run it once for a play through. However if it does rest on you just run the bat again. 

To check type ﻿﻿getgs ihourstoclearcorpses and it will show you the value.

attributes.author: reg2k
attributes.description:
[size=6][color=#f1c232]Faster Workshop[/color][/size]

Faster Workshop is an F4SE plugin that optimizes workshop loading times by replacing some of the most expensive and inefficient regions of workshop loading code with far more efficient versions.

On top of this, it also does two more things:
[list]
[*]Provides a hotkey to instantly enter Workshop mode.
[*]Fixes the issue with workshop icons not loading when navigating through them quickly.
[/list]
Testers with a current workshop load time of ~15s (from activating a Workshop to having the build menu appear) report a drop in load time to less than half a second. Those with a lower starting load time report near-instantaneous Workshop loads with the plugin installed.

[size=5][color=#f1c232]About[/color][/size]

As you acquire more mods that add content to your game, you may have noticed the game freezing up (video freezes and you cannot move) for increasingly longer periods of time when you attempt to start Workshop mode. Even when these mods have nothing to do with the Workshop!

[b][size=3][i]What's going on?[/i][/size][/b]

[spoiler]It boils down to the game using some incredibly inefficient code to figure out what objects you can build in workshop mode. Whenever you start Workshop mode, the game evaluates the conditions on [b]every single constructible object in the game[/b] to find out if they belong in the workshop - this includes even non-workshop items like weapon mods and chems. And it does that not just once (!), but repeats this loop for [b]each and every workshop submenu you have[/b]!

If you install a mod that adds two new submenus to your workshop, one would reasonably expect to incur just a small overhead of a couple of additional checks. Instead, in reality, this causes two more loops through every single craftable object in the game.

As you install more mods that add any kind of craftable object to the game, entering the workshop will inevitably and perhaps noticeably slow down, even if these objects have nothing to do with the workshop.

And to make it all worse, every time you exit the workshop, the game tears down all this data it worked so hard to build and starts over![/spoiler]

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Do I need this mod?[/color][/size]

When you start workshop mode, is there any noticeable delay before the build menu appears? If so, this mod can help.

If you do not currently experience any lag when starting Workshop mode, congratulations! You have a beefy-enough rig, or do not have many (workshop) mods installed. But do keep this mod in mind in case you need it in the future. The rate of load time increase is [b]not linear[/b] in the number of mods you have installed - it is far worse, so you may see load times shoot up quickly if you install certain kinds of mods. (see About section for more detailed information)

[size=5][color=#f1c232]How it works (technical)[/color][/size]

[spoiler]This F4SE plugin rewrites code that handles workshop object loading. On the first workshop load of the game session, the plugin goes through the constructible objects once and maps keywords to their constructible objects. Now, instead of looping through the entire COBJ list every time a mapping of COBJ to KWYD is needed, it is a constant-time operation to look up this information from the prebuilt map. Conditions will now only be evaluated on COBJs that belong in the workshop category, instead of all loaded COBJs.[/spoiler]

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Installation[/color][/size]

Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder.
Make sure that you start the game with the F4SE loader, otherwise F4SE will not be active.

This is an in-memory code patch. It does not attach any scripts to objects or your save and is safe to install or remove at any time.

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Requirements[/color][/size]

Fallout 4 game version 1.10.50 or higher.
[url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url], 0.6.4 or higher.
The [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497/]Mod Configuration Menu[/url], if you want to assign a hotkey for starting Workshop mode. Not necessary otherwise.

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Acknowledgements[/color][/size]

Many thanks to the xSE team, for F4SE.

attributes.author: Greslin
attributes.description:
[size=3][b]FERALS AFTER DARK[/b][/size]
by Greslin

As anyone who watches zombie movies knows, the zombie apocalypse doesn't get any easier after the sun goes down.  28 Days Later, Walking Dead, I Am Legend, you name it.  Who knows why it gets worse at night.  Perhaps the sun makes them a bit sluggish, maybe it's the cooler air. 

This mod adds a version of the Night Person perk to feral ghouls.  From 6pm to 6am, ferals get a health boost, a bit more unarmed damage, and a +2 Perception bonus.  This should make them more likely to notice you at night, more likely to hit you hard, and a bit harder to put down.  Affects ferals and Glowing Ones, but not regular ghouls - only ferals that belong to the vanilla feral ghoul race group.  It shouldn't matter whether combat is happening outside or indoors.

Installation: Drop the .ESP into your load order.  That's it.

Compatibility: This will conflict with any other mod that alters the feral race records.  The feral NPC records should be fine.  To fix it, simply either load the ESP after any other feral race edits, or add the NightGhoul effect to the race records manually with FO4Edit.


[b]ABOUT ME[/b]
=========================

I am now available for mod support over Discord.  Visit me here about this or any other of my mods: [url=https://discord.gg/jMUnXDV]https://discord.gg/jMUnXDV[/url]

[b]See my other Fallout 4 mods:[/b]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23558/?]Stash Those Caps[/url] - Makes caps truly portable again, just like in FO3/FNV
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23269/?]Insult To Injury[/url] - Implements a working FNV-like limb damage/recovery system in Survival mode
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22744/?]Companion Heal Thyself[/url] - Give companions the power to patch themselves up in Survival mode
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22585/?]Passive Aggressive Piper[/url] - Add affinity checks to Piper's more annoying, sarcastic and flirtatious comments
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22434/?]Ferals After Dark[/url] - Makes feral ghouls a bit smarter and more dangerous after the sun goes down
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22436/?]More Realistic Cats[/url] - Buffs the cat race to make them behave more like, well, cats
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23498/?]Atomic Brahmin[/url] - When cows turn into mean, aggressive, highly unstable nuclear weapons

[b][i]==== What the gaming media is saying[/i]! ====[/b]

"Cat-Mod takes care of the cats of the end time"
- Gamestar.de (Google translated from German) March 27 2017
about "More Realistic Cats"

[b]Read my Fallout modding blog:[/b]  [url=https://greslinmods.wordpress.com/]https://greslinmods.wordpress.com/[/url]

attributes.author: Rivelle
attributes.description:
***********************************************
Fill Bottle while playing on any difficulty.
***********************************************

[b]You should be able to install/uninstall this mod without problems, but to minimize the possibility of breaking your saved game, always make a backup before installing any mod and use the Nexus Mod Manager Profiles.[/b]

[b]IMPORTANT -> Read Known Issues.[/b]

The basic version (the same than v0.1) its just an edited version of the perk HC_FillWaterBottlePerk, so it doesn't check if you are playing on Hardcore (Survival Difficulty).
It should work the same way, so if you have an empty bottle you should be able to fill it at a Water Pump for example.
Starting in version 0.2, adds the option to fill empty bottles with water from other sources not included in Vanilla.

[b]As in a vanilla game, if you don't have empty bottles the Fill option will not appear.[/b]


It should work with any bottle that is added to the ingame "fillable with water" bottle list (HC_FillableWaterBottlesList).
It'd be useful on a vanilla game, but mainly if you are using mods like [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8791/?]Hobo-Scavenger[/url] or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13193/?]Give Me That Bottle[/url] so you recover the bottles after drinking its content.
It can be useful in Survival too, if you want the extra water filling sources.


[b]***************
Known Issues:
***************
If you have played in Survival and changed to another difficulty, it should work because you already have the hidden perk HC_FillWaterBottlePerk. If not, you will have to add the perk via console: player.addperk 00249f55[/b]



***********
Versions:
***********
Ver. 0.1:
Allows the player to fill bottles, just like in Survival Mode, when playing on any difficulty setting.
Ver. 0.2:
Allows the player to fill bottles, just like in Survival Mode, when playing on any difficulty setting.
Adds the option to fill empty bottles with water from other sources not included in Vanilla:
- Water Purifier.
- Water Purifier - Industrial.
- Water Pump - Powered -> Requires Wasteland Workshop (DLCworkshop01.esm).
Ver. 0.3:
Working in a new version with more options. If almost any water source is radiated, how do you get clean water with just a pump? I think that you would need to purify it first, so...
It'll add a new version of the the water source, when it makes sense, so one version provides dirty water and the other purified water.
I'm deciding the best way to make the two versions of the pumps (prerequisites and materials), and which options the installer should have to be user friendly.
I'm testing it for now.



**************
Installation:
**************
Nexus Mod Manager (Recommended): The mod is provided with an installer with all the options, thanks to the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821/?]FOMOD Creation Tool[/url] by Wenderer.

Manual installation: Copy the chosen version of the file "FillBottleAnyDifficulty.esp" to your Fallout 4 Data folder:
From the folder FillBottleAnyDifficulty_Perk -> to get just the modified perk so you can fill empty bottles while playing on any difficulty.
From the folder FillBottleAnyDifficulty_Extra -> to get the perk and some extra water filling sources.
From the folder FillBottleAnyDifficulty_Extra_DLC (recommended)-> to get the perk and some extra water filling sources, including the Pump (Water Pump - Powered) from Wasteland Workshop (DLC required).

***********************
Recommendations:
***********************
[b]You should be able to install/uninstall this mod without problems, but to minimize the possibility of breaking your saved game, always make a backup before installing any mod and use the Nexus Mod Manager Profiles.[/b]
I'm using a lot of mods and would like to recommend them all, but for that will need a recommendation page and time to work on it (maybe on the future).
The must have (for me) in order to get a Hardcore/Survival realistic experience:

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10399/?]Hardcore Mode [ON][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815/?]Better Locational Damage[/url]

The names are self-explanatory. You should take a look at them, and to the other mods from their authors and to their recommendations.

**********************************
Credits (in alphabetic order):
**********************************
Bethesda: For the game and the Creation kit.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/?]FO4Edit[/url]: A very useful tool for the modders, and users or wanna be modders.
Nexus community: For allowing to convert good games in great games with their work and for the help offered to users and modders.
Wenderer: For the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821/?]FOMOD Creation Tool.[/url]

attributes.author: shatsnazzle
attributes.customFileName: More Realistic Fire Behavior - Fire Behavior With Crippling v1 DLC
attributes.description:
This mod makes it so NPC humans and civilized ghouls will drop their weapon and run away when they are on fire. No more of this, "it's OK that I'm on fire let me slowly strafe, and calmly steady my aim at you," no. fuck that.

YOU. ARE. ON. F I R E .

Drop your gun and act like you give a shit.

[color=#ffff00][u][b]This mod affects:[/b][/u][/color]
Molotovs
Flame thrower
Incendiary shots
Lasers with fire mods
Special NPC fire abilities
Oil traps
Fire hazards
And a few others!
This mod skips altering a few fire hazards that are labeled as having small effects.

There are 2 versions available of this mod.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Version 1 (cool version):[/u][/b][/color]
When hit with a molotov or set on fire, civilized ghouls and human NPCs will be staggered hard, have their shootin' arm crippled, drop their gun, and they will run away. When NPCs run away they zip away at ridiculous speed so I added a slowing effect (curable if the NPC uses a Stimpak) and debuffed their action points for 30 sec so they can't sprint (cannot stimpak out of the action point debuff). Molotovs work the same as vanilla on anyone in power armor because well, it's power armor![color=#00ffff][u][b] All of these new features to fire have no effect on the player[/b][/u];[/color] we're already smart (or dumb) enough to panic when we are on fire.

In order to make this cool version work and make NPCs reliably drop their gun, I made it so humans and civilized ghouls can no longer use crippled limbs. It's awesome.
[color=#00ffff][u][b]Note: you the player are still susceptible to limb crippling from gunfire or anything else that hits you, including fire, you are just immune to the artificial limb crippling added to fire effects.[/b][/u][/color]
If you like crippling enemies but you prefer to be immune to crippling you can either wait until you level up and get the Adamantium Skeleton perk or you download the optional Player Immune to Cripple file.

In order to make crippled limbs unusable I had to edit a HumanRace and GhoulRace value. I have no idea if this will conflict with any anime chick body overhaul cartoon cheerleader boob physics mods you're using but if it does I have a suck version available:

[color=#ff0000][b][u]Version 2 (suck version):
[/u][/b][/color]This version does almost all the same things except instead of enabling unusable crippled limbs and crippling the arm it simply disarms the victim and applies a fear effect to make them run (there's also a fear effect in version 1 for good measure but it's probably redundant with a crippled arm). The downside to this is enemies will very often just pick the weapon right back up or go grab another weapon near their new location after running away. Also sometimes they just don't even run.

[color=#ff7700][u][b]Possibly weird behavior:[/b][/u][color=#000000]
[/color][/color]In order to make NPCs reliably run away I added an effect that actually heals crippled legs. Otherwise the molotov has a chance of crippling their legs and they just sit on the floor staring at you while they roast and it looks dumb. So if you cripple a leg and then decide to set them on fire, this is why they are able to magically run again.

[color=#ff7700][b][u]Other weird behavior:[/u][/b][/color]
Honestly this mod is just changing NPCs from displaying reeeeeally weird behavior to less weird behavior. I don't think it would take much imagination to make something better and I hope someone does. I would love to see NPCs on fire truly freaking out and and flailing or trying to protect their face but I have no idea how to do that and I have no plans of ever learning how to animate stuff.

[color=#ff0000][b][u]Conflicts:[/u][/b][/color]
If you use CROSS Crit Gore overhaul just put this mod somewhere [s]above[/s] below CROSS Crit in your load order. Thanks [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/11355265]DerekUGA[/url].

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Installing:[/u][/b][/color]
Just install as usual with Nexus Mod Manager

[color=#00ff00][u][b]Uninstalling:[/b][/u][/color]
Just uninstall as usual with Nexus Mod Manager. There shouldn't be any residual effects at all. This mod just adds a few tweaked "spell" effects alongside vanilla fire damage over time spells.

[color=#ffff00][u]Requirements:[/u][/color]
Not really a requirement but I highly recommend using this with some damage overhaul or realism mods such as unbogus health scaling and MADNESS to make the NPC's fire-to-death time feel satisfying and believable.
DLC and non-DLC version available.
[color=#00ffff][b][u]
Getting your hott pervy mods to work with version 1.1:[/u][/b][/color]
You'll have to google some mod conflict manager software or just open your body mod in the Creation Kit and remove the checkbox in HumanRace and GhoulRace that says they're allowed to use crippled limbs. Let me know in the comments if you need help.

attributes.author: Zzyxzz
attributes.customFileName: Game Configuration Menu
attributes.description:
[center]
﻿[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img][/center]
[b][size=4]What is GCM?[/size][/b]

GCM allows you easily set many game settings without the need of additional ESPs or console commands.

[size=4][b]What can not be changed?[/b][/size]
[size=3]Survival settings (Hunger, Thirst, Fatigue, Sleep, Diseases etc.)
As survival has been added as a brand new script based system by Bethesda, it has been excluded from this mod and released as a standalone mod.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37599]Survival Configuration Menu[/url]
Features a brand new eat and drink system, which relies on weight of the item instead of the caps value and allows you to control it. In addition to that, you can tweak many aspects of the survival added features. Like tweaking disease chance, disabling adrenaline. Choose how long you can maximally sleep on the different bet types. And more.[/size]

[size=4][b]What can be changed?[/b][/size]
There are a lot of settings within the game, this mod does not cover all. This mod will be updated over time and new settings will be added.
Right now the following categories exist to give you an idea:


[b]Barter -[/b]
(buy and sell settings)

[b]Character -[/b]
(Adjust character attributes and formulas)

[b]DLC - [/b]
(Covers only Automatron right now: Disable robot encounters, adjust chances, etc.)

[b]Difficulty - [/b]
(Change the difficutly of each difficutly setting on the fly!)

[b]Experience -[/b]
(Change the exp gain from crafting)

[b]Gameworld -[/b]
(Respawn settings)

[b]Legendary -[/b]
(Adjust legendary chances/spawn rate)

[b]NPCs -[/b]
(Adjust bonus health of NPCs, adjust throw frequency of stuff/explosives, disable the spidy sense dodge)
[b]
Quests & Factions -[/b]
(Covers only BoS for now. Adjust quest item chances and reward amount, unlock railroad armor mods)

[b]Power Armor -[/b]
(Power drain settings, durability settings and settings for the jetpack)

[b]Random Encounter -[/b]
(Disable random encounters, adjust frequency, set level conditions etc.)

[b]Skills -[/b]
(Pickpocket max chance, Hacking settings to set the number of words, lockpick settings)

[b]Sneak -[/b]
(Sneak damage multiplier, reverse pickpocket, detection settings)

[b]Sound -[/b]
(Settings to allow you to disable combat music or tweak it)

[b]Time -[/b]
(Timescale, gamehour, fast travel speed)

[b]VATS -[/b]
(VATS activation distance[can be used to disable VATS!], timeslow, damage reduction)

[b]Visual Settings -[/b]
(Gun shells lifetime, debri amount, ironsight blur)

[b]Weather -[/b]
(Change weathers)

[b]Workshop -[/b]
(Adjust powerline length)



[b][size=5]Future plans:[/size][/b]
-Add more game settings
-Add one button configurations
-Save configs and share them with others


You know helpful game settings, that should be added? Write a comment or send me a message!


[b][size=4]My Other Mods:[/size][/b]

[size=4][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815]Better Locational Damage[/url]
[/size][size=4]Most realistic damage overhaul you'll find on the whole nexus. Promised.
Features: Scripted headshots, scripted dismemberment, bleedings, stagger ,stab
your enemies from behind, Shotgun knockback and more! Balanced melee and
range combat. Settings holotape available to tweak features to your
liking or completely disable them!

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13193]Give me that bottle[/url]
Ever wondered that you drink a beer for example and the bottle is magically gone? With the new survival mode you could use the bottle to
get some water! But how to get this bottle!? Give Me That Bottle fixes
that and gives a bottle in return! This mod adds new water bottles and
cooking recipes to turn your dirty water into purified water

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3648]Better Explosives[/url]
Better Explosives overhauls explosives in Fallout 4.
The aim of this mod is to make explosives deadly, more fun and make them differ from each other.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7515]Better Power Armor[/url]﻿
Your Power Armor will now fully absorb the damage of ballistic and laser weapon types.
Each armor part will work individually and absorb the damage of the bodypart it covers.
When one power armor part breaks, only this bodypart that was covered will take damage.
Keep your power armor in a good state and it will protect you.
