attributes.author: Undyne777 - Cooleo
attributes.description:
[center][color=#00ffff][b][size=4]GUNSMITH EXTENDED[/size][/b]
[/color][size=4]Firearm Modification Overhaul[/size]
[size=3]Mod by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/1312926/?]Undyne777[/url] & [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/65149-cooleo/]cooleo[/url]

[color=#00ffff]Note from the authors, to anyone that still checks in on this regularly.

First, thank you to the FO4 Mod Community for your support on both this, and my other projects. I've dabbled in modding privately in past games, but this game has been my first foray on the scale that I have done. Your support and critiques kept me coming back and helped make this better (all 700+ endorsers, 13K+ downloaders, and 140+ comments).

Right now, due to work commitments and other personal developments, I am officially done with supporting this project. I don't have the bandwidth to do it justice. As of now (10/21/16), this project is 100% open-source to anyone who wants to take it and roll with it. Keep it going or change it up - that can be up to you. If you've enjoyed using this as much as I have, I hope you consider making it your own.

I've said it before and I'll say it again - BIG thank you to [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/65149-cooleo/]cooleo[/url]. He kept this thing going while I've been MIA. He pushed out a lot of refinements that I never thought of and for that we're all grateful. Can't wait to see what you crank out, dude![/color]

[color=#efefef][i]Ever want an automatic .50 pistol that shoots plasma rounds?
5.56mm Hunting Rifle with cryo rounds?
5mm Submachine Gun with armor piercing rounds?
Well, this is the mod for you!
[/i][/color][color=#00ffff]
[u]SOME BACKGROUND

[/u][/color][/size][size=3]I started out modding Fallout 4 with a little project called [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3480/?]Caliber Conversion Kit[/url] that sought to add multiple receiver options to swap out ammo types. Even after I completed that project and moved onto other things, I still felt like there was more to do in terms of overhauling the existing weapon mod framework. 

Thus, Gunsmith Extended was born. ([b]NOT[/b] affiliated with the Weaponsmith Extended mod).

This mod does a deep dive series of changes to the existing modifications for ballistic firearms as pertains to receivers, fire modes, ammo types, and calibers. I drew on the things I learned working on my other mods to hopefully help diversify the options available when using vanilla weapons.

I hope you enjoy using it as much as I enjoyed making it! Cheers! :-)

[/size][size=3][color=#00ffff][b][u]MOD DETAILS[/u][/b][/color]

[size=3]Adds three (3) new modification categories to supported weapons at the workbench: [color=#00ffff]Fire Mode, Ammo Type, and Caliber[/color]

[color=#00ffff]*Fir[/color][/size][color=#00ffff]e Mode[/color]: Switch supported firearms between automatic & semi-automatic. 'Nuff said.
[size=3][color=#00ffff]Ammo Type[/color]: A cocktail of conventional and quirky ammo effects relevant to the Fallout universe
[color=#00ffff]Caliber[/color]: Switch which type of ammunition your peacemaker uses! Stats will change relative to the type of bullet.

[color=#00ffff]*Automatic Receiver changes[/color]: the existing "Automatic Receivers" have been converted to be "Light Bolt Receivers" that increase the rate of fire values.

[color=#00ffff]Lever Action Rifle changes[/color]: In addition to adding caliber swaps and ammo types, the lever action rifle also now receives +3 ammo capacity when using the Long Barrel or Long Ported Barrel options [i](they have longer tubes... why not use them?)[/i]

[color=#00ffff]All vanilla and Far Harbor firearms are supported as of version 1![/color] Note that not all categories are available for every gun (for example, there is no automatic fire mode for the flare gun or double barrel shotgun since it doesn't make sense).

[color=#00ffff]New caliber/fire mode combinations will spawn from enemies and be sold by vendors!
[/color][/size][/size][/center][center][size=3][color=#ff0000]If you encounter any issues or crashes, DO NOT post to the comments. [/color][color=#efefef]Your issue will probably get lost.
Help me help you. Submit a Bug report with your exact weapon build (eg. receiver, barrels, muzzles, etc.) and if you use any other mods that might conflict.[/color][/size]

[b][u][color=#00ffff][size=3]DETAILED CHANGE LIST[/size][/color][/u][/b]

[size=3][color=#ffd966]10mm Pistol -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers 
[color=#ffd966].44 Pistol -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers 
[color=#ffd966]Assault Rifle - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for calibers
[color=#ffd966]Combat Rifle -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers 
[color=#ffd966]Combat Shotgun - [/color]Ammo Types | Fire Modes
[color=#ffd966]Deliverer - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Double Barrel Shotgun - [/color] Ammo Types
[color=#ffd966]Hunting Rifle - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Minigun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Pipe Gun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Pipe Bolt-Action Gun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Pipe Revolver - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Flare Gun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types
[color=#ffd966]Lever Action Rifle (Far Harbor) -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Radium Rifle (Far Harbor) -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Firing Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers

Only the [color=#ffd966]weapon listings[/color] (e.g. 10mm Pistol, .44 Pistol, etc.) and [color=#ffd966]receiver object modifications[/color] (e.g. Hunting Rifle .50 Receiver, Assault Rifle Automatic Receiver, etc.) are tweaked by this mod. [color=#ffd966]No changes have been made to loot lists or NPCs[/color].[/size]
[list=1]

[/list][size=3][b][u][color=#00ffff]INSTALLATION
[/color][/u][/b]
Pick which version is relevant to you (DLC Edition or No DLC) and drop the ESP file into your Fallout 4 Data folder.

To uninstall, just delete the ESP. Easy!

[b][u][color=#00ffff]WHAT'S NEXT?
[/color][/u][/b]
I'm trying to decide if / how to support energy weapons and non-conventional firearms (broadsider, harpoon gun, syringer, etc.) More to come on this...

[color=#00ffff][b][u]MOD CONFLICTS

[/u][/b][/color]Any mod that tweaks the vanilla weapon receivers or weapon properties will create a conflict. To solve for this, simply create a merged patch. If you do not know how to do this, try Google or YouTube for a quick and easy tutorial. I did a quick search and found [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Xc5tQCiDvo][u]this video here[/u][/url] [/size]in less than 20 seconds.[/center][center][size=3]
If you make a compatibility patch, you are free to release it to the public if you so desire.
[b]
I [color=#ff0000]do not[/color] create patches for other mods. It's simply too time-consuming because there are so many mods out there to account for. Sorry![/b]
[u][color=#00ffff][b]
[u][color=#00ffff][b]CHECK OUT MY MODS
[/b][/color][/u]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14847/?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/14847-0-1465350671.jpeg[/img][/url]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14448?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/14448-0-1464648547.jpeg[/img][/url]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12516?][/url][u][color=#00ffff][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12516?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/12516-0-1461897154.jpeg[/img]
[/url][/b][/color][/u][u][color=#00ffff][b][u][color=#00ffff][b]

[/b][/color][/u]

[b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10343?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/10343-0-1461896648.jpeg[/img][/url]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9943?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/9943-1-1461896727.jpeg[/img][/url][/b]

[u][color=#00ffff][b]CHECK OUT COOLEO's MODS
[/b][/color][/u][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12417/?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/12417-0-1484845150.png[/img]

[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20712/?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/20712-0-1482185995.png[/img]
[/url]


PERMISSIONS
[/b][/color][/u]
Any permitted use requires citation of myself as the original authors. You may not use the contents of this file or commercial uses.

No need to ask if you would like to release updated versions of the ESP here. Please just link back to this original file and cite the authors for their contributions. Thanks!

[u][color=#00ffff][b]CREDITS
[/b][/color][/u]
Myself ([url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/1312926/?]Undyne777[/url]) for creating the original mod within FO4Edit and the Creation Kit
[url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/65149-cooleo/]cooleo[/url] for his help with the v1.2 fix for suppressor projectiles and beyond!
Hlp, Zilav and Sharlikran for their test distribution of FO4Edit on Nexus

attributes.author: registrator2000
attributes.description:
[size=15][font=Courier New]HUDFramework[/font][/size]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ ABOUT ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

HUDFramework is a UI framework that makes it possible for mods to add new UI elements to the HUD in a conflict-free way.

Stats, time, widgets... and more! Welcome to a new world of UI modding.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ DETAILS ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Previously, any mod modifying the HUD would necessarily overwrite and conflict with every other HUD mod. HUDFramework solves this by dynamically loading individual interface mods into the HUD at runtime. It gives modders the tools to load custom widgets and communicate with their widgets.

Note that you need to have a mod installed that uses the framework to see any widgets! If you're looking for HUDFramework mods to install, there's a list on the sticky in the Comments section.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ INSTALLATION ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

1. Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder.
2. Activate HUDFramework.esm in your mod manager, or via the Mods menu.

Note: If you receive a message about overwriting HUDMenu.swf, then you have an existing UI mod installed. To use both together, you can inject HUDFramework into the other mod using the HUDFramework auto-patcher. See the Compatibility section.

[line]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ FEATURES (for mod authors) ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*][b]Create HUD widgets[/b] and modify existing UI elements on-the-fly via a Papyrus interface.
[*][b]Write AS3 expressions[/b] directly within Papyrus and have them dynamically evaluated in Scaleform.
[*][b]One framework[/b] for both PC and console. HUDFramework benefits from, but does not require F4SE - you can bring your UI mods to consoles.
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ USAGE EXAMPLES ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Retrieving a reference to HUDFramework:
➲ [size=1][i][code]HUDFramework hud = HUDFramework.GetInstance()[/code][/i][/size]

Load UI Widget:
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.RegisterWidget(Self, "MyWidget.swf", 100, 100)[/code][/i][/size]
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.LoadWidget("MyWidget.swf")[/code][/i][/size]

Communicate with UI widget:
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.SendMessage("MyWidget.swf", UpdateResourceBar, 100)[/code][/i][/size]

Show/hide compass:
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.Eval("hud.BottomCenterGroup_mc.CompassWidget_mc.visible = false;")[/code][/i][/size]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ WHAT'S POSSIBLE ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*]On screen clock showing in-game/real time
[*]Companion status widget (view health and stats)
[*]Survival stats widget (hunger, sleep, thirst)
[*]Custom crit meter outside VATS
[*]Weapon wheel
[*]Companion wheel
[*]Custom crosshair
[*]Hide specific UI elements
[*]Quest-specific UI elements, such as a radar, minimap, or a timer counting down to detonation
[*]...and more!
[/list]
If you want to see more examples of what is possible with UI mods, see the supported modlists for UI frameworks for previous Fallout games.

[line]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ COMPATIBILITY ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

A DEF_UI patch is provided in the Files section.
If you are using any other mod that replaces HUDMenu.swf, you should merge HUDFramework with the other mod's HUDMenu.swf. This is an automated process - the HUDFramework Auto-Patcher is able to automatically inject HUDFramework into any HUDMenu.swf. [i](In fact, this release itself is an auto-patch on the vanilla HUDMenu!)[/i] Get the auto-patcher in the Files section - instructions are included in the download.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ CREDITS & ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

BISE Scripting Engine for making dynamic AS3 evaluation possible.
RABCDASM for robust, nondestructive SWF disassembly and assembly.
F4SE for Scaleform logging.
attributes.name: HUDFramework 1.0f-20309-1-0f
attributes.shortDescription: HUDFramework is a UI framework that makes it possible for mods to add new UI elements to the HUD.

attributes.author: Antonix35
attributes.description:
[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Features﻿[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[list]
[*][size=3]Unlock FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Untie the game speed from the framerate, [/size][size=3]allowing you to play at any FPS values at normal speed.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixed stuttering. The game will become smoother. No more need for iFPSClamp=60 and it works with any FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixes a problem with dialogs.[/size]
[*][size=3]Jump height fix at high FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Reduces loading time. The effect is especially noticeable if game is on SSD.[/size]
[*][size=3]Ability to disable animation on loading screens to [color=#ffff00]significantly[/color] reduce loading time.[/size]
[*][size=3]Ability to shorten post-loading animation.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix incorrect processor threads allocation at loading time[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix rotation speed of objects.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix [/size][size=3]rotation speed in workshop mode.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixes a problem of stuck NPC and [/size][size=3]getting stuck when you access to the terminal and power armor.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix lockpick rotation speed and sound during lockpicking.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix wind speed (clothes and hair).[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixed a bug with a white screen when the player falls (from the third person). [/size]
[/list]
[size=3]The mod will be useful for any FPS.[/size]
[size=3]You can customize mod by editing the HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini file, which is located in game folder Fallout 4\Data\F4SE\Plugins or in mod folder: true - enabled, false - disabled.

[/size][size=3]If the EnableDisplayTweaks setting is set to true: 1) The Fullscreen and borderless options in the launcher (bFull Screen and bBorderless in Fallout4Prefs.ini) have no effect. If you want to change the display mode - it must be set in HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini (FullScreen and Borderless settings). 2) If using ENB disable "ForceVSync" in enblocal.ini setting and set "Vertical synchroniztion" to application-controlled in driver settings or your game get black screen.[/size]

[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Requirements[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[size=3]Fallout 4 - 1.10.163.0
A version for VR is available.[/size]
[size=3]F4SE - 0.6.20+[/size]


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Compatibility﻿[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[size=3]The mod must be compatible with others.[/size]


[center][size=4][color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b]My others mods[/b][/font][/color][/size][/center]
[size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/47760]Sprint Stuttering Fix
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48078]Weapon Debris Crash Fix[/url][/size]


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=3][center]Credits[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/36620665?tab=user+files]R3zy[/url] for providing the source of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/18160]Havok Fix[/url] for Skyrim SE.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/5217635?tab=user+files]SlavicPotato[/url] for providing the source of [url=https://github.com/SlavicPotato/SSEDisplayTweaks]SSE Display Tweaks[/url] for Skyrim SE.
F4SE's team.

The source is available on [url=https://github.com/AntoniX35/HighFPSPhysicsFix]GitHub[/url].


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Особенности[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[list]
[*][size=3]Разблокировка FPS (частоты кадров).[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление дрожания изображения\NPC\игрока. Игра станет более плавной. Нет больше необходимости в iFPSClamp=60 и это работает с любым ФПС.[/size]
[*][size=3]Отвязка скорости игры от частоты кадров, что позволит вам играть при любых значениях FPS c нормальной скоростью.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправляет проблему с диалогами.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление высоты прыжка при высоком FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Ускорение загрузки локаций. Эффект особенно заметен, если игра работает на твердотельном накопителе (SSD).[/size]
[*][size=3]Возможность отключить анимацию на загрузочных экранах, чтобы [color=#ffff00]значительно[/color] сократить время загрузки.[/size]
[*][size=3]Возможность сократить послезагрузочную анимацию.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление неверного распределения потоков процессора во время загрузок.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости вращения объектов.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости вращения в режиме строительства.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление застреваний NPC, а также при попытке подойти к терминалам/силовой броне.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости вращения отмычкой и звука при взломе.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости ветра (одежда и волосы).[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправлен баг с белым экраном во время падения игрока при камере от третьего лица.[/size]
[/list][size=3][size=3]
Мод будет полезен при любом FPS.[/size]
[size=3]Вы можете настроить мод, отредактировав файл HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini, который находится в папке с игрой Data\F4SE\Plugins или в папке мода: значение true - включено, значение false - отключено.
[/size]
Если у настройки EnableDisplayTweaks установлено значение true: 1) Параметры полноэкранного режима и оконного режима без рамки в лаунчере (bFull Screen и bBorderless в Fallout4Prefs.ini) не действуют, если вы хотите изменить режим отображения, он должен быть установлен в HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini (настройки FullScreen и Borderless). 2) При использовании ENB отключите "ForceVSync" в файле enblocal.ini и установите "Вертикальную синхронизацию" на управляемую приложением в настройках драйвера, иначе ваша игра получит черный экран.

[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Требования[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[size=3]Fallout 4 - 1.10.163.0[/size]
[size=3]F4SE - 0.6.20+[/size]


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][center]Совместимость[/center][/b][/font][/color][/size]
[size=3]Мод должен быть совместим с другими.[/size]


[center][size=3][color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b]Мои другие моды[/b][/font][/color][/size][/center]
[size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/47760]Sprint Stuttering Fix
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48078]Weapon Debris Crash Fix[/url][/size]

attributes.author: Gopher
attributes.description:
[youtube]AnIbFgJeTeY[/youtube][youtube]v4PQgf82wVw[/youtube]
The aim of iHUD is to provide the immersive feel you get from having no HUD, whilst keeping the usefulness of having one. It takes the permanantly visible HUD elements such as compass and crosshair, and hides them when not needed. Hence the motto:

HUD when you need. HIDE when you don't.

[color=#00ff00]What does it let you do?
[/color]1. Hides the HUD and lets you set the circumstances under which it re-apears.
2. Lets you set up situations where single HUD elements appear rather than the entire HUD.
3. Toggle the HUD with an in game item. 
3. Toggle the compass with an in game item. 

[color=#00ff00]Requires[/color]
1. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309/?]HUDFramework[/url] v[b]1.0d or later

[/b][color=#00ff00]Recommended[/color]
1. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497/?]Mod Configuration Menu[/url] - Adds a user friendly menu system to control the mod without having to use holotapes.

[color=#00ff00]Installation[/color]
1. Click the Download with Manager button in the files section to download to NMM.
2. Activate the mod from the mods tab.

[color=#00ff00]Load Order[/color]
Please place iHUD below/after the HUDFramework mod in your load order.
attributes.name: Immersive HUD - iHUD-20830-3-0
attributes.shortDescription: HUD when you need. Hide when you don't.

attributes.author: Hamper
attributes.description:
[b]UPDATE:
Now also included in my [/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/45944][b]Complimentary Gameplay Enhancements[/b][/url][b]﻿ mod, give it a look!
[/b]

This is what I feel is the most realistic, fun and immersive way to tweak the movement speeds.

Your character now actually feels like he/she has some weight behind his/her movement, like in recent 2020 games.

You are now running around 10-15% slower than vanilla. You are walking 10-20% faster though.
One-handed weapons slow you less than two-handed weapons. Backward speed is reduced, sideways is slightly reduced.
Power armor does not become much slower when unholstering any weapon, since it is a powerful machine.

Includes no NPC movements edits, since that is now known to cause fps drops and quest bugs.
Includes the sprint stutter fix, so sprint is max 470.

Give it a try. Safe to install/uninstall mid-playthrough.
attributes.name: Immersive Movement Tweaks-45943-1-02-1593703518
attributes.shortDescription:
This tweaks the movement of the player and power armor to be more realistic.
You are now slightly slower, 2handed is slower than 1handed. Backwards and sideways movement are slightly slower than forward.
Everything balanced to not be too slow either.
Power armor are more consistent in speed.
(Includes the fps stutter sprint fix

attributes.author: AKcelsior
attributes.description:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/sSx5eFQ.jpg[/img][/center][line][center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode]
This mod reduces the density of insignificant objects to [size=2]0[/size], effectively removing their existence safely from your game. You choose what to keep and what to get rid of.

Maybe you need that extra bit of performance to run "Sim Settlements", or maybe you think the pebbles and twigs are an eyesore. Whatever your reasoning, this mod will take care of it. 

[color=#cfe2f3]Skyrim Special Edition[/color] version [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/3354?]here[/url]![/font][/center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][line] [/font][center][b][color=#b6d7a8][size=2]Special thanks to [b][color=#ffd966]The White Collar Players[/color][/b][/size][/color][b][size=2][color=#b6d7a8], [/color][/size][/b][color=#ffd966]HTH Mods[/color][size=2][color=#b6d7a8], [/color][b][color=#ffd966]Fonnie Dro[/color][/b][color=#b6d7a8], [/color][color=#ffd966]Tyrannicon[/color][color=#b6d7a8], and [/color][color=#ffd966]SkyttsTV [/color][color=#b6d7a8]for featuring this mod in their videos:[/color][/size]
[/b]
[youtube]X0Nf4CghcD0[/youtube] [youtube]UnCiYiN7k3c[/youtube] [youtube]ESg0Q2N3p28[/youtube] [youtube]B0kY4DgSENw[/youtube] [youtube]7rTPK2UcCAY[/youtube][/center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][line][/font][b][color=#ffe599][size=4]
Install[/size][/color][/b][size=4]:[/size]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Click the download with NMM button and activate.[/font]

[size=4][color=#ffe599][b]Uninstall[/b][/color]:[/size]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Deactivate in NMM.
[/font]
[b][size=4][color=#ffe599]Load Order[/color]:[/size][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]It shouldn't matter. If I had a gamma gun to my head I would say place it after mods that edit landscapes.[/font][i][color=#e69138] [/color][/i]
[line]
[b][font=Trebuchet MS][color=#ffe599][size=4]FAQs[/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana]:

[/font][/b][font=Tahoma][b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]What exactly did you remove?[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8][b]A:[/b][/color] Procedural "grass" that isn't actually grass - These objects are spawned in varying densities in a radius around the player when you load an area. Things like small stones, rubble, concrete debris, the crap underwater, a couple twigs, the stuff you probably never noticed and [u]can't interact with[/u].
[color=#ffd966][size=1]*There are 4 different versions bundled in the installer. Choose which one suits your tastes.[/size][/color]

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Why did you do this?[/color]
[b][color=#b6d7a8]A:[/color] [/b]Because your processing/rendering power is better used generating things you can actually see.

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]How much performance do I gain?[/color]
[b][color=#b6d7a8]A:[/color][/b] Depends on the scene, draw distance, hardware, etc. If your computer is less than 3 or 4 years old, there's a good chance you won't need this mod. If you have a decent rig but use massive mods like "Sim Settlements" that add their own clutter, this mod can help, especially once your settlements upgrade. 

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Does this mess up the new "Weapon Debris" feature added for [b]NVIDIA (PhysX/FleX)[/b] users in patch 1.3.x?[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8][b]A:[/b][/color] Absolutely not. Your weapons will still generate real time debris that can be interacted with. 

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Is this compatible with...?[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8][b]A:[/b][/color] Probably. This mod doesn't actually delete anything so there's no chance of CTD.

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Can you provide me with a wall of text explaining EVERYTHING?[/color]
[b][color=#b6d7a8]A:[/color] [/b]Those little rocks, twigs, bits of concrete, and piles of rubble in the screenshots aren't physical objects in the game world. It's actually [url=http://www.creationkit.com/Grass]GRASS[/url] that's generated on the fly using [url=http://i.imgur.com/1HGfDY0.jpg]PARAMETERS[/url][url=http://i.imgur.com/tLekmPt.jpg] [/url]initialized when you launch the game. I'm essentially removing 1/4 of all the grass you don't see to try and net older systems a few additional FPS. 

You won't CTD because I didn't break precombines, swap any meshes or delete any references. Even if another mod uses junk I removed, the engine will still have all the necessary information to attempt to draw that junk at a density of 0. 

In the eyes of the engine it's all just grass to be processed, but to our human eyes it's grass mixed with a ton of insignificant objects. Objects that will no longer exist once you activate this esp.[/font]
attributes.name: Insignificant Object Remover-9835-1-0
attributes.shortDescription: Safely removes insignificant objects to improve performance without visual degradation.

attributes.author: ElPolloAzul
attributes.description:
[size=4][i][b]Institute Portal Gun[/b][/i][/size]
ElPolloAzul

[u][b]The Pitch[/b][/u]

* Upset with not being able to see what's at the top of some building or water tower?
* Yearn to visit the REAL stands of Diamond City?
* Desire to have a quick and easy way to retreat to your settlement from
some dungeon overloaded with loot -- and don't want to call a
vertibird?
* Need to disappear your foes quickly to a hostile area? Tend to appear
during the night in a place you shouldn't be?
* Feel like you should be able to get the jump on people?
* Fancy abducting your friends and making them walk all the way back
home?
* Could benefit from being able to throw grenades in one place only to
have them explode in another place?
* Want to make a real big mess?
* Or do you just want to steal everything in sight?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, the Institute has the
versatile tool for you!

[u][b]The Who What When Where and Why[/b][/u]

Deep within an ice chest in a meat freezer, there is a cancer, known as
the Portal Gun...
With each shot, the Institute Portal Gun conjures up one of two
entangled mystical, magical portals!

One is blue. The other? Orange.

Use this gun to ascend to new heights, perform daring raids, and annoy
settlers in endless loops.
If you can figure out how to solve puzzles or perform testing with it in
this game, well, good for you.

Here's how it works:

Shoot one portal onto some object or surface, step close to it, and be
warped to the other portal.
Teleportation works between and within interiors, large exterior places,
and in the Commonwealth at large.

But be careful: watch where you warp!
And it's not just you who can be transferred to the other side...

Change portal colors by unequipping and reequipping the gun.

Here's where you can find it:

The Institute has wisely sequestered this awesome power in a place few
would think to look: its agents have secreted the gun and a special
holotape in Diamond City, in an ice machine which is itself in the Meat
Freezer atop Choice Chops!

Also from The Institute labs: Project Holdall, your holotape uplink to
convenient temporary remote storage of items in the Cloud (of radiation,
that is).

Equip the Portal Gun with the Loot Coprocessor to gain even more
irresponsible power: the power of taking everything in sight for later
retrieval at your convenience.

In a word: "Emergent" gameplay!

[u][b]Manual type stuff:[/b][/u]

[i]Installation[/i]

No special instructions, archive contains 1 ESP and 2 BA2s.
Prior to uninstalling, make sure you clear out the remote inventory.
Its world location is next to the icebox where you get the gun.

[i]Where is this thing specifically?[/i]

For more specific guidance, when you first enter the middle of Diamond City (not the Stands),on the right is the All Faiths Chapel, and next to it is the butcher stand (Choice Chops).  If you've got to the front door of the Dugout Inn you've gone too far. You want to get on the roof of Choice Chops to access its meat locker (one way is to not completely go up to the stands and walk along the edge of the stadium seating). In
the Meat Locker is the ice container with the portal gun.  This is a small room with hanging meat and frost, so it's pretty distinctive once
you are inside.

[i]How do I change portal colors?[/i]

If you unequip and then re-equip the portal gun ([b]through the menu only[/b]) the colors on the gun should change. When it's blue, you should be able to fire a blue portal. Do the same to switch back to orange. Sometimes when a save loads, the right color mod
might not be equipped; you should also be able to get back in proper phase by this same equipping and un-equipping.

A melee bash (Alt) will also do this: this is the preferred method since it minimizes out-of-color-change phase cosmetic issues.

As an easter egg, if you have a item in the world grabbed, then bash, if you release the grab it will throw the item out in front of you instead of just dropping.

[i]General Cautions[/i]

* If you use the remote storage, clear it out before you uninstall!
* Dying, getting stuck, breaking NPC behaviors when you displace things, losing things is (WC4:) The Price of Freedom. 

Some notes on buggy behavior and engine limitations:

[i]Fast Travel and Jump[/i] / "Falling" Animation

This glitchy behavior has been around for some time in the Havok enabled Gamebryo games...

From time to time, a warp which results in an incomplete fall animation
will stick the player temporarily with a falling state. If you want to
fast travel or jump, these are things you cannot do while the game
thinks you are falling; another telltale sign is that the character may
also amusingly hold their hands up when interacting. This problem can
more rarely happen in the vanilla game in any situation in which you
fall abruptly or are ragdolled severely. Usually this issue is solved
pretty handily with this mod by using the Portal Gun to precipitate one
or two more falls to clear the "floating walk" state. Sometimes menu or
area transitions or ground cover also resolves this issue.

[i]Controls[/i]

You switch portal types by equipping and reequipping the gun. This is
admittedly inconvenient: if there was a sensible way in native scripting
to capture melee attacks or capture other keystrokes this would have
been ideal. It may be more convenient for the moment to assign the gun
and another weapon to quick keys to accelerate this process.

I have looked into multiple ways of doing this. If you come up with something
particularly crafty, let me know. Otherwise, I plan to put a version of this out
for the Script Extender at some point, which should make this more convenient.

And yes, something like ammo-type switch (a player-initiated event tied to the gun,
but triggered before the weapon firing) would have been
quite nice! A way to capture a weapon bash event, as pointed out below,
would also work.  It turns out that swapping an object/weapon mod on a
gun requires an unequip-reequip cycle anyway. It's nice, for example,
that you can detect if the player is sneaking slightly after the portal
is opened, but this doesn't let you perform an action upon the player
sneaking. There are a handful of other approaches, with their own
issues. It would do good things for weapon mods not requiring script extenders
if Bethesda patched an alternate fire mode switching mechanism in at
some point.

[i]Assets: Nostalgia Deficiency![/i]

Now, to address the elephant in the room, if anyone does come up with a nice,
well-rigged, nicely textured mesh to approximate the original gun
from Portal, I would be happy to help realize a version of this mod
which uses the attractive and nostalgic assets. I don't have the expertise or the proper
tools for the time being to give you all the best run at this, so veteran weapon mesh artists, animators, and NIF configurers
may be interested in bringing the Portal gun and the authentic portal effects to life.

[b]Community Videos[/b]

A good feature overview comes from user "[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCW6yg9hSuAVZMeT_kMMFxwg]Total SideQuest[/url]"
[youtube]1W9tSrP9J-Y[/youtube]

And if you want visual guidance, there's this from [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCX86tbjTYYFne8z1XnbD2ug]EpicCRAZY WOLF[/url]:
[youtube]q23n4LjAVTc[/youtube]

Thanks to everyone who makes videos with these mods.

And, finally, hope you all have fun with this.
attributes.name: Institute Portal Gun Version 1.51-15586-1-51
attributes.shortDescription: With each shot, the Institute Portal Gun conjures up one of two entangled mystical, magical portals! One is blue. The other? Orange. Use this gun to ascend to new heights, perform daring raids, and annoy settlers in endless loops. If you can figure out how to solve puzzles or perform testing with it in this game, well, good for you.

attributes.author: Cthorthu
attributes.description:
This mod adjusts raiders level, to allow them to use different weapons throughout the progress of the game.

Raiders level is increased, and their health value is manually adjusted to not make them overpowered. The result is: They use a larger variety of weapons.

At level 1, raiders use level 1 weapons. But while the player character levels up, the weaponry of the raiders starts being more varied.

Also, the raiders health is increased a bit when the player levels up.

Raider: Vanilla level 1 (health 30) >>> Modded level 1-10 (health 30-75)
Raider Scum: Vanilla level 4 (health 45) >>> Modded level 5-15 (health 45-75)
Raider Psycho: Vanilla level 9 (health 70) >>> Modded level 10-20 (health 70-120)
Raider Scavver: Vanilla level 14 (health 125) >>> Modded level 15-25 (health 125-175)
Raider Waster: Vanilla level 21 (health 175) >>> Modded level 25-35 (health 175-225)
Raider bosses[b]*[/b]: Vanilla level 10 (health 85) >>> Modded level 25-35 (health 85-135)
Raider Survivalist and Raider Veteran: No modfied (they have levels 30 and 39 in vanilla)

[b]*[/b][size=1]("Raider bosses" includes unique named raiders, but unique raiders have their own bonuses, and this is not modified by this mod.)[/size]

As you can see, raiders will have a bit higher health value, but only when the player character has a higher level.

In vanilla, basic raiders have pipe weapons and double barrel shotguns (and melee weapons). With this mod, basic raiders also can have 10mm pistols and hunting rifles, but only when the player character has a higher level. Other types of raiders get [b][u]larger[/u][/b] variety of weapons.



[size=3][b]Compatbility[/b][/size]

This mod makes raiders have higher level weapons from the "raiders weapons list", but this mod doesn't modify this list. It is compatible with mods that modify weapons and leveled lists, but it may be not compatible with mods that modify raiders characters stats.

This mod is fully compatible with Varied Raiders.



[b][size=3]Miscellaneous things[/size]
[/b]
If you install this mod mid game, I recommend to wait more than 20 days in a inner cell (all respawnable things will be respawned).





[font=Georgia][size=4][i]Would you like to know more?
[/i][/size][/font]
In a modded playthrough, with weapons added lo leveled lists, a higher levels means: Raiders will use many different weapons, specially at high levels. But it depends on what weapon mods you are using.

Also, this mod can be used as a part of [b]Redistribute Weapon Lists - Pipe guns removed[/b] (only if you don't like pipe weapons).
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/44724/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/44724/[/url]
Used this way, raiders and you will enjoy every battle. Promised.
If interested, read locked post.
attributes.name: Leveled Raiders-44775-1-1588206205
attributes.shortDescription: This mod makes some tweaks to raiders, to bring them more weapon variety.

attributes.author: DeathclawAlpha
attributes.description:
[size=5][center][b][font=Trebuchet MS][color=#e06666]﻿Live Dismemberment[/color][/font][/b][/center][/size][center][color=#f4cccc][size=3][u]Make them pay![/u][/size][/color][/center]Inspired by the musings of musical artists such as [color=#3c78d8]Blue Stahli[/color] and [color=#c9daf8]Carpenter Brut[/color], I bring you the pinnacle of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_Space_2]brutality-based engineering[/url] - your very own .esp that allows you to FUCK!NG KILL anyone who stands in your way with the power of mutilation! Now, after crippling an enemy's limb, the limb in question has a chance (or guarantee!) of[url=http://i.imgur.com/38xR3qR.png] blowing into bits or falling off[/url], depending on the situation!
Your options are as follows:
[list]
[*]Liebermode: For when you want mutilation, but you don't want much of it! Makes mutilation relatively rare but not to the point that you'll never see it.
[*][color=#f4cccc]Regular:[/color] The standard package! Tear off limbs now and then. Get angry. [s][color=#dd7e6b]PISS ON BLOATFLIES. [size=3]I FUCKING [/size][size=4]HATE[/size][size=3] BLOATFLIES[/size][/color][/s]
[*][size=2][color=#ea9999]Brutal:[/color] A step above regular! Painful, but not too painful. Kind of like a[url=http://i.imgur.com/7tZRwlg.jpg] gentle sack tap right before you FUCK!NG UPPERCUT YOUR FUCK!NG ENEMIES[/url][/size]
[*][size=2][color=#e06666]Insane-o:[/color] Things are getting intense. More likely than not, you'll mutilate your enemies. [url=https://i.ytimg.com/vi/LmNiypWmW4g/maxresdefault.jpg]They deserve it.[/url][/size]
[*][size=2][color=#cc0000]Mental: [/color]You are not serious! Or are you? [code]ARE YOU?! E[/code]xtreme mutilation chance.[/size]
[*][color=#900000]Postal: [/color][color=#ff0000][b][size=2]T[/size][size=4]H[/size][size=1]E[/size][/b][size=2][b] E[/b][font=Verdana][i]A[/i][/font][/size][size=4][font=Verdana]R[/font]T[/size][font=Times New Roman][size=1]H [/size][size=2]IS [/size][/font][size=3][font=Times New Roman][s]H[/s][/font][font=Tahoma]U[/font][/size][size=2][font=Tahoma]N[/font][font=Arial][u]G[/u][/font][/size][size=1][u]R[/u][/size][size=4]Y. [i]A[/i]L[/size][font=Arial]W[/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=4][s]AYS [/s][/size][/font][font=Tahoma]MU[/font][font=Tahoma][size=1][b]TIL[/b][/size][/font][font=Arial]ATE[/font][/color]
[*][color=#ff0000][size=2]Mind-Blowing: [/size][/color][size=2]Every crippled limb will always be mutilated... including the head.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
As you can see, the variety is i[code]mmense! No reason to not tear apart those horrible, worthless, meaningless, deadbeats who keep stealing my weapons... Dear God, I want to tear their arms off and make them beg for mercy... As I beat them to death with their own arms! HAHA! AHAHAHAH! HEEEEEE!
[/code]
In addition to all of this, [color=#ff0000]realistic headshot damage![/color] Anyone who can survive a shotgun shell to the face does not belong in my world!



[/size][size=3][u]Permissions and Credits
[/u][/size]You may do whatever you want with this mod as long as you credit me - anything [b][color=#ff0000][size=3]EXCEPT POSTING IT ON BETHNET.[/size][/color][/b]
THANKS [color=#00ff00]ADAMANTIUM SKELETON
[/color][url=https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/78/Salt_shaker_on_white_background.jpg]Woolie for Rebooting my love for video games[/url]
Also, thanks to ShoddyCast for removing [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newton%27s_laws_of_motion#Newton.27s_third_law]recoil[/url] from dismembered limbs.

attributes.author: xatmos
attributes.description:
[size=2]Next Version
 - Option to auto loot food and drink items.
 - Option for keeping highlights more persistent.
 - Experimental pulsing highlights.
 - System for simple compatibility patches.
 - Detect mines and some types of traps.

Version 3800 - 6/7/2018
 - Autoloot should properly trigger OnActivation events.
 - Improved mod startup/reboot time.

[b]DESCRIPTION[/b]
This mod will highlight corpses, ash/goo piles, unassigned settlers and objects, broken or unpowered objects, friendlies when scoped, creatures sleeping or unconscious, containers, terminals, collectibles, keys, holos, books, plants, doors, weapons, ammo, caps, chems, legendary items.. and even synth infiltrators.  This mod is highly configurable including settings for when and what to highlight, when to unhighlight, and the color of each highlight.

The mod activates once you take the Scrapper perk, or you manually start it via MCM or holotape.

[b]FOR XBOX ONE VERSION [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4059313]CLICK HERE[/url][/b]

[b]SETTLEMENTS & OWNERSHIP
[/b]The mod detects when you are in a settlement or an interior location that you own and disables container and item highlights automatically.  No reason to loot something that is already yours.  Out in the world, common loose items will not highlight if taking them would be stealing, but containers will still highlight so that you can examine their contents.

[b]COMPONENT TRACKING[/b]
In the vanilla game Scrapper rank 2 highlights objects (like junk) that contain components you tag.  You can tag components in the crafting interface and in the pipboy inventory.  This mod provides an alternative to this feature, so you can customize how junk is highlighted.  It also allows you to tag components from the MCM.  If you are not using F4SE customization of this feature is limited.

This feature will highlight objects in the world containing the components you select, and will also include those objects in inventory searches (highlighting corpses and containers).  The mod remembers encountered items and becomes more accurate and responsive over time.

[b]SEMI-AUTOMATIC LOOTING[/b]
Common sundries such as ammo, chems, caps, bobbypins, as well as tracked junk can be auto-looted.  Junk will be sent to your last visited workshop, while ammo etc. is given to the player when the pipboy is opened.  Non-legendary weapons can be auto-looted and converted immediately to caps.  Quest items are not autolooted and this feature will not take an item if it would count as stealing.  Also survival needs like meats and plants will not be autolooted.

Autolooting is only active while highlights are active.

Normally autoloot triggers on proximity.  But if an exploded corpse is strewn across the battlefield and you can't find the "center" of it just pick up a chunk of that supermutant or whatever it used to be and autoloot will trigger.

[b]DYNAMIC MOD WEAPON SUPPORT[/b]
New weapons and ammo added by mods can be highlighted and autolooted too.  The first time you equip a new weapon from a mod Loot Detector will ask you to confirm adding it to the detection list.  Default ammo for the weapon will automatically be discovered as well.  To teach Loot Detector about special ammo, drop a single round on the ground and let it be highlighted.

[b]SYNTH INFILTRATOR DETECTION[/b]
Normally when you aim at a friendly they will be highlighted in cyan, but if you have synth highlighting active (and the requisites) synth infiltrators will highlight in gray instead.  When you detect a synth in your settlement, keep your gun trained on them and approach, they will panic and attack (or surrender).  Thus they can be eliminated without turning your settlement against you.

[b]MANUAL OVERRIDE HOTKEY[/b]
You can map a key via MCM or other means to toggle all active effects.
Use this console command for manual mapping:
cqf xatmosScrapperQuest ToggleManualOverride

[b]EXTRA PERK REQUIREMENTS
[/b](these are disabled by default)

Some features can be gated behind perks as follows:
- Sleeping highlight requires Mister Sandman.
- Highlighting unassigned settlers and work objects requires Local Leader.
- Highlighting scrappable junk requires Scrapper rank 2.
- Highlighting doors requires VANS.
- Detecting friendlies requires Awareness.
- Detecting synth infiltrators requires Awareness AND Robotics Expert.
- Autolooting items requires Science! AND Scrounger OR Fortune Finder.

[b]UPGRADING & UNINSTALLING
[/b]Usually uninstalling or upgrading will not cause any problems.  But just to be extra safe, make multiple saves before upgrading or removing the mod.

To fully uninstall, verify that the following files and/or folders are removed:
Fallout 4\data\scripts\xatmosScrapper*.pex
Fallout 4\data\scripts\xatmos\xatmosScrapper*.pex
Fallout 4\data\MCM\Config\Loot Detector\*
Fallout 4\data\MCM\Config\xatmosLootDetector\*
Fallout 4\data\textures\effects\gradients\xatmosScrapper\*

[b]INSTALLATION[/b]
Users of the pre-CK version of this mod should first uninstall everything related to it.  Do not install any "patches" for this mod, they are all outdated.

NMM users should download the ESP version.  NMM does not properly support ESL files.  If you are new to modding and run into trouble give [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]this page[/url] a read through!

Don't forget to install the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16899]Brawl Bug Fix[/url]﻿ by ErshinPL to prevent certain scripted events from breaking.

The mod can take about a minute to boot up for the first time.

[b]CONFIGURATION WITHOUT MCM
[/b]Check your inventory for the Loot Detector holotape.  Below is a description of each option:

[Features]
Corpse Vision:  Highlight corpses and ashpiles with loot.
KO Vision:  Highlight unconscious (e.g drugged, knocked out, or powered down) actors.
Sandman Vision:  Highlight sleeping friends and foes.
Loot Vision:  Highlight keys, collectibles, and legendary items in the world (optionally more).
Dumpster Vision:  Highlight containers with loot.
Nerd Vision:  Highlight books, holotapes, and terminals.
Aiming IFF:  Highlight friendlies in ironsights or scoped.
Explorer Vision:  Highlight doors and door-like objects.
Taskmaster Vision:  Highlight unassigned settlers and objects, also settlers with quests.
Mechanist Vision:  Highlight broken and unpowered workshop objects.

[Advanced]
Common Sundries:  Include ammo, chems, etc in world and inventory scans.
Survival Needs:  Include food, drink, and flora in scans.
Weightless Trifles:  Highlight and/or loot 0-weight items with a cap value.
Legendary Tracker:  Show or hide the tracker quest objective.
Proximity Suppression:  Suppress highlights on actors when in close proximity.
Component Highlighting:  Include scrappable junk.
Disable Vanilla Component Radar:  Prevent vanilla Scrapper2 highlighting.
Extra Perk Requirements:  Require additional perks for some features.
Unhighlighting:  Determines behavior for corpses and containers.
VATS Override:  Set how VATS interacts with highlight conditions..
Auto Collect:  Toggle auto-looting common sundries and junk.
Caps4Guns:  Automatically convert plain weapons to caps.
Voigt-Kampff Protocol:  Determine how to handle synth infiltrators.
Corpse Context:  Condition for highlighting remains.
Sandman Context:  Condition for highlighting unconscious actors.
Loot Context:  Condition for highlighting items and containers.
Explorer Context:  Condition for highlighting doors and nerd stuff.
Workshop Context:  Condition for workshop highlights.

Currently there are more options that are only available in the MCM.

[b]COMPATIBILITY[/b]
- Load order does not matter at all (no vanilla forms are modified).
- F4SE and MCM are not required, but highly recommended.
- No DLC is required.  All DLC is supported.
- The Unofficial Patch is highly recommended.
- Mods that change the boundaries of settlements could cause problems.
- Some items from other mods may not be detected within inventories.
- If junk components are changed, tracking may not be accurate.
- Only vanilla components (adhesive, steel, etc.) are supported.

[b]KNOWN ISSUES[/b]
- Doors placed as static objects like rubble or fake walls may be highlighted.
- Flora that is not harvestable may be highlighted anyway.
- Shaders do not work on some transparent objects like glass beakers.
- Magnifying glass icon on tagged objects doesn't update until reload.
- The friendly highlight can get temporarily stuck if toggled rapidly.
- Shotgun ammo boxes highlight but do not trigger a proximity event.
[/size]
attributes.name: Loot Detector (ESP for NMM)-4380-3800
attributes.shortDescription: Adds a glow effect to lootable corpses, collectibles, etc. when you have the Scrapper perk.  Updated for 100% more enjoyment!

attributes.author: Baron
attributes.customFileName: Loot Vision - Highlight Unlooted Corpses - Loot Vision v1.1
attributes.description:
[size=5][u]Summar[/u]y[u]:[/u]
[/size]
I like looting.  I frequently lose track of all the corpses I create in my adventures which is detrimental to looting.  There are mods out there that highlight corpses, and some also only highlight if the corpse has loot that can be sold for caps but that solution requires you to take EVERYTHING from the corpse that has value (even if it's just 1 caps worth).  If you play in survival you have greatly reduced carry weight which prevents you from taking literally everything which means these solutions don't really work.  So I decided to make a solution of my own.

When using berry mentats, power armor targeting hud, or anything else that grants "detect life" as a feature, slain enemies will highlight orange.  As soon as you investigate the corpse (the second the inventory menu pops up) the orange highlight will disappear.

This effect only applies to enemies killed in game.  It does not show up on corpses that spawn in dead like the dog and wastelander just across the bridge from sanctuary to red rocket.


[size=5][u]Compatibilit[/u]y[u]:[/u]
[/size]
Mods that alter the targeting hud helmet mod for power armor, berry mentats, or the detect life effect will conflict.  I have provided compatibility patches for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8671/]Targeting HUD and Berry Mentats Enhanced[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17374]Horizon[/url].  Choose one or the other as they both override berry mentats.  Install both the main files and the patch file for whichever mod your using.

Special note, it appears to override Horizon's white corpse highlight, even after the corpse is marked as looted.  I'll try to get them to play nice together but I don't really care about corpses I've already looted not highlighting anyways so not a huge priority to me.  Targeting HUD Enhanced on the other hand seems to play both shaders at once so you get blue smoke AND orange smoke which I think is a feature.


[size=5][u]Installin[/u]g[u]/Uninstallin[/u]g[u]:[/u][/size]

Should be safe to install or uninstall whenever.  If you already have targeting hud on your power armor and you're IN your power armor when you load your save for the first time after installing you will have to leave your power armor and re-enter it for the effect to begin.


[size=5][u]Credits:[/u][/size]

I made the shader effect by copying and modifying the base game's detect life shader effect so credit to bethesda for that file.  Also for making a game so easily and readily modifiable.  

I also borrowed inspiration from Targeting hud enhanced so props to Yukichigai, the author, as well.

I used FO4Edit to check compatibility and do general cleanup so credit should be given to the FO4Edit team.  A lot of this stuff wouldn't be possible without them.



Thanks and enjoy!
attributes.name: Loot Vision v1.1.7z-27349-1-1
attributes.shortDescription: When using power armor targeting hud or berry mentats, slain enemy corpses will highlight orange.  Accessing their inventory will make the orange highlight disappear.

attributes.author: The6thMessenger

UPDATE: Now available for NMM.

A simple compilation of existing Pipe-Weapons retexture into moddable materials. It affects the weapon's performance, and spawns randomly in the wasteland. Think of it like Pipe-Weapons being able to be made from different materials. 

I apologize in advance, for the poor Spiked Sharpshooter's Grip retextures, i only recolored them, that is not my expertise.

Don't forget to endorse and comment.

DISCLAIMER | WARNING!
[quote] It will reinstall the Vanilla Pipe-Weapons texture as the "Rusted" version. It will not affect existing Pipe-Weapons automatically but will only affect newly-spawned Pipe Weapons. It is however easily fixed by applying the mods manually in the crafting bench.[/quote]MATERIALS:
 - [0] Rusted: -15% Weight, Reload Speed, Damage. +15% Recoil. - 0.40 Speed.
 - [1] Shadowed Rusted: -10% Weight, Reload Speed, Damage. +15% Recoil. Increased stealth in dark areas. - 0.40 Speed.
 - [2] Worn: No Penalty
 - [3] Shadowed Worn: +5% Weight. Increased stealth in dark areas
 - [4] Polished: +15% damage.
 - [5] Quality: +20% damage, +10% Weight.
 - [6] High-Quality, +25% damage, +15% Weight.
 - [7] Shadowed High-Quality, +25% damage, +20% Weight. Increased Stealth in dark areas.
 - [8] Aluminium: -65% Weight. +25% Recoil. -13% Sight Transition, +13% Aim-Stability, -25% AP Cost. 
 - [9] Alloyed: -40% Weight, +15% Recoil and Damage. -8% Sight Transition, +8% Aim-Stability, -15% AP Cost.

0.) Standard rusted materials, with stats supposedly weakening the weapon, living up to it's junky trashy nature.
1.) Shadowed rusted version is basically above, but with painted materials to increase stealth in dark areas. Useful for stealth-builds.
 - The first two are locked with Gun-Nut 1 as to not make the modification of weapons too easy without as much as even investing a single point in Gun-Nut.

2.) Basically standard, all the penalties lifted.
3.) Like above, but increased stealth in dark areas.
4.) Somewhat better-materials via cleaning resulting in more damage.
5.) Quality materials further increases damage at the cost of more weight, and potentially more AP consumption. It's good for Non-VATS builds.
6.) High-Quality is an end-game materials, further increases damage at the cost of weight.
7.) Same as above but with a bit more weight and increased Stealth in dark areas.
8.) Very light-weight materials resulting in less AP consumption and better handling traits, at the cost of increased recoil.
9.) Cross-road between High-Quality and Aluminium, Alloyed materials give a bit nice handling traits yet give good damage bonus.

Credits:
 - AlexSlesh - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3181/?]More Realistic Handmade Pipe Weapons[/url]
 - Johnsack2001 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/748/?]Darker pipe weapons[/url]
 - Billyro - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8141/?]Better Reflective Pipe Weapons[/url] 
 - Acacyn - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/742/?]Darker Pipe Rifle - Pistol - Revolver[/url]
 - murdalizer - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/822/?]Brown to Gray Pipe Weapons[/url] 
 - TrickyVein - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10484/?]Crossbows of the Commonwealth

Modding Notes:
 - The actual textures and materials are separated at "PWO ..." so to not conflict with vanilla textures. It is also able to be retextured by simply replacing the files.
 - Also works with Syringer, except it's Long-Barrel, but currently is not implemented.

Future Plans:

I know what you're thinking, it would be more realistic if one can pick different materials for other slots like the Receivers, magazines, Stocks/Grip, Barrel, Scope etc.

While yes, maybe in the future, but right now i am dreadfully uninterested.
attributes.name: MPWM 2.20 - PWO B11.05-8666-2-20-1572761401
attributes.shortDescription: Pipe weapons for everybody!

attributes.author: Crazy sam10
attributes.description:
Alright, I've had to overhaul the description page due to the most recent update, which is a major overhaul.

This mod now adds the following:
*All DLC Support for ammo machines and the ballistic weapon machine.
*A Chem machine.
*A "Nuka-Loom" machine.
*New Textures
*Tweaked ammo recipes from Manufacturing Extended.
*Armour machines allowing the construction of full armour sets.

That's right. This mod builds upon the mod, Manufacturing Extended, by Kentington by adding and tweaking where he left off. Firstly, it's added the DLC ammo in to the base ammo machine, now called the Ballistic Ammo Machine. It has also added some new machines, the much requested Chem station, and the Energy Weapon ammo machine. As of right now, only the Ballistic ammo machine has its unique texture, but that is scheduled to change as the mod grows. It should also be noted while this builds upon Manufacturing Extended, it is [b]not [/b]required to use this mod. So if you're only after the DLC support, then this mod works just as well on its own.

I have also played around with a few of the recipes that Kentington had provided when making the ammo because I felt they didn't fit. Such an example is replacing the copper in Plasma Cartridges to plastic, because they look more plastic than coppery.

The chem machine at present only has base game chems, nothing from DLC. But it does allow the creation of Med-X, Rad-X and Buffout, recipes not in the base game. The Energy Weapon ammo machines does what it says on the box, and it now allows the creation of flares and fusion cores. All with balancing of course.

Huge thanks to Cartman1975 to helping me figure out how to add recipes, as well as making me the new textures. As well as Kentington for making the original Manufacturing Extended mod.

[center][/center][u][b][center]Recommended mods[/center][/b][/u][list]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16810/?]Growable wild plants[/url] - Great for growing plants for the chem machine such as brain fungus and hubflower.
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15429/?]Manufacturing Extended[/url] - Goes without saying really.  This mod builds upon said mod, so I recommend it if you don't yet have it. Just ensure this mod is loaded over it however, as this mod fixes a few bugs that one had.
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14996/?]Worthwhile Eyebot Pods[/url] - Great for getting components for the manufacturing machines. Especially lead and fertilizer.
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16040/?]Power Armour Forge[/url] - Adds machines for all 4 power armour types. Saves myself having to make these machines.
[/list]
[center][u][b]Load Order[/b][/u][/center]
Thanks to GenericFallout for finding this out.

Working Load Order for Manufacturing Extended Expanded:
--------------------------------------------------------------
Your .esms (as you can't really move them...)

Amorsmith Extended.esp

ManufacturingExtended.esp (Kentington's mod)
DLC items to manufacturing.esp (from this mod)

<.esps that add/change ITEMS you can make (Armor, weapons, and such)

ValdacilsItemSorting-00-ValsPicks-DLCVersion-VanillaWeight.esp (Your ViS picks might change the name here)

<.esps that change/add settlers (Better Settlers, Don't Call me Settler, those kinds of mods)

Radrose Usability Enhancements.esp
Radrose -Valdacil Patch - Armorsmith Extended.esp
Radrose - Vladacil Patch - SettlersRename.esp

<.esps with regards to your workshop/settlements

Scrap Everything... if you use it! (j/k, it should already be dead-last )
---------------------------------------------------------------------

This load-order MIGHT work for you, if you use AWKCR, a bit of AE, some settlermods, and the ViS/DEF_Inv/Radrose package.

YOUR mileage may vary.

Of course, I also highly recommend using LOOT as well.

attributes.author: Kentington
attributes.description:
[color=#00ff00][size=3][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/fallout-4-contraption-mods-add-machines-to-butcher-corpses-create-soylent-green/]Featured in PC Gamer![/url]
[/size]
Want to build your own settlers? [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16354/?]Workshop Synth Production[/url] is just what your factory needs!
Version 1.4 allows the component extractor and object extractor to pull items from linked workshops, among other general improvements. You will need to access the extractor's settings from a terminal.
Version 1.3 adds a generic object extractor and a workaround for Recycler-related lag.
Version 1.2 adds a conveyor intersection, adds an auto-loom to produce faction armor, and allows the explosives mill to produce Nuka Grenades and nuke mines.
[/color]
The manufacturing mechanics introduced in Contraptions Workshop are frankly underwhelming; they require too much manual intervention and tend to be incomplete (ammo types) or annoyingly random (armor manufacturing). This mod aims to fix that.

[font=Courier New][color=#00ff00][b][size=5]New Devices[/size][size=3]
[/size]
[/b][/color][/font][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Component Extractor
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Breaks down junk from the workshop's inventory, then outputs components onto its conveyor belt. You can specify which components to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Object Extractor
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Pulls items from the workshop. You can specify which items to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Recycler
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Junk items passed into it are broken down into components.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Conveyor Workshop Storage
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Deposits items into the workshop's inventory.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Conveyor Intersection
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Allows joining belts at a 90-degree angle.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Vault-Tec Auto-Loom
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Builds jumpsuits and other Vault-related outfits.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Faction Auto-Loom
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Builds Brotherhood, Institute, Railroad, Minutemen, and Atom Cats clothing.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Power Armor Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Builds power armor pieces, fusion cores, and frame kits. With a kit in your inventory, go to the Special workshop category to build a frame.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Melee Weapon Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Builds melee weapons.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Fist Weapon Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Builds unarmed weapons.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Distillery
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Produces alcohol and Nuka Cola products.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Auto-Butcher
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Breaks down corpses into meat, bone, leather, or other resources depending on the type of creature. And yes, it works on people too...

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Robot Disassembler
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Breaks down destroyed robots into junk and components.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Inventory Management Brain
[/b][/size][/color][/font]When power to this device is toggled, components, ammo, and aid items stored in the workbench are consolidated into a single object reference. This can relieve lag caused by how FO4 handles in-world objects.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Far Harbor Ammunition Plant (Requires optional patch)
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Produces Far Harbor ammunition.

[font=Courier New][b][color=#00ff00][size=5]Modified Devices[/size][/color][/b]
[/font][font=Courier New]
[/font][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Armor Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Now allows you to choose which piece is produced. Also can now produce synth armor.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Ammunition Plant
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Now produces fusion cells, plasma cartridges, gamma cells, flamer fuel, cryo cells, and railroad spikes.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Explosives Mill
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Now produces cannonballs, missiles, mini-nukes, nuka grenades, and nuke mines.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Weapon Forge
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Now produces syringers and railway rifles.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Energy Weapon Forge
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Now produces Institute laser weapons.

************************************
[size=4]Add-Ons

[/size]Other modders have taken Manufacturing Extended and... extended it. Please message me if you'd like your mod featured here.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15776/?]Soylent Green[/url]

************************************

[size=4][b]You Might Also Enjoy[/b][/size]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5393/?]Moveable Power Armor
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7835/?]Where Are My Provisioners?
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7809/?]Power Armor Delivery[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7835/?]
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8262/?]Power Armor Autopilot[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8347/?]Rip A Guy's Arm Off And Beat Him To Death With It[/url]

[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12858/?]Vertidrones[/url]

attributes.author: reg2k - Neanka - shadowslasher410
attributes.description:
[img align=right]https://i.imgur.com/yThthRV.png[/img]
[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ About ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

The Mod Configuration Menu is a settings page for mods!

It provides a central location for mod configuration, accessible via the Pause menu.

ModSettings are stored in per-mod INI files under Data\MCM\Settings, making it easy to backup and restore settings and even change them outside the game if so desired should the mod support it.

Are you a modder? Check out the [url=https://github.com/Neanka/MCM_0.1_AS3/wiki]documentation[/url] for detailed information on creating MCM menus.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Features ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*] Configure more aspects of your mods than ever before - the MCM provides a range of controls such as checkboxes, steppers, dropdowns, sliders, buttons, text, and keybinds.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Optimized for PC[/b]. The MCM steps far beyond what is allowed for consoles.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]No ESM/ESP[/b]. The MCM does not count towards your load order.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Save-safe[/b]. The MCM never sinks its teeth into your savegame - any modifications, as with most F4SE plugins, are done in-memory.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]File-safe[/b]. No vanilla forms or files on disk are overriden. The MCM is completely standalone.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Hotkey support and conflict detection[/b]. Assign hotkeys to mod actions to activate them on-the-fly.
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Details ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Each mod's menu lives in its own directory in [code]Data\MCM\Config\ModName[/code].

User settings are located at [code]Data\MCM\Settings\ModName.ini[/code].

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]FOLDER STRUCTURE[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[spoiler][font=Courier New]Data/
└── MCM/
    ├── Config/
    │   ├── Mod1/
    │   │   ├── config.json         (Required) Menu Layout
    │   │   ├── lib.swf             (Optional) Image library
    │   │   ├── keybinds.json       (Optional) Keybind Definitions
    │   │   └── settings.ini        (Optional) Mod Setting Defaults
    │   ├── Mod2/
    │   │   └── ...
    │   └── Mod3/
    │       └── ...
    └─── Settings/
         ├── Mod1.ini               Mod Settings for Mod1
         ├── Mod2.ini               Mod Settings for Mod2
         └── Mod3.ini               Mod Settings for Mod3[/font][/spoiler]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Installation ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder for a manual install.

You should see a new option in the Pause menu in-game.

If there is no Mod Config option, double-check that you have [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url] installed and running!

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Requirements ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Fallout 4 (check Files tab for version requirements).
[url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url], 0.4.2 or higher.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Team ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/17152929/]registrator2000[/url] - Backend: architecture design, F4SE plugin and Papyrus bindings
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/6719842/]Neanka[/url] - Frontend: MCM interface - everything you see and interact with
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/5694891/]shadowslasher410[/url] - Frontend: MCM control design, logo & consultation

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ More ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Please report issues at the [url=https://github.com/Neanka/MCM_0.1_AS3/issues]Github issue tracker[/url]!
Suggestions are welcome - please post them in the [url=https://discord.gg/4VtnEnb]MCM Discord[/url] server.

Source code:
[url=https://github.com/reg2k/f4mcm]Github[/url] [C++] (F4SE plugin)
[url=https://github.com/Neanka/MCM_0.1_AS3]Github[/url] [AS3] (Interface)

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Acknowledgements ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Many thanks to the F4SE team for their tireless work extending the core feature-set of the game. The MCM would not be possible without it. Most modders make mods - these people make the tools that make other mods possible. They work behind-the-scenes; outside the limelight. Without them, the modding scene would be decidedly less interesting and very much more mundane.

attributes.author: Abbalovesyou
attributes.description:
So this mod well pretty much allow you to wear those 5 extra piece of armor on anything that usually takes all the slots, like the clean dirty suits, they take each body slot but with this mod that wont be happening anymore. 

There will be major clipping with all the armor parts due to the fact they weren't made to be wearable on clothes and armor like this. but the more body slots the better.

Some clothes and armor were made playable, like all the npcs in the beginning of the game.

You can either install this with Nexus Mod Manager  or the one i like to use Fallout 4 Mod Manager. orrrrrrrrrrrrr manual. Place esp in data folder and edit Plugin.txt  put More Armor Slots.esp on the list and saved it as read only. Plugin.txt should be in C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\Fallout4

Fallout 4 Mod Manager:

http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/495/?

I this mod was mad in TesVsnip and then updated with Fo4edit

attributes.author: Azhadi
attributes.description:
[b][color=#dd7e6b][size=6]More Settlement Attacks![/size][/color][/b]

This mod rises the basic change for a settlment to be attacked from 1% to 5% and reduce the cooldown from 7 days to just one day. Because 5% is still not that much, the mod also rises the amount for resources to generate "danger" and reduced the amount of "savety" at the same time. So how more resources your settlment has, the more it is likley that a attack event may trigger - to keep it immersive.


[color=#ffd966][b][size=4]Modifiervalues[/size][/b][/color]

The values to rise/decrease the chance to be attacked are altered ([b][color=#ea9999]+[/color][/b] for more Attackchance, [b][color=#b6d7a8]-[/color][/b] for less):

[color=#ea9999][size=4]+[/size][/color] 5% per Resource-Point (Water, Food, Energy)
[color=#b6d7a8][size=5]-[/size][/color] 1% per Savety-Point
[color=#b6d7a8][size=5]-[/size][/color] 2% per Settler

[center][color=#00ff00][size=5][b]How to install[/b][/size][/color]

[i]first, make sure modding is enabled by following the steps in this wiki guide:

[url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation[/url][/i][/center]


[i][b][i][color=#00ff00][size=3]Default Vanilla Install: [/size][/color][/i][/b][/i]

Download with NMM (recommended)
- or download 'NUCLEAR Nude NMM Installer' from file section and from NMM choose 'Add mod from file' and select the .zip

That's it!

[i]for manual install:[/i]

download the file NUCLEAR Nude MANUAL Install version and extract it somewhere. inside are all the skins each in their own archive. Unpack your skin of choice and copy the Data folder into your Fallout4 game folder.

since v3.3 the manual install version has been split into 3 files:
one containing the player normal skins, one with the thong skins and the last one the raider skins.


[b][i][color=#00ff00][size=3]NUCLEAR CBBE Install:[/size][/color][/i][/b]

1. Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15/?]Caliente's Beautiful Bodies Enhancer -CBBE-[/url] first
2. Download and install NUCLEAR Nude CBBE NMM Installer
3. Select 'Yes to All' when asked to overwrite
Enjoy!

[b][i][color=#00ff00][size=3]NUCLEAR JB Install:[/size][/color][/i][/b]

1. Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8288/?]Jane Bod -JB- Rev[/url] by [b]Nightasy[/b] first
2. Download and install NUCLEAR Nude JB
3. Select 'Yes to All' when asked to overwrite
Enjoy!


[size=3][center][/center][/size][color=#cc4125]Known issues:[/color]

regarding the raider skins, if you are using the new thong skins the raiders will appear to be wearing transparent thongs as well!

this is due to Bethesda using the same normal map for the raiders and player/female characters, hopefully they will patch this soon so raiders can have a unique normalmap!

as of v3.5 the NN installer now includes an optional tiny .esp plugin to let raiders have a unique normalmap to fix the issue.

CBBE backhead fix:

cbbe uses separate textures called femalebhed_d.dds and femalebhed_s.dds in order to fix a backhead texture issue. Nuclear nude does not replace these files by default (since it would increase filesize considerately) but you may experience a small seam/lighting issue in the backhead area when using some skins (or missing backhead tattoos on phoenix skins). 

the current solution is:
download the vanilla 'NUCLEAR Nude Main Skins MANUAL Install Files',
extract the skin that matches your currently installed cbbe skin
rename the file 'femalebody_d.dds' to 'femalebhed_d.dds'
rename the file 'femalebody_s.dds' to 'femalebhed_s.dds' 
copy both of those files to Fallout 4/data/textures/actors/character/basehumanfemale/ and overwrite

[color=#cc4125]How to uninstall:[/color]

If you use NMM, simply right-click the mod and select 'Uninstall Mod'

[i]manual uninstall:[/i]

1. Navigate to \Fallout 4\Data\textures\actors\character\basehumanfemale\

2. For the skin - delete the files: 
femalebody_d.dds, femalebody_s.dds, femalebody_n.dds, BaseFemaleHands_d.dds, BaseFemaleHands_s.dds

3. For Raiders - delete the files: 
FemaleBodyDirty_d.dds, FemaleBodyDirty_s.dds, FemaleBodyDirty_n.dds, BaseFemaleHandsDirty_d.dds, BaseFemaleHandsDirty_s.dds

That's it


[size=3][b][color=#d9ead3]Mini screenshot guide & tips:[/color][/b][/size]

1. look for a nice spot with good dynamic lighting and make sure you are in 3rd person view
2. open the console
3. type 'tfc 1' - this will enable free moving camera and pause all action
4. type 'sucsm 1' - this controls the speed of the free camera and brings it to a level where you can make good adjustments
5. optionally you can change the field of view with the command 'fov xx' where xx is the fov (ex 'fov 70')
6. close the console and use the controls to find a nice angle for a screenshot
7. when you found a good spot, open the console again
8. type 'tm' - this will hide all user interface and lock your current view, including the console so be warned! it is still active even tho you can't see it!
9. take screenshot by hitting print screen key
10. type 'tm' again to unhide the user interface - if you by accident closed the console, just hit the open console key and type 'tm'
11. type 'tfc' to return to normal game camera mode
12. your screenshot is saved in your fallout 4 game installation folder!

Happy snapping!
