attributes.author: MadMAX713 - Joemitchell320 - Thirdstorm - KKthebeast - MunkySpunk
attributes.customFileName: Raider Overhaul WIP - Raider Overhaul WIP 12.4 Main File I Please read changelog
attributes.description:
[center][/center][center][img]http://i68.tinypic.com/154dlpt.png[/img][/center][line][color=#f6b26b][size=4][center][color=#ffff00]**********12/10/2016**********
Fairly large update, [b][u]please[/u][/b] READ THE Change Log & Sticky notes before installing.[/color][/center]

Raider Overhaul[/size][/color]
This is a Work In Progress mod that tries to add more style and diversity to the raiders of the Commonwealth. I mean, your going to be fighting them ALL THE TIME. This mod adds various headwear and armor in the game that appear wilder, more savage, more "raider-esque". Also included are consumables, new power armor, dog gear and equipment modifications, designed to reflect the savagery and carelessness of the raider faction. This mod requires the AWCKR mod, and nearly everything is CBBE compatable. Every piece included (except the raider mod armor retexture) is 100% standalone and no vanilla textures have been replaced in any way. Raiders and their dogs in your game will randomly spawn with n new or armor. You may even meet a Raider Dreadnaught up close!

[color=#ff0000][size=5]WARNING: This mod makes raiders tougher (duh)[/size][/color]

If you like my Power Armor, but dont want the rest of my mod, check out [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13552/?]Mad Max's Raider Power Armor Chop-Shop[/url]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15/?]CBBE[/url] compatable.

KKTheBeast has made [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14182/?]VIS[/url] patches for this mod.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6091/?tab=1&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Ffallout4%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D6091%26preview%3D&pUp=1]Armor and Weapons Keyword Community Resource[/url] is required to use this mod.

I have also included a download, [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10962/?]Raider Armor Buff[/url] that adds a little defense to raider armor.

There's also the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11853/?]Super Mutant Redux[/url]

Dont forget there is now [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5028/?]Better Armor Mod Descriptions[/url] support!

Featured on [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/6083674-haoswidasee/]Haoswidasee[/url]'s [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/3642835-ultimate-fallout-4-mod-compilation-100-working-mods-with-installation-instructions/]Ultimate Fallout Mod Compilation[/url]!

Hable Espanol: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15915?]Raider Overhaul WIP with Spanish Translation[/url]
[line][center][b][font=Tahoma][color=#ffd966][size=4][img]http://i67.tinypic.com/28bs5j8.png[/img][/size][/color][/font][/b][/center][list]
[*][b][font=Tahoma][color=#ffd966][size=4][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][color=#f6b26b][/color][/size][/font]
[*][b][font=Tahoma][color=#ffd966][size=4]Weapons [/size][/color][/font][/b]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10771/?]Mad Can: Fury Beans (Can Cudgel)[/url][/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11117/?tab=4&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Ffallout4%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fthread_id%3D3922275%26mod_id%3D11117]Crowbar[/url][/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][color=#f6b26b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12102/?]Murdering Chainsaw[/url][/color][/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][color=#f6b26b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11142/?]Slaughtering Buzz Axe[/url][/color][/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][color=#f6b26b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16657/?]Crude Blowback[/url][/color][/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][color=#f6b26b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/18457/?]Handmade Revolver[/url][/color][/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][color=#f6b26b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17335/?]Concrete Sledgehammer[/url][/color][/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10826/?]Pipe [/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10826/?]Shotgun [/url][/size][/font]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11274/?]Standalone Pipe Shotgun[/url][/size]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2]Chopper Pipe Rifle Mod[/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2]H.A.T.E. Bat Mod[/size][/font]
[*][b][font=Tahoma][color=#ffd966][size=4]Upgrades[/size][/color][/font][/b]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2] Junkyard Dog Armor (3 variants, Heavy, Medium and Light)[/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2] Full Raider Power Armor Paint sets and new upgrades[/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2] Astoundingly upgraded Raider Modular Armor[/size][/font]
[*][font=Trebuchet MS][size=2]
[/size][/font]
[/list][size=2][line]
[/size][img]http://i65.tinypic.com/25us6lc.png[/img]
The Dreadnaught's armor is in. This (very) heavy Raider upgrade is one tier higher than buttressed armor. It sports impressive stats, on par with Heavy Combat Armor. The Dreadnaught set is layered in vibrant, contrasting colors to attract enemies, and bring WAR. You'll instantly know where to focus your attention, as will your enemies when your wearing this fortress of undiluted awesome! Completely compatible with all linings, renaming, and fully integrated into the game. With this set I've included a custom fitted Dreadnaught Helmet, as fearsome as it is defensive. Also there's a new outfit to compliment the set, the Tar Walker Outfit, garb peeled from the oily hands of the infamous Tar Walkers from a secluded, ruined city called Filla Delphia.[size=2]

[/size]
[center][line]
[img]http://i65.tinypic.com/jhvggp.png[/img]
The forged have a whole new look and feel. And a big defense boost to boot. Ive added custom armors for the forged that will only spawn on them. There are 5 variants:[/center][list]
[*]Forged Subaltern Outfit
[*]Forged Factotum Outfit
[*]Forged Abettor Armor
[*]Forged Despot Armor
[*]Forged Magnate Armor
[/list]Each variant has slightly more defense and fire resistance than the previous. 3 of the outfits can be crafted in the AWKCR Armor Station, however the other 2 variants must be looted from the forged themselves. Furthermore, the forged will now spawn with crowbars and shiskebabs in addition to their flamers.

[color=#ff0000] IMPORTANT[/color]: This update doesnt make the forged OP in any way, however it does make them tougher. I highly suggest you take the time to outfit the settlers at the Slog. Giving your settlers better guns and armor will give them a much easier time against the tougher Forged.


[center][img]http://i67.tinypic.com/t9cny8.jpg[/img][color=#f6b26b][color=#e1e1e1][size=5][img]http://i65.tinypic.com/30ijb0g.png[/img][/size][/color][/color]
[size=2]With this mod the Raider Power Armor has gotten a complete overhaul, every power armor mod, including jetpacks, 8 new paints, each with their own benefits, full leveled list integration, so it can be found throughout the Commonwealth. It still has less defense that other PA variants, but it has a great amount of health, and can be repaired with some steel and duct tape. Expect raider bosses to battle in tricked out custom power armor rigs![/size]
[line][/center][center][img]http://i65.tinypic.com/2jfejps.png[/img][/center][img]http://i64.tinypic.com/2hhn0i1.png[/img]

The Junkyard Dog Armor(s) come in light, medium and heavy variants, all of which are much heavier than vanilla dog armor, but offer far more protection, without breaking immersion. The armor will NOT make DogMeat invincible, but it will make him more resilient. I gave them some energy resistance since the majority of the armor is metal.

[color=#ff0000] IMPORTANT NOTE[/color]: this upgraded defense can make raider mongrels fairly tough, but they wont spawn with any armor at low levels and their damage output remains the same. Just be prepared if you see a raider mongrel rushing at you with this armor on.

[list]
[*][color=#ffd966][b][size=3]Heavy Junkyard Dog Ar[/size][/b][b][size=3]mor[/size][/b][/color]
[/list] [size=2]-15 Units of weight
-60 Damage Resistance
-30 Energy Resistance[/size][list]

attributes.author: acidgiraffe
attributes.description:
In fallout 4 a central problem is that more often than not the only option available to the player is to kill everything that moves. This issue is exemplified in the raider faction which will attack the player regardless of what the player does.This mod will allow the player to infiltrate raider camps assuming he can either avoid patrols or talk his way in.


What this mod adds.
-All raiders neutral as standard
-All raider area containers both interior and exterior are now owned by raiders - no stealing!
-Raider crime faction that will make the player hostile for 24 hours if they upset a group of raiders.
-All raiders have guard packages that will warn you off and attack if you dawdle too long.
- Unique lookout npcs that will challenge the player [u]if detected[/u]. The raider will have opportunities in dialogue to talk his way past the guard but if he fails or runs off then the lookout will trigger a nearby siren.
-lookouts have 3 sets of random dialogue (unvoiced)
-Sirens are placed in virtually every raider interior/ exterior as are lookouts who often have guard dog followers.
-4 unique raider npcs with location based dialogue that will give you the opportunity to talk your way into an area.

I'm looking to add to and continue working on this mod over time especially if people like it.
First port of call would be getting some voice actors who sound like they fit in with the fallout 4 raiders!
I am also considering adding more unique raider quests and adding more facets to the raider camps like caged guard dogs that are released by the alarms and perhaps reinforcements!






UPDATES:  The dialogue was wonky and was not working as intended. This should be solved now in the latest version of the mod! I have added blank dialogue as a placeholder which means you can skip dialogue if you want to. I've added Lilly into Corvega interior now. 



REQUIREMENTS: Turn on your subtitles because dialogue is currently unvoiced. No dlc or mod requirements.



Conflicts : Nothing unless it changes the raider actor ai I believe

attributes.author: Gorgulla
attributes.description:
[font=Verdana][b][size=4][center]﻿[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/1717-0-1477959668.png[/img][/center]

Description:[/size][/b][/font][font=Verdana]
The series continues! From Skyrim to Fallout! Because fallout deserves immersion as well!

[size=3]Ever wondered why [/size][/font][font=Verdana][size=3][font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's [/size][/font]always seems to have a longer pause between each sentence? Well No more, They are actually talking like people should do now.
Every social logic in Fallout for [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] is changed, they talk more often to each others. And will less likely greet to you from a distance, they will also greet less often too, making them to not act as much as robots. [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] are also more clever and will know for example if they talked to a [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC [/size][/font]and will therefore talk to another or not talk at all. After some time, they talk again with each others.
Expressions is also overhauled, they express themselves when they actually should.
Emotions is as well overhauled, You can see how the [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] face look more alive.
The time when NPC's eats is overhauled as well, now NPC's will eat at a more regular time like lunch: 12-1pm, Dinner 4-5pm. Player will comment more when skipping a dialogue and much much more!

Additionally, I included the option to increase the amount of active NPC's at one cell. It doesn't magically add more NPC's it just makes it possible, so enjoy visiting your settlements with many NPC's or running into a battlefield with a huge amount of NPC's fighting.

Did you accidentally run in to some stuff, and [/size][/font][font=Verdana][size=3][font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's [/size][/font]start to yell at you?
Well it won't happen as often now, It happen way too often in vanilla.

This is a must-have mod for anyone that has sound on while playing.[/size]

[size=5][b]What it covers:[/b][/size]
[size=3]This covers all talking/singing [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] ( also new modded [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] ), no matter what language you have.
Also covers modded sentences.
[/size][size=6]
[b]Compatibility:[/b][/size]

[/font][list]
[size=3][font=Verdana]Any mod actually.
[/font][/size][/list][font=Verdana]
[size=5][b]Savegame compatible and clean:[/b][/size]
[size=3]The mod is savegame compatible and is also safe to uninstall.
[b]This mod is completely script free.[/b][/size]
[size=5]
[b]Install:[/b][/size]
[size=3]Choose one of the Main files or one from the optional files.
Activate with your mod manager[/size]

[/font][font=Verdana][size=4][b]My other Fallout 4 mods:[/b][/size]
[size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/145/?]Fallout Texture Overhaul Stars
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/160?]Fallout Texture Overhaul Moons

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/32514]Realistic Conversations Fallout 4[/url][/size][color=#ffffff][size=3][u][b]

[/b][/u][b][size=6][b]Permissions:[/b][/size]
[size=3]This mod is made by Gorgulla and is ONLY allowed to be uploaded by Gorgulla on either Nexusmods or Bethesda.
If you find it elsewhere, IT'S STOLEN.
You are not allowed to change my mod and upload it as your own.[/size][/b][/size][/color]

attributes.name: Realistic Conversations-32514-1-0
attributes.shortDescription: Every social logic in Fallout for NPCs is changed, they talk more often to each others. And will less likely greet to you from a distance, they will also greet less often too, making them to not act as much as robots. NPCs are also more clever and will know for example if they talked to a NPC and will therefore talk to another or not talk at all.

attributes.author: MG
attributes.description:
[center]
[font=Comic Sans MS][size=4][b]Realistic Melee Range[/b][/size][/font]

[font=Arial]Several edits to melee range for both player and npcs. The game default setting is far beyond realism, which basically makes a machete to an invisible long spear and enemies can kill you from the air. It is extremely immersion breaking and also difficult to predict and dodge. If you are playing a difficulty that you can only take 1 or 2 hits before going down, this is exactly what you want in your load order.[/font]


[font=Comic Sans MS][size=4][b]Disable Enemy Killmove[/b][/size][/font]

[font=Arial]The optional file is made for Frost users mainly, what it does is disabling Human enemies' killmove. The default game setting is that if one hit takes out more than 50% player's hp, there is a chance a killmove will be triggered. Left killmove enabled basically makes melee combat in Frost frustrating as enemy will constantly execute you even you have a lot of health. This mod gives you the chance to fight back even though you still gonna die a lot, in a satisfying way at least. Bigger enemies such as Death claw left untouched as they are supposed to kill you in one hit.


[/font][font=Comic Sans MS][size=4]Compatibility[/size][/font]

Some edits to game default records, no script involved, should not cause any problems. Put as low as possible in your loader for maximum compatibility.
  [/center]

attributes.author: SKK50
attributes.customFileName: PlayerUndead death recovery by SKK - SKKPlayerUndead_003
attributes.description:
[size=3]The SKK GriefProof PlayerUndead™ service recovers player death, automatically restoring a player from zero health bleedout in place or to the nearest owned settlement with all their stuff and companion. Configurable service charge and health restore options.
[/size]

[color=#00ff00][center][size=3][ all Papyrus scripts are digitally remastered in full 4K UHD with 7.1 surround ] [/size][/center][/color]
[size=3] 
Install this mod at any time in any game stage for any game difficulty (including survival) and the player is given a regenerating [color=#00ff00][ .SKK pLAYERuNDEAD ] [/color]menu item in AID inventory after exiting V111 (craft spares at the Chemlab). When the item is activated, a menu pops for:

 
Service state: [ Enable | Disable ]
Service fee: [ 0% | 50% | 100% ] of player caps.
Restore [ 10% | 50% | 100% ]  of player health.
 
 
[b]User Notes (RTFM)
[/b]
When PlayerUndead™ is enabled, the player is configured to be essential with no bleedout recovery (like a companion) so they don't actually die.

After bleeding out the player can chose to recover in place or to the nearest owned workshop (that is not being attacked by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37393]Settlement Attack System[/url]).

If there are no registered owned workshops in the worldspace or interior, the player is recovered to Sanctuary because ownership of that workshop should never be lost. If Sanctuary is a hostile Conquerer settlement, that's on you.

If the player has a companion using the standard companion slot who is also bleeding out, they are moved with the player so they don't try to bail and return to their home location.


[b]Known Issues[/b]

(1) If the player dies whilst in VATS the imagespace animations freeze and death can not be recovered. Reload from save. 

(2) In some areas of the world bad surface/navmesh can cause the "[i]player the bleeding out on the ground[/i]" idle animation to fall through the world, or the 3rd person camera to become stuck. Reload from save.

(3) When actors are bleeding out they are actually marked as dead so they are no longer attacked. This can cause other actors to loot their weapons and ammo during bleedout. If your stuff is not on a dead hostile, check your companion.


[b]Compatibility

[/b](1) The mod has no dependencies on extenders or DLCs.

(2) There is one change to a base game asset: MGEF [font=Courier New]RestoreRadsCompanion[/font] to avoid Stimpaks healing rads on the player whilst they are essential. It will conflict with anything that modifies the effect.

(3) If the mod detects that the player is already essential when the [color=#00ff00][ .SKK pLAYERuNDEAD ] [/color]menu item is activated, it will pop a warning message that it can't continue. Things known to already manage the player essential state are Death Matters, Horizon, Follower Revive System, Zombie Walkers and Fallout 4-76 PlayerUndead™ option.

(4) This mod should be compatible with multiple companion/follower mods if you use the "recover in place" option. It will not be compatible if you use the "recover to nearest workshop option" as it doesn't know about the additional headcount to manage their bleedout state and move them with the player.


[/size][size=3][b]PC Console configuration[/b][/size]

[size=3]If additional inventory items trigger you, no problem throw it away and use the console, hotkeys.ini or create an MCM json thing:[/size]

[font=Courier New][size=2]set SKK_PUEnabled to 1       ;; options [0 | 1]
set SKK_PUCapsCharge to 0    ;; range [0 to 1] decimal percent of player total caps. 
set SKK_PURestoreHealth to 1 ;; range [0.1 to 1] decimal percent of player total health (do not set to zero).
cqf SKK_PUQuest "SKK_PUQuestScript.SwitchPlayerUndead" ;; call this for enable/disable to take effect[/size][/font]

[size=3]
[b]Nexus PC manual installation & disable

[/b]Copy SKKPlayerUndead.esp and  SKKPlayerUndead – Main.BA2 to your...\Fallout 4\Data directory and add to Plugins.txt, or enable in the Bethesda mod menu, use a mod manger or however you organise. 

Do not disable this mod if the service state is enabled, but when the service state is disabled the mod is idle and can be disabled in the load order. Only remove mods if you are happy to accept potential conflicts from load order changes in a save game. If that is unclear, best to be safe and don't ever remove mods from a savegame.


[b]Nexus FAQ[/b]

(1) Why is there no ESL version ? Because life already contains sufficient hassle. 

(2) Why an aid item menu rather than MCM ? Because 90% of SKK mod users like to shoot stuff on Xbox.

(3) It has been decided to not merge this function into [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37963]SKK Dynamic Damage Manager[/url] because reasons.

[color=#00ff00](4) Holdon pal, isn't this just a rip and republish of a feature from your massive [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/32599]Fallout 4-76 Open World[/url] overhaul mod ? Why Timmy, yes that's quite right ! Mainly because I need a lightweight no death solution based on scripts I trust more than your mommy when I am not in the 4-76 open world, but also a 4K UHD remaster of the original Papyrus scripts must be worth publishing standalone just like those HD nipples and 4K scrotum re-textures. It is of course in no way a cynical "[i]let's shard our mods into lots of separate little downloads to game the Nexusmods DP system so we can feed our cats[/i]" type of thing, as suggested in Mr Spunk's excellent [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/40818]craftable 4K earwax[/url] (possibly beeswax) mod.[/color] 


[/size][size=3][b]SKK Combat oriented mods[/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/30308]SKK Combat Stalkers[/url] - the hostile spawning solution.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/42081]Random Encounter Manager by SKK[/url] - amp up or dial down the combat opportunities.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37393]SKK Settlement Attack System[/url] - replace base game settlement attacks with something that actually works.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/34693]SKK Combat Settlers[/url] - manage settlers health, damage and power armor use.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27492]SKK Instant Battleground[/url] - when you want to fight, now.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37963/]SKK Dynamic Damage manager[/url] - tune damage in and out in realtime to find the perfect game balance.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41002]PlayerUndead death recovery by SKK[/url] - recover from bleedout death in place or at a workshop.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/46799]Unlimited Combat Followers by SKK[/url] - recruit disposable meat shields, not waifus.


[/size]For the avoidance of doubt: you are not allowed to upload this content to other sites. The only exception is when specific written permission has been granted to republish a translated ESP, but that permission will never include the BA2 archive(s) or any extracted scripts.

attributes.author: SKK50
attributes.description:
[size=3]Monitor workshop access by NPC actors and configure the automatic return of weapons, ammo and legendaries looted by them.


Install this non intrusive mod at any time in any game, as it makes no static changes to your game at all. After waking in V111 cryo or moving in the Commonwealth the player is given a regenerating [ [color=#00ff00].SKK Workshop Access Monitor [/color]] aid item for menu configuration and commands (craft replacements in the chemlab).  

The ability for NPC actors to loot containers to upgrade weapons (based on value or dps no one really knows) and ammo during combat is hard coded into the game engine, which can become hassle if you run a lot of workshop attacks. This solution detects NPC actors accessing your player owned workshops to enforce your policy.

Update 003 includes a central weapon stash for settler returns & upgrades, with access activators which can be crafted (furniture/containers) at each workshop. If one is present, settlers will use the central stash rather than the workshop to return and upgrade weapons when commanded. [i][b][color=#00ff00]This means you can still manage upgrades when access to the workshop is blocked.[/color][/b][/i]


[b]Menu Options
[/b]
(1) Open all workshop actor and follower inventories [ go ]

(2) Return all weapons/ammo & upgrade to the best [ go ]

(3) Include active Followers in return all weapons [[color=#00ff00] *OFF[/color] | ON ] 

(4) Workshop Monitor [ [color=#00ff00]*Enable[/color] | Disable ] 

(5) Take weapons [ [color=#00ff00]*Enable [/color]| Disable ] 

(6) Return excess ammo  [ [color=#00ff00]*Enable[/color] | Disable ] 

(7) Legendary warning   [[color=#00ff00] *Enable[/color] | Disable ] 

(8) Wasteland Justice [ Enable |[color=#00ff00] *Disable [/color]] 


[b]Menu Option Details [/b]

(1) [[color=#00ff00] Open all actor inventories [/color]] will open in sequence all player followers and local workshop assigned actors to find any other theaving. Companions (active and dismissed) are the WORST for grabbing and keeping extra weapons and ammo from corpses and containers during combat.

(2) When in an owned workshop location the [ [color=#00ff00]Return all weapons/ammo & upgrade to best[/color] ] option will transfer any droppable base game/DLC weapon and ammo from organic humanoid (Human, Ghoul, Synth, Supermutant) workshop actors and player followers to the local workshop (if workshop access is allowed) or central stash (if a local activator is built). Actors that do not have a recognised weapon or have animations for regular weapons are excluded (Alien, Robots & etc). Supermutants can only use Pipe, Assault, Hunting and Minigun weapons. 

(3) Companion actors are never included in the automatic upgrade process to avoid their undroppable/inventory invisible default weapon from being removed and lost forever.

(4) The active workshop monitor must be enabled enabled to unlok the following functions: 

(5) Block weapons & ammo being taken. This will not help with actors scavenging wepons off the ground or looting corpses during combat, but [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/34693]Combat Settlers[/url]﻿ can manage that battlefield scavenging, fully compatible with this monitor for total loot coverage. If Combat Settlers is installed and its Mange Weapons function is enabled, this Take Weapons is LOCKED enabled/allowed.

(6) If not allowed to take weapons, still return excess ammo (because actors always take the whole stack) except the 1 round they actually need. 

(7) If allowed to take weapons, warn if a legendary has been taken and optionally pop the actor inventory to retrieve it. This does not automatically return legendary weapons to avoid blocking loops where actors are allowed to upgrade weapons from the workshop, but keep trying to take the same highest value legendary that keeps getting returned. 

(8) With update 002 if actors are not allowed to take weapons, Wastleand Justice can be enforced. Any workshop thief that is not a quest target, unique or a companion actor is kicked from the workshop, made mortal and hostile. Sort them out. Check the corpse for stolen loot to clear the holding marker so it can be cleaned up.


[b]Known Issues[/b]

(1) The automatic [ [color=#00ff00]Return all weapons/ammo[/color] ... ] functions can occasionally trigger actors to reset to their default ActorBase outfit if you have equipped non standard clothes/armor. This outfit reset is a base game defect triggered by script functions RemoveItem(Weapon), AddItem(Weapon) and comically EquipItem(Armor) when trying to fix the issue by automatically re-equipping armor. Even the official high quality supported Creation Club content has this problem.

(2) Best weapon is defined in the priority order of FormList [font=Courier New]SKK_WAMWeaponListUpgrade [/font]which can be editied before a game starts, but not once a game is running as DLC weapons are automatically added to the top of the list which will be lost.

(3) This automatically includes most DLC weapons/ammo if installed, but clearly does not know about your mod added weapons/ammo. They can be added to [font=Courier New]SKK_WAMWeaponListUser and [font=Courier New]SKK_WAMAmmoListUser [/font][/font]with xEdit at any time (best to save an an over-ride file) to be included in the main lists. Once added DO NOT REMOVE ENTRIES as this will corrupt the lists with NULL holes. 

(4) Grenades and particularly mines are excluded from the weapons lists as they can cause problems with scripted interactions. If you are feeling lucky you can try adding them to [font=Courier New]SKK_WAMWeaponListUser[/font] and see what happens. Boom.

[b]
Compatibility[/b]

The mod has no dependencies on extenders or DLCs and does not change any existing base game scripts, assets or objects. It is 100% pure new Creation Kit forms and scripts which means that it has no load order dependencies.

As this mod was published after November 2019 it depends on Fallout4.exe 1.10.162.0 (or later). 


[b]Nexus PC manual installation & disable[/b]

Copy SKKWorkshopAccessMonitor.esp and  SKKWorkshopAccessMonitor – Main.BA2 to your...\Fallout 4\Data directory and add to Plugins.txt, or enable in the Bethesda mod menu, use a mod manger or however you organise. 

If [ [color=#00ff00]Workshop Monitor Disable [/color]] is set in the menu no scripts will be active so the mod can be disabled in the load order if you have removed any built weapons stash activators. Only remove mods if you are happy to accept potential conflicts from load order changes in a save game.


[b]Nexus FAQ[/b]

(1) But I can stop settlers taking my stuff with seperate non accessible/locked containers or keeping all my stuff in workshops with no settlers ! Absolutley if you actually enjoy that stuff micromanagement then keep on fiddling. Clearly this QOL solution was not created for you, try Fallout 76 which contains 101% maintenance grind and inventory micromanagement.

(2) But I am using your allegedly settler proof Global Stash ! When the player is building all the global stash inventory is transferred to the local workshop, so settlers CAN infact get their grubby little paws on your sweet sweet stuff if there is any combat whilst you are building. 

(3) Why is there no ESL version ? Because life already contains sufficient hassle maintaining 50 scripted ESP solutions. 

(4) Will this be merged the other mainstream SKK workshop/settler solutions like Workshop Ownership Utilities or Combat Settlers to reduce mod slots ? Possibly.


[b]Console Configuration for default settings[/b][/size]
[font=Courier New][size=2]
set SKK_WAMEnableMonitor    to 1 ;[0|1] disable | enable.
set SKK_WAMAllowWeapons     to 1; [0|1] disable | enable.
set SKK_WAMReturnAmmo       to 1; [0|1] disable | enable.
set SKK_WAMLegendaryWarning to 1; [0|1] disable | enable.
set SLL_WAMIncludeFollowers to 0; [0|1] disable | enable.
set SKK_WAMWastelandJustice to 0; [0|1] disable | enable.

cqf SKK_WAMQuest "SKK_WAMQuestScript.RegisterWorkshops" ; Function to implement changes 
[/size][/font][font=Courier New][size=2]
cqf SKK_WAMQuest "SKK_WAMQuestScript.OpenInventories" 8DigitWorkshopREF  
cqf SKK_WAMQuest "SKK_WAMQuestScript.ReturnWeapons" 8DigitWorkshopREF [/size][/font]

attributes.shortDescription: Monitor workshop access by NPC actors and configure the automatic return of weapons, ammo and legendaries looted by them.

attributes.author: Norr
attributes.description:
Fun fact #1: Only basic robot parts, if any, can be looted from the robots in the game.
Fun fact #2: Automatron includes a leveled list for vendors who sell robot parts.
Fun fact #3: No vendor in the game uses this leveled list, therefore no vendor sells any robot parts. At all.

What this means for players is if you want to build a cool robot, you HAVE to invest in crafting skills, some of which has steep requirements.
What this means for a player going through the game with no crafting skills at all (and therefore needs to 1: scavenge weapon and armor mods or 2: spend caps at vendors to get decent guns and armor) can't build any cool robots. At all.

Ball bearings to that.


- Vanilla robots now drop appropriate robot parts (limbs, weapons, armor).
- Mechanist robots now drop a large selection of parts, with a slight bias towards ranged weapons. May also drop hydraulic or voltaic frames.
- Regular Robobrains now have their own leveled list, but robobrains with prefixes (integrated etc) will drop the same variety of parts as other mechanist robots, but with a bias towards robobrain parts.
- Rust Devil robots now drop a large selection of parts, with a slight bias towards melee weapons. May also drop appropriate armor (warmonger, serrated etc).
- One merchant may now sell robot parts. The merchant will become available upon completing the Automatron 'good' ending.

Specific drop chances are available in the ReadMe.


Compatability:
Anything that changes death item leveled lists for vanilla robots will create a conflict.
Anything that changes Automatron exclusive robot NPCs or death item leveled lists will create a conflict.
attributes.name: Salvage Robot Parts-25355-2
attributes.shortDescription: Robots now has a chance to drop appropriate robot parts. For people who likes to scavenge for their robot parts instead of building from scratch.

attributes.author: spacefiddle
attributes.description:
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/21228-0-1485152708.png[/img]

[size=4]When a Power Armor piece is destroyed, [color=#ffff00][b]it's really destroyed.[/b][/color][/size]
[size=4]No silly zero-weight, zero-health inventory entry, with the broken pieces of it on the ground.[/size]
[color=#dda0dd][i]what the hell am i carrying[/i][/color]

[size=4][color=#6fa8dc]Maybe now there can be some meaning and purpose to the ten jillion PA suits around the Commonwealth.[/color][/size]

[size=4][color=#ffff00]Fusion cores[/color] are also more rare, and will have a [color=#00ffff]random charge[/color] - [/size]
[size=4]not be "almost always 100% and sometimes 50%." (I did not edit cells or touch the various placed cores.)[/size]

[size=5]So why use it now?[/size]

[size=3]Scarcity's Power Armor is [color=#00ff00]much more protective than Vanilla PA[/color], [color=#008000]preventing more damage[/color] from reaching the player, and [color=#008000]grants [/color][color=#00ff00]immunity to poison and acid[/color], [color=#00ff00]when in good condition[/color]. But as its condition [color=#ff7700]degrades[/color], so does its protection. A completely banged-up suit of Scarcity armor will protect you less than Vanilla PA.

And it will cost you more to repair.
 
You can no longer fix the most advanced infantry weapon ever created by [color=#fce5cd]slapping 4 tin cans together[/color].
Instead of "4 steel," [color=#ffd700]repair requirements have been made meaningful[/color], using better components.[/size]
 
[color=#ffffff][size=5]Power Armor will protect you well - as long as you maintain it well.
And maintaining it will no longer be trivial.[/size][/color]
 
[size=3]For example: if [b]any[/b] piece goes [color=#ff0000]red[/color], then the suit's seals are broken, you get a warning alarm, and you lose the poison/acid immunity (along with the decreased damage resistance). Thusly:[/size]

[youtube]DqJyeQXYEnU[/youtube] [img=right]http://i.imgur.com/lYM54vj.png[/img]

Oh, and... yes, NPCs get the added protection as well. You're going to have to blow someone's helmet off before you can shoot them in the head...

[i][color=#00ff00][size=5]Two main versions available:[/size][/color][/i]

[size=3][color=#00ffff]Power Armor only:[/color] 
Doesn't touch general loot rules. [color=#00ff00]Compatible with loot-changing mods and overhauls[/color].
Random Fusion Core changes are kept.

or
[color=#00ffff]Full version[/color] with extensive changes to leveled lists, requiring higher levels for better loot.[/size]

[size=3]The PA-Only version's Fusion Core changes edits a single record of "what kind of FC just dropped?" and is therefore safe with any other Loot mod - FROST, Horizon, whathaveyou. Put the PA version after any overhaul; it only modifies Vanilla Power Armor and the Fusion Core drops, so putting it second ensures the FC change carries over. Horizon has its own version of the random charge effect; but you'll need mine second to get PA changes. Let me know if Horizon's function is vastly different.[/size]

[size=2]Technical note: it doesn't touch anything that [i][b]calls [/b][/i]for an FC drop. No containers, NPC lists, etc. Only the single form that determines what you get when you win a Fusion Core. So, if your overhaul makes FCs extremely rare - then not only will they be extremely rare, but they'll drop with a random charge.
Good luck![/size]

[i][color=#00ff00][size=5]The following additional changes are in the Full Version:[/size][/color][/i]

[color=#00ffff][size=5]Significant changes to item drop rates and level thresholds.[/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=3][b]As with the PA-Only version, Fusion Cores are far more rare[/b], and when they are found, [b]they probably won't be at 100%.[/b] A variety of charge levels will be found, from nearly-depleted on up.[/size]
[*][size=3]Ammunition is less plentiful.[/size]
[*][size=3]Stimpacks, bobby pins, purified water, and antibiotics are less likely to be found in containers.[/size]
[/list]
[color=#00ffff][size=5]Weapon tech levels are greatly spaced out.[/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=3]You will need to be higher level before seeing the better weapons.[/size]
[*][size=3]You might actually want to upgrade that double-barrel...[/size]
[*][size=3]Your fully-modded pipe gun will be your best friend for a while.[/size]
[*][size=3]Finally finding a new weapon will feel like the major boost in power that it should.[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[/size]and in keeping with more of a sparse, scrounging or solo play style,
[color=#00ffff][size=5]Crafting station requirements have been altered to [/size][/color][color=#1e84cc][size=5]make some damn sense[/size][/color][color=#00ffff][size=5].[/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=3]You no longer need to be an accomplished politician in order to bang a hammer on a table, or [color=#ff0000]light a freakin' fire[/color][/size]
[*][size=3]Weapons workbench? Gun Nut 1 OR Blacksmith 1[/size]
[*][size=3]Armor workbench? Armorer 1[/size]
[*][size=3]You get the idea I think[/size]
[*][size=3]Any cooking "station" - an Int greater than 2. (Seriously.)[/size]
[size=3][i]it's a frakkin' fire with rocks around it[/i][/size][/list]
Supply lines and stores and things still require Local Leader, because those ARE about managing people.

NOTE: An upcoming update will also allow Science 1 to build the Weapons bench, as someone pointed out Energy weapons to me.
The cooking fires have a requirement at all because I know there are people out there who will enjoy their 1 or 2 Int character being too stupid to get a fire going. If I can figure out how, maybe cooking stations cause them a burn...
 
[color=#ffff00][size=6]IMPORTANT THINGS TO KNOW[/size][/color]
 
[size=3]The [b][color=#1e84cc]full [/color][/b]version alters the jumping begeezus out of leveled lists. There's just no other way to do it. The drop rates and pretty much everything tied to "crap you find" are all in the base leveled-list forms.

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]If you use any mod that *adds* things to the leveled lists via script, you're fine. Just make sure they come after Scarcity.[/size]
[*][size=3]Anything else that also alters leveled lists for weapons, ammo, loot in boxes, etc., will conflict.[/size]
[*][size=3]Anything that alters [b][color=#00ffff]vanilla [/color][/b]Power Armor will conflict. Things like Worsin's Garage, that adds stuff or alters paint mechanics, are fine. (The acrobatics I used to get the PA destruction to work is ridiculous, and now every piece of Vanilla PA has a script attached to it.)[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[color=#ff7700]There is a PA-Only version in the installer that does not have all the list changes, which should make it compatible with all the various loot overhauls and total (non-PA) conversions.[/color]
[/size]
[size=6][color=#00ffff]WHAT I [/color][color=#ff0000]DIDN'T [/color][color=#00ffff]MESS WITH: Unique PA pieces[/color] [/size]
[size=3] 
The Piezoelectric, the Tesla pieces from Automatron - they're left alone. They won't get destroyed; they will still become the silly 0-health phantom item in your inventory. As there's no way you could get them back outside of console commands, the mod is being released in safe-mode. If any masochists out there want a patch that will let the unique or named pieces get wrecked too, let me know.
 
I recommend using this on a new playthrough, to get the full effect of the changes to loot and weapon upgrades.
For an existing game: if you are wearing PA in your savegame, EXIT YOUR ARMOR, make a new save, and THEN activate this mod. The scripts don't seem to get applied correctly to existing pieces that are actively equipped.[/size]

---

Massive credit also goes to Wenderer for his [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821]FOMOD Creation Tool[/url].
This thing is awesome and saves a TON of time getting stuff packed up.

[color=#00ffff][size=2]I ALSO MADE DESE TINGS:[/size][/color]

[size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51381]Accelerator Sound Fix - Custom Reverb and Quad's Reload Sounds[/url][/size]
[size=4]Gets rid of the Bethesda Bullet Bangs every weapon has outdoors and gave the Plasma Accelerator 9 custom reverb tails from its own firing sounds. Also custom reload effects, and a slight balance tweak. Plus a new optional skin for fun.[/size]

[size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51295]Unique Pickman's Blade and Bowie Knife Buff[/url][/size]
[size=4]A unique appearance and new name for Pickman's Blade, instead of the generic Combat Knife, plus buffs Mike Moore's Bowie Knives' damage a bit.[/size]

[size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51569/]Effective Melee Blocking[/url][/size]
[size=4]Makes blocks actually stop enough damage to keep you alive, and more[/size]

[size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51622]Ad Pictoriam - Brotherhood of Steel Apocolyptic Visuals-Only Override[/url][/size]
[size=4]Strips out most of the game changes from Ad Victoriam, existing-save friendly, keeps all the cool new visuals[/size]

[size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51549]Useful Assault Masks[/url][/size]
[size=4]Changes the Assault Gas Mask to three varieties of hood/mask color - and gives it stats that make it worth using[/size]

[size=4][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27994]Mastermind - Automatron Provisioners using Robotics Expert[/url][/size]
[size=3]Think it's silly needing to be a politition and salesman to program your robots? Now the Robotics Expert perk works too![/size]
[size=2]Time to build your robot army![/size]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15823/]Companion Stealth Distance Fix (No Free Hugs!)[/url][/size]
[size=3]Tired of your companions standing on your head when you stealth? Now with Less Dogmeat Standing on Loot![/size]
[size=2]Still some. Just much, much less.[/size]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21271]Bugfix for Dismissed Companion Endless Babble[/url][/size]
[size=3]A permanent fix for the bug that makes Companions spout all their comments endlessly after you dismiss them.[/size]
[size=2]You know, maybe I [b]like[/b] the rain, Preston! Custom interval times available![/size]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21371]Perforation: Better Automatic Weapons[/url][/size]
[size=3]Not a damage number tweak, but a changed mechanic. Preserves balance and ammo, and adds [i]fun[/i].[/size]
[size=2]Did I mention it also affects the [b]Minigun[/b] and [b]Gatling Laser[/b][/size]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17596]Home Despot - Local and Linked Workshop Component Inventories[/url][/size]
[size=3]Shows the raw component totals from all the junk in your Workshops, local or linked.[/size]
[size=2]Get a Grip on Your Junk[/size]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21228]Scarcity: Destructible Power Armor and More[/url][/size]
[size=3][b]Permanently destroyed[/b] PA pieces. Fewer and [b]randomly-charged[/b] Fusion Cores. Tougher requirements for repairs.[/size]
[size=2]Less is... less.[/size]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/19036]FusionGun-VIS: a compatability patch[/url][/size]
[size=3]for the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17847]Fusion Gun by Fallout Suite[/url] (not me), tagging it like [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3877]Valdacil's Item Sorting[/url] (also not me) using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6091]AWKCR[/url] (still not me).[/size]

attributes.author: shadowslasher410 and VIitS
attributes.description:
[center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/5320-0-1454899189.png[/img][/center]
[center][color=#00ff00][size=5]LIKE IT? Please endorse![/size][/color][/center]

[size=4]To use this mod across the entire wasteland (with mods that let you build anywhere) change the following line in your fallout4.ini (under the heading [general] ): [color=#00ffff]bUseCombinedObjects=1[/color] to [/size][size=4][color=#00ffff]bUseCombinedObjects=0[/color][color=#1e84cc]. [/color][color=#ff0000]Do not use the ini edits otherwise, they hurt more than they help.[/color][color=#1e84cc] This can also be set using the FOMOD installer. [/color][/size][color=#0000ff]

[/color]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/5320-1-1454899188.png[/img][/center]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[size=4][size=5][color=#ff0000]
Put this file at the absolute END of your load order, or else you will get areas in which scrapping doesn't work as advertised![/color][/size]

This mod fixes the glaring oversight Bethesda made when they chose to only make a small fraction of objects able to be scrapped. With Scrap Everything, you, the user, has the final say on what stays and what goes. Want to scrap your settlement down to the bare bones and have yourself a whole bunch of empty land to go wild on? Done. Want to scrap things like trash, debris, vines, bushes and even dead machines, animals, and people, but leave the buildings and trees? Done. This mod allows you to scrap literally everything in each and every one of your settlements, should you so choose. 

[size=4][color=#f4f4f4][color=#ff7700][b]This mod scraps everything that these mods do (and more):[/b][/color] Spring Cleaning, Scrap Dead Things, Scrap Scrap, Scrappable Commonwealth
[/color][/size][b]
[/b][color=#f4f4f4][color=#ffff00][b]Permissions:[/b][color=#ffffff]Users may [/color][/color]change, modify, add, remove, etc. whatever they want for PERSONAL USE. If you want to upload a MODIFIED VERSION or a TRANSLATION, YOU MUST GET [s]MY PERMISSION[/s] VIITS'S PERMISSION FIRST! This mod is NOT to be made available on ANY other site without my permission, with the exception of ONE COPY for ARCHIVAL PURPOSES ONLY (ONLY on dedicated mod archive sites).

In order to upload ANY VERSION of this mod (whether it be a modified, archival copy, or a translation) you MUST:
1) contact [s]me[/s] VIitS (and wait for a reply). If I do not reply to you within thirty days of your message, chances are I have gone AWOL (you still have to follow the other rules, though). 
2) credit me as the original author
3) Provide at least one CLEAR AND VISIBLE link on the main page of the mod's description back to this page (unless the Nexus gets shut down for some reason).
[color=#ff0000][color=#ffffff]4)[/color] [color=#ffffff]NEVER UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD THIS MOD OR ANY OF ITS DERIVATIVES BE SOLD OR EXCHANGED FOR MONEY OR PROFIT IN ANY SHAPE OR FORM. EVER!

[/color][/color]Edit: As shadowslasher410 has relinquished control of this mod to me (VIitS), I am the one you would need to contact for permission.  

[color=#ff00ff][size=5][color=#ff0000]No, this is NOT going to be ported to any type of console[/color][color=#f4f4f4] due to memory issues, lack of debugging, and the fact that Bethesda.Net has an absolutely HORRIBLE interface for uploading and maintaining mods[/color][/size][/color][size=5]. [color=#ff0000]PLEASE STOP ASKING ME!![/color][/size][color=#ff00ff]
[/color]
[/color][/size]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/5320-2-1454899187.png[/img][/center]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[color=#ff7700]Is this your first time installing a Fallout 4 mod?[/color] Please go [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]here[/url] and make sure you have followed the instructions in order for your mod(s) to work!
[color=#ffff00]
Nexus Mod Manager/Mod Organizer:[/color] Download the file and add it to your mod manager of choice. For NMM, use the "Add Mod From File" button (it looks like a green + sign in the "Mods" tab) or use Mod Manager Download option. For Mod Organizer <TO BE ADDED>. Then simply install the mod, make sure it's enabled (AND LAST) in your load order, and play!

[color=#ffff00]Manual:[/color] Unzip Scrap Everything.zip and transfer the Scrap Everything - Core.esp file into your Fallout 4/Data folder. If you want DLC support, make sure to add the respective plugins to your Data folder as well. Go [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation#How_To_Manually_Install_Fallout_4_Mods]here[/url] for more information on installing mods manually.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/5320-3-1454899187.png[/img][/center]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[list]
[*][color=#f4f4f4][size=4] [s]sprinting bug[/s] - Use the .ini file provided or add [color=#00ffff][b][b][b]fPlayerDisableSprintingLoadingCellDistance=0[/b][/b][/b][/color] to your Fallout4Custom.ini under the [Gameplay] heading (if the heading or the file doesn't exist, create it).[/size][/color]
[/list]                       - Note, this bug was fixed several years ago. If you are experiencing this bug, it won't hurt anything to add the line to your .ini file, but it only occurs if you have an extremely broken mod loaded. 
[color=#f4f4f4][size=4][color=#ff0000]REMEMBER TO SAVE BEFORE YOU SCRAP![/color][/size][/color]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/5320-4-1454899187.png[/img][/center]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[size=4]
This mod allows scrapping of the following:

Everything in each one of the 30 settlements (including Home Plate, Boston Airport, and Bunker Hill)!
Plus...

Update notes for 2.4 and newer are available from the Logs tab under Changelogs.

v 2.2 -
[size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size] Added Nuka World support
   [size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]•[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size] industrial frames (those giant beam things next to walls)
   [size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]•[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size] quarry stone blocks
   [size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]•[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size] Eat-O-Tronics
   [size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]•[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size] Monorails (trains)
   [size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]•[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size] Redid the Precombined/Previsibility in the Mechanist's Lair and Vault 88 - no more FPS drops/texture issues/world randomly disappearing bugs
  [size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]•[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size] Redid the fomod installer to include the Nuka World Add-on as well as more .ini options for the folks too lazy and/or those who don't want to do it themselves.
v 2.1 -
[size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size] [/size][/size][/size]Greatly expanded Far Harbor and Automatron support (pretty much everything that can be added to a scrap list is added now)
[size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size] More work on [/size][/size][/size]dividing up the more general categories into multiple, more specific categories (no, I'm not going to tell you all the categories I added, there are like 50 of them...)
v 2.0 -
[size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size] [/size][/size]Added Far Harbor and Automatron support (in separate plugins)
[size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size] [/size][/size]Separated all the different types of roads into separate formlists
v 1.96b -
[size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size] [/size][/size]Preliminary beta version to try and fix the occlusion bug
v 1.95 -
[size=4][size=4]   •[/size] [/size]Renames certain objects (that I added names to) for better compatibility with NX Pro Farming mod
[size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size][/size][/size] Allows all types of flora (that you can't store in the workshop) to be scrapped (no, I don't know how to make them storeable) (Examples: hubflower, bloodleaf, glowing fungus, thistle, etc.)
[size=4][size=4][size=4][size=4]   •[/size][/size][/size] [/size]Preliminary work for allowing scrapping of everything in non-settlement areas (Vault 111, Goodneighbor, Diamond City, etc.) when used with mods that let you build anywhere
v 1.91 -
   • Removes Light Sources scrapability to fix lighting bugs that appear as a result of light sources being scrappable
   •  Adds components for the new categories added in 1.9 (I forgot to add the components in the last release)
V 1.9 -
   • Names for ALL the objects my mod lets you scrap
   • Light Sources (the actual beams of light itself)
   • Overhauls the categories (formlists) and adds about 15 separate categories for objects that were once part of a larger general category
   • More dead people/animals/machines
V 1.8 -
   • COMPLETE SCRAPABILITY FOR ALL THE SETTLEMENTS!!! YAY!!!! (well, preliminary scrapability, anyway. I probably missed a few things here and there - Make sure to tell me if you find anything you can't scrap!)
V 1.7 -
   • Complete (hopefully) scrapability for Covenant, Starlight Drive In, Tenpines Bluff, and Oberland Station
   • Also (hopefully) complete scrapability for Outpost Zimonja, Greentop Nursery, Graygarden, and Croup Manor
   • Pier kit pieces
   • Lots of different Industrial Machines
   • Many types of lamps and lights
   • Roads that I forgot to add earlier
   • A couple of greenhouse water pipes that I missed
   • Covenant NPCs (plus Deezer and Covenant turrets) - may not work on the two generic settlers (if it doesn't just use the console to disable them)
   • Just a ton of random things in lots of different categories
V 1.6 -
  • Spectacle Island scrapability (except for some areas underwater, which will be added post CK because I don't know their location coordinates)
  • The Castle scrapability (except for the walls - scrapping the walls causes major crashes)
  • Stone walls (the low crumbling kind)
  • Lots of different house kit pieces
  • Skeletons and certain dead settlers/raiders/traders/etc.
  • Boats and Barges
  • Consoles and Console towers
  • Lots more miscellaneous stuff...
V 1.5 -
  • Complete (hopefully) Red Rocket, Abernathy Farm, Home Plate, and Sunshine Tidings Co-op scrapability!
  • Most (if not all) Industrial Kit pieces
  • Silos
  • Lots of different kinds of pipes
  • Most (if not all) Deco Kit pieces (note that most of these still need names, which I will do post CK because Bethesda's labels are confusing)
  • certain types of Billboards
  • retaining walls (those stone walls in Sanctuary and other places)
  • Most (if not all) Warehouse Kit pieces
  • Most (if not all) Greenhouse Kit pieces (plus pots and planters)
  • Shipping Crates
  • Seaweed
  • Those advertisements painted on the sides of buildings
  • telephone/electric poles
  • Stone debris (commonly found in the Castle)
  • Lots more stuff that I'm probably forgetting about...
V 1.4 -
  • Fixed a disappearing building at Egret Tours Marina... Whoops!
  • Added Most (if not all) wood and metal shack pieces
  • Added those big static wood and metal shelves
  • Added grocery store shelves (at red rocket)
V 1.3 -
  • Support for existing scrapable items (vines, trash, etc.)  has been added in all settlements, plus non-settlement workshops like Boston Airport
  • Castle debris piles (the ones I know I can safely scrap)
  • Most (if not all) types of trash, debris and decals
  • Most (if not all) types of rocks (statics only. no static collections)
  • Most (if not all) types of roads and sidewalk pieces
  • Certain types of posters
  • Swimming pool pieces
V 1.2 -
  • kitchen cabinets in the players house
  • partial Red rocket and Abernathy farm scrapability
  • NPC invisible furniture markers (no more hammering away at nothing!)
V 1.1 -
  • Posters
  • Certain types of rocks
  • Dormer (upper house part/roof)
  • Fireplace
  • Other stuff that I missed with the first version (different types of objects detailed below)
V 1.0 –
  • Sanctuary house walls, foundations, carports (where the cars are parked) and roofs
  • Grasses, shrubs, trees, hedges, vines, brambles, leaf piles, and other plants
  • Sanctuary Roads and sidewalks
  • Halloween decorations (pumpkins, skulls, cats, skeletons, and more)
  • Ceiling, floor, and wall lamps and lights
  • Candles (and melted candle puddles)
  • Playground Equipment (monkey bars and jungle gym)
  • Floor grates
  • Office papers
  • Trash and debris
  • Dogmeat’s Doghouse (can’t be scrapped when he is in it, so make him move before you scrap it)
  • Kitchen counter (there was a type that wasn’t scrapable)
  • HVAC units (found in the laundry rooms of the Sanctuary houses)
  • Towel hooks (in the bathroom)
  • Bathroom grab bars
  • Makeup? Drawer (in the bathroom)
  • Fire extinguisher holder
  • Showers and shower curtains
  • Soap trays and toilet paper holders
  • Wallpaper scraps (the flowers sometimes found on the walls in certain houses)
  • Ceiling fans
  • Foot Paths (in the backyard of some houses in Sanctuary)
  • (static) oil lanterns
  • Planters
  • Garden hoses
  • Thermostat
  • Plywood door[/size]

attributes.shortDescription: Ever feel like scrapping everything in your settlement? With this mod, you can scrap houses, grasses, trash and debris, roads, sidewalks, and much more!

attributes.author: Athelbras
attributes.description:
[b][size=5][color=lightblue]Settlement Tidy Bot[/color][/size][/b]

Version 2.4


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Description:[/color][/size][/b]

Mr. Tidy "undertaker bot" that scurries around removing "remains" from a Settlement.

[center]---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[i][size=2]Originally created in 2041 by General Atomics International before the Great War, the Mister Helper Type-1b was intended as a supplement to the highly-regarded 2037 Mister Handy Type-1 product.  However, frequent returns for factory maintenance and/or replacement resulted in the Type-1b model being temporarily withdrawn from volume production.

Limited re-introduction occurred in 2042 with rebranding as a Mister Rescue Type-1c "disaster relief" unit in response to the devastating earthquake in Mexico City that year. Mister Undertaker, an early prototype model, was quietly introduced a short while later.

Mister Rescue met with commercial success and was subsequently marketed to consumers as Mister GroundsKeeper in 2045 with notable sales revenue from golf courses, vacation resorts, and daycare centers.

2055 saw the release of Mister Salvage & Reclamation (later rebranded "Mister Salvage").  Revenue for this Type-1d model was modest with purchase orders primarily from construction and landscaping firms.

That same year, the Vault-Tec Corporation acquired exclusive rights for a Mister Tidy Type-1e model (essentially a redesign of the Mister Undertaker prototype) which was subsequently deployed at Vault-Tec's numerous facilities.[/size][/i]

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Key Features:[/color][/size][/b]

• Automatic Operation
• Limited to One per Settlement
• Continues working while its Cell is unloaded
• Recovered items are transferred to the Station Pad's chest
• Waits at the station pad when there is currently nothing to tidy
• Tidying requires wall-clock time and is not affected by Wait, Sleep, or Fast Travel
• The content of Mr Tidy's chest can be extracted using a Vacuum Hopper (Contraptions Workshop DLC)

This mod provides a "lore friendly" approach for removing corpses and other dead things from a settlement by enabling you to assign that task to a Vault-Tec [color=lightblue][b]Mister Tidy[/b][/color] robot.  Just place the 'bot in a central area, instruct it to begin tidying, wait a minute for it to "beep" (or makes cheerful noises when there is nothing to tidy up), and then feel free to resume your adventures.

Mr. Tidy can be directed to tidy things within the boundaries of that settlement, or for a distance that can extend beyond those boundaries, with tidying always centered on its station pad. Mr. Tidy returns to the station pad upon completion.  It then waits there until it is instructed to resume, or is stored in its workshop, or is scrapped.  Items recovered from corpses are stored in the station pad's chest.

There is a brief initial mission / quest which provides a bit of backstory and conveys essential usage information.  It normally begins after escaping from Vault 111.  For those using an "alternate start" mod, it begins while outdoors in the Commonwealth (the main game area) -- or try visiting Sanctuary Hills and stand near the Workshop for a few minutes.

[b][size=3][color=white]NOTE:[/color][/size][/b]  This is a mod for removing dead things, but which also automatically collects items for you from those dead things. It is not intended to be just a looting mod. So players who do not desire dead things to be removed (perhaps because of the behavior of some other mod) should simply not use Mr Tidy.

[b][size=3][color=white]ANOTHER NOTE:[/color][/size][/b]  Create a saved game before tidying a settlement -- one that you can return to if issues are encountered.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]How To Build:[/color][/size][/b]

Mister Tidy is placed in a settlement by using a WorkShop to build a Station Pad. The station pad can be found in the STRUCTURES>MISCELLANEOUS section of the WorkShop's building menu when an initial quest ("Rest In Peace") is completed. The quest appears shortly after leaving Vault 111 for normal play, or when outdoors in the Commonwealth when using an "alternate start" mod. If the quest does not appear when expected, then double-check to confirm that this mod has been enabled.

When opening a workshop to build something, you initially see the user interface positioned at a wooden building with "Structures" as a label above it. Go upwards one row from there, and then go over to the right along that row until you see "Structures>Miscellaneous" as a label; in the base game that label is above a bloodied super mutant pole but may be something different depending on the mods you installed. Now go up one row from there. Everything you then see horizontally in that row is the "Structures>Miscellaneous" subcategory. In that row will be the Mister Tidy Station Pad; perhaps as the very first item.

It is best to position the Station Pad on the ground in the central area of a settlement in such a way that Mister Tidy will have easy access to places within the settlement's boundaries.

If you are not able to find the"Structures>Miscellaneous" subcategory, then you installed a mod that alters the basic construction categories of the game. In which case you may not be able to build the Station Pad, and hence will not be able to use this mod -- if you are lucky, the conflicting mod may have simply rearranged items, with the Station Pad now residing elsewhere in some other category or subcategory instead of where it was intended to be.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Tidying Up:[/color][/size][/b]

Mr. Tidy automatically removes the following "remains" and stores any recovered items that they may have contained in the station pad's Chest:

• Corpses
• Dead Things
• Skeletons
• Bone Fragments


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Mr. Tidy Status:[/color][/size][/b]

Mr. Tidy's station pad has colored indicators which identify the bot's current status:

[b][color=yellow]Yellow[/color][/b] -- Mr. Tidy has not yet been activated.  Interact with the station pad to begin tidying.  The colored indicators will then become Blue.

[b][color=lightblue]Blue[/color][/b] -- Mr.Tidy is currently gathering cleanup information.  The player should remain in the settlement while the indicators are Blue.  When the cleanup information has been collected, the indicators will become Green if there are "remains" to be tidied, or will become White if there is no work to be done.

[b][color=lightgreen]Green[/color][/b] -- Mr. Tidy is currently analyzing cleanup information or actively traveling around to tidy things up.  Mr. Tidy will Beep when the indicators become Green.  The bot will now be able to continue tidying while the player is away from the settlement.  The indicators will become White when cleanup has been completed.

[b][color=white]White[/color][/b] -- Mr. Tidy is currently idle while waiting to begin the next tidying cycle.  This is the time to store (or scrap) a settlement's Mr. Tidy when its job is completed.  Tidying is resumed by interacting with the station pad.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Scan Range:[/color][/size][/b]

The scan range for both "long range" and "within settlement boundaries" is 10,000 units of game-world distance. So the difference between those choices is simply whether particular remains are processed (inside the bounds) or not (outside the bounds) when Mr Tidy's station pad is positioned in a settlement's central area. Short Range is 3,500 units. Medium Range is 6,000 units.

10,000 units is far enough to span the interior of base-game settlements when Mr Tidy's station pad is centrally positioned. I have never used the DLCs so do not know the coverage for their settlements. And of course coverage will vary when using mods that alter settlement boundaries or add new settlements.

As an example, just over the bridge from Sanctuary there is initially a dead NPC and a dead dog. They are outside Sanctuary's settlement boundary and so are never processed when using "within settlement boundaries", but are processed when using "long range" with Mr Tidy's station pad positioned near Sanctuary's workshop. The distance from that workshop to the corpses is approximately 8,500 units.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Installation:[/color][/size][/b]

Install using a mod manager, or unpack the mod and copy the .ESP/.ESL and .BA2 files into the game's \DATA folder, then enable the mod.

Position this mod's .ESP/.ESL file to be as low as it will go in your "Load Order" sequence.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Install ESP or ESL?[/color][/size][/b]

If you are reaching the maximum allowed number of .ESP installs, and want to install more mods, then install the .ESL versions of those new mods ...

Back-in-the-day, many players were reaching the maximum number of allowed .ESP installs, so Bethesda introduced a way to permit more via .ESL files.

The Light Master (.ESL) file is an optimized file format introduced in the Fallout 4 v1.10 update. Using Light Master files allows more plugins (mods and patch mods) to be installed than previously possible with .ESP files. For .ESP files there is a limit of 255, whereas a maximum of 4096 .ESL files can be loaded (but in practice is difficult to achieve due to other technical constraints).

Both file types can be used together, which means you can install just .ESP files if your install count remains below the .ESP maximum, or just .ESL files if your count remains below the .ESL maximum, or some of both such as using .ESP files initially and then adding .ESL files thereafter when the maximum for .ESP has been reached.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]ESP/ESL Compatibility:[/color][/size][/b]

Saved games that currently use an .ESP mod are not compatible with an .ESL of that same mod. Similarly, saved games that are currently using the .ESL for a mod are not compatible with an .ESP of that same mod. That is a basic game restriction in terms of switching between .ESP and .ESL versions of a mod. There is no "fix" or workaround -- it is inherent in the game's design.

So, to switch from .ESP to .ESL, or from .ESL to .ESP, you must:

1 ) uninstall the mod
2 ) load the current saved game
3 ) create a new saved game (while that mod is not installed)
4 ) install the other download of that mod
5 ) resume play with that newly created saved game

Objects and NPCs provided by the mod will not be there now and must be created once more. Similarly, quests will need to be done again.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Requirements:[/color][/size][/b]

No special requirements. DLCs are not needed.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Known Issues:[/color][/size][/b]

The game can be a bit quirky at times, which can result in an NPC becoming a bit confused (or even stuck) when traveling from one place to another.  When this happens for a Mr. Tidy, it automatically performs "fast travel" (teleports) back to its Station Pad.  So if you are watching Mr. Tidy, and it suddenly disappears, it has returned to its Station Pad and resumes its tidying activities from there.

Mister Tidy, by necessity, uses a pathing mechanism that is less robust and more error prone than the one that NPCs and other Robots typically use.  As a result, Mister Tidy can be more readily befuddled by obstacles, especially with regard to fencing and walls that surround a settlement -- they will hinder its ability to enter and exit that place.   So an "open" settlement environment is generally best.

If this mod's initial quest is not starting for you after being installed with the Vortex mod manager, it might be because it has not been properly activated/enabled.  If you click PLUGINS within Vortex, you will then see which mods are truly activated/enabled or not (whereas the MODS section sometimes shows incorrect information). Within that PLUGINS interface you can activate/enable the mods that were not properly set when installed.

Corpses for NPCs created by the NPCs Travel mod are intentionally not removed because it breaks that mod by preventing those NPCs from re-spawning as intended.  So depending on the frequency/quantity/importance of NPCs Travel's enemies for a player's settlement fights, this mod might not be very useful.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Known Conflicts:[/color][/size][/b]

There is a conflict between this mod and War Of The Commonwealth which can result in crashes. I have identified the specific conflict, but at present there is no fix or workaround that I can provide. So it is best to not use the two mods at the same time.

[s]Corpses for NPCs created by the NPCs Travel mod will no longer re-spawn as originally intended if those corpses are tidied-away by Mr Tidy.[/s] Fixed by NPCs Travel v2.95.

The initial quest can be prevented from starting, or become stalled part-way through, when using a buggy "quick start" or "alternate start" mod.  The quest normally begins a short while after exiting from Vault 111 for the first time, or a short while after loading a saved game when already outdoors in the Commonwealth.  Otherwise, it might (or might not) begin when standing for a few minutes outdoors at the Sanctuary Hills workbench.

If you experience crashes while traveling during the initial quest, or are unable to complete that quest, it is then highly likely some other mod has been installed that "breaks" the Vault 111 area (or possibly the Sanctuary settlement) thereby preventing this mod from working correctly.

If you are not able to find the "Structures>Miscellaneous" subcategory, then you installed a mod that alters the basic construction categories of the game. In which case you may not be able to build the Station Pad, and hence will not be able to use this mod -- if you are lucky, the conflicting mod may have simply rearranged items, with the Station Pad now residing elsewhere in some other category or subcategory instead of where it was intended to be.

[s]Please be aware that "Anom's Sanctuary Hills Overhaul" has been reported to conflict with some of my Settlement mods, such that when both are installed the player is then no longer able to create a new saved game. This might (or might not) be the case here as well.[/s]


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]To Uninstall:[/color][/size][/b]

Uninstall with the mod manager that was used for the original install, or delete SettlementTidyBot files.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Permissions:[/color][/size][/b]

This mod may not be reused in part or whole for any purpose other than its original intent.  It may not be uploaded to any other web site.

Get in touch with me if you wish to discuss translation into a non-English language; prior approval is mandatory.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Change Log:[/color][/size][/b]

See the Change Log to review what is included in each update.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Credits:[/color][/size][/b]

Bethesda Softworks - for the original Models and Textures [I merely provided the ingenuity and scripting to bring Mister Tidy "to life"]


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]My Other Mods:[/color][/size][/b]
