attributes.name: Settlement Tidy Bot-33217-2-4-1596036701
attributes.shortDescription: Mr. Tidy "undertaker bot" that scurries around removing "remains" from a Settlement

attributes.author: Project Valkyrie Discord Server
attributes.description:
[center][b][color=#6aa84f]"Fallout 4 companions play like a great first effort from a gifted modder."[/color][/b]
- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/1200978?tab=user+files]llamaRCA[/url]﻿, author of the #1 companion mods [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/41779/?]Willow[/url]﻿ and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23273]Heather[/url]﻿.[/center]
[center][color=#ff7700][b]﻿Let's add some polish.[/b][/color][/center]
[center][youtube]2_AZ0Poyp-M[/youtube][/center][center][color=#00ffff][b]﻿November 2019 Mod of the Month[/b][/color][/center]
[color=#00ff00][b][u]What this mod does[/u][/b][/color]

1) Reduces or eliminates repetitive companion dialogue.  How many times do you need to hear Cait say "Can't wait to get out of this goddamn heat" at 2 a.m. when it's raining? Now she'll only ever say that line once, and at the right time. Same with comments about looting, crafting, chem use, etc.

2) Adds new situation-appropriate dialogue for companions. They'll have more to say and seem more aware of their surroundings.

3) New dialogue menu options for Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, Hancock, Danse, Deacon, and Gage. They all give side quests now, except Curie, who can serve as a vendor and combat medic once she's converted to a synth.

4) Generic vanilla settler dialogue now pulls from a bank of over 150 lines instead of just 21, multiplied by up to 10 different potential voice types for each line.

5) Settlers are aware of your quest progression, and while they still occasionally complain about "my back hurts, my feet hurt...", they display increased awareness of the dangers lurking in the Commonwealth, expressing gratitude for the protection you've provided them, with a more tolerable balance between positive, neutral, negative, and snarky comments. If your settlement happiness is high enough, they will occasionally give you small gifts when expressing their gratitude.

6) Adds additional combat dialogue variety to Raiders and Gunners.

In total, the mod adds over 2,300 voice lines to companions, settlers, and enemies.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]How it works[/u][/b][/color]

This was accomplished with vanilla dialogue by:

[color=#9fc5e8][color=#ea9999]- Incorporating content that was cut from the game[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8]- Editing and splicing existing lines to create new ones[/color]
- Re-purposing hidden or rare dialogue to apply to new situations
[color=#b4a7d6]- Flagging certain annoying/repetitive lines to only be said once (e.g. loot junk comments)[/color]
[color=#ffe599]- Adding cool-down timers to other repetitive lines (e.g. combat taunts)[/color][/color]

No NPC records were edited - only companion dialogue quest records and the 'DialogueFarmGeneric' quest (for settlers). No vanilla scripts were touched. NPC appearance mods are fully compatible, as are mods that affect NPC stats, NPC leveled lists, and companion affinity.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Companions[/u][/b][/color]

Companion dialogue diversity is only as good as the most repeated line. Piper has over two-thousand lines, but you hear only a small fraction of those on a typical play-through. Some of her wittiest lines trigger only if she's with you on a particular quest, while some of her combat lines she says dozens of times.

I've traveled with Piper over 200 hours. Sorting through the raw audio files to make this mod, I was shocked to find hundreds of lines I'd never heard her say before.

A lot of us travel with companions for as long as they're interesting and not annoying. When they start repeating the same lines over and over, we lose interest and dismiss them. With this mod, that happens much later into the game.

The companion dialogue that is added here doesn't change their characters. It's the same companions you're used to, just with more content. Specifically:

[color=#00ffff][color=#00ff00]- Triple the amount of general combat lines (detect enemy, taunt enemy, victory line) for Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, Hancock, Danse, Deacon, and Gage.[/color]

- Lots of new random idles, especially in dungeons, and sometimes with a sarcastic slant if it suits the character.

[color=#ffff00]- Certain vanilla random idles that tend to repeat often will now only be said once.[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]
- When you loot, pick a lock, hack a terminal, use a workbench, take drugs, eat a corpse, walk around naked, enter power armor, etc., your companion will comment, but they will never repeat that same comment again.[/color][/color]

[center]﻿[youtube]TXVtZTQTRiI[/youtube][/center][color=#00ffff][u][color=#00ff00][b][u]Settlers[/u][/b][/color][/u][/color]

I was trying to figure out why I lost interest in settlement building about 6 months after the game launched. The settlement mods that have released since then are incredible. Why am I not motivated to engage with that part of the game anymore?

Partly because it doesn't feel like my actions matter. Not only does the game not in any way react to the massive colony I've built on Spectacle Island, the settlers there don't care either. They're still complaining about the same old things.

I wanted the game to feel like the settlers were on the same team as me, functioning as more than professional mooches. If I'm General of the Minutemen, call me "General" once in a while, and talk to me about tactical stuff. Acknowledge the threats we face and the things we're doing to solve problems. Or barring that, at least be semi-interesting and make me laugh occasionally.

So that's what I tried to implement via more dialogue lines, much of it conditioned upon what's going on in the game and/or the settlement. The increased variety in settler dialogue only occurs if a settlement's happiness is above 60, and some of the lines won't trigger until happiness is closer to 100.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Raiders and Gunners[/u][/b][/color]

Raider and Gunner combat lines have been tweaked to make them sound a little smarter, and to increase variety. This was done by adding lines (over 130) from cut content, DLC, and re-purposing voice files from quests where lines are only said once in specific areas (e.g. Museum of Freedom, Combat Zone, Cabot quest line).

The new lines are general in nature, not location specific, and it's stuff like: "You're goin' nowhere", "C'mon, I got places to be!", "Get it over with and die already!", "God dammit! You're gonna regret ever comin' here!", etc. It sounds indistinguishable from the vanilla combat, there's just more of it.

Also, Raiders won't call you "Rookie" once you're not a rookie anymore, and several of the lines that make Raiders sound comically obtuse have been flagged as "say once": e.g.  "Hiding? From me? Not even possible..."", "What the...!? No, no, it's nothing.." Raiders will still sound dumb, saying lines like "Huh?", Wha?", "What the...", but it won't be quite as over-the-top as it is in the vanilla game.

When stalking Gunners, they'll no longer say a few of the lines that make them sound incompetent: e.g. "Huh?" "Wha?", so it feels more like you're encountering trained mercenaries instead of dumb Raiders.

[left][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41785/41785-1575190586-1130611822.png[/img]﻿[/left][center][/center][color=#00ff00][b][u]Quests[/u][/b][/color]

Certain companions give repeatable quests now:

- Piper gives you the quests "[color=#93c47d]Anything for a Story[/color]" to explore places you haven't cleared yet and "[color=#93c47d]You Can't Stop the Press[/color]" to gather supplies for her newspaper business.

- Cait offers a quest "[color=#93c47d]Lookin' for Trouble[/color]" to hunt down those Raiders she talks so much about hating.

- Danse assigns you the quest "[color=#93c47d]Outstanding, Soldier![/color]" to eliminate Super Mutants and Feral Ghouls.

- Hancock has a quest "[color=#93c47d]Because I Got High[/color]" to track down chem stashes.

- Nick gives the quests "[color=#93c47d]Lost and Found[/color]" to track down stolen property for Diamond City residents and "[color=#93c47d]Commonwealth Justice[/color]" to complete bounties on behalf of the Diamond City Council.

- Gage gives the quest "[color=#93c47d]Let's Go Kill Some Sh*t[/color]" to wipe out rival gangs.

- Deacon also gives a non-repeatable quest called [color=#93c47d]"Coming Clean"[/color] once you've maxed his affinity. Ask him "What's News?" and cycle through all the dialogue to start the quest and experience a new chapter of his never-ending stream of B.S.

[color=#00ffff][u]Radiant quests are lame[/u][/color]

[color=#ea9999]Typical BoS/Institute quest[/color]: Talk to Quest Giver > Travel to Dungeon > Kill bad guys > Travel to Quest Giver > Talk to Quest Giver.

[color=#f6b26b]Typical Preston quest[/color]: Talk to Preston > Travel to Settler > Talk to Settler > Travel to Dungeon > Kill bad guys > Travel to Settler > Talk to Settler > Travel to Preston > Talk to Preston.

That's a lot of talking and load screens for not much action. It's more fun when the quest giver travels with you to do the quest: Talk to Companion > Travel to Dungeon > Kill bad guys > Talk to Companion.

These new quests are optional, nothing is forced, and you can cancel the quest by talking to the companion. The side quests are accessed via the 'More Options' dialogue menu. Completing a quest for a companion will raise their affinity ("like" or "love" event), grant a small amount of XP, and yield caps or a custom reward.

This gives you potentially a new way to explore the Commonwealth and discover most locations naturally without needing to do the main quest.

[color=#00ffff][u]What else?[/u][/color]

Beyond quests, this mod didn't fit well into an existing category. It's similar in spirit to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/1187]Relationship Dialogue Overhaul [/url]for Skyrim, but "Overhaul" typically implies something that edits a lot of things and requires a slew of patches. This has a light footprint- shouldn't require any patches. Doesn't add a new companion, or new NPC's, or conflict with any mods that alter companion/NPC appearance or stats.

[center]﻿[youtube]gMtn-nGmTDg[/youtube][/center]
[color=#00ff00][b][u]Load Order and Compatibility[/u][/b][/color]

There are various mods that add or edit Fallout 4 dialogue. If you run one of those mods, here's where they go in load order relative to this mod (SCDO) so that it all plays nice together and you receive the benefits of both mods. "Below" means "After", and "Above" means "Before".

[b][i][color=#f6b26b][u]Below SCDO in load order[/u][/color][/i][/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25050]Deeper Thoughts Curie[/url] - Adds some additional dialogue to Curie. Mostly redundant with SCDO installed, but will add a little extra variety to idle comments.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25525]Icebreaker Piper - Companion Dialogue Overhaul[/url] - Adds more dialogue to Piper. Largely redundant with SCDO unless you would like more Piper responses to specific player actions (e.g. loot junk, swim, eat corpse, pick lock, etc), and some additional greetings.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13717/?]Nick Valentine Romance [/url]-  Allows you to romance Nick Valentine. Load order shouldn't matter, but put it below SCDO to be safe.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10365]No companion junk comments[/url] - Companions never comment on looting junk at all (versus in SCDO they'll say it once). Load order shouldn't matter, but place below SCDO just in case.

[b][i][color=#f6b26b][u]Above SCDO in load order[/u][/color][/i][/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/26638]Flirty Commonwealth[/url] - Edits and adds some flirty some companion idle comments. The Raider taunts it adds play really well with this mod (no overlap).

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14108]Immersive Generic Dialogues [/url]- Edits some settler idle comments and companion idle comments.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22166?]
Player Comments and Head Tracking[/url] - Edits some companion idle lines by adding player responses to them. If you place this, or its patch, below SCDO in load order, the repetition that SCDO removes from certain companion comments (e.g. Loot junk, pick lock, eat corpse, walk around naked) and idle comments (e.g. Cait's "we'd move faster if you kept your eyes on the road and off me arse"), will be reintroduced. For best results, do not use the unauthorized SCDO patch available for download on the Player Comments mod page.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4598]
Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch[/url] - Fixes typos on companion idle lines, and these fixes have been incorporated into SCDO, without requiring UF4P to be installed (although you should probably have it installed for a plethora of other reasons).
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25972/?]
Icebreaker Settlements - Settler Dialogue Overhaul [/url]- Adds more dialogue to settlers via the 'DialogueFarmGeneric' quest. Largely redundant with SCDO. Load order shouldn't matter, but as SCDO has more variety in settler dialogue, place SCDO lower in load order to be safe.

[b][color=#f6b26b][i][u]In General[/u][/i][/color][/b]

As a starting point, put SCDO below your quest mods.

Except as noted above, place SCDO [color=#00ffff]below[/color] anything else editing the [color=#ffe599]companion dialogue quests[/color]. (ComPiperTalk, ComCaitTalk, etc). If you screw up, not a big deal, the result is that you may not see 100% of the features from this mod for a particular companion if another mod is overwriting the same dialogue topic.

You can check whether a mod edits a quest by loading all your mods in FO4Edit, clicking on the Quest records in this mod, and seeing whether any other mods edit the same Dialogue Topic within a quest (i.e. look for red and orange records when both mods are loaded in FO4Edit).

Other than that, SCDO should be [color=#00ffff]compatible with everything unless explicitly stated otherwise.  [/color]

Compatible with mods that edit NPC appearances, mods that edit leveled lists, mods that affect companion affinity or companion stats, multi-follower mods, Horizon, Sim Settlements/Conqueror, Start Me Up, Better Settlers, No Negative Affinity, Visible Companion Affinity, Full Dialogue Interface, Extended Dialogue Interface, Realistic Conversations, Amazing Follower Tweaks, Unlimited Companion Framework, Combat Zone Restored, Keep Both X6-88 and Porter Gage Plus Deacon, Danse Dialogue Overhaul, and the other 30,000 or so mods for Fallout 4, unless stated otherwise on the mod page.

[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41785/41785-1573848586-1768463613.png[/img]﻿﻿[/center][color=#00ff00][b][u]Requirements and Installation[/u][/b][/color]

The base game, Automatron, Nuka World, and Vault-Tec Workshop are required. No other mods are required.

Install like any regular mod. You can use the mod at any point on an existing save game. It also works on a new save game.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Translations[/u][/b][/color]

Check the Translation drop down menu at the top of the mod page for an updated list of available translations.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Troubleshooting[/u][/b][/color]

- If a companion's buy/sell vendor menu comes up empty the first time, exit the conversation and try again. If Gage isn't selling chems, dismiss him and re-recruit.

- If Gage turns hostile in "Open Season", use the "Make Gage a Companion Again" holotape on the counter in Fizztop Grille to restore him, or craft the holotape at a chem station under "Utility". If you never want Gage to become hostile in the first place during "Open Season", use the mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/29192?]Keep Both X6-88 and Porter Gage Plus Deacon[/url].

- If a companion gives a quest, but no quest comes up, it's possible you've cleared all the eligible quest locations and may need to wait for them to respawn. Try asking again, and if that doesn't work, fast travel somewhere else, wait a day or so, then ask again.
[color=#00ff00][b][u]
XBox, PlayStation?[/u][/b][/color]

PS4: not possible due to voice files.
XBox: Yes, [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4133638]here[/url].

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Additional dialogue for other companions?[/u][/b][/color]

Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, and Danse were initially chosen for additional dialogue and new content based on a Discord poll asking the question, "[color=#ffd966]Which companions do you still play with for 6 hours or more on a Fallout 4 play-through? (Check all that apply)[/color]". There were over 100 responses, and those were the five companions people still actually use long enough for dialogue repetition to matter. And Dogmeat, but he doesn't talk. Hancock was also given additional dialogue because I like Hancock. Same with Gage, Deacon, and MacCready.

As it stands now:

- Companions with additional dialogue and new content: Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, Danse, Deacon, Hancock, Gage, and MacCready
- Companions adjusted to avoid/reduce repetitive dialogue: All of the above plus Ada, Preston, Codsworth, X6-88, and Strong.
- Companions for whom no adjustments were made: Dogmeat and Old Longfellow

[color=#00ff00][b][u]More Quest Content?[/u][/b][/color]

This mod plays nice with the following quest mods if you want another 60+ hours of Fallout 4 content:

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/35513]Depravity[/url] - (August 2019 Mod of the Month)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/28085]Project Valkyrie[/url] - (August 2018 Mod of the Month)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21469]Outcasts & Remnants [/url]﻿- (April 2017 Mod of the Month Runner Up)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16423]Fusion City Rising[/url] - (September 2016 Mod of the Month)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/45546]Diary of a Madman[/url] - (Alternate path to Depravity's evil ending to the vanilla game)

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/xrT20hp.png[/img]﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿[/center]The quest locations in this mod have very little overlap with the locations in the mods above. If you are looking for a workable Fallout 4 mod list based on flexibility, fun, safety, ease of install, and popularity over personal preference, check out [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41435]Thuggyfied[/url].

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Donations?[/u][/b][/color]

[color=#00ff00][color=#ffffff]We do not accept donations, nor is the mod opted in to receive Donation Points from Nexus. However, we'll take endorsements and game-play screenshots if you've got good ones.

Another way to support what we're doing: we have a [url=https://discordapp.com/invite/gMpaxn3]Discord Server[/url] where we answer questions about these mods + provide general mod support, help people with making mods, discuss mod ideas, do play-testing and early access to upcoming mods, etc.

It helps us if you boost that server (visit the [url=https://discordapp.com/invite/gMpaxn3]Discord Server[/url], Click on Project Valkyrie in the upper left, then click on 'Server Boost', and then 'Boost This Server'). 

We don't receive any money from that, it all goes to Discord, but it helps us and all the Discord users by allowing access to more Discord features (e.g. uploading larger files, streaming at high resolution directly into the server, better user interface, etc). So huge thanks in advance if you do it!

If you're a [url=https://discord.com/nitro]Discord Nitro[/url]﻿ subscriber, they give you 2 free boosts with which you can boost any servers you'd like.[/color][/color]

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Credits[/u][/b][/color]

[url=https://discordapp.com/invite/gMpaxn3]Project Valkyrie Discord Server [/url]for play-testing and feedback. LlamaRCA, Flashy(Joer), Nika Cola for technical help. Sacremas for content help.
[color=#e69138]Mod page art[/color]: @Raikou.ff for Cait, [url=https://pain-art.tumblr.com/archive]Pain-Art@Tumblr[/url] for Curie and Piper, [url=https://girlandgeese.tumblr.com/archive]GirlAndGeese[/url] for Nick, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9740/?]ItsPreciousTime.Tumblr[/url] for Danse, [url=https://yuhimebarbara.tumblr.com/]Yuhimebarbara[/url] for Hancock, [url=https://www.deviantart.com/odme1]Odme1[/url] for Gage, Bjorn Kissel for settler comic, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/4304289?tab=user+files]SMB92[/url] for city skyline.
attributes.name: Settler and Companion Dialogue Overhaul-41785-1-01-1607796844
attributes.shortDescription: Tired of hearing the same old lines from companions and settlers? Wish they had more to say? Or gave quests? Now they do.

attributes.author: Kris Takahashi
attributes.description:
[b]Atomic Radio is a Pre-War radio channel. Includes 5 hours of lore friendly commercials of Fallout Universe products, as well as PSAs, TV shows, movie trailers. See videos below for examples. Also, the quest mod Tales from the Commonwealth is on this page too. The mod Settlers of the Commonwealth is now available here as a download.  Go to [url=http://3dnpc.com ]3dnpc.com [/url]for details.


[/b][b][url=http://3dnpc.com][img]http://imgur.com/GvgjcI9.jpg[/img][/url]  [/b][b][url=http://twitter.com/3dnpc][img]http://i.imgur.com/VGhtxvp.jpg[/img][/url]  [url=http://patreon.com/3dnpc][img]http://i.imgur.com/YU1HT1v.jpg[/img][/url]  [url=http://youtube.com/3dnpc][img]http://imgur.com/fiLODCu.jpg[/img][/url]  [/b][b][url=https://discord.gg/7WG4Eyd][img]http://imgur.com/Y8VaX9Y.jpg[/img][/url][/b][b]
[/b]

[b][size=4]If you like Atomic Radio and Tales from the Commonwealth, try my little indie game, Out of Shapes, on Steam[/size]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1308240/Out_of_Shapes/][size=5]https://store.steampowered.com/app/1308240/Out_of_Shapes/[/size][/url][/b]

[youtube]pwyKMSVbi48[/youtube]
[center]***[/center]
[b]ACTORS, CELL MAKERS, AND MESH TEXTURE PEOPLE NEEDED
In addition to the radio - which is always expanding - I'm working on quest mods and NPCs, which I'll upload beta versions for here. If interested, please contact me at kristakahashi@gmail.com with a demo or an audition.
You can find [url=http://3dnpc.com]all pertinent info on the site blog.
[/url][/b]

[center]***[/center]
[b]ON BUG REPORTS AND COMMENTS[/b]
In all honesty, I don't have time to manage this site. I will check it periodically at best.
[b][url=http://3dnpc.com]However, if you leave bug reports on the blog, I will answer within 24 hours guaranteed, as I get an email[/url]. [/b]
It helps me manage both Interesting NPCs and the FO3/FNV/FO4 mods in one place.

attributes.author: Dheuster
attributes.description:
[u][size=6][b]Overview[/b][/size][/u]

A simple mod that makes it unsafe to rest in uninhabited areas at night. Your sleep can be interrupted by an enemy ambush or any number of wasteland creatures. 

[center]
[youtube]MX2pBOFXxzU[/youtube][/center]

[size=4][u]Requirements[/u][/size]

Sleepless Nights was compiled with Fallout 4 patch 1.10.114. It may or may not work with older versions of Fallout 4.

[u][size=6][b]Details[/b][/size][/u]

[b]A) How Often will I get attacked?[/b]

In normal mode, you are safe to sleep in the daytime. The probability of being attacked at night is determined by how long you sleep and your luck:
 
[list]
[*]1 hour   : 10% chance of being attacked
[*]2 hours : 13%  chance of being attacked
[*]4 hours : 20%  chance of being attacked
[*]8 hours : 50%  chance of being attacked
[/list]
    Luck:
  [list]
[*]Poor Luck  (0 -> 3) multiplies odds of getting attacked by 1.25
[*]Good Luck  (7 -> 9) multiplies odds of getting attacked by 0.75
[*]Great Luck (10+)    multiplies odds of getting attacked by 0.50    
[/list]
Example:

If you sleep for 7 hours, normally there is a 20% chance of being attacked. If your luck score is 3 or less, that increases to a 25% chance. If your luck is 10 or more, odds drop to a 10% chance. 

[b]B)  Enemies[/b]

The number of enemies in a wave is determined by your level. After level 35,  there is a 50% chance you will get a second random wave of enemies if the first roll succeeds. IE: You might get a group of deathclaws and a group of raiders all at once. 

[b]C)  Safe Locations[/b]

You are always 100% safe to sleep in big cities such as Diamond City, Goodneighbor, Bunker Hill, Vault 81, Far harbor, Arcadia, Nuka Town and Most Vaults. You are also generally safe to sleep in your Faction Stronghold.

In normal mode, you are also safe to sleep in the daytime and in owned settlements. However settlements are only safe at night if their defense rating is 20 or higher. Night is considered the hours between 9:30 PM and 5:30 AM.

In Nightmare mode, you can be attacked even in owned settlements. However, settlers may help defend the player.

Finally, if you are attacked on a given day, you will not be attacked the next time you sleep unless you enable the option to allow multiple attacks per day. 

[size=4][u][b]Nightmare Mode[/b][/u][/size]

Users can optionally enable Nightmare mode. In nightmare mode:
[list]
[*]You can be attacked anytime you sleep, day or night
[*]Basic settlements no longer offer protection. 
[*]Only big cities and indoor strongholds are safe.
[*]Every 7th day, sleeping carries a 50% risk of being attacked by a Ghoul Horde
[/list]  
Ghoul Horde:
  
A ghoul horde is a sizable group of ghouls that arrive in 3 waves. Each wave is tougher than the previous. Hi-level glowing ghouls can emit a radiation burst that heals and resurrects nearby dead ghouls from earlier waves. This is what makes Ghoul Hordes particularly dangerous. One stray final boss can resurrect all 3 previous waves at once. 
  
So keep an eye on your Game Day. If it is divisible by 7, find shelter or be prepared for a major battle.

[size=4][u][b]Daydream Mode[/b][/u][/size]

An optional mode for users who want sleepless nights to be less challenging so they don't have to reload their save games as much.   In this mode:
   [list]
[*]You can sleep up to 2 hours with 0% chance of being interrupted
[*]Sleeping for 3 or 4 hours is less risky
[*]The Max Number of Sleeps before a mandatory attack is doubled

[*]Sleeping within the boundaries of any settlement is safe. Ownership and defense rating don't matter.

[*]Enemies still level with the player, but the number of enemies stops increasing at level 20. 
[*]No larger-than-man sized enemies. IE: No Behemoths or Deathclaws
[*]No possibility of a second wave of enemies or Ghoul Horde.

[/list]
[i][u]Shameless Self Promotion[/u]

[size=2]This mod was created to complement the mod [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/26976]Amazing Follower Tweaks[/url][/i][size=2][i] in order to increase the value of multiple companions and a portable camp with defensive capabilities. While recommended, AFT is not needed for this mod to work.
[/i][/size]
[size=6]Usage:[/size]
[size=2]
After being installed, you will find a Misc Holotape in your inventory called "Sleepless Nights Settings"
[/size]
[list=1]
[*][ ] Nightmare Mode - Toggle this option on if you wish to play in nightmare mode.
[*][ ] Daydream Mode - Toggle to play in Daydream Mode
[*][ ] Allow Multiple attacks per day -  Toggle if you don't mind being attacked multiple times a day.
[*]Force Attack After [ ] Sleeps - determines max sleeps in uninhabited areas before an attack is forced.
[*]Prepare for Uninstall - Select to shut down Sleepless Nights Scripts. Recommended before disabling the mod. 
[*]Tab to Exit - Reminder, but also offers a back door to the Debug Menu. Click 6 times and it changes to [Debug Menu].
[/list][center]﻿[/center]

attributes.author: cartman1975
attributes.description:
[size=4]This mod is an optional add-on to [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15429/?]Manufacturing Extended[/url][size=4] made by [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/1179663]Kentington[/url]


[color=#ff0000][size=4]UPDATE v0.5: New Soylent Cola and Soylent Cola Crate[/size]
[size=3]Texture of soylent soap improved
[/size]Bug with bone meal fixed

[/color]UPDATE v0.4: New Chem Device (Jet, Soylent Jet), soylent soap, boxes and pallets to store soylent green
[size=2]UPDATE v0.3: Two new items added: bone meal and glue
UPDATE v0.2: Food Paste added and XB0X1 upload[/size]


[size=4]It adds three new devices:[/size]

[color=#00ff00]VAULT-TEC Emergency Food Processor[/color]
[size=4]Processes the output of the autobutcher[/size]

[size=2]Input: Meat (all types)[/size]
[size=2]Output: Soylent Green, Dog Food (Mutant&Ghoul Flavor) and Food Paste. All four are consumables
[/size]

[color=#00ff00]VAULT-TEC Remains Recycler[/color]
[size=4]Creates some new decoration and junk (can be found under Decoration/Misc)[/size]

Input: Skull+Oil (it actually will work with all bones, so use items sorter to let it look more realistic)
Out: Skull Candle (Junk item but placeable via the workshop with a lit candle (Decoration/Misc, after the plants)
Input: Bones
Out: Soylent Soap, Bone Meal(Fertilizer)

[color=#00ff00]VAULT-TEC Chem Processer[/color]
[size=4]Creates jet in all variants[/size]

Input: Components for Jet
Out: Jet, Jet Fuel, Ultra Jet, Ultra Soylent Jet 
Input: Bloodbag
Out: Stimpack


[color=#00ff00]New Recipes for cooking station[/color]
[size=4]Also comes with two new recipes: Ghoul Stew and Mutant Steak made of Ghoul&Mutant Meat[/size]

[color=#00ff00]Boxes and pallets for soylent green
[/color]Box with 25 cans of soylent green, pallet with 150 cans of soylent green (can be found under Decoration/misc) to store the products.
when scrapped you get the whole input back.
Works like my other mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15289/?]Warehouse[/url] to store the boxes and pallets in shelves



[color=#ff0000]Installation
[i]DLC [/i][i]Contraptions[/i] and [i]Manufacturing Extended[/i] 1.4 are required[/color]
[size=4]Install both first and keep them in a higher load order.[/size]
[size=4]Install/Uninstall it with NMM.

[/size]The original Auto-Butcher is only slighty changed: Two new textures for the Ghoul&Mutant Meet and Bloodpacks added as Output.
After deinstallation everything will work as before.

attributes.author: Hanaxar
attributes.description:
[font=Arial][size=5][color=orangered][center][b]DO NOT FLAG THE UFO4P-FDI PATCH AS AN ESL. IT'LL BREAK THE PATCH.[/b][/center][/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]DESCRIPTION[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]It's a strings patch for Full Dialogue Interface, I recreated the strings from the base game + DLCs with xTranslator, then edited many of them by hand. And it's English only, I'm unable to do it for other languages. Actually I made it for myself but I decided to share it with my fellow wastelanders.
[color=#ffff00]TL;DR: You'll have your FDI compatible with the latest FO4 (v1.10.163)[/color]

[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41659/41659-1574435733-1516041926.gif[/img][/center]
[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]FEATURES[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#aaaaaa]1.[/color] Replaces FDI's old version of strings with the recent version of the game.
[color=#aaaaaa]2.[/color] Corrects issues of the vault suit names and pip-boy names because of the old strings.
[color=#aaaaaa]3.[/color] I had always "Sturges tell him/her." dialogue stuck during entire conversation in the Museum of Freedom, this patch corrected this one for me. It'll correct some weird dialogue issues here and there caused by FDI but it's impossible for me to list all of them here.
[color=#aaaaaa]4.[/color] Corrects shortened dialogues of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4598][color=#ffff00]Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch[/color][/url] version 2.1.0 (if you have it).

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]REQUIREMENTS[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#ffff00]Fallout 4[/color] (Game version 1.10.163)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1235][color=#ffff00]Full Dialogue Interface[/color][/url] (You only need the main mod)

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]COMPATIBILITY[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]It's compatible with anything, it does not affect save games, and perfectly safe to uninstall or reinstall whenever you want.

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]INSTALLATION[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]Use a mod manager like MO2/Vortex; it has a fomod installer.
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41659/41659-1575294472-1300168992.png[/img]

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]FINAL NOTES[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]A bit rant here: I'm surprised when I checked the strings; because since 2016 (when FDI last updated), Bethesda only changed the strings of vault suits and pip-boys for their creation club contents, and some tiny dialogues here and there, that's all... Then I realized that all the updates we had in the last 3 years were probably unnecessary. I even don't believe they made any bug fixes, it was just for their CC content... It's sad.

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]THANKS[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#ffff00]Gentester[/color] for correcting UFO4P patch and saving me.
[color=#ffff00]Bethra[/color] for reporting issues and pointing me in the right direction.
[color=#ffff00]Cirosan[/color] for FDI that I still use it.
[color=#ffff00]Bethesda[/color] no matter what they do I'm still grateful for Fallout games.

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]CHANGELOG[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#ffff00]06/01/20: Version 1.5[/color]
Updated UFO4P-FDI patch.

[color=#ffff00]12/15/19: Version 1.4[/color]
Created all strings from scratch for game version 1.10.163 with the xTranslator tool.
Created UFO4P-FDI patch from scratch with the xEdit script I wrote for this tedious job.

[color=#ffff00]12/02/19: Version 1.3[/color]
Checked every quest dialogues in UFO4P-FDI patch and made countless corrections.

[color=#ffff00]11/23/19: Version 1.2.1[/color]
Corrected UFO4P-FDI patch thanks to Gentester.
Corrected version info.

[color=#ffff00]11/23/19: Version 1.2[/color]
Updated for FO4 version 1.10.162.

[color=#ffff00]11/23/19: Version 1.1.1[/color]
Corrected UFO4P patch thanks to Gentester.
Corrected version info.

[color=#ffff00]11/22/19: Version 1.1[/color]
Added UFO4P patch.
Made an all-in-one fomod installer.

[color=#ffff00]10/21/19: Version 1.0[/color]
Initial release.

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]MY OTHER MODS[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#aaaaaa][Fallout 4][/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33819][color=#ffff00]Purged Menu[/color][/url] (Clean the main menu with this F4SE independent mod)
[color=#aaaaaa][Fallout NV][/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/67172][color=#ffff00]Six Feet Under[/color][/url] (Bury dead people, creatures or even robots)



[color=#ffff00][center]Please don't forget to endorse. Thank you.[/center][/color][/size][/font]

attributes.author: KeyC0de
attributes.description:
[b][size=3][img]http://i67.tinypic.com/5c0gfl.jpg[/img][/size]

[size=3]Were you always bothered by the weakness of the robots in Fallout games? [/size]
[size=3]I feel that a robot, even the most simple robot, should be formidable. [/size]
[size=3]Consider that it's basically full plated armor, with no weak points (especially the combat robots). [/size]
[size=3]It can't be bargained with. It can't be reasoned with. It doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. [/size]
[size=3]And (if provoked) it absolutely will not stop, EVER, until you are dead. [/size]

[size=3]Now only very capable adventurers (or other robots) should mess with a combat robot, or synth. [/size]
[size=3]Which means having power armor would definitely be useful. I strongly recommend [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2249/?]WIPAG[/url][size=3] mod for some proper Power Armor gearing. [/size]

[size=3]A sentry bot should now be pretty much the toughest (non-Boss) opponent you can face in the wasteland. Well, it's a monstrous nuclear powered ([b][size=3]judging from the explosion)[/size][/b] electro-mechanical [/size][color=#cc0000][size=4]DEATH machine![/size][/color][size=3] It deserves all the bonuses. [/size]


[size=3][img]http://i64.tinypic.com/20pbuc5.jpg[/img][/size]

[size=3]In case you didn't realize from the intro, this mod makes all robots SUPAPOWERFUL, but not ridiculously so. I believe they are now as strong as a (Fallout) robot should be. [/size]

[size=3]Specifically all roboids get the following benefits: [/size]
[/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x4 health [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 damage resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]75+ unarmed damage (where applicable)[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]Sole exception to the damage and energy resistance bonuses is the robobrain race. 
That's because they are too "exposed", as one can easily shoot their "brains" [i]clean off[/i]. 

The Sentry race of Robots gets the following benefits instead: 
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x8 health [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x4 damage resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]Double damage output to all its ranged damage dealers (from its miniguns to rockets etc) [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x4 unarmed damage[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x1.25 scaling of model dimensions[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]
All synths get the following benefits: 
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x2 health[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 damage resistance[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]75+ unarmed damage (where applicable)[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]Coursers get all the synth's benefits and in addition:
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]
All turrets (which are completely ridiculous in vanilla) get the following benefits: 
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x10 health[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 damage resistance[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x3 base damage output[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x1.4 increased range [/size][/b]
[/list][size=3][b]Turrets were positioned there to cover the area for a long time. Now they should do that more effectively. [/b]
[b]They are also relatively rare which compensates for the big bonuses. [/b]


[b][img]http://i66.tinypic.com/21ctfe8.jpg[/img][/b]

[b][size=3]Added new Non-DLC version fully updated. [/size][/b]

[color=#ff7700][u]v1.1 Released[/u]![/color]

[b]New Features: [/b]
[list]
[*][b][size=3]Tweaked Sentry Bot leveled lists such that their loot will be MUCH more rich to reward those who manage to defeat them. Their prowess and scarcity has been accounted for this. [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]Increased Sentry Bot Action Points, Action Point Rate & Carry Weight [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]Adjusted Sentry Bot overheating to occur less often [/size][/b]
[*][size=3][b]Added another Sentry loadscreen appropriate for the occasion. If you spot it you can mention it in a comment if you want. [/b][/size]
[*][b][size=3]Misc small tweaks to Sentry's offensive stats [/size][/b]
[/list]
[b]v1.1.1 - Bugfix: [/b]
[list]
[*][b]Nuka World Protectron / Galactron health bug fixed [/b]
[/list]
[b]I suggest everyone to download and use the latest version[/b]


[b][img]http://i66.tinypic.com/2ewo8cj.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]This mod requires Fallout 4 and all DLCs.
An optional non-DLC version is provided.[/b]


[b][img]http://i64.tinypic.com/10eeyy8.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]1. [/b]
[b]Download the appropriate file depending on whether you have all of the DLCs, or none of them.[/b]

[b]2. [/b]
[b]Install with NMM / MO, [/b]
[b]or manually [/b]
[b]by extracting the downloadable archive contents and pasting the "data" folder into the main game folder: ~/Steam/Steamapps/Common/Fallout 4[/b]


[b][img]http://i64.tinypic.com/x4lus0.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]Clearly the mod is incompatible with other mods that alter robots / synths / turrets. [/b]
[b]But it should be compatible with everything else. [/b]

[b]You may have to wait for some in game days for all creatures to be updated (or just start a new game). [/b]


[b][img]http://i63.tinypic.com/2n6zrkj.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]For optimal gameplay, combat & immersion i strongly recommend to use this mod in conjunction with the following: [/b]
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27763/?]Advanced AI Tweaks[/url] along with all mods listed in that mod page recommendations section as well & [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27734/?]Fire, Grenades, Explosions Enhanced[/url] : for a realistic overhaul of all fire, grenades, mines, missile weapons, nukes etc. [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13822/?]Deadlier Deathclaws[/url] : Make deathclaws challenging too with this mod [/size][/b]
[*][size=3][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27623]Global Damage Multiplier for all Difficulties[/url] : Increased damage output - highly recommended [/b][/size]
[/list][b][size=3]You're gonna love it!


Made with the Creation Kit.
[/size][/b]

attributes.author: Ghostfc3s
attributes.description:
Recommended to create a save before using this mod to revert to if something goes wrong.

[b]Russian Version[/b]

http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/19765/?


Update v7 fixes culling issues in Andrews station attached to the mission "along time coming." This update also added npc control points to prevent the whole map from rushing the player for the whole map. 

Update v6 adds a new station layout, the new layout is used for concord station, airport station, a new station is added at Monsignor Plaza and as well as tunnel connecting Goodneighbor and Malden station. An abandoned tunnel was added to connect Glowsea to West Roxbury Station.

This mod connects 90% of the standard subway stations, and creates a network of subway tunnels filled with raiders, super mutants, synths and ghouls. Subway stations have been added throughout this network. With a focus on survival play through there are easy to access to beds for save points to bunk down for the night. This system once cleared out of enemies allows the player to move quickly across the wasteland. Be warned the battles to take back the network and make them safe for travel will be not an easy one.

The maps are fully nav meshed and companion friendly.
I recommend using companion whistle to keep them close, especially if you are using more the one companion.

This mod is large and modifies some world spaces to allow access to the subway network. I to care to avoid settlement locations and areas that could conflict with other mods.

To gain access to Good Neighbor you must complete the quest “The Big Dig” otherwise the station is inaccessible from the surface.  I did this as 3rd rail is often used by other modders as a player home.

[b][u]Not compatible with underhouse mod.

[/u][/b]There are some issues with other immersive mods, notably stumble upon, interior and bean town. 

You will have to play with load order to get them all to work together. 

Currently I have interior over hall, then subway runner, bean town and stumble upon, I am still playing through a play through with this order but it appears to work.

There is no plans to incorporate dlc. I purchased the season pass for ps4 when we were promised mods, have no intention of paying another $70 for dlc I already own. 

My to-do list for future updates, I will check them off as I go and upload hopefully 1 big update.

Move light sources away from the walls,

Remove 2-3 loot tables from each cell as they are noticeably over represent.

Try to figure out why the grenade arks are not present

Add more rubble to prevent pop up and noticeable draw distance.

attributes.author: registrator2000
attributes.description:
[line]

[size=12][center][font=Courier New]TAKE COVER[/font][/size]
[font=Verdana][size=5]Bringing 3rd-person cover to Fallout 4![/size][/font][/center]

[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/g3pDikSjbmMh2.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](Pop out of cover by aiming down sights.)[/size][/font][/center]
[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ About ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Take cover behind objects and automatically lean out to shoot when you aim down sights!
I've always found taking cover to be inadequate in Fallout 4. In first person, if you tried to utilize cover tactically, you'd be staring at a blank wall most of the time. In third person, all you can do is crouch behind some rock or furniture, occasionally walk out, and hope enemy bullets don't hit you.

This mod hopes to give you a true cover mechanic.

Integrating third-person cover hasn't been a trivial task at all. Thank you for your patience and support![/font]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ How to Use ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]OPTION 1. AUTOMATIC/INTEGRATED MODE[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=4]☢ [/size] With your weapon drawn, sprint into a wall to take cover behind it.
[size=4]☢ [/size] [Beta version only] Double tap the forwards movement key to enter cover. 
[/font]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]OPTION 2. HOTKEY MODE[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Activate assigned hotkey to enter cover mode. 
[/font]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Both automatic mode and hotkey activation can be used interchangeably.[/font]

[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/1xrLCzZp0Vx2E.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](Sprint into a wall to take cover behind it.)[/size][/font][/center]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Details ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]HOW TO CHOOSE YOUR COVER[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]You have two cover options - a standing cover, and a crouching cover for low objects.
When entering cover,
[size=4]☢ [/size]Point down (crosshair below eye level) to enter a crouching cover.
[size=4]☢ [/size]Point up (crosshair above eye level) to enter a standing cover.[/font]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]HOW TO EXIT COVER[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Move backwards to exit cover. The activator also can be used to exit cover (default) or configured to swap between standing and crouching covers.[/font]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]HOW TO VAULT OVER LOW OBJECTS[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]In crouching cover only,
[size=4]☢ [/size] Hold forward and activate the hot-keyed Take Cover activator.
[size=4]☢ [/size] [Beta version only] Double tap the forwards movement key. (Turn on this option in the Config)
Make sure Cover Vault is enabled in Configuration - it's off by default.[/font]

[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/jxtcxTfGLAjAI.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](YES YOU CAN COVER-VAULT)[/size][/font][/center]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Installation ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Install the mod with your mod manager or manually by copying the files in the archive into your Fallout 4 Data folder.

Once installed, on first load, you will see a message box saying that Take Cover is active. If you don't, then the mod was not installed correctly. See [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]here[/url] for instructions on how to set up Fallout 4 for modding.

You will receive Take Cover and Take Cover Config in the AID section of your inventory.

At this point, the cover system is active. Sprint towards a wall with your weapon drawn to take cover.

You can also hotkey the Take Cover activator to a quick-key in your favorites to quickly enter and exit cover at any point in time, or use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11664/]FO4 Hotkeys[/url] to bind it to any key on your keyboard or any extra mouse buttons you may have. I highly recommend binding Take Cover to Shift+Aim with FO4Hotkeys so that you have cover available at the touch of your mouse.

Use Take Cover Config to configure various aspects of the cover system, including whether sprint-to-cover is turned on and whether cover-vaulting is enabled.[/font]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Notes ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]
[size=4]☢ [/size]It wasn't easy to do, but yes - it works great with VATS! VATS traditionally roots you to the spot and gives you no movement control, but this mod lets you "pop-out" of cover even in VATS. After entering VATS, tap V (view-change key) to pop out of cover. You automatically re-enter cover when VATS ends!

[size=4]☢ [/size]Did you know that Fallout 4 has [url=https://imgur.com/a/EGwRQ]first-person cover[/url]?[/font]


[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/lC9tAjmxeytR6.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](Vanilla VS Mod)[/size][/font][/center]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Known Issues ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Weapons switched while in cover using a favorites hotkey will be invisible. Switch weapons with your Pip-Boy, or pop into VATS and back out.[/font]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] You cannot move directly rightwards in cover. To move right, you must move diagonally front-right or back-right, or you can face the right and move front.[/font]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Not compatible with melee weapons, heavy weapons (miniguns) and sniper rifles that bring you into first person scope.

Without animation tools, it will be difficult to address the first and second issues as these are limitations in Bethesda's animation files.
If you are an animator and you'd like to help with the animations, please do get in touch!

Integrating third-person cover hasn't been a trivial task at all. Thank you for your patience and support!
[/font]


[center][color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Video Showcase ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Thanks to Mudcups for being so amazingly quick to have a video up![/font]

[youtube]zg2dIh_N3Xw[/youtube][youtube]urljxpsdBDQ[/youtube][/center]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ FAQ ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Q: What's the best way to use cover?

A: [color=#cccccc]Read [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/263/]Protips for Taking Cover![/url] for some tips to enhance your cover experience.[/color]

Q: Does this work in first-person?

A: [color=#cccccc]You have an option in the Config to set whether you want a first-person sprint to activate cover. It's off by default. If turned on, you will automatically enter third-person and go into cover when sprinting up against a wall in first-person. From 1.1 onwards, you'll also automatically return to first-person when leaving cover if you entered from it.[/color]

Q: Sprint-to-cover is not sensitive enough / too sensitive! (entering cover when you don't actually want to)

A: [color=#cccccc]Every system is different, and you might want to tweak the sensitivity of cover-entering yourself! I've provided a couple of preset options in the Config - you have Default, High, and Very High to specify how still you have to be while sprinting before you enter cover.

You can tweak these values beyond the presets that I've given with this console command:
[font=Courier New]cqf cover setsensitivity <your desired value here>[/font]

The preset values in the Config are:
Default: 2
High: 10
Very High: 20

To make entering cover less sensitive, you can type [font=Courier New]cqf cover setsensitivity 0.5[/font] to lower the sensitivity below the default.[/color]

Q: Blind-firing?

A: [color=#cccccc]Yes! You can blind-fire around cover by just hitting the fire button without aiming down sights.[/color]

Q: How do I see if the mod is working for me?

A: [color=#cccccc]Compare your cover experience with those in the linked video showcases! That's what you can expect from Take Cover.[/color]

Q: I want to uninstall Take Cover.

A: [color=#cccccc]Run the console command [font=Courier New]cqf cover uninstall[/font]. This will unregister all events and prepare the mod for safe removal.[/color]




[center][color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ More Videos ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Tyrannicon features Take Cover (beta) at [url=https://youtu.be/H2G5zyy7BO8?t=1m23s]1:23[/url].[/font]

[youtube]H2G5zyy7BO8[/youtube][youtube]cWSE4d23K5A[/youtube][/center]

[line]

[center]
[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Other mods by me:[/b][/size][/font][/center]
[center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9325/]Bullet Time - Slow Time[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9437/]Better Wait Menu and Wait Anywhere[/url]

Send your companions to their original homes or to Home Plate.

A for-fun mod that lets you shoot cars at your enemies.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10282/]Outfit Switcher[/url]
Save entire loadouts and swap between them via hotkey. It's like favorites, but entire loadouts at a time.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11664/]FO4 Hotkeys[/url]
Hotkey anything to any key, including equipment, items, and even console commands.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11784/]Companion Command and Tactics[/url]
Shout to your companion from wherever you are. Position them, switch up their equipment and be a lot more tactical in your fights.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13462/]Journal of the Sole Survivor[/url]
Gives you a personal journal that you can type in.

See all of my mods [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/searchresults/?src_order=1&quicksrc_auth=registrator2000]here[/url].[/center]


[center]Made possible by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/]FO4Edit[/url] and the amazing [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7380/]Caprica[/url] compiler.[/center]
attributes.name: Take Cover 1.3 BETA-10875-1-3-beta
attributes.shortDescription: New gameplay mechanic - 3rd person cover system! Take cover behind objects and automatically lean out to shoot when you aim down sights. NEW: v1.1 BETA released - Dynamic Camera - you can now switch shoulders, double-tap forward key to enter cover/cover-vault, and transition smoothly from first-person to third for cover, then automatically back

attributes.author: darkconsole
attributes.description:
[img]https://67.media.tumblr.com/e692bc2506fc9dcde53b36a3dbe5193d/tumblr_o8cqzsQD6n1u8cymno1_r1_1280.png[/img]


[b][color=#e06666][size=6][u]
About[/u][/size][/color][/b]

This mod automatically pulls all Fusion Cores out of your power armor when you get out of it. It has two modes, timer (default) and distance. Because we have no MCM yet for Fallout, you will have to update and change its settings through the console. Don't worry, I've made it easy. See the Settings section for more info.

[quote][color=#f1c232][b][u][size=5]Timer Mode[/size][/u][/b]
[/color]
Gives you the cores from the power armor X seconds after getting out of the frame. This mode is the default. Note that pulling the core before the shut down sound finishes, causes the shut down sound to stop. See the settings section for more info if you are using shorter animations or longer sounds, and you wish to hear it t

[youtube]s_Ix1vOV3iQ[/youtube][/quote][quote][b][u][color=#f1c232][size=5]Distance Mode[/size][/color][/u][/b]

Gives you the cores from the power armour after you walk X meters away from the frame. This allows you to keep the core in while staying nearby to do your charisma checks or whatever, and hopping back in without having to reinsert. Or if you are Eric and apparently constantly just accidentally jump out of your armor on accident. Honestly depending on feedback distance mode will probably become the default in future versions.

[youtube]HI0gox4KNZA[/youtube][/quote][b][color=#e06666][size=6][u]
Settings[/u][/size][/color][/b]

Because we have no MCM all settings are done through changing variables from the console. The pattern looks like this:

[center][b][font=Georgia][size=4]set VariableName to Value[/size][/font][/b][/center]
So you literally type set, the variable name, the word to, and then the value you wish to set. Then hit enter.[quote][list]
[*][b][color=#f1c232]Switch to Timer Mode[/color][/b]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockMode to 1[/color]
[/list][color=#ffffff]
[/color][list]
[*][b][color=#f1c232]Switch to Distance Mode[/color][/b]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockMode to 2[/color]
[/list][color=#ffffff]
[/color][list]
[*][color=#f1c232][b]Timer Mode: delay before removing core. (in seconds)[/b][/color]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockDelay to 5.5[/color]
[*]This is the value (5.5) I use for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2920/?]Car Sounds for Power Armor[/url], the most immersive mod on the Nexus, to get that beep beep at the end. If you aren't using that mod you might as well just go throw your power armor in the ocean and give up ever being accepted in the Atom Cats.
[/list][color=#ffffff]
[/color][list]
[*][color=#f1c232][b]Distance Mode: Distance before removing core. (in meters)[/b][/color]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockDist to 8[/color]
[/list][/quote][color=#e06666][size=6][b][u]
Update Notes and Instructions[/u][/b][/size][/color]

Because we have no MCM I have included two bat files with the mod. Every Time You Update you should run the PALockUpdate file, and if you want to reset the options to defaults then you can run the PALockReset file. These are TXT files which sit next to the ESP file, if you care to inspect them.
[quote][b][color=#f1c232]DO THIS IN THE CONSOLE AFTER YOU INSTALL THE UPDATES. NO EXCEPTIONS.
[/color][/b]
[color=#ffffff]bat palockupdate[/color]

[img]https://66.media.tumblr.com/08a587a3305f27bc33f164d08706bd9b/tumblr_o8cqzsQD6n1u8cymno3_r1_1280.png[/img][/quote][b][u][color=#e06666][size=6]
Permissions[/size][/color][/u][/b]

Under no circumstances is this to be uploaded to any other sites by anyone other than me.
[color=#e06666][size=6][u]
[/u][/size][/color][b][color=#e06666][size=6][u]See Also.[/u][/size][/color][/b]

I have a [url=http://darkconsole.tumblr.com/mods/fallout4]bunch of other mods[/url] too.

attributes.author: Kris Takahashi
attributes.description:
[b]Atomic Radio is a Pre-War radio channel. Includes 5 hours of lore friendly commercials of Fallout Universe products, as well as PSAs, TV shows, movie trailers. See videos below for examples. Also, the quest mod Tales from the Commonwealth is on this page too. The mod Settlers of the Commonwealth is now available here as a download.  Go to [url=http://3dnpc.com ]3dnpc.com [/url]for details.


[/b][b][url=http://3dnpc.com][img]http://imgur.com/GvgjcI9.jpg[/img][/url]  [/b][b][url=http://twitter.com/3dnpc][img]http://i.imgur.com/VGhtxvp.jpg[/img][/url]  [url=http://patreon.com/3dnpc][img]http://i.imgur.com/YU1HT1v.jpg[/img][/url]  [url=http://youtube.com/3dnpc][img]http://imgur.com/fiLODCu.jpg[/img][/url]  [/b][b][url=https://discord.gg/7WG4Eyd][img]http://imgur.com/Y8VaX9Y.jpg[/img][/url][/b][b]
[/b]

[b][size=4]If you like Atomic Radio and Tales from the Commonwealth, try my little indie game, Out of Shapes, on Steam[/size]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1308240/Out_of_Shapes/][size=5]https://store.steampowered.com/app/1308240/Out_of_Shapes/[/size][/url][/b]

[youtube]pwyKMSVbi48[/youtube]
[center]***[/center]
[b]ACTORS, CELL MAKERS, AND MESH TEXTURE PEOPLE NEEDED
In addition to the radio - which is always expanding - I'm working on quest mods and NPCs, which I'll upload beta versions for here. If interested, please contact me at kristakahashi@gmail.com with a demo or an audition.
You can find [url=http://3dnpc.com]all pertinent info on the site blog.
[/url][/b]

[center]***[/center]
[b]ON BUG REPORTS AND COMMENTS[/b]
In all honesty, I don't have time to manage this site. I will check it periodically at best.
[b][url=http://3dnpc.com]However, if you leave bug reports on the blog, I will answer within 24 hours guaranteed, as I get an email[/url]. [/b]
It helps me manage both Interesting NPCs and the FO3/FNV/FO4 mods in one place.

attributes.shortDescription:
The Tales from the Commonwealth mod adds quests and companions.
The Atomic Radio mod adds a radio station.
The Settlers of the Commonwealth mod adds settlers with interesting dialogue.

Go to 3dnpc.com for details.

attributes.author: Reveurr
attributes.description:
[size=3][size=6][center]UNnaked Power Armor
[size=3]- Stack your Body and Power Armor Protection -[/size][/center][/size]

In Vanilla, when your enter a Power Armor, the game considers you're naked under it : protections don't stack.
This mod corrects that by stacking Body Armor and Power Armor Protection.
Simply learn the [url=http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Toughness]Toughness perk Rank 1[/url] and you're good to go.



[youtube]40VNebzXV3k[/youtube]



[u]Compatibility with your existing character:[/u]

This mod is fully compatible with any character, whether you allready knew the perk Toughness Rank 1, or not.
Just remember to learn this Perk to activate the mod functionnalities.




[u]How the mod works:[/u]

* This mod constantly searches for your body armor protection, and dynamically adjusts a linked variable accordingly.
This variable can add or delete 2.5 points from its value each second, so in order to find an armor of 20, when you were previously naked, it'll take (20 - 0) / 2.5 = 8 seconds.

Other example : you just equiped a piece of armor and your total resistance went from 100 to 110, the mod will take (110 - 100) / 2.5 = 4 seconds to adjust the variable and detect your new armor.
So, if when entering your Power Armor, the added value isn't the one you're actually looking for, just get out of the PA, wait a few seconds (without looking at your Pip-Boy screen, it freezes time) and reenter it.
The Added Armor will have been updated.[size=3]


* Due to FO4Edit limitations, I had to manually configure each possible Damage Resistance value the player can have, in order for this mod to detect them.
In other words, I configured a specific range Resistance detection, out of which more Protection won't be added.

Here are the Ranges for each Resistance type:
- Damage Resistance: 0-600
- Energy Resistance: 0-600
- Radiation Resistance: 0-200 + 1000
- Poison Resistance: 0-100


* For the same reason, SPECIAL attributes bonuses have a +10 / -10 detection [size=3][size=3]range[/size][/size].
For example, if your character has 7 base agility, the mod will be able to detect the following bonuses :
- 7 -> 8 : Bonus of +1 Agility given by Body Armors
- 7 -> 9[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +2 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size]
- 7 -> 10[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +3 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size]
- 7 -> 11[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +4 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 12[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +5 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 13[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +6 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 14[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +7 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 15[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +8 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 16[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +9 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 17[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +10 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size]
- Higher values will stack as a +10 Agility Body Armor Bonus.


* Almost all Legendary Armor Bonuses Stack in Power Armor:
- Exterminator's : Reduces damage from Mirelurks and bugs by 15%.
- Assassin's : Reduces damage from humans by 15%.
- Ghoul slayer's : Reduces damage from ghouls by 15%.
- Hunter's : Reduces damage from animals by 15%.
- Mutant Slayer's : Reduces damage from super mutants by 15%.
- Troubleshooter's : Reduces damage from robots by 15%.  
- Duelist's : 10% chance to disarm melee attacker on hit.
- Powered : Increases Action Point refresh speed.
- Punishing : Reflects 10% of melee damage back on attacker.
- Safecracker's : Increases size of sweet spot while picking locks.
- VATS Enhanced : 10% reduction in Action Point cost in V.A.T.S.
- Sprinter's : Increases movement speed by 10%.
- Sentinel's : Reduces damage while standing and not moving by 15%.
- Cavalier's : Reduces damage while blocking or sprinting by 15%.
- Poisoner's : +25 poison resistance.
- Cunning : +1 Agility and +1 Perception
- Fortifying : +1 Strength and +1 Endurance
- Lucky : +2 Luck.
- Acrobat's : Reduces falling damage by 50%. (Equiping a Power Armor negates Fall Damage)
- Freefall : Prevents falling damage. (Equiping a Power Armor negates Fall Damage)

* The following [size=3]L[size=3]egendary Armor Bonuses don't stack in Power Armor:[/size][/size]
- Bolstering : Grants increasing energy and damage resistance the lower your Health (up to +35).
- Chameleon : Enemies have a harder time detecting you while you're sneaking and not moving.
- Low Weight : Low carry weight.
- Martyr's : Temporarily slows time down during combat when you are at 20% or less Health.
- Piezonucleic Lining : Radiation exposure increases Action Point refresh speed.

This limitation is due to the fact this mod detects actor values, not armor enchantments.
So if there's a condition on activation, the value is only active from time to time, which is not reliably detectable.


* For the same reason as above, [size=3][size=3]almost all Normal Armor Bonuses Stack in Power Armor:[/size][/size]
- BioCommMesh : Increases duration of chems 50%.
- Strengthened : Reduces limb damage.
- Stabilized : Scoped Aiming is more steady.
- Brawling : Improves Unarmed damage.
- Weighted : Unarmed and Melee attacks ignore some of target's armor.
- Muffled : Reduces detection from moving.
- Aerodynamic : Power attacks drain less AP.
- Custom Fitted : Sprinting takes less AP.

[size=3][size=3]* The following Normal[size=3][size=3] Armor Bonuses don't stack in Power Armor:[/size][/size][/size][/size]
- Padded / Dense : Reduced damage from explosions.
- Asbestos Lining : Immune to being set on Fire.



[u]Installation[/u]:

Download only One esp : the latest version.

* With Nexus Mod Manager:
Simply click the download button and let NMM install the mod.

* Manually:
Download and extract the mod, then copy "UNnaked Power Armor.esp" into your Fallout Data Folder.[/size]

* V0.9 : The Radiation protection from Body armor and Power armor now stack.[/size]

[size=3][size=3]*[/size][/size] V0.6: Alpha Release

None.

attributes.author: Unofficial Patch Project Team
attributes.description:
[center][img]https://www.afkmods.com/modbanners/UFO4PVaultBoyBanner920x200.jpg[/img][/center]
[center][color=#ff0000][size=6]Requires Fallout 4 patch 1.10.163 or greater!
Requires *ALL SIX* Official DLCs.[/size][/color][/center]

A comprehensive bugfixing mod for Fallout 4. The goal of the Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch (aka UFO4P) is to eventually fix every bug with Fallout 4 not officially resolved by the developers to the limits of the Creation Kit and community-developed tools, in one easy-to-install package.

Features:
- Hundreds of gameplay, quest, NPC, object, item, text and placement bugs fixed.
- Created by the authors of the Unofficial Oblivion and Skyrim Patch series.
- No unsafe changes (such as deletions of stock objects).
- Designed to be compatible with as many other mods as possible.

For more information (ie the recent changelog, mods that UFO4P replaces) see [url=https://www.afkmods.com/index.php?/forum/350-unofficial-fallout-4-patches/] UFO4P's threads on the AFK Mods forum here[/url].

[url=https://www.afkmods.com/Unofficial%20Fallout%204%20Patch%20Version%20History.html]The complete changelog is posted here[/url].

If you're experiencing a bug with Fallout 4, please report the bug to us in as much detail as possible on [url=https://afktrack.afkmods.com/index.php?a=issues&project=32]the UFO4P bugtracker[/url]. Please use search to ensure that you aren't submitting something that is already there.

[url=https://www.afkmods.com/index.php?/topic/4420-frequently-asked-questions-bugs/]Frequently Asked Questions - BUGS[/url]
[url=https://www.afkmods.com/index.php?/topic/4421-frequently-asked-questions-about-the-project/]Frequently Asked Questions - About the Project[/url]

[center][url=https://www.patreon.com/arthmoor][img]https://c5.patreon.com/external/logo/become_a_patron_button.png[/img][/url][/center]

[b][u][size=4]Installation Requirements[/size][/u][/b]

Fallout 4 version 1.10.163 or greater.
Official Automatron DLC.
Official Wasteland Workshop DLC.
Official Far Harbor DLC.
Official Contraptions Workshop DLC.
Official Vault-Tec DLC.
Official Nuka-World DLC.

[color=red]DO NOT extract the contents of the BA2 files into your Data folder as loose files, or let your mod manager perform an equivalent function on the contents of the file. Doing so will cause things to load in the wrong order and break the game. Fallout 4 is intended to load BA2 files alongside their ESM/ESP files. Circumventing this causes issues which we will not provide support for. If you insist on going against this advice, you will receive no support for the problems you generate as a result of this.[/color]

After installing the mods, the following general load order needs to be followed:

Fallout4.esm
DLCRobot.esm
DLCworkshop01.esm
DLCCoast.esm
DLCWorkshop02.esm
DLCWorkshop03.esm
DLCNukaWorld.esm
DLCUltraHighResolution.esm (OPTIONAL)
Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch.esp
[Everything else you have installed]

For getting load order set with other mods loaded, please use [url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url]. It will provide you a solid starting point for everything that you can then tweak as needed.

[b][u]Disclaimer[/u][/b]

This mod is not made, guaranteed, or supported by Zenimax, Bethesda Game Studios, or any of their affiliates.

[u][b]Officially Recommended Translations[/b][/u]
