fileInfo.name: No VATS Overhaul

modInfo.author: hidcon
modInfo.description:
[u][size=4][b]TL;DR[/b] VATS is disabled and perks that give bonus in VATS are modified to be useful again.
[/size][/u]
[u][size=4]Also, if you like VATS, I'm completely fine with it as long as you just walk away.[/size][/u]



[size=5]Installation:[/size]

Not 100% sure that modifications to perks that player already acquired apply correctly.
Nothing I can do about it; it's engine problem.
Use console commends to remove and re-acquire modified perks to be certain.



[size=5]Requirements:[/size]

Nuka World DLC
Far Harbor DLC



[size=5]Complementary Mod:[/size]

Critical Hits Outside of VATS by [b]NotSure700 - [/b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12653/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12653/?[/url]

[u][b][size=4]HIGHLY RECOMMENDED![/size][/b][/u] I did not modify perks that are already modified by this mod.



[size=5]Full Change List:[/size]


Awareness
1 Time slows down by 30% for 5 seconds when combat begins.
2 Now time slows down by 50% for 8 seconds when combat begins.

Concentrated Fire
1 You do 20% more damage to enemies with 30% or less health.
2 Now you do 30% more damage to enemies with 40% or less health.
3 Additionally, you do 50% more damage to enemies with 20% or less health.

Sniper
3 Non-automatic, scoped rifles do 100% more limb damage.

Quick Hands
2 Now you can reload all guns even faster. (50% faster; rank 1 is 35% faster)

Blitz
1 You do 50% more melee weapon damage for 5 seconds after sprinting more than 2 seconds.
2 Now you do 80% more melee weapon damage for 8 seconds after sprinting more than 1 second.

Gun-Fu
1 Every time you switch to a pistol, rifle, or heavy weapon, you do 10% more damage with them for 10 seconds. The bonus stacks up to twice.
2 Gun-Fu bonus stacks up to three times. Gun bashing does 50% more damage.
3 Gun-Fu bonus stacks up to four times, and lasts 5 more seconds.

Grim Reaper's Sprint
1 Any kill has a 15% chance to restore all Action Points. 
2 Any kill now has a 25% chance to restore all Action Points.
3 Any kill now has a 35% chance to restore all Action Points and reduce incoming damage by 50% for 5 seconds.

Penetrator
1 You ignore 20% of a target's armor.
2 Now you ignore 30% of a target's armor.

V.A.N.S.
1 Track nearby human targets for 30 seconds.
2 Track human and robotic targets further away for 30 seconds.

Critical Banker
1 You have 5% chance of critical hit on enemies with full health.
2 Now you have 10% chance of critical hit on enemies with full health.
3 Now you have 15% chance of critical hit on enemies with full health.
4 Now you have 15% chance of critical hit on enemies with 75% or more health.



[size=5]Change Log:[/size]

1.1
- fixed Grim Reaper's Sprint rank 3 chance


[size=5]Work In Progress:
[/size]
- No clue how to change Mysterious Stranger perk; best possible implementation would be one in which the NPC spawns somewhere in the middle of a combat. I would have to do a lot more than tweaking perk entries for that, so currently it's untouched.

- Companion perks, legendary weapon mods, when I have time to look into them.

- Let me know if there is other game play elements that are VATS-dependent!



[size=5]My Other Mods:[/size]

No VATS Overhaul: Disables VATS and modify VATS-dependent perks to be useful without VATS.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25428/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25428/?[/url]

Power Armor No Sneak: Makes sneaking extremely hard with power armors, especially when moving.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25051/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25051/?[/url]

Binary Pickpocket Overhaul: You can either pickpocket an item with 99% chance, or not at all, depending on your perk, agility, and the item's value. No more save & load bullshittery!
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25123/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25123/?[/url]

Animated Chems - re-done Fix: Quick fix for FLipdeezy's Animated Chems - re-done mod
Original: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13278/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13278/?[/url]
Fix: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25094/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25094/?[/url]

fileInfo.name: SKKPlayerUndead_003

modInfo.author: SKK50
modInfo.description:
[size=3]The SKK GriefProof PlayerUndead™ service recovers player death, automatically restoring a player from zero health bleedout in place or to the nearest owned settlement with all their stuff and companion. Configurable service charge and health restore options.
[/size]

[color=#00ff00][center][size=3][ all Papyrus scripts are digitally remastered in full 4K UHD with 7.1 surround ] [/size][/center][/color]
[size=3] 
Install this mod at any time in any game stage for any game difficulty (including survival) and the player is given a regenerating [color=#00ff00][ .SKK pLAYERuNDEAD ] [/color]menu item in AID inventory after exiting V111 (craft spares at the Chemlab). When the item is activated, a menu pops for:

 
Service state: [ Enable | Disable ]
Service fee: [ 0% | 50% | 100% ] of player caps.
Restore [ 10% | 50% | 100% ]  of player health.
 
 
[b]User Notes (RTFM)
[/b]
When PlayerUndead™ is enabled, the player is configured to be essential with no bleedout recovery (like a companion) so they don't actually die.

After bleeding out the player can chose to recover in place or to the nearest owned workshop (that is not being attacked by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37393]Settlement Attack System[/url]).

If there are no registered owned workshops in the worldspace or interior, the player is recovered to Sanctuary because ownership of that workshop should never be lost. If Sanctuary is a hostile Conquerer settlement, that's on you.

If the player has a companion using the standard companion slot who is also bleeding out, they are moved with the player so they don't try to bail and return to their home location.


[b]Known Issues[/b]

(1) If the player dies whilst in VATS the imagespace animations freeze and death can not be recovered. Reload from save. 

(2) In some areas of the world bad surface/navmesh can cause the "[i]player the bleeding out on the ground[/i]" idle animation to fall through the world, or the 3rd person camera to become stuck. Reload from save.

(3) When actors are bleeding out they are actually marked as dead so they are no longer attacked. This can cause other actors to loot their weapons and ammo during bleedout. If your stuff is not on a dead hostile, check your companion.


[b]Compatibility

[/b](1) The mod has no dependencies on extenders or DLCs.

(2) There is one change to a base game asset: MGEF [font=Courier New]RestoreRadsCompanion[/font] to avoid Stimpaks healing rads on the player whilst they are essential. It will conflict with anything that modifies the effect.

(3) If the mod detects that the player is already essential when the [color=#00ff00][ .SKK pLAYERuNDEAD ] [/color]menu item is activated, it will pop a warning message that it can't continue. Things known to already manage the player essential state are Death Matters, Horizon, Follower Revive System, Zombie Walkers and Fallout 4-76 PlayerUndead™ option.

(4) This mod should be compatible with multiple companion/follower mods if you use the "recover in place" option. It will not be compatible if you use the "recover to nearest workshop option" as it doesn't know about the additional headcount to manage their bleedout state and move them with the player.


[/size][size=3][b]PC Console configuration[/b][/size]

[size=3]If additional inventory items trigger you, no problem throw it away and use the console, hotkeys.ini or create an MCM json thing:[/size]

[font=Courier New][size=2]set SKK_PUEnabled to 1       ;; options [0 | 1]
set SKK_PUCapsCharge to 0    ;; range [0 to 1] decimal percent of player total caps. 
set SKK_PURestoreHealth to 1 ;; range [0.1 to 1] decimal percent of player total health (do not set to zero).
cqf SKK_PUQuest "SKK_PUQuestScript.SwitchPlayerUndead" ;; call this for enable/disable to take effect[/size][/font]

[size=3]
[b]Nexus PC manual installation & disable

[/b]Copy SKKPlayerUndead.esp and  SKKPlayerUndead – Main.BA2 to your...\Fallout 4\Data directory and add to Plugins.txt, or enable in the Bethesda mod menu, use a mod manger or however you organise. 

Do not disable this mod if the service state is enabled, but when the service state is disabled the mod is idle and can be disabled in the load order. Only remove mods if you are happy to accept potential conflicts from load order changes in a save game. If that is unclear, best to be safe and don't ever remove mods from a savegame.


[b]Nexus FAQ[/b]

(1) Why is there no ESL version ? Because life already contains sufficient hassle. 

(2) Why an aid item menu rather than MCM ? Because 90% of SKK mod users like to shoot stuff on Xbox.

(3) It has been decided to not merge this function into [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37963]SKK Dynamic Damage Manager[/url] because reasons.

[color=#00ff00](4) Holdon pal, isn't this just a rip and republish of a feature from your massive [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/32599]Fallout 4-76 Open World[/url] overhaul mod ? Why Timmy, yes that's quite right ! Mainly because I need a lightweight no death solution based on scripts I trust more than your mommy when I am not in the 4-76 open world, but also a 4K UHD remaster of the original Papyrus scripts must be worth publishing standalone just like those HD nipples and 4K scrotum re-textures. It is of course in no way a cynical "[i]let's shard our mods into lots of separate little downloads to game the Nexusmods DP system so we can feed our cats[/i]" type of thing, as suggested in Mr Spunk's excellent [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/40818]craftable 4K earwax[/url] (possibly beeswax) mod.[/color] 


[/size][size=3][b]SKK Combat oriented mods[/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/30308]SKK Combat Stalkers[/url] - the hostile spawning solution.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/42081]Random Encounter Manager by SKK[/url] - amp up or dial down the combat opportunities.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37393]SKK Settlement Attack System[/url] - replace base game settlement attacks with something that actually works.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/34693]SKK Combat Settlers[/url] - manage settlers health, damage and power armor use.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27492]SKK Instant Battleground[/url] - when you want to fight, now.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37963/]SKK Dynamic Damage manager[/url] - tune damage in and out in realtime to find the perfect game balance.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41002]PlayerUndead death recovery by SKK[/url] - recover from bleedout death in place or at a workshop.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/46799]Unlimited Combat Followers by SKK[/url] - recruit disposable meat shields, not waifus.


[/size]For the avoidance of doubt: you are not allowed to upload this content to other sites. The only exception is when specific written permission has been granted to republish a translated ESP, but that permission will never include the BA2 archive(s) or any extracted scripts.

modInfo.author: Undyne777 - Cooleo
modInfo.description:
[center][color=#00ffff][b][size=4]GUNSMITH EXTENDED[/size][/b]
[/color][size=4]Firearm Modification Overhaul[/size]
[size=3]Mod by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/1312926/?]Undyne777[/url] & [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/65149-cooleo/]cooleo[/url]

[color=#00ffff]Note from the authors, to anyone that still checks in on this regularly.

First, thank you to the FO4 Mod Community for your support on both this, and my other projects. I've dabbled in modding privately in past games, but this game has been my first foray on the scale that I have done. Your support and critiques kept me coming back and helped make this better (all 700+ endorsers, 13K+ downloaders, and 140+ comments).

Right now, due to work commitments and other personal developments, I am officially done with supporting this project. I don't have the bandwidth to do it justice. As of now (10/21/16), this project is 100% open-source to anyone who wants to take it and roll with it. Keep it going or change it up - that can be up to you. If you've enjoyed using this as much as I have, I hope you consider making it your own.

I've said it before and I'll say it again - BIG thank you to [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/65149-cooleo/]cooleo[/url]. He kept this thing going while I've been MIA. He pushed out a lot of refinements that I never thought of and for that we're all grateful. Can't wait to see what you crank out, dude![/color]

[color=#efefef][i]Ever want an automatic .50 pistol that shoots plasma rounds?
5.56mm Hunting Rifle with cryo rounds?
5mm Submachine Gun with armor piercing rounds?
Well, this is the mod for you!
[/i][/color][color=#00ffff]
[u]SOME BACKGROUND

[/u][/color][/size][size=3]I started out modding Fallout 4 with a little project called [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3480/?]Caliber Conversion Kit[/url] that sought to add multiple receiver options to swap out ammo types. Even after I completed that project and moved onto other things, I still felt like there was more to do in terms of overhauling the existing weapon mod framework. 

Thus, Gunsmith Extended was born. ([b]NOT[/b] affiliated with the Weaponsmith Extended mod).

This mod does a deep dive series of changes to the existing modifications for ballistic firearms as pertains to receivers, fire modes, ammo types, and calibers. I drew on the things I learned working on my other mods to hopefully help diversify the options available when using vanilla weapons.

I hope you enjoy using it as much as I enjoyed making it! Cheers! :-)

[/size][size=3][color=#00ffff][b][u]MOD DETAILS[/u][/b][/color]

[size=3]Adds three (3) new modification categories to supported weapons at the workbench: [color=#00ffff]Fire Mode, Ammo Type, and Caliber[/color]

[color=#00ffff]*Fir[/color][/size][color=#00ffff]e Mode[/color]: Switch supported firearms between automatic & semi-automatic. 'Nuff said.
[size=3][color=#00ffff]Ammo Type[/color]: A cocktail of conventional and quirky ammo effects relevant to the Fallout universe
[color=#00ffff]Caliber[/color]: Switch which type of ammunition your peacemaker uses! Stats will change relative to the type of bullet.

[color=#00ffff]*Automatic Receiver changes[/color]: the existing "Automatic Receivers" have been converted to be "Light Bolt Receivers" that increase the rate of fire values.

[color=#00ffff]Lever Action Rifle changes[/color]: In addition to adding caliber swaps and ammo types, the lever action rifle also now receives +3 ammo capacity when using the Long Barrel or Long Ported Barrel options [i](they have longer tubes... why not use them?)[/i]

[color=#00ffff]All vanilla and Far Harbor firearms are supported as of version 1![/color] Note that not all categories are available for every gun (for example, there is no automatic fire mode for the flare gun or double barrel shotgun since it doesn't make sense).

[color=#00ffff]New caliber/fire mode combinations will spawn from enemies and be sold by vendors!
[/color][/size][/size][/center][center][size=3][color=#ff0000]If you encounter any issues or crashes, DO NOT post to the comments. [/color][color=#efefef]Your issue will probably get lost.
Help me help you. Submit a Bug report with your exact weapon build (eg. receiver, barrels, muzzles, etc.) and if you use any other mods that might conflict.[/color][/size]

[b][u][color=#00ffff][size=3]DETAILED CHANGE LIST[/size][/color][/u][/b]

[size=3][color=#ffd966]10mm Pistol -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers 
[color=#ffd966].44 Pistol -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers 
[color=#ffd966]Assault Rifle - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for calibers
[color=#ffd966]Combat Rifle -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers 
[color=#ffd966]Combat Shotgun - [/color]Ammo Types | Fire Modes
[color=#ffd966]Deliverer - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Double Barrel Shotgun - [/color] Ammo Types
[color=#ffd966]Hunting Rifle - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Minigun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Pipe Gun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Fire Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Pipe Bolt-Action Gun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Pipe Revolver - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Flare Gun - [/color]Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types
[color=#ffd966]Lever Action Rifle (Far Harbor) -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types |Naming convention changes for new calibers
[color=#ffd966]Radium Rifle (Far Harbor) -[/color] Caliber Swaps | Ammo Types | Firing Modes |Naming convention changes for new calibers

Only the [color=#ffd966]weapon listings[/color] (e.g. 10mm Pistol, .44 Pistol, etc.) and [color=#ffd966]receiver object modifications[/color] (e.g. Hunting Rifle .50 Receiver, Assault Rifle Automatic Receiver, etc.) are tweaked by this mod. [color=#ffd966]No changes have been made to loot lists or NPCs[/color].[/size]
[list=1]

[/list][size=3][b][u][color=#00ffff]INSTALLATION
[/color][/u][/b]
Pick which version is relevant to you (DLC Edition or No DLC) and drop the ESP file into your Fallout 4 Data folder.

To uninstall, just delete the ESP. Easy!

[b][u][color=#00ffff]WHAT'S NEXT?
[/color][/u][/b]
I'm trying to decide if / how to support energy weapons and non-conventional firearms (broadsider, harpoon gun, syringer, etc.) More to come on this...

[color=#00ffff][b][u]MOD CONFLICTS

[/u][/b][/color]Any mod that tweaks the vanilla weapon receivers or weapon properties will create a conflict. To solve for this, simply create a merged patch. If you do not know how to do this, try Google or YouTube for a quick and easy tutorial. I did a quick search and found [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Xc5tQCiDvo][u]this video here[/u][/url] [/size]in less than 20 seconds.[/center][center][size=3]
If you make a compatibility patch, you are free to release it to the public if you so desire.
[b]
I [color=#ff0000]do not[/color] create patches for other mods. It's simply too time-consuming because there are so many mods out there to account for. Sorry![/b]
[u][color=#00ffff][b]

fileInfo.description: Includes fix for a no-melee damage glitch on some weapons related to the new bash feature.
fileInfo.name: Institute Portal Gun Version 1.51

modInfo.author: ElPolloAzul
modInfo.description:
[size=4][i][b]Institute Portal Gun[/b][/i][/size]
ElPolloAzul

[u][b]The Pitch[/b][/u]

* Upset with not being able to see what's at the top of some building or water tower?
* Yearn to visit the REAL stands of Diamond City?
* Desire to have a quick and easy way to retreat to your settlement from
some dungeon overloaded with loot -- and don't want to call a
vertibird?
* Need to disappear your foes quickly to a hostile area? Tend to appear
during the night in a place you shouldn't be?
* Feel like you should be able to get the jump on people?
* Fancy abducting your friends and making them walk all the way back
home?
* Could benefit from being able to throw grenades in one place only to
have them explode in another place?
* Want to make a real big mess?
* Or do you just want to steal everything in sight?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, the Institute has the
versatile tool for you!

[u][b]The Who What When Where and Why[/b][/u]

Deep within an ice chest in a meat freezer, there is a cancer, known as
the Portal Gun...
With each shot, the Institute Portal Gun conjures up one of two
entangled mystical, magical portals!

One is blue. The other? Orange.

Use this gun to ascend to new heights, perform daring raids, and annoy
settlers in endless loops.
If you can figure out how to solve puzzles or perform testing with it in
this game, well, good for you.

Here's how it works:

Shoot one portal onto some object or surface, step close to it, and be
warped to the other portal.
Teleportation works between and within interiors, large exterior places,
and in the Commonwealth at large.

But be careful: watch where you warp!
And it's not just you who can be transferred to the other side...

Change portal colors by unequipping and reequipping the gun.

Here's where you can find it:

The Institute has wisely sequestered this awesome power in a place few
would think to look: its agents have secreted the gun and a special
holotape in Diamond City, in an ice machine which is itself in the Meat
Freezer atop Choice Chops!

Also from The Institute labs: Project Holdall, your holotape uplink to
convenient temporary remote storage of items in the Cloud (of radiation,
that is).

Equip the Portal Gun with the Loot Coprocessor to gain even more
irresponsible power: the power of taking everything in sight for later
retrieval at your convenience.

In a word: "Emergent" gameplay!

[u][b]Manual type stuff:[/b][/u]

[i]Installation[/i]

No special instructions, archive contains 1 ESP and 2 BA2s.
Prior to uninstalling, make sure you clear out the remote inventory.
Its world location is next to the icebox where you get the gun.

[i]Where is this thing specifically?[/i]

For more specific guidance, when you first enter the middle of Diamond City (not the Stands),on the right is the All Faiths Chapel, and next to it is the butcher stand (Choice Chops).  If you've got to the front door of the Dugout Inn you've gone too far. You want to get on the roof of Choice Chops to access its meat locker (one way is to not completely go up to the stands and walk along the edge of the stadium seating). In
the Meat Locker is the ice container with the portal gun.  This is a small room with hanging meat and frost, so it's pretty distinctive once
you are inside.

[i]How do I change portal colors?[/i]

If you unequip and then re-equip the portal gun ([b]through the menu only[/b]) the colors on the gun should change. When it's blue, you should be able to fire a blue portal. Do the same to switch back to orange. Sometimes when a save loads, the right color mod
might not be equipped; you should also be able to get back in proper phase by this same equipping and un-equipping.

A melee bash (Alt) will also do this: this is the preferred method since it minimizes out-of-color-change phase cosmetic issues.

As an easter egg, if you have a item in the world grabbed, then bash, if you release the grab it will throw the item out in front of you instead of just dropping.

[i]General Cautions[/i]

* If you use the remote storage, clear it out before you uninstall!
* Dying, getting stuck, breaking NPC behaviors when you displace things, losing things is (WC4:) The Price of Freedom. 

Some notes on buggy behavior and engine limitations:

[i]Fast Travel and Jump[/i] / "Falling" Animation

This glitchy behavior has been around for some time in the Havok enabled Gamebryo games...

From time to time, a warp which results in an incomplete fall animation
will stick the player temporarily with a falling state. If you want to
fast travel or jump, these are things you cannot do while the game
thinks you are falling; another telltale sign is that the character may
also amusingly hold their hands up when interacting. This problem can
more rarely happen in the vanilla game in any situation in which you
fall abruptly or are ragdolled severely. Usually this issue is solved
pretty handily with this mod by using the Portal Gun to precipitate one
or two more falls to clear the "floating walk" state. Sometimes menu or
area transitions or ground cover also resolves this issue.

[i]Controls[/i]

You switch portal types by equipping and reequipping the gun. This is
admittedly inconvenient: if there was a sensible way in native scripting
to capture melee attacks or capture other keystrokes this would have
been ideal. It may be more convenient for the moment to assign the gun
and another weapon to quick keys to accelerate this process.

I have looked into multiple ways of doing this. If you come up with something
particularly crafty, let me know. Otherwise, I plan to put a version of this out
for the Script Extender at some point, which should make this more convenient.

And yes, something like ammo-type switch (a player-initiated event tied to the gun,
but triggered before the weapon firing) would have been
quite nice! A way to capture a weapon bash event, as pointed out below,
would also work.  It turns out that swapping an object/weapon mod on a
gun requires an unequip-reequip cycle anyway. It's nice, for example,
that you can detect if the player is sneaking slightly after the portal
is opened, but this doesn't let you perform an action upon the player
sneaking. There are a handful of other approaches, with their own
issues. It would do good things for weapon mods not requiring script extenders
if Bethesda patched an alternate fire mode switching mechanism in at
some point.

[i]Assets: Nostalgia Deficiency![/i]

Now, to address the elephant in the room, if anyone does come up with a nice,
well-rigged, nicely textured mesh to approximate the original gun
from Portal, I would be happy to help realize a version of this mod
which uses the attractive and nostalgic assets. I don't have the expertise or the proper
tools for the time being to give you all the best run at this, so veteran weapon mesh artists, animators, and NIF configurers
may be interested in bringing the Portal gun and the authentic portal effects to life.

[b]Community Videos[/b]

A good feature overview comes from user "[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCW6yg9hSuAVZMeT_kMMFxwg]Total SideQuest[/url]"
[youtube]1W9tSrP9J-Y[/youtube]

And if you want visual guidance, there's this from [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCX86tbjTYYFne8z1XnbD2ug]EpicCRAZY WOLF[/url]:
[youtube]q23n4LjAVTc[/youtube]

Thanks to everyone who makes videos with these mods.

And, finally, hope you all have fun with this.

fileInfo.description: Settle anywhere, as many times as you want to
fileInfo.name: Fallout - 76 - C.A.M.P.

modInfo.author: Cancerous1
modInfo.description:
[b][size=6][i]Build your C.A.M.P. now! 
[/i][/size][/b]
Now you can carry placeable workbenches and throw them down and settle wherever you want to! take over any building and make it a player home, or stake your claim on a good spot outdoors with a view! -Nukes are not included-

This mod started when I was just "fixing" player homes that were missing the workshop quest for my crop growing mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14835]Fruitful Labor[/url]. When I saw the trailer for Fallout 76 I knew this had to happen.

Isnt this mod like XYZ... ? No -  this is totally unlimited, no cap on how many places you can settle. The only limit is that due to the mechanics of the game only one workshop will be active per location in game. You can settle indoors, outdoors, the middle of the Institute, the Railroad, Museum of Freedom, the Prydwyn, use your imagination! 

Does this mod include campfires, backpacks, coffee, quests, backrubs - NO - there's other mods for that.

You can craft them in the chem station under grenades, you place them in the world like mines, you can pick them up and move them if you want to correct placement or just dont like quite where you put it down (hold E)  And you can scrap extras if you accidentally place 2 in the same location. 

That's it, no more instruction is needed, no complicated systems or mechanics, just toss it out and you're good to go.

I never really thought about it before but I've had the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3528]build higher mod[/url] installed pretty much since Fallout 4 launched, I recommend using it with this.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3528]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3528[/url]

[center][youtube]pDZMc9rfJLY[/youtube]
( a video review from [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCB7Q7U-eIVX8PxM8-oj5gYA]DiscoGnome [/url]﻿)

[youtube]GAPbRn1xzds[/youtube]
Video from Westname

p.s. Send me some screenshots of cool places you settle in buildings or outdoors![/center]

fileInfo.description: Latest Version
fileInfo.name: Power Armor Distribution Overhaul

modInfo.author: darthbdaman
modInfo.description:
[size=5][b]Summary[/b][/size]

This mod attempts to vary the distribution of Power Armors throughout the game, as Bethesda has, once again, made one type of armor appear almost exclusively throughout the game, and it makes even less sense this time than it did in Fallout 3.

This adjusts the leveled lists for all types of BOS, Atom Cats, and Military Power armor, which previously only existed for T-60, to use all 4 types of power armor (T-45, T-51, T-60, & X-01). This means that every single member of the Brotherhood (except [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AjPau5QYtYs]Paladin Safety Danse if we want to[/url]) and Atom Cats can spawn with any type of level appropriate power armor (and [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AjPau5QYtYs]leave our friends behind[/url]) (except Raider).

Thanks to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11234/?]Consistent Power Armor Overhaul[/url] (which is [b][u]required[/u][/b]), we have gorgeous paints for the non-T-60 armors, that mesh in perfectly with the default paints, for both the BOS and Atom Cats.

I had to edit the T-45, T-51, and X-01 Power Armors in order to get them to apply the paints when added to the leveled lists. This means incompatibility with any other mods that edit the armor base forms. I have provided a patch for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7584/?]Impervious Power Armour[/url], as I personally use it. There aren't very many mods that conflict at the moment, so you should be pretty safe.

They should spawn with armor of the correct rank as well. Knight-Captains will have armor painted for the rank and so on. Due to some serious fucking stupidity and laziness by Bethsoft, the random leveled grunts will not use ranked armor, and will just use knight painted armor. This isn't currently fixable, but I will do my best to fix it once the GECK descends to us mere mortals. Named NPC's should all use correctly painted armor though, so there's that.

I have spent a good deal of time, trying to integrate this in the most compatible, and most seamless manner possible, I think I have gotten it working the best it can at the moment (due to the lack of GECK).

[size=5][b]Features[/b][/size]

[list]
[*]Randomized Power Armor for all major factions, no more T-60 exclusivity
[/list]
[size=5][b]Requirements & Compatibility[/b][/size]

[list]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11234/?]Consistent Power Armor Overhaul[/url] is awesome and [u]required[/u]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6876/?]Armour Categories Re-done[/url] has a patch
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7584/?]Impervious Power Armour[/url] has a patch
[/list]
[size=5][b]Recommended Mods[/b][/size]

[list]
[*]You might want to consider using [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11978/?]Brotherhood Power Armor Overhaul[/url] instead
[/list]
[size=5][b]Other Links[/b][/size]

If you would like to know what else I am working on, you can follow me on my [url=http://twitter.com/darthbdaman]Twitter[/url]. If you want to see more of my mods, you can view all of them on my [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/2734837/?]Nexus profile[/url].

If you would like to see more, you can subscribe to my [url=https://www.youtube.com/user/darthbdaman]YouTube[/url] channel, or follow me on [url=https://www.twitch.tv/darthbdaman]Twitch[/url], where I play a variety of games and showcase a variety of mods. If you really feel like supporting any of this other work, I have a [url=https://www.patreon.com/darthbdaman]Patreon[/url], though this is obviously not necessary.

If you want to discuss any of my work, or just want to hang out, you can join my [url=https://discord.gg/Q87yJRV]Discord[/url]. If you want to directly contact me, my email address is [url=mailto:darth@darthbdaman.com]darth@darthbdaman.com[/url].

Thank you for reading, enjoy!
modInfo.name: Power Armor Distribution Overhaul (Consistent Power Armor Overhaul)
modInfo.summary:
Revises how armor is distributed to the various factions throughout the Wasteland.

Adjusts the Brotherhood and Atom Cats to use leveled armors, from T-45 all the way to X-01. All armors have appropriate paints, and are seamlessly integrated, thanks to Consistent Power Armor Overhaul.

fileInfo.description: Install/Update as usual: Unpack and paste .esp in "~\Fallout 4\Data" directory.
fileInfo.name: Advanced AI Tweaks

modInfo.author: KeyC0de
modInfo.description:
[b]
[img]http://i64.tinypic.com/o7k9x4.jpg[/img]

Goal: Realism => greater difficulty + greater sense of achievement 

This mod applies many changes concerning how NPCs & creatures behave in the game on various circumstances.
Greatest focus placed upon combat handling and detection system. 

It is the result of a lot of tweaking, reading and testing in game. Also by having experience with some modifications i did back in the day for Fallout 3. 

The mod will make NPC behavior more lifelike. 


[img]http://i66.tinypic.com/35an412.jpg[/img]

[list]
[*][size=2]Generic AI detection tweaks [/size]
[*][size=2]Effect of lighting conditions is now much more important. It will be the most critical factor on detection chance [/size]
[*][size=2]Adjusted the impact that sound and noises have on detection [/size]
[*][size=2]NPC status (eg. just woke up, sitting etc) now affects its alertness [/size]
[*][size=2]Player sneak skills now pose a smaller coefficient on successful stealth. Environmental conditions (ie. lighting / darkness) are more important now [/size]
[*][size=2]Detection distance tweaked [/size]
[*][size=2]Changes in various timers, eg. how long enemies will look / be alert, or search for you (increased all the more) [/size]
[*][size=2]Stealth point system tweaks [/size]
[*][size=2]AI visibility fov slightly reduced, from 190 to 170. I believe it was way too much [/size]
[*][size=2]Patrolling / Sandboxing areas are expanded [/size]
[*][size=2]Adjusted some combat tactics, such as how often AI should throw grenades or advance their cover etc. [/size]
[/list]

[img]http://i64.tinypic.com/dyav61.jpg[/img]

Install with NMM / MO, 
or manually 
by extracting the downloadable archive contents and pasting the data folder into the main game folder: ~/Steam/Steamapps/Common/Fallout 4

[b]Works with, or without any of the DLC. [/b]

[b]Compatible with most mods, but make sure to load it as low in the load order as possible (loaded last / higher priority) to make sure all changes are applied. It is a very safe and stable modification. [/b]

This mod consists solely of game-setting changes. As such it can be installed, or uninstalled at any time without side effects. 


[img]http://i67.tinypic.com/2ef73vd.jpg[/img]

The following variables have been changed (presented in categories) vanilla -> mod

Detection formula variables:
[list]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakVisualBaseValue                                                                    -20   ->     -5[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakDistanceAttenuationExponent                                              2      ->     4[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
Visibility & Lighting factor contribution in Detection:
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fDetectionViewCone                                                                       190       ->    170[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fDetectionSneakLightMod                                                             15         ->    8[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakLightMult                                                                              0.33      ->    0.73[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakLightExteriorMult                                                                0.5        ->    1.0[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakLightRunMult                                                                       0.4        ->    0.8[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]iLightLevelInteriorMod                                                                   25         ->    10[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]iLightLevelExteriorMod                                                                  0           ->    4[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]iLightLevelMax                                                                                150       ->    200[/size][/b]
[/list][/b][size=2]
NPC condition modifiers:
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakAlertMod                                                                              0    -> 0.5[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakCombatMod                                                                        -0.4 -> -2          // NPC is less likely to detect/bother with you if he's already fighting)[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakSleepBonus                                                                         0    -> -0.2        // NPC takes some time after waking up to realize the enemy)[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
Player Skill factor in detection:
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakSkillMult                                                                                0.5        -> 0.25[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fPlayerDetectionSkillMult                                                              0.4        -> 0.3[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fPlayerDetectionSneakMult                                                           0.4        -> 0.8[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fPlayerDetectionSneakBase                                                          10         -> 5[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakPerceptionSkillMax                                                             90 // sight depth is determined by perception [/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
AI Distance factors: 
Basically detection can happen from greater distances 
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakMaxDistance                                                                      4096      ->  6144[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fDetectProjectileDistanceNPC                                                    256        ->  512[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fDetectProjectileDistancePlayer                                                 512        -> 1024[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fDetectEventDistanceNPC                                                            512        -> 1024[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fDetectEventDistancePlayer                                                        2048      ->  3072[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fDeadReactionDistance                                                                400        ->  1000[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
AI Search system: 
Much increased radius of AI in searching / be alert for enemies - Very needed
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchExteriorRadiusMax                                              3072 ->   4096[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchExteriorRadiusMin                                               1536 ->   2048[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchInteriorRadiusMax                                               1536 ->   2048[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchInteriorRadiusMin                                                768   ->   1280[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchLookTime                                                               1       ->   3[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchStartAttackLocationTimeLimit                          10     ->   20[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchStartKnownLocationTimeLimit                          30     ->   40[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatSearchInvestigateTime                                                   2.5    ->  10[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
Timers: 
Enemies will be alert, suspect and hunt you for a longer time
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatDetectionLostTimeLimit                                                    10        -> 40[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatDetectionKnownTimeLimit                                                10        -> 30[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatDetectionSuspectedAttackTimeLimit                             15        -> 30[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatDetectionSuspectedKnownTimeLimit                             5          -> 20[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatDetectionDialogueMinElapsedTime                                 1         -> 4[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatDetectionDialogueMaxElapsedTime                                3         -> 12[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fDetectionEventExpireTime                                                               2.5     -> 10[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
Stealth Point System & Detection: 
Mostly increasing duration of stealth related attributes. 
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatStealthPointRegenAlertDelayTime                                  10         -> 20[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatStealthPointRegenDetectedEventDelayTime                 12.5     -> 25[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatStealthPointRegenAttackedDelayTime                           20         -> 40[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatStealthPointRegenLostDelayTime                                   1           -> 4[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatStealthPointMax                                                                  100      -> 200[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatStealthPointKilledMaxValue                                              50        -> 75[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
Expanded sandboxing / patrolling (a floor's height is 288 [url=https://www.creationkit.com/index.php?title=Unit]game units[/url] - AI is able to wander around floors of a building - up to 4 from original floor):
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fSandboxCylinderBottom                                                             -100     -> -576[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSandboxCylinderTop                                                                    150       -> 576[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]You can increase that even more if you want, at the cost of more CPU usage. I don't think it would be of much use though. 

AI Combat Tactics: 
[b][size=2]AI becomes more energetic, but also tactical during combat[/size][/b]
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatCoverAdvanceChanceMin                                               0.1        -> 0.25      // cover system tweaks[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatCoverAdvanceChanceMid                                               0.5        -> 0.6[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatCoverAdvanceChanceMax                                              0.75      -> 0.9[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatCoverChangePositionChance                                         0.25      -> 0.35[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatRangedThrowDelay                                                           5           -> 7.5[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fCombatRangedGrenadeThrowDelay                                            7.5        -> 12.5      // can't spam grenades all the time[/size][/b]
[/list][size=2]
Audio conditions affecting detection (including gear weight etc):
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakActionMult                                            1                           // affects noise level of weapons, how much it affects detection [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakSoundsMult                                          1           -> 0.8      // audio is slightly less significant in sneaking except when running (see fSneakRunningMult) - eg. the player is careful not to make noise for trivial equip/unequip matters [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakEquippedWeightBase                          12        -> 6[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakEquippedWeightMult                           0.5      -> 0.25[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]fSneakRunningMult                                         2          -> 4          // running when in stealth conditions makes it easier for ai to hear you (the enemy to spot you), because you are making more noise [/size][/b]
[/list]
[b]Note: I've left a couple of variables unchanged (no arrow ->), as "still open for experimentation". [/b]
[b]

[img]http://i63.tinypic.com/2hnrp5f.jpg[/img]

[color=#ff7700]v1.1 [/color]Released! (12/1/2018) 

Features: 
Detection & sneak tweaks. Some bugs fixed. Numerous Combat Style changes make for [b]a more punishing AI [/b]. 

[list]
[*][b]fDetectionViewCone                                                                       170      ->   190      // revert to original value[/b]
[*][b]fCombatCoverAdvanceChanceMin                                              0.25     ->   0.2[/b]

[*][b]fCombatRangedGrenadeThrowDelay                                          12.5      ->   22.5[/b]
[*][b]iLightLevelExteriorMod                                                                  4           ->   -12       // the higher the harder to be detected [/b]
[*][b]iLightLevelInteriorMod                                                                   10         ->   -4       // same here [/b]
[*][b]fSneakActionMult                                                                           1            ->   3[/b]
[*][b]fCombatSearchLookTime                                                              3           ->   4[/b]
[*][b]fDeadReactionDistance                                                                 800       ->   1200[/b]
[*][b]fSneakSleepBonus                                                                         -0.2       ->   0        // revert to original value [/b]
[*][b]fCombatStealthPointMax                                                             200        ->   100    // revert to original value [/b]
[*][b]fCombatThreatViewCone                                                             120        ->   150[/b]
[*][b]fSneakExteriorDistanceMult                                                        1.25       ->   2[/b]
[*][b]fSneakDistanceAttenuationExponent                                        2             ->   4[/b]
[/list]

Note: When updating it's best to wait some in game hours and restart your current cell status (leave and come back again, or go to an interior location and wait some hours). 
[/b]

[img]http://i65.tinypic.com/2guhxyu.jpg[/img]

[b]A more realistic timescale (set timescale to 4 / 5 / 6) is mandatory (imo) [/b]
[b]Pick a better FOV 90-105 for 1st person, 75 for 3d person to be able to see and respond better to what's around you. [/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4472/?]True Storms[/url][b], [/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/191/?]Darker Nights[/url][b] and [/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8768/?]Interiors Enhanced - Darker Ambient Light and Fog[/url][b] establish a much needed immersive weather system and realistic lighting. [/b]

[b]In addition the following gameplay mods: [/b]
[list]
[*][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1770/?][size=2]Piles of Corpses - Increased De-spawn timer[/size][/url][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1371/?]Longer Area Respawn[/url] : must use those 2 along with a more realistic timescale mod [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6752/?]No Combat Boundaries[/url] : Very much recommended to accompany this one [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815/?]Better Locational Damage[/url] : Amazing combat overhaul [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27623/?]Global Damage Multiplier 3x for all Difficulties (or 2x) [/url]: For increased damage output and faster, more tactical and thoughtful battles - recommended [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27734/?]Fire, Grenades, Explosions Enhanced[/url] : and all the mods listed there in the recommendation section as well [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27662/?]No Sneak HUD Indicator[/url] : Remove sneaking messages for immersion [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2249/?]Worsin's Immersive Power Armor Garage (WIPAG)[/url] : Proper power armor gearing [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6209/?]Carry More with Power Armor[/url] : +200 for me[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9748/?]Centered Camera[/url] [/size][/b]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15408/?]Sync Kill Animations[/url] : Killmoves for all humanoid races [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/19191/?]Sneaky Kills[/url] enabled [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8442/?]Head Wound Decals[/url] : Bethesda was too focused on mutilation they forgot to add head wounds! [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14650/?]Survival Options[/url] : Tweak all survival settings [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.dropbox.com/sh/tusejr1eelsp1i8/AADoZJ0KCIQ3pJP2ti6X1la1a?dl=0]Fallout Loot Overhaul[/url] and the 2017 patches (https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23794/?) [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/26942/?tab=4&&navtag=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Ffallout4%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fmod_id%3D26942%26page%3D1%26sort%3DDESC%26pid%3D0%26thread_id%3D6010018&pUp=1]Food Mod[/url] : Food / aid doesn't heal [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23214/?]Less Sneaky Pip-Boy Radio[/url] : sneaking with radio enabled should be almost impossible now! [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27707/?]Stronger Robots, Synths & Turrets[/url] , [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13822/?]Deadly Deathclaws[/url] : make all robots, turrets & Deathclaws powerful as they should be. Deathclaws have "dragon" skin, robots are basically full plated impenetrable armor. They shouldn't die as easily as other NPCs & creatures. [/b][/size]
[/list]
[b]I found that after play-testing the mod for weeks i can't play the game anymore without my changes. I hope it makes your gameplay experience better too. In general, it will make the game harder, but it will also train you to become better. [/b][b]Gameplay won't feel as complete without some of the mods recommended above ([b]best you have them all though for the ultimate immersive gameplay possible). [/b][/b]

[b][b]
[img]http://i63.tinypic.com/ab3vck.jpg[/img][/b]

What i basically wanted to establish in the mod, is for me (the player) to not have to think each time how the game actors would respond to my actions. For example in real life you know that when you stand 30 meters away from someone at line of sight he will see you. In the game that's not the case. He may, or he may not, you must make guesses. 

IRL if you (were to) break into someone's house at night will you start lighting candles in order to see more clearly and navigate through the house? Will you start moving faster just to get on with your daily (/nightly) business? The game doesn't care very much about that. Same goes for absolute darkness - if you are spotted. 

My goal was to not have to think how the game would act in a specific scenario. For example when infiltrating a raider base / camp. I would just have to act how i would in real life, ie. be absolutely prepared and ready not to make any mistakes. Which means any noise, running, line of sight with enemy will make you spotted. You will have to be [/b][b][size=3]extra[/size] [/b][b]careful. If you are spotted, you will no longer become "unspotted" after a few seconds of searching by the enemies! The enemy AI will be [size=3][u]relentless[/u] [/size]especially on this. The enemy doesn't have schizophrenia. He knows what he saw, he knows what he heard. He saw you! It's a matter of life and death. The NPC's life depends on finding you and killing you! He won't stop searching for you for a long time and in longer distances! [A[b]bout 5 times more searching time actually and x1.5 greater distance radius (careful not to up this too much, as it can cause bugs). Game separates searching time in "look" time, as just looking or being suspicious, and in time after you have already been spotted (in which case searching time is much more than "look" time.] [/b]The slightest thing can trigger the ai! So do you understand? You don't have to think how the enemies / game ai would react, you act based on intuition (in other words by real life experience to put it semi-loosely). You simply act (more like) the way you would in real life. 
[b]
All these factors and much more (see technical section) can be adjusted by properly setting various formula coefficients that affect the gameplay. Bethesda set them loosely, because the average gamer doesn't notice and thus may not care about that sort of thing. This mod makes these coefficients more harsh by performing the delicate and intricate process of [u]optimization[/u]. 

As i said, the goal is realism. I believe the mod makes the game more realistic (by making it harder). 
[/b]But make sure you also have (at the very least) a greater damage mod in order for all of this to make sense. Even if you the perfect ai mod, what does it matter if the enemies can't kill you? No tactical skills and no challenge and no reward. 
[/b][b]
The process of optimizing these settings is ongoing (but currently on a stable and sufficient for me level). These tweaks may be improved in a future version, or even more game settings may be considered and come into play. They are, by no means, perfect. I just believe they are better than Vanilla. 
[/b]

[img]http://i67.tinypic.com/1585dz8.jpg[/img]

[b]Of course Bethesda for Fallout is always the first to give thanks for creating the game! [/b]

[b]Various fora, especially on Nexus & Bethesda helped me a great deal in assembling this information. [/b]
[b]Particularly the websites below: [/b]
[list]
[*][b][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74355/?]Skyrim Realistic AI Detection[/url] - Olivier Doorenbos's mod for Skyrim helped me greatly in assembling a lot of information about the game settings and get on with this process faster. He basically conducted a similar optimization procedure for Skyrim [/size][/b]
[*][size=2][b][url=http://geck.bethsoft.com/index.php?title=Category:Detection]Older GECK site[/url] with m[/b][b]any formulas and explanations [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b]Fallout 4 [url=http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Fallout_4_derived_statistics]wikia[/url] pages [/b][/size]
[*][size=2][b]The Creation Kit pages, particularly the Detection section (https://www.creationkit.com/index.php?title=Category:Detection)[/b] [b]which contains many formulas with explanations, as well as the [/b][/size][b][url=https://www.creationkit.com/index.php?title=Category:Settings]Game settings section[/url] which contains many game settings with explanation about their function [/b]
[/list][b]


[size=6][center][u][color=#ff00ff]Featured in the Hot Files! Thank You All![/color][/u][/center][/size][/b][img]http://i68.tinypic.com/24x12is.jpg[/img]

modInfo.description:
UPDATE: Now available for NMM.

A simple compilation of existing Pipe-Weapons retexture into moddable materials. It affects the weapon's performance, and spawns randomly in the wasteland. Think of it like Pipe-Weapons being able to be made from different materials. 

I apologize in advance, for the poor Spiked Sharpshooter's Grip retextures, i only recolored them, that is not my expertise.

Don't forget to endorse and comment.

Required Files:
 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7556?]Pipe Weapons Overhaul[/url]
 - Pipe Weapons Paint Resources (In this mod)

Useful Links:
 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/191/?]Darker Nights[/url]
 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6965/?]Pipe Reflex-Sights Fix[/url]
 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4809/?]Pipe Weapons Mag-In Sound Fix[/url]
 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5406/?]Legendary Modification Rebalance[/url]
 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4042/?]Craftable Legendary Mods[/url]
 - [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]How to install mods[/url]
 - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HZpIQ6P38xE]How to install mods manually demo[/url]
 - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rAKcAEn6hLg]How to install mods using NMM demo[/url]


My Weapon Overhauls:

> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7556]Pipe Weapons[/url] + [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8666]Materials[/url]  
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4227]Minigun[/url]  
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4711]Laser Musket[/url]

> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/40765]SMG[/url]

> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41231]Combat Weapons[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41269]Assault Rifle[/url]  
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41303]Lever Rifle[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41304]Radium Rifle[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41326]Handmade Rifle[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41315]Sidearms[/url]
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41297]Double-Barrel[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41420]Flamer[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41497]Fatman[/url]
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41344]All-In-One Merged Pack[/url]

DISCLAIMER | WARNING!
[quote] It will reinstall the Vanilla Pipe-Weapons texture as the "Rusted" version. It will not affect existing Pipe-Weapons automatically but will only affect newly-spawned Pipe Weapons. It is however easily fixed by applying the mods manually in the crafting bench.[/quote]MATERIALS:
 - [0] Rusted: -15% Weight, Reload Speed, Damage. +15% Recoil. - 0.40 Speed.
 - [1] Shadowed Rusted: -10% Weight, Reload Speed, Damage. +15% Recoil. Increased stealth in dark areas. - 0.40 Speed.
 - [2] Worn: No Penalty
 - [3] Shadowed Worn: +5% Weight. Increased stealth in dark areas
 - [4] Polished: +15% damage.
 - [5] Quality: +20% damage, +10% Weight.
 - [6] High-Quality, +25% damage, +15% Weight.
 - [7] Shadowed High-Quality, +25% damage, +20% Weight. Increased Stealth in dark areas.
 - [8] Aluminium: -65% Weight. +25% Recoil. -13% Sight Transition, +13% Aim-Stability, -25% AP Cost. 
 - [9] Alloyed: -40% Weight, +15% Recoil and Damage. -8% Sight Transition, +8% Aim-Stability, -15% AP Cost.

0.) Standard rusted materials, with stats supposedly weakening the weapon, living up to it's junky trashy nature.
1.) Shadowed rusted version is basically above, but with painted materials to increase stealth in dark areas. Useful for stealth-builds.
 - The first two are locked with Gun-Nut 1 as to not make the modification of weapons too easy without as much as even investing a single point in Gun-Nut.

2.) Basically standard, all the penalties lifted.
3.) Like above, but increased stealth in dark areas.
4.) Somewhat better-materials via cleaning resulting in more damage.
5.) Quality materials further increases damage at the cost of more weight, and potentially more AP consumption. It's good for Non-VATS builds.
6.) High-Quality is an end-game materials, further increases damage at the cost of weight.
7.) Same as above but with a bit more weight and increased Stealth in dark areas.
8.) Very light-weight materials resulting in less AP consumption and better handling traits, at the cost of increased recoil.
9.) Cross-road between High-Quality and Aluminium, Alloyed materials give a bit nice handling traits yet give good damage bonus.

Credits:
 - AlexSlesh - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3181/?]More Realistic Handmade Pipe Weapons[/url]
 - Johnsack2001 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/748/?]Darker pipe weapons[/url]
 - Billyro - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8141/?]Better Reflective Pipe Weapons[/url] 
 - Acacyn - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/742/?]Darker Pipe Rifle - Pistol - Revolver[/url]
 - murdalizer - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/822/?]Brown to Gray Pipe Weapons[/url] 
 - TrickyVein - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10484/?]Crossbows of the Commonwealth

Modding Notes:
 - The actual textures and materials are separated at "PWO ..." so to not conflict with vanilla textures. It is also able to be retextured by simply replacing the files.
 - Also works with Syringer, except it's Long-Barrel, but currently is not implemented.

Future Plans:

I know what you're thinking, it would be more realistic if one can pick different materials for other slots like the Receivers, magazines, Stocks/Grip, Barrel, Scope etc.

While yes, maybe in the future, but right now i am dreadfully uninterested.

modInfo.author: xatmos
modInfo.description:
[size=2]Next Version
 - Option to auto loot food and drink items.
 - Option for keeping highlights more persistent.
 - Experimental pulsing highlights.
 - System for simple compatibility patches.
 - Detect mines and some types of traps.

Version 3800 - 6/7/2018
 - Autoloot should properly trigger OnActivation events.
 - Improved mod startup/reboot time.

[b]DESCRIPTION[/b]
This mod will highlight corpses, ash/goo piles, unassigned settlers and objects, broken or unpowered objects, friendlies when scoped, creatures sleeping or unconscious, containers, terminals, collectibles, keys, holos, books, plants, doors, weapons, ammo, caps, chems, legendary items.. and even synth infiltrators.  This mod is highly configurable including settings for when and what to highlight, when to unhighlight, and the color of each highlight.

The mod activates once you take the Scrapper perk, or you manually start it via MCM or holotape.

[b]FOR XBOX ONE VERSION [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4059313]CLICK HERE[/url][/b]

[b]SETTLEMENTS & OWNERSHIP
[/b]The mod detects when you are in a settlement or an interior location that you own and disables container and item highlights automatically.  No reason to loot something that is already yours.  Out in the world, common loose items will not highlight if taking them would be stealing, but containers will still highlight so that you can examine their contents.

[b]COMPONENT TRACKING[/b]
In the vanilla game Scrapper rank 2 highlights objects (like junk) that contain components you tag.  You can tag components in the crafting interface and in the pipboy inventory.  This mod provides an alternative to this feature, so you can customize how junk is highlighted.  It also allows you to tag components from the MCM.  If you are not using F4SE customization of this feature is limited.

This feature will highlight objects in the world containing the components you select, and will also include those objects in inventory searches (highlighting corpses and containers).  The mod remembers encountered items and becomes more accurate and responsive over time.

[b]SEMI-AUTOMATIC LOOTING[/b]
Common sundries such as ammo, chems, caps, bobbypins, as well as tracked junk can be auto-looted.  Junk will be sent to your last visited workshop, while ammo etc. is given to the player when the pipboy is opened.  Non-legendary weapons can be auto-looted and converted immediately to caps.  Quest items are not autolooted and this feature will not take an item if it would count as stealing.  Also survival needs like meats and plants will not be autolooted.

Autolooting is only active while highlights are active.

Normally autoloot triggers on proximity.  But if an exploded corpse is strewn across the battlefield and you can't find the "center" of it just pick up a chunk of that supermutant or whatever it used to be and autoloot will trigger.

[b]DYNAMIC MOD WEAPON SUPPORT[/b]
New weapons and ammo added by mods can be highlighted and autolooted too.  The first time you equip a new weapon from a mod Loot Detector will ask you to confirm adding it to the detection list.  Default ammo for the weapon will automatically be discovered as well.  To teach Loot Detector about special ammo, drop a single round on the ground and let it be highlighted.

[b]SYNTH INFILTRATOR DETECTION[/b]
Normally when you aim at a friendly they will be highlighted in cyan, but if you have synth highlighting active (and the requisites) synth infiltrators will highlight in gray instead.  When you detect a synth in your settlement, keep your gun trained on them and approach, they will panic and attack (or surrender).  Thus they can be eliminated without turning your settlement against you.

[b]MANUAL OVERRIDE HOTKEY[/b]
You can map a key via MCM or other means to toggle all active effects.
Use this console command for manual mapping:
cqf xatmosScrapperQuest ToggleManualOverride

[b]EXTRA PERK REQUIREMENTS
[/b](these are disabled by default)

Some features can be gated behind perks as follows:
- Sleeping highlight requires Mister Sandman.
- Highlighting unassigned settlers and work objects requires Local Leader.
- Highlighting scrappable junk requires Scrapper rank 2.
- Highlighting doors requires VANS.
- Detecting friendlies requires Awareness.
- Detecting synth infiltrators requires Awareness AND Robotics Expert.
- Autolooting items requires Science! AND Scrounger OR Fortune Finder.

[b]UPGRADING & UNINSTALLING
[/b]Usually uninstalling or upgrading will not cause any problems.  But just to be extra safe, make multiple saves before upgrading or removing the mod.

To fully uninstall, verify that the following files and/or folders are removed:
Fallout 4\data\scripts\xatmosScrapper*.pex
Fallout 4\data\scripts\xatmos\xatmosScrapper*.pex
Fallout 4\data\MCM\Config\Loot Detector\*
Fallout 4\data\MCM\Config\xatmosLootDetector\*
Fallout 4\data\textures\effects\gradients\xatmosScrapper\*

[b]INSTALLATION[/b]
Users of the pre-CK version of this mod should first uninstall everything related to it.  Do not install any "patches" for this mod, they are all outdated.

NMM users should download the ESP version.  NMM does not properly support ESL files.  If you are new to modding and run into trouble give [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]this page[/url] a read through!

Don't forget to install the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16899]Brawl Bug Fix[/url]﻿ by ErshinPL to prevent certain scripted events from breaking.

The mod can take about a minute to boot up for the first time.

[b]CONFIGURATION WITHOUT MCM
[/b]Check your inventory for the Loot Detector holotape.  Below is a description of each option:

[Features]
Corpse Vision:  Highlight corpses and ashpiles with loot.
KO Vision:  Highlight unconscious (e.g drugged, knocked out, or powered down) actors.
Sandman Vision:  Highlight sleeping friends and foes.
Loot Vision:  Highlight keys, collectibles, and legendary items in the world (optionally more).
Dumpster Vision:  Highlight containers with loot.
Nerd Vision:  Highlight books, holotapes, and terminals.
Aiming IFF:  Highlight friendlies in ironsights or scoped.
Explorer Vision:  Highlight doors and door-like objects.
Taskmaster Vision:  Highlight unassigned settlers and objects, also settlers with quests.
Mechanist Vision:  Highlight broken and unpowered workshop objects.

[Advanced]
Common Sundries:  Include ammo, chems, etc in world and inventory scans.
Survival Needs:  Include food, drink, and flora in scans.
Weightless Trifles:  Highlight and/or loot 0-weight items with a cap value.
Legendary Tracker:  Show or hide the tracker quest objective.
Proximity Suppression:  Suppress highlights on actors when in close proximity.
Component Highlighting:  Include scrappable junk.
Disable Vanilla Component Radar:  Prevent vanilla Scrapper2 highlighting.
Extra Perk Requirements:  Require additional perks for some features.
Unhighlighting:  Determines behavior for corpses and containers.
VATS Override:  Set how VATS interacts with highlight conditions..
Auto Collect:  Toggle auto-looting common sundries and junk.
Caps4Guns:  Automatically convert plain weapons to caps.
Voigt-Kampff Protocol:  Determine how to handle synth infiltrators.
Corpse Context:  Condition for highlighting remains.
Sandman Context:  Condition for highlighting unconscious actors.
Loot Context:  Condition for highlighting items and containers.
Explorer Context:  Condition for highlighting doors and nerd stuff.
Workshop Context:  Condition for workshop highlights.

Currently there are more options that are only available in the MCM.

[b]COMPATIBILITY[/b]
- Load order does not matter at all (no vanilla forms are modified).
- F4SE and MCM are not required, but highly recommended.
- No DLC is required.  All DLC is supported.
- The Unofficial Patch is highly recommended.
- Mods that change the boundaries of settlements could cause problems.
- Some items from other mods may not be detected within inventories.
- If junk components are changed, tracking may not be accurate.
- Only vanilla components (adhesive, steel, etc.) are supported.

[b]KNOWN ISSUES[/b]
- Doors placed as static objects like rubble or fake walls may be highlighted.
- Flora that is not harvestable may be highlighted anyway.
- Shaders do not work on some transparent objects like glass beakers.
- Magnifying glass icon on tagged objects doesn't update until reload.
- The friendly highlight can get temporarily stuck if toggled rapidly.
- Shotgun ammo boxes highlight but do not trigger a proximity event.
[/size]

modInfo.summary: Adds a glow effect to lootable corpses, collectibles, etc. when you have the Scrapper perk.  Updated for 100% more enjoyment!

fileInfo.name: Workshop Framework

modInfo.author: kinggath
modInfo.description:
[size=3]TLDR: Workshop Framework attempts to open up the settlement system in a way that many mod authors can contribute (and not just coders either! There are tons of things even the greenest mod author can take advantage of). It has immediate benefits to players outlined in the [i]Player Focused Features [/i]list below.[/size]

If you use the [b]Unofficial Patch [/b]- be certain that [b]Workshop Framework comes AFTER it[/b] in your load order.

[b]Player Focused Features[/b]

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Faster and more stable Workshop scripts[/size]
[*][size=3]Settlement Import/Export system[/size]
[*][size=3]Automatically open/close doors in and out of Workshop mode[/size]
[*][size=3]Automatic Workshop Menu protection[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixes Pipboy Data screen issues[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixes the "Spectacle Island" problem[/size]
[*][size=3]No DLC requirements[/size]
[*][size=3]New Options via MCM/Holotape[/size]
[*][list]
[*][size=3]> Auto assign controls[/size]
[*][size=3]> Adjust max amount of food and defense settlers can operate[/size]
[*][size=3]> Adjust base robot happiness (eliminate the penalty if you like)[/size]
[*][size=3]> Make robots not count against your max population[/size]
[*][size=3]> and more![/size]
[/list]
[/list]

[size=4][b]Mod Author Focused Features[/b][/size]

[list]
[*]Rewritten Workshop Scripts - faster and more open
[*][b]Completely backwards compatible[/b]* - no property names or function signatures were altered
[*]Adjust any workshop value on the fly - [b]no more hard coded variables[/b]
[*][b]Simple API[/b] for advanced functionality for folks who can only code a little (ex. Dynamically place workshop items like Sim Settlements does with just a few lines of code)
[*][b]50+ new workshop values [/b]you can apply to workshop items to create new more interesting bonuses for players
[*][b]Add your own[/b] workshop values for production and consumption with just a single line of code
[*]High-capacity, easily expandable [b]threading system[/b]
[*]New [b]Container System[/b] to route production to more than just the Workshop Container
[*]Uninstall-safe [b]injection[/b] to change workshop production, settler pool, and more
[*][b]Automatic workshop menu protection[/b] means no more need for uninstall chems for workshop mods.
[*][b]Settlement Layout Import/Export system[/b] can be extended and code driven for powerful automated settlement building.
[*]UIManager system to offer simple access to complex UI interactions such as using barter menus for player option selection.
[*]Easy-to-use scripts for complex workshop items such as display racks, cluttered surfaces, and vendor inventory display.
[*]HUDFramework abstraction layer to handle automatic detection, throttling, and communication so you can include HUDFramework calls throughout your code without worrying if the player has it installed or not.
[*] ﻿﻿Including new easy-to-use Progress Meters system!
[*]Completely[b] open-source[/b] and community driven
[/list]
* Any other mods that altered workshop scripts will break this and are likely incompatible. The exception is the Unofficial Patch which should be placed before this in your load order so that the additional script changes made by Workshop Framework will overwrite the UFO4P versions. 

[size=4]New in 2020 - Settlement Layout System[/size]
[center][youtube]N3MGiari9xc[/youtube][/center]
[center][youtube]9OVzgFzjnRw[/youtube][/center]



[size=4]Overall Goal[/size]

The goal of Workshop Framework is to open up the settlement system so we can do more interesting things with it.

Adjusting most of the behavior of settlements requires adjusting the Workshop scripts - and as soon as you do that, you are incompatible with all other mods that want to edit that same script. Since the Settlements are controlled with just a few scripts - many things you may have thought would be simple, basically never got made into mods because people don't want to deal with the hassle of having edited vanilla scripts.

No more! Workshop Framework completely rewrites many of the base workshop scripts and introduces tons of hooks, new options, and eliminates most hard-coded variables so that tons of mod authors can release mods editing just the part of the settlement system they want to change.


[size=4]Easy-to-Use Advanced Systems[/size]

On top of opening up the scripts, I've added several advanced systems presented in a simple way, so that even people without a massive programming background can contribute new mods and functionality that add very powerful changes to settlements. For example, much of the code that makes the Sim Settlements City Plan's work is now a core system in Workshop Framework so that anyone with a little bit of coding experience can dynamically place large swathes of objects in a settlement on the fly!


[size=4]Design Philosophy[/size]

When designing this, it was important to me that the core gameplay functionality of settlements is completely unaltered by this framework. If you install this in your game, you should notice no difference other than the few bugs it fixes and an overall performance increase with settlement related activities. All gameplay options are left intact, and always will be.

That said, somethings will work wildly different behind the scenes in order to open new options for adjustment, so while players can safely install this without thinking about it, if you are a mod author - you are likely very concerned about what this is doing! So to alleviate your fears, I offer the following:

- I have not altered any vanilla property or function signatures. If you are currently expecting a function or property from the existing workshop scripts - it's still there, so your code will not break.

- I will never alter property names or function signatures of anything in Workshop Framework now that it is released. Any time I'm forced to adjust a function, I will leave the original version in tact and simply point it to the updated version. This way you can be confident your mods based on WSFW will continue to work from version to version.

- I will do everything in my power to keep this code bug-free, and am open to suggestions and improvements to the code base so that we can all have a flexible, powerful core to work from.


[size=4]Documentation[/size]

For complete documentation, head to the [url=https://github.com/kinggath/WorkshopFramework]Github repo[/url].


[size=4]Demo Mod[/size]

The optional file is a demo mod, not meant for widespread usage. It is designed to show the potential of certain parts of the code, and allow people who want to see these features expanded on and improved test them out quickly to help give me feedback and bug reports.

v1.0.0 - All friendly NPCs will have an alternate activation called Recruit. This will allow you to convert virtually any NPC to a settler and send them to one of your settlements. (This is made possible by a code overhaul in version 2.0.0 of Workshop Framework). Note that these NPCs will not work with Sim Settlements plots due to the way plots are coded currently (this will change in some future version of Sim Settlements).


[size=4]Open Source and Permissions
[/size]
While this is open-source, and anyone has permission to make use of pieces of code found inside of these scripts, please do not release new versions of the exact same named scripts, or release things based on the code that would interfere with what this mod is trying to achieve. The idea is that this framework will become a central staple we can all build on without compatibility issues.


[size=4]The Future[/size]

- Continue Improving the speed and stability of the Workshop scripts.
- Flesh out and expand the API.
- Add more hooks to allow doing other things the community dreams up (drop by the Github repo to join in the discussion or even get in on the development!).
- Add additional advanced systems that more mod authors can take advantage of to add extra functionality to their mods without the need for a programming background.


[size=4]Special Thanks[/size]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/106891?tab=user+files]1000101[/url] - For helping me develop the threading system and allowing me to use his thread locking code!
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/684492]Arthmoor[/url] and the rest of the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4598]Unofficial Patch team[/url] for allowing me to use their Workshop fixes!

Woodfuzzy, Krazyhorse, and Moonbeam for testing the crap out of this so I could feel comfortable releasing it...
modInfo.name: Workshop Framework
modInfo.summary:
Framework to open up the settlement system to editing by the community.

For Players: New controls and faster, more stable workshop scripts.

For Modders: Add new resource types, override settings, and generally change the way settlements work dynamically.
