fileInfo.name: Bullet Time - Slow Time - v1.3

modInfo.author: registrator2000
modInfo.description:
[center][size=5][i]Slow Time[/i]
[font=Tahoma]The first fully-featured bullet-time mod for Fallout 4![/font][/size][/center]

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Features:[/b][/size][/font]

[list]
[*][b]Hotkey activation[/b] - one button toggle for both on and off.
[*][b]Bullet-time, real-time.[/b] The toggle turns bullet time on and off immediately - no lag or delayed effects!
[*][b]Real-time AP drain[/b] while bullet time is active.
[*][b]Fully configurable.[/b] Set time-dilation factor, AP cost, and visual FX in-game.
[/list]
All aspects are configurable to suit your play style. Increase, decrease or turn AP drain off completely. Or change the time-dilation factor. Choose if you want a visual effect (like with Jet) or no overlay at all. All settings are configurable from within the game - no need to swap out plugins! Works with gamepads.

[center]---[/center]

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Why bullet-time?[/b][/size][/font]

Bullet time is a great alternative to VATS. While VATS takes control away from you and keeps you rooted in a spot, bullet-time lets you retain full control over your mobility and aim. And instead of blaming a miss in VATS on a set of chances on the screen, well.. [size=1]now you can blame your aim[/size]. Just look at what you can do!

[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/yfnm2F6ylsl68.gif[/img]

[img]http://i.giphy.com/lWHHzNJVxxNvi.gif[/img]

[img]http://i.giphy.com/byHGs5YbowqFa.gif[/img]

[img]http://i.giphy.com/AjMykxu4qEBmU.gif[/img][/center]

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Usage[/b][/size][/font]

When you go in-game, assign the Bullet Time object in your Aid Inventory to a hotkey of your choice. That hotkey will toggle bullet-time.
To configure Bullet Time, select the Bullet Time Configuration item to open the configuration menu.

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/font]

Use a mod manager, or, for a manual installation, copy the contents of the mod folder into your game's Data directory.
When you load your game, you'll receive two items - the Bullet Time toggle and Bullet Time Configuration. They will appear in the Aid menu of your Pip-Boy.

If you're having problems, ensure mods in general are enabled for your game! [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]Here's[/url] a guide.
In particular, ensure that you have "sResourceDataDirsFinal=" in your ini file and nothing else beyond the equals sign.

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Other Platforms[/b][/size][/font]

[url=https://mods.bethesda.net/#en/workshop/fallout4/mod-detail/1010239]Bullet Time for Xbox One[/url] (just uploaded!)

[center][font=Verdana][size=4][b]Video Review by Mudcups[/b][/size][/font][/center]
[center][youtube]2vaoJLGka-4[/youtube][/center]

[center][font=Verdana][size=4][b]More Video Reviews[/b][/size][/font][/center]
[center]Thanks to Vatiwah, Tyrannicon, Gopher and KottabosGames for featuring Bullet Time![/center]
[center]Alongside other great mods, Bullet Time is showcased at [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ge4OB8g0sIA&t=9m30s]9:30[/url], [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_2Lp5Qbin_g&t=4m7s]4:07[/url] and [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UuQZ1r1H8gA]0:00[/url] respectively.[/center]
[center]KottabosGames covers Bullet Time for the entirety of his video.[/center]
[center][youtube]ge4OB8g0sIA[/youtube][youtube]_2Lp5Qbin_g[/youtube][youtube]UuQZ1r1H8gA[/youtube][youtube]gVQ_-eLBdNc[/youtube][youtube]yu62vnMAbyM[/youtube][youtube]RAXEtgPpfuM[/youtube][youtube]bkPBxn9yUqA[/youtube][youtube]wNGaLcCODR8[/youtube][youtube]7rTPK2UcCAY[/youtube][/center]

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]A nod to other bullet-time mods:[/b][/size][/font]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7397/]Shaikujin's V.A.A.S. -Bullet Time mod-[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/983499/]shaikujin[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1577/]Bullet Time Mod (Alpha)[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/1208815/]hawkidoki[/url]

Shaikujin's V.A.A.S. mod has a slightly different take on bullet-time, adding a new VAAS perk. Do explore your choices!

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]Other mods by me:[/b][/size][/font]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9437/]Better Wait Menu and Wait Anywhere[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10029/]Companions Go Home[/url] - Send your companions to their original homes or to Home Plate.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10282/]Outfit Switcher[/url] - Save entire loadouts and swap between them via hotkey. It's like favorites, but entire loadouts at a time.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10317/]Visible Weapons - 3rd Person Holster[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10631/]Car Launcher[/url] - A for-fun mod that lets you shoot cars at your enemies.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10875/]Take Cover[/url] - New gameplay mechanic - 3rd person cover system! Take cover behind objects and automatically lean out to shoot when you aim down sights.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11664/]FO4 Hotkeys[/url] - Hotkey anything to any key, including equipment, items, and even console commands.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11784/]Companion Command and Tactics[/url] - Shout to your companion from wherever you are. Position them, switch up their equipment and be a lot more tactical in your fights.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13462/]Journal of the Sole Survivor[/url] - Gives you a personal journal that you can type in.

See all of my mods [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/searchresults/?src_order=1&quicksrc_auth=registrator2000]here[/url].

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]A word of thanks:[/b][/size][/font]

If you liked this mod, consider grabbing my first [s]mod[/s] app for Android! It's called [url=http://bit.ly/appsearchplus]App Search Plus[/url] and it lets you find and manage installed apps quickly by name - useful if you have a lot of apps installed. It's completely free. Leave a nice review if you find it useful! I do this because I enjoy it. Don't donate to me - if you really want to, make a donation to the Nexus for hosting this great community. Thanks for the overwhelming support! :)

[b]Atomic Radio is a Pre-War radio channel. Includes 5 hours of lore friendly commercials of Fallout Universe products, as well as PSAs, TV shows, movie trailers. See videos below for examples. Also, the quest mod Tales from the Commonwealth is on this page too. The mod Settlers of the Commonwealth is now available here as a download.  Go to [url=http://3dnpc.com ]3dnpc.com [/url]for details.


[/b][b][url=http://3dnpc.com][img]http://imgur.com/GvgjcI9.jpg[/img][/url]  [/b][b][url=http://twitter.com/3dnpc][img]http://i.imgur.com/VGhtxvp.jpg[/img][/url]  [url=http://patreon.com/3dnpc][img]http://i.imgur.com/YU1HT1v.jpg[/img][/url]  [url=http://youtube.com/3dnpc][img]http://imgur.com/fiLODCu.jpg[/img][/url]  [/b][b][url=https://discord.gg/7WG4Eyd][img]http://imgur.com/Y8VaX9Y.jpg[/img][/url][/b][b]
[/b]

[b][size=4]If you like Atomic Radio and Tales from the Commonwealth, try my little indie game, Out of Shapes, on Steam[/size]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1308240/Out_of_Shapes/][size=5]https://store.steampowered.com/app/1308240/Out_of_Shapes/[/size][/url][/b]

[youtube]pwyKMSVbi48[/youtube]
[center]***[/center]
[b]ACTORS, CELL MAKERS, AND MESH TEXTURE PEOPLE NEEDED
In addition to the radio - which is always expanding - I'm working on quest mods and NPCs, which I'll upload beta versions for here. If interested, please contact me at kristakahashi@gmail.com with a demo or an audition.
You can find [url=http://3dnpc.com]all pertinent info on the site blog.
[/url][/b]

[center]***[/center]
[b]ON BUG REPORTS AND COMMENTS[/b]
In all honesty, I don't have time to manage this site. I will check it periodically at best.
[b][url=http://3dnpc.com]However, if you leave bug reports on the blog, I will answer within 24 hours guaranteed, as I get an email[/url]. [/b]
It helps me manage both Interesting NPCs and the FO3/FNV/FO4 mods in one place.

fileInfo.name: PrivateProfileRedirector F4 0.5.2

modInfo.author: Kerber
modInfo.description:
[center][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/92725]Skyrim LE[/url]﻿ | [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/18860/]Skyrim SE[/url]﻿ | [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33947]Fallout 4[/url]﻿[/center]
[b]Problem[/b]
The problem this plugin tries to solve comes from the fact that the game uses an old, deprecated and extremely inefficient function to load values from INI files. The function in question is ﻿[code]GetPrivateProfileString[/code], a relic of 16 bit operating systems. But do you know what is worse than using such a function? Using it hundreds of thousands of times.Apparently the game uses that function for every game setting individually, which means that the same ini file is opened and closed hundreds of times. What really makes this terrible is the fact that for each enabled plugin the game will attempt to read all the same settings from a hypothetical INI file that that plugin might or might not be loading. So you end up with an insane amount of incredibly inefficient calls for each enabled mod plugin. As a solution this mod will hook the functions involved and load the target INI files in memory so that each following call to the same INI file will be much faster as it will read directly from memory and will not require opening the file from scratch again.

The amount of seconds that this mod will reduce your start time by depends on the amount of enabled plugins you have, as well as other things using INI files such as ENB (though ENB comes with it's own loading issues that this mod can't fix). It will be basically imperceptible when used on the vanilla game and will go up from there, shaving off 6 seconds for 50 or so plugins, up to 20+ seconds for 250+ plugins.

[b]Solution[/b]
When the game, ENB or something else calls [code]GetPrivateProfileString[/code] first time this plugin will load requested file in memory and return required data. Next time, no file will be loaded and data will be fetched from memory as well. Same thing happens when process tries to write a value to file. Instead of opening file again, parse and save to disk the plugin will write data it to in-memory file and then saves to disk (if allowed). Also all files is saved on game close, if game won't crash in process.

Plugin source is available on [url=https://github.com/KerberX/PrivateProfileRedirector]GitHub[/url].

[s]Some problems such as infinite loading screen and weird camera FOV were reported. You have been warned.[/s] Should have been fixed in version 0.3.1.

[b]Requirements[/b]
F4SE, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33946]xSE PluginPreloader F4[/url].

[b]Installation[/b]
It's an F4SE plugin, so install like any other F4SE plugin. Extract archive in your game folder or use mod manager.

[b]Uninstallation[/b]
Use mod manager or remove all installed files.

[b]Covered functions[/b][code]
GetPrivateProfileStringA
GetPrivateProfileStringW
WritePrivateProfileStringA
WritePrivateProfileStringW
GetPrivateProfileIntA
GetPrivateProfileIntW
GetPrivateProfileSectionNamesA
GetPrivateProfileSectionNamesW
GetPrivateProfileSectionA
GetPrivateProfileSectionW
[/code]

[b]Configuration[/b]
Plugin can be configures in its own INI file ([code]PrivateProfileRedirector.ini[/code]), each parameter is described inside this file.
[spoiler]
[i][General][/i]
Enables logging for debugging purposes, will increase startup time if enabled. 
Log file will be created in "Data\<Script extender folder (SKSE, F4SE, etc)>\Plugins\PrivateProfileRedirector.log".
Disabled by default.
[b]EnableLog=0[/b]

Allows initialization of Script Extender function even when runtime SE version
does not match SE version for which this plugin was compiled (not recommended).
Enable this option only in case new game and/or Script Extender version is already released,
but this plugin has not updated yet.
Disabled by default.
[b]AllowSEVersionMismatch=0[/b]

Suppresses all write operations if enabled.
When enabled options 'SaveOnWrite', 'SaveOnThreadDetach' and 'NativeWrite' will not be automatically disabled,
and plugin will log all write attempts, but no changes will be written to disk.
Disabled by default.
[b]WriteProtected=0[/b]

Enables use of native 'WritePrivateProfileString' function to write files.
Use this, if you experience write issues, like some files being written incorrectly.
When this enabled 'SaveOnWrite' and 'SaveOnThreadDetach' automatically disabled.
Disabled by default.
[b]NativeWrite=0[/b]

Saves cached files to disk each time they are written to. Slightly slower performance if enabled.
With this enabled the ini files are sure to be saved even in case the game crashes for some reason.
Enabled by default.
[b]SaveOnWrite=1[/b]

When 'SaveOnWrite' is enabled, this option sets maximum number of changes per file before they will be saved to disk.
For example, 'SaveOnWriteBuffer' is set to '3'. The game made two changes, they are saved in memory but not yet
saved to disk. The game changes another option and now this INI file will be saved to disk with all three changes.
Counter resets for this file and after another 3 changes it'll be saved again.
Disabled by default (0). Possible values: [2, 2000]. If the value is outside of this range the option is considered disabled.
[b]SaveOnWriteBuffer=0[/b]

Saves all cached files to disk each time a game thread exits.
With this enabled the ini files will be saved periodically and will probably be saved in case the game crashes for some reason.
Disabled by default.
[b]SaveOnThreadDetach=0[/b]

Saves all cached files to disk on DLL unload (usually on this happens when the game exits).
Enabled by default.
[b]SaveOnProcessDetach=1[/b]

Saves all cached files to disk before saving the game.
Enabled by default.
[b]SaveOnGameSave=1
[/b]
Enables support for inline comments for values.
If enabled these comments will not be preserved, but value will be correctly read.
Otherwise comments will be read as part of value.
Enabled by default.

[Section]
Key1=0x11 #comment1
Key2=0x1E ;comment2
[b]ProcessInlineComments=1[/b]

Set code-page to convert non-ASCII characters.
Set to CP_UTF8 to use v0.1.x behavior (not recommended).
If you're on Japanese Windows version you might need to use CP_UTF8.
See full list here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/intl/code-page-identifiers
CP_ACP by default.

CP_ACP                    0           Default to ANSI code page
CP_OEMCP                  1           Default to OEM code page
CP_MACCP                  2           Default to MAC code page
CP_THREAD_ACP        3           Current thread's ANSI code page
CP_SYMBOL                 42          SYMBOL translations
CP_UTF7                    65000       UTF-7 translation
CP_UTF8                    65001       UTF-8 translation
[b]ANSICodePage=0[/b]
[/spoiler]

[b]Q&A[/b]
[b]Q:[/b] Do I really need this?
[b]A:[/b] It depends. If your game starts from shortcut to main menu in split second then no. If it takes longer, this plugin can help. How much time you will save depends on your setup.

[b]Q:[/b] Will this work with MO/NMM/Vortex/Kortex (yeah, I had to mention it) or any other mod manager?
[b]A:[/b] It was tested with MO2, Vortex and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/90868]Kortex[/url] and no problems was found. NMM have not been tested yet but are expected to work just fine. I can't say anything about compatibility with other mod managers.

[b]Q:[/b] I've installed it and game crashes at startup (or you have any other problem).
[b]A:[/b] Enable log in config file and reproduce your crash. Go to [code]Data\F4SE\Plugins[/code], look for file [code]PrivateProfileRedirector.log[/code], zip it, upload it somewhere and post a link to it in your issue report. Log file can be more that 100 MB, so don't upload it as is, be sure to compress it.

[b]Q:[/b] There is new version of Fallout 4 and/or F4SE, can I use this version with new game/F4SE version?
[b]A:[/b] Redirector itself doesn't need Script Extender to function. The only thing that depends on F4SE is overriding of "RefreshINI" console command to reload files from disk to update cached INI files. If you load Redirector without F4SE or with newer or older version of F4SE the Redirector will not override "RefreshINI" but still will function as usual. So [b]you can use this plugin with any game and F4SE version[/b].

If you absolutely need "RefreshINI" command to work with this plugin and I haven't had time to update it, you can disable Script Extender version check in [code]PrivateProfileRedirector.ini[/code] file. Open it, find option [code]AllowSEVersionMismatch[/code] and change its value to [code]1[/code].

Thanks to everyone who helped test the plugin, especially AL12 and Augh.
modInfo.name: PrivateProfileRedirector F4 - Faster game start (INI file cacher)
modInfo.summary: Speeds up game start by storing INI files in memory instead of opening, parsing and closing the file each time some value from it is needed.

fileInfo.description: Disables Auto Aim.
fileInfo.name: Disable Auto Aim F4

modInfo.author: g10stpd
modInfo.description:
This is a small mod to disable the auto aim in Fallout 4.

Disable Auto Aim focus on 3 variables for increased accuracy:
fAutoAimMaxDegrees 0.1  <-- Increases straightness of projectile
fAutoAimMaxDegrees3rdPerson 0.1  <-- Increases straightness of projectile
fAutoAimMaxDistance 64000  <-- Should prevent projectiles from raising (old engine issue, assume it's still there)
fAutoAimScreenPercentage -1  <-- 0 would also disable, but I believe causes issues. Maybe can't divide by 0? Who knows..

[s][b]Old version (Improved Auto Aim):[/b]
I have increased fAutoAimMaxDistance from 4000 to 6400. According to GECK, 64 units is 1 yard. If this holds for F4, then auto aim should cut off after 100 yards. This is to go along with a typical rifle being sighted in at 100 yards.

I have also decreased fAutoAimScreenPercentage from 6 to 1. This means you need to aim closer. Setting it to 0 is supposed to disable auto aim, but it has been said that 0 caused issues in F3 and NV. [/s]
modInfo.name: Disable Auto Aim Fallout 4
modInfo.summary: Disables the auto aim in Fallout 4.

fileInfo.name: Faster Workshop 1.1

modInfo.author: reg2k
modInfo.description:
[size=6][color=#f1c232]Faster Workshop[/color][/size]

Faster Workshop is an F4SE plugin that optimizes workshop loading times by replacing some of the most expensive and inefficient regions of workshop loading code with far more efficient versions.

On top of this, it also does two more things:
[list]
[*]Provides a hotkey to instantly enter Workshop mode.
[*]Fixes the issue with workshop icons not loading when navigating through them quickly.
[/list]
Testers with a current workshop load time of ~15s (from activating a Workshop to having the build menu appear) report a drop in load time to less than half a second. Those with a lower starting load time report near-instantaneous Workshop loads with the plugin installed.

[size=5][color=#f1c232]About[/color][/size]

As you acquire more mods that add content to your game, you may have noticed the game freezing up (video freezes and you cannot move) for increasingly longer periods of time when you attempt to start Workshop mode. Even when these mods have nothing to do with the Workshop!

[b][size=3][i]What's going on?[/i][/size][/b]

[spoiler]It boils down to the game using some incredibly inefficient code to figure out what objects you can build in workshop mode. Whenever you start Workshop mode, the game evaluates the conditions on [b]every single constructible object in the game[/b] to find out if they belong in the workshop - this includes even non-workshop items like weapon mods and chems. And it does that not just once (!), but repeats this loop for [b]each and every workshop submenu you have[/b]!

If you install a mod that adds two new submenus to your workshop, one would reasonably expect to incur just a small overhead of a couple of additional checks. Instead, in reality, this causes two more loops through every single craftable object in the game.

As you install more mods that add any kind of craftable object to the game, entering the workshop will inevitably and perhaps noticeably slow down, even if these objects have nothing to do with the workshop.

And to make it all worse, every time you exit the workshop, the game tears down all this data it worked so hard to build and starts over![/spoiler]

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Do I need this mod?[/color][/size]

When you start workshop mode, is there any noticeable delay before the build menu appears? If so, this mod can help.

If you do not currently experience any lag when starting Workshop mode, congratulations! You have a beefy-enough rig, or do not have many (workshop) mods installed. But do keep this mod in mind in case you need it in the future. The rate of load time increase is [b]not linear[/b] in the number of mods you have installed - it is far worse, so you may see load times shoot up quickly if you install certain kinds of mods. (see About section for more detailed information)

[size=5][color=#f1c232]How it works (technical)[/color][/size]

[spoiler]This F4SE plugin rewrites code that handles workshop object loading. On the first workshop load of the game session, the plugin goes through the constructible objects once and maps keywords to their constructible objects. Now, instead of looping through the entire COBJ list every time a mapping of COBJ to KWYD is needed, it is a constant-time operation to look up this information from the prebuilt map. Conditions will now only be evaluated on COBJs that belong in the workshop category, instead of all loaded COBJs.[/spoiler]

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Installation[/color][/size]

Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder.
Make sure that you start the game with the F4SE loader, otherwise F4SE will not be active.

This is an in-memory code patch. It does not attach any scripts to objects or your save and is safe to install or remove at any time.

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Requirements[/color][/size]

Fallout 4 game version 1.10.50 or higher.
[url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url], 0.6.4 or higher.
The [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497/]Mod Configuration Menu[/url], if you want to assign a hotkey for starting Workshop mode. Not necessary otherwise.

[size=5][color=#f1c232]Acknowledgements[/color][/size]

Many thanks to the xSE team, for F4SE.
modInfo.name: Faster Workshop (Workshop Lag Fix)

Also provides a hotkey to instantly enter Workshop mode and fixes workshop icon load lag.

fileInfo.description: All (okay, most) robots drop appropriate robot parts. Requires Automatron.
fileInfo.name: Salvage Robot Parts

modInfo.author: Norr
modInfo.description:
Fun fact #1: Only basic robot parts, if any, can be looted from the robots in the game.
Fun fact #2: Automatron includes a leveled list for vendors who sell robot parts.
Fun fact #3: No vendor in the game uses this leveled list, therefore no vendor sells any robot parts. At all.

What this means for players is if you want to build a cool robot, you HAVE to invest in crafting skills, some of which has steep requirements.
What this means for a player going through the game with no crafting skills at all (and therefore needs to 1: scavenge weapon and armor mods or 2: spend caps at vendors to get decent guns and armor) can't build any cool robots. At all.

Ball bearings to that.


- Vanilla robots now drop appropriate robot parts (limbs, weapons, armor).
- Mechanist robots now drop a large selection of parts, with a slight bias towards ranged weapons. May also drop hydraulic or voltaic frames.
- Regular Robobrains now have their own leveled list, but robobrains with prefixes (integrated etc) will drop the same variety of parts as other mechanist robots, but with a bias towards robobrain parts.
- Rust Devil robots now drop a large selection of parts, with a slight bias towards melee weapons. May also drop appropriate armor (warmonger, serrated etc).
- One merchant may now sell robot parts. The merchant will become available upon completing the Automatron 'good' ending.

Specific drop chances are available in the ReadMe.


Compatability:
Anything that changes death item leveled lists for vanilla robots will create a conflict.
Anything that changes Automatron exclusive robot NPCs or death item leveled lists will create a conflict.
modInfo.name: Salvage robot parts
modInfo.summary: Robots now has a chance to drop appropriate robot parts. For people who likes to scavenge for their robot parts instead of building from scratch.

So this mod well pretty much allow you to wear those 5 extra piece of armor on anything that usually takes all the slots, like the clean dirty suits, they take each body slot but with this mod that wont be happening anymore. 

There will be major clipping with all the armor parts due to the fact they weren't made to be wearable on clothes and armor like this. but the more body slots the better.

Some clothes and armor were made playable, like all the npcs in the beginning of the game.

You can either install this with Nexus Mod Manager  or the one i like to use Fallout 4 Mod Manager. orrrrrrrrrrrrr manual. Place esp in data folder and edit Plugin.txt  put More Armor Slots.esp on the list and saved it as read only. Plugin.txt should be in C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\Fallout4

Fallout 4 Mod Manager:

http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/495/?

I this mod was mad in TesVsnip and then updated with Fo4edit

modInfo.author: The6thMessenger
modInfo.description:
[center][b][color=#ff7700][/color][quote][color=#ff7700]UPDATE B10.0[/color]
[size=4]A massive update. Now uses Perk-Injector. Uninstall your previous patches for Minigun, and Gauss.[/size][/quote][/b][/center][center][b][color=#ff0000][size=6]Known Bugs:[/size][/color][/b][/center][quote][color=#ffffff] - Upon first-time installation, any existing Pipe-Weapons will be broken, as the two receivers are re-categorized, leaving no "Receivers" slot to the weapons, except those that were ammo-conversions, and thus removing them upon installation. And because of that, the weapons will be invisible. It's best installed upon a beginning of a new game, or can be simply fixed by modding the pipe weapons once again, individually. This does not affect the new weapons being introduced.

 - At some point in the game, some attachment slots will disappear. Rest assured it is still there, all you have to do is equip the weapon you intend to modify, and then the missing slots would show up.
[/color][/quote]
[center][youtube]z8oDVoRc_iM[/youtube][youtube]Nhyy7oWZuL4[/youtube][/center]
PREFACE:

[quote]If you find the .38 Round already too weak, try the .44 Round instead, or even the 5.56mm Round and make an assault rifle. Maybe you'd find the shredding Rapid Powerful 5mm Pipe PDW, or the steady chug of the Advanced-Auto .44/.308/.30-06 Pipe-HMG to be quite attractive. Do you intend to hybridize? Attach an Axe Stock or Spiked Grip, play it like a combination melee and ranged weapon. Do you fancy a Strength Build? The Heavy Barrel turns pipe-weapons into a Heavy-Gun!

If you liked this mod, please endorse, and check out my other mods. ^_^

Be sure to check out the links below first if you're interested in optimizing the Pipe Weapons as a whole, or simply do not know how to properly install a mod yet.[/quote]
CREDITS:

My Weapon Overhauls:

> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7556]Pipe Weapons[/url] + [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8666]Materials[/url]

> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41297]Double-Barrel[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41420]Flamer[/url] 
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41497]Fatman[/url]
> [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41344]All-In-One Merged Pack[/url]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 - [url=https://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]How to install mods[/url]
 - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HZpIQ6P38xE]How to install mods manually demo[/url]
 - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rAKcAEn6hLg]How to install mods using NMM demo[/url]

Main Changes:

1.) [b][u]Receiver Rechambering[/u][/b], extra rounds integrated, and Internal Modifications:

 - .38 Pipe-Gun: 13 
 - .38 Pipe-Revolver: 19 
 - 5.56mm Pipe-Bolt-Action: 33

 - 10mm Pipe-Gun: 17
 - 10mm Pipe-Revolver: 26
 - 5mm Pipe-Gun: 10
 - 5mm Pipe-Bolt-Action: 18
 - .45 Pipe-Gun: 23
 - .45 Pipe-Revolver: 34
 - .44 Pipe-Gun: 37
 - .44 Pipe-Revolver: 42
 - .44 Pipe-Bolt-Action: 54
 - 5.56mm Pipe-Gun: 26
 - .308 Pipe-Gun: 32
 - .308 Pipe-Revolver: 36
 - .308 Pipe-Bolt-Action: 40
 - Pipe-Revolver Shotgun: 65
 - Pipe-Bolt-Action Shotgun: 95
 - .30-06 Pipe-Gun: 37
 - .30-06 Pipe Bolt-Action: 45
 - .50-Auto Pipe-Gun: 45
 - .500-Magnum Pipe-Revolver: 72
 - .50-Cal Pipe-Bolt-Action: 84

2.) [u][b]Fleshed out the Receivers into Internal Modifications[/b][/u], 

 > Damage Mods add 15% of damage per level.
 > Calibration Mods increases critical damage and improves accuracy, but also increases AP Cost.
 > Frame Mods offers damage trading with weight and AP cost.
 > Trigger Mods allow Pipe-Weapons to function differently:

 - Automatic Trigger fire in Full-Auto, has -22.22% range and damage, and -10% recoil. It shoots in 3-round bursts in VATs.
 - Rapid Automatic Trigger fire in Full-Auto with 40% ROF Bonus, has -33.33% range and damage, and -15% recoil. Shoots in an extended 6-round bursts with VATs.
 - Retarded Automatic Trigger fire in Repeated Single-Shot, -11.11% range and damage, and -15% recoil. Will only have single-shot in vats. Benefits from Rifleman/Gunslinger instead.
 - Tuned Bolt is for Bolt-Action, It adds Reload-Speed and increases ROF.
 - Double-Action for Revolver, removes the need of pulling the hammer back every time.
 - Hair Trigger is simply an improved Standard Trigger, it has faster rate of fire but reduced range.
 - Broken Trigger turns the Pipe-Gun into bolt-action, increasing damage by 15%

Damage Hierarchy:

 - Non-Tuned Bolt Action
 - Tuned Bolt-Action
 - Broken Pipe-Gun
 - Single-Action Revolver
 - Double-Action Revolver
 - Semi-Auto and Hair Trigger Pipe-Gun
 - Retarded Auto Pipe-Gun
 - Automatic Pipe-Gun
 - Rapid-Automatic Pipe-Gun

> Ammo Mods
 - Match Rounds provide +15% damage and range, but will have +35% recoil. 
 - Radium Rounds provide -25% damage, but has flat +35 Radiation Damage.
- Incendiary Rounds provides 21 Energy Damage over 6s, but with -15% DMG.
- Armor-Piercing Rounds provide 35% Penetration, but with -15% DMG.
- AP-Incendiary provide 50% Penetration with 21 Energy Damage over 6s, with -45% DMG.

 > The Shotgun Receiver uses a different Ammunition Mod lineup,. Buckshot is standard, but Armor-Piercing round takes form of a single slug and uses Pistol Barrel. There's also explosive slug with slower projectile speed but deals AOE damage, and Incendiary that bathes an area with a cloud of fire. 

3.) Added and Changed Things

 - Certain NPCs are tougher, such as Diamond Security, and Lucy Abernathy.
 - Did you ever notice how the glow of the Glow-Sights seems to tarnish? Yeah, i fixed that. It no longer weakens anymore.
 - Added Large Suppressors and rebalanced Suppressors.
 - Rebalanced Recoil of Pipe Weapon Attachments
 - Separated Bayonets from the Muzzle, simplifying the combination. Now Added underbarrel slot, with the Bayonets and flashlight.
 - Long-Barrels to "Carbine Barrels", and new Long Barrels with more range. Recalibrated Barrels' bonuses, with lesser AP penalties and redistributed recoil and ADS spread. Finned series has the least Hip-Fire spread penalty of the length.
 - Added Large Drum Magazine for the Pipe-Gun, sporting 120 capacity, and even lesser handling qualities.
 - Added Small Magazines for the Pipe Gun, sporting only 10 Capacity, but improved handling traits.
 - Added "Night Recon" Scope series, Combined Recon + Night Vision.
 - Added “Heavy” barrels: provides the most accuracy, range, and recoil-reduction in their Length. Generally has increased damage, and lowered accuracy penalty while firing. It also requires Blacksmith 1 perk to craft. And turns the weapon into a Heavy-Gun that uses Heavy-Gunner perk.
 - These (new) Long Barrels, and the Heavy Long and Heavy Carbine Barrel, along with the Large Suppressor will be treated as Rifles; holds the gun with 2 hands and benefits from rifle-perks.
 - Added new sights, and rebalanced gunsights. Combat sights have the most zoom, Gunner sight has no reticle but is nimble.
 - Added Deathclaw Bayonet, credits to henkspamadres
 - Added separate Leveled-Items.
 - Tweaked "Short Recon Scope”, has only x2 Magnification
 - Added new "Medium Recon Scope", has x6 Magnification.
 - Long-Scopes adds 15% recoil, Medium Scopes add 10% recoil, while Short-Scopes add 5% recoil.
 - Added [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Choke_(firearms)]Chokes[/url] for Shotgun, these only shows up when the Shotgun Receiver is attached. Chokes are tapering of the barrel by the muzzle, that which tightens the spread.
 - Choke, Half Choke, and Full Choke tightens spread, and improves range by 10/20/30% at the cost of more recoil.
 - Rebalanced Incendiary Legendary to do 28 damage over 6s, that stacks.
 - Fixed Drum-Mag Brackets. If you don't know, originally, it moves with the magazine, and now it doesn't.
 - Added Spiked Sharpshooter's Grip and Axe Stock, requiring Gun-Nut 2, and Blacksmith 1. Deals heavy bash damage, but does not stack with Bayonets.

4.) Renaming:

Simplified the Naming system, that attachments that alter Weapon Type will no longer be mentioned -- such as Drum-Magazines needed for LMG/MMG, or Scopes needed for a Sniper Rifle, etc. likewise only relevant mods will be mentioned.  Caliber will be mentioned between the Weapon Type and Mods.
-------------------------

Weapon Types:

 - "Pipe Anti-Materiel" is with the .50 Receiver and Rifle Stock, and will override most suffixes. It will not mention the caliber.
 - "Pipe Express Pistol" is with the .50 Receiver and Pistol Grip, and will override most suffixes. It will not mention the caliber.
 - "Pipe <Bolt-Action/Revolver>  Shotgun" is with the Shotgun Receiver, and will override most suffixes.
 - "Pipe HMG" is with Rifle Stock + Long Heavy Barrel + Automatic + Large Drum Magazine.
 - "Pipe MMG" is with Rifle Stock + Any Long / Carbine Heavy Barrel + Automatic + Large Drum Magazine.
 - "Pipe LMG" is with Rifle Stock + Any Carbine / Short Heavy Barrel + Automatic + Large Drum Magazine.
 - "[b]Automatic[/b] Pipe Rifle" is with Rifle Stock + Any Long / Carbine Heavy Barrel + Retarded Automatic.
 - "[b]Automatic[/b] Pipe Carbine" is with Rifle Stock + Any Carbine / Short Heavy Barrel + Retarded Automatic.
 - "[b]Automatic[/b] Pipe Carbine" is any non-shotgun with Rifle Stock + Carbine / Short / Stub / Short Heavy Barrel  or Pistol Grip + Long/Heavy Carbine Barrel, and Retarded-Automatic trigger. 
 - "[b]Automatic[/b] Pipe Target Pistol" is with Pistol Grip + Scope + Retarded Automatic. 
 - "[b]Automatic[/b] Pipe Pistol" is with Pistol Grip + Retarded Automatic + Not-Long Barrel.
 - "Pipe Sniper Rifle" is with Rifle Stock + Any Long / Carbine Heavy Barrel + Scope + Non-Automatic + Small/Medium Magazine, and not shotgun.
 - "Pipe Scout Rifle" is with Rifle Stock + Short/Carbine Barrel + Scope + Non-Automatic + Small Magazine, and not shotgun.
 - "Pipe DMR" is with Rifle Stock + Any Long / Carbine/ Short Heavy Barrel + Scope, not shotgun, and Small Mag. It will override Assault-Rifle and Battle-Rifle.
 - "Pipe Battle Rifle" is with Rifle Stock + Any Long / Carbine Heavy Barrel + non-retarded Automatic.
 - "Pipe Assault Rifle" is with Rifle Stock + Any Carbine / Short Heavy Barrel + non-retarded Automatic.
 - "Pipe PDW" is anything with Rifle Stock + Short/Stub + non-retarded Automatic + Rifle Caliber.
 - "Pipe PDW" is also any 5mm with Automatic attachments and rifle stocks, as the 5mm Receiver will never get the "Assault Rifle" or "Battle Rifle".
 - "Pipe SMG" is anything with Rifle Stock + Short/Stub + non-retarded Automatic + Pistol Caliber.
 - "Pipe SMG" is with Pistol Grip + Non-Retarded Automatic + Long-Barrel.
 - "Pipe Rifle" is any non-shotgun with Rifle Stock + Long / Carbine Heavy Barrel, and non-automatic trigger.
 - "Pipe Carbine" is any non-shotgun with Rifle Stock + Carbine / Short / Stub / Short Heavy Barrel or Pistol Grip + Long/Heavy Carbine Barrel, and non-automatic trigger.
 - "Pipe Machine Pistol" is with Pistol Grip + Non-Retarded Automatic + Not Long Barrel. 
 - "Pipe Hunting Revolver" is Pipe Revolver with Pistol Grip + Non-Automatic + Scope. 
 - "Pipe Target Pistol" is with Pistol Grip + Non-Automatic + Scope. 
 - "Pipe Pistol" is with Pistol Grip + Non-Automatic + Not Long Barrel. 

5.) Legendary Spawns and more powerful NPCs. The NPCs that wielded them, except Amelia, has increased Health, Energy, and Aggression. 

[quote] - Peacemaker (xx000B36): "Six rounds, no compromise. Peace!"

Pipe Revolver of [b]Mayor McDonough[/b] [In Sheep's Clothing], Pipe Revolver of Mayor Mcdonough, as a homage to the classic Single-Action Army Colt "Peacemaker", it' tries to become an unadulterated six-shooter, no gimmicks but being home-made. Has "Violent" legendary attachment, spawns with Heavy Short Barrel, Glow-Sights, Heavy-Frame, Sharpshooter's Grip, and pistol caliber; .45-Receiver, .44-Magnum, or .500-Magnum at higher levels.[/quote][quote] - Lady Luck (xx000B37): "The personification of luck, Lady Luck makes Critical a gamble that you make or break."

Pipe Assault-Rifle of [b]Red Tourette,[/b] Designed for heavy-damaging VATs crit, to vomit bullets; using the Long-Burst offered by the Rapid Automatic + 100% Crit bonus of "Calibrated" + "Lucky-Weapon"' 100% crit-bonus as well, the "Lady Luck" packs one hell of a VATs Crit, and you can always pair it with Better Criticals perk. Has "Lucky Weapon" legendary attachment, spawns with Heavy Short Barrel, Glow-Sights, Quick-Eject Large-Magazine, Marksman's Stock, Heavy-Frame, Rapid Automatic Trigger, Calibrated, Armor-Piercing, and uses 5mm, 5.56mm, .308, or .30-06. [/quote][quote] - Quickcaster (xx000B42): "Professionals shoot twice."

Pipe Sniper-Rifle of [b]Sully Mathis [/b][Pull the Plug], has "Vats-Enchanced" legendary attachment, -40% AP cost version which is not available for guns normally. Designed for quickly shooting, it's a sniper-rifle capable of multiple shots in vats. Spawns with Long Light Barrel, Compensator, Hair-Trigger, Any-Scope, Small-Magazine, Marksman's Stock, Not-Calibrated, Light-Frame, Armor-Piercing and uses .44 ,5mm, 5.56mm, .308, or .30-06. With enough modification, it can attain negative AP cost.[/quote][quote] - Dianne (xx000B3E): "Cute and cute and cuddly, is the bee's knees"

Pipe PDW of [b]Tower Tom[/b], has "Kneecapper" Legendary attachment. A hybrid of light-machine gun and sniper-rifle, it's designed to not deal lots of damage but cripple enemies and spray bullets long range, it uses the 5mm round to compensate for it's short barrel and short range. Spawns with Stub-Barrel, Muzzle-Brake, Marksman's Stock, Any-Scope, Rapid Automatic Trigger, Drum Magazines, 5mm Reciever, Heavy Frame, Calibrated, Armor-Piercing.[/quote][quote] - Van Buren (xx000B39): "Order in the face of anarchy."

The (confiscated) Pipe Bolt-Action Rifle of [b]Amelia Stockton[/b] [Human Error], found at the Steamer-Trunk near her cell. Not as flexible as other weapons, it's only goal in mind is to work, and it's reliable enough to shoot. Has "Rapid" Legendary attachment. Spawns with Heavy Carbine Barrel, Marksman's Stock, Calibrated, Glow-Sights, Heavy Frame, and Tuned Bolt. Spawns with Shotgun, .44, .30-06, or .50-Cal Receiver.[/quote][quote] - Scheherazade (xx0011AC): "After one-thousand and one."

The Pipe Bolt-Action Pistol of [b]Tweez[/b]. A surprisingly sturdy bolt-action pistol made from junk, strangely it garnered the love of its owner after defeating expectations, of still functioning after a thousand of rounds, after a thousand of days. Has "Nocturnal" Legendary attachment. Spawns with .44 Receiver, Heavy Short Barrel, Spiked Sharpshooter's Grip, Calibrated, Glow-Sights, Light Frame, and Tuned Bolt.[/quote]

6.) Far-Harbor Changes:

 - "M4-Carbine" Legendary; December's Child has +35% damage, +35% rate of fire, +25% reload-speed and -50% weight.
  - Bertha and Tony looks less beggars, with Small Bertha 10% taller, to make her look more a teenager and less of a child.
  - Bilge uses the legendary weapon: "Deuce Ex" Pipe Gun LMG, with Steadfast Legendary. (xx000804) 
  - Malcolm uses the legendary weapon: "Right-Arm of the Wasteland" Pipe Battle Rifle, with Retarded Auto, and has Deadeye Legendary. (xx000806)
 - Braun uses the legendary weapon: "Russian Roulette" Pipe Revolver, with Heavy Short Barrel, and Defiant Legendary. (xx000807)
 - "Glorious Revolution" is lootable from Douglas. Pipe Revolver, with Heavy Short Barrel, and Resilient Legendary. (xx000807)
- "Victoria's Secret" is lootable in Southwest Harbor inside "Victoria's Trunk", it is a Pipe Scout-Rifle with stub barrel and suppressor, and has Hitman Legendary. (xx000823)

7.) Nuka-World changes:

 - Added 7.62mm Reciever, deals 29 for Pipe Gun, 37 for Bolt Action, 33 for Revolver with capacity of 8. Has 1.00 Speed.
 - Handmade Rifle damage from 32, to 40. Full-Auto fire Rate from 1.25 to 1, and more recoil.
 - Handmade Rifle chamberings 5.56mm, 5mm, and .308.
 - Handmade Rifle Quick Eject Small Mag to Quick Eject Mag with 20 round capacity.
 - Rebalanced Handmade Rifle receivers to follow traditional trend; 25% each step.

8.) Optional Tweaks - included is changes to other weapons instead. 

 - Rechambered Deliverer to .38, reduced damage to 16.

 - Double Barrel Shotgun deals 70 damage, from 45. Stagger Increased to Extra Large. Deals 100% damage bonus at point-blank range.
 - Combat Shotgun' Stagger increased to Large. Deals 100% damage bonus at point-blank range.
 - Double-Barrel Shotgun has "Double Fire" feature which uses Twin Shotgun-Shells (custom ammo craftable at Chemistry Workbench), has double everything.
- Chokes are integrated with Double-Barrel and Combat Shotgun.
 - .44-Magnum has Trigger mod "Fanned Trigger"
 - Mini Nuke, and Nuke Mines can incinerate, like Laser Gun.
 - Mr. Gutsy uses 5.56mm.
 - Sentry Bots uses .50 Cal and increased damage to 36, and speed to 12.7 -- the same speed as SMGs.
 - Legendary Mods: Powerful to +35%, Violent to +50% damage and limb damage. Powerful, Violent, and Two-Shot now has Multiplicative than Additive Damage.

Notes:
- The Heavy Barrel and Shotgun Grenade rounds turn the weapon into a Heavy Gun that is improved by the Heavy Gunner perk. This ties in with the melee-attachments, allowing a strength-based build.
  - Nick Valentine’s Revolver comes with attachments. Using the console command, use "00002f25.removeitem 5bba7; 00002f25.additem 5bba7" (without the quotes) to reset his default weapon.
  - The Legendary Weapons may fail to spawn if you have already encountered the NPCs that wielded them or containers that have them.
 - This mod cuts both ways, making the wielder of the weapons a bit more powerful, as such in the enemies' hands it will be equally painful to deal with.
 - This mod conflicts with any mod that modifies any Object Modification entities, as such it's not compatible with the Better Mod Descriptions, any mod that modifies the Player NPC directly, as well as anything that adds new Receivers for any of the three pipe weapons. Since the mod borrows sound from something like .44 Pistol, should the sound used by the .44 Pistol is changed, this weapon’s .44 Pistol sound will also change. This also applies to all calibers and to automatic and suppressed fire modes too.
 - The naming mechanism conflicts with any mods that modify it, such as Valdacil's Better Item-Sorting Mod. While it works, it just doesn't apply to the three weapons as they use a different INNR record. There is a compatibility patch for that -- not that it uses Valdacil's but it's made to somewhat fit.
 - I also tweaked the Loading Screen.
  - The sound change uses the default sounds of other weapons via keywords. If you change sounds of any of the default weapon, this means the used sound of this weapons will change too. E.g. if you changed the 10mm Pistol's sound, the 10mm Receiver also changes sound.

[quote] - Currently, the Pipe Revolver has [color=gold][b]hundreds of millions[/b][/color] of possible combinations:

> Basic: = 9 (Receiver) x 13 (Barrels) x 8 (Stocks/Grips) x 4 (damage mod) x 2 (trigger mod) x 3 (frame mod) x 2 (calibration) x 6 (ammo mod) x 23 (Sights/Scopes) = 6200064 (10,055,232 with DLC)
> Bayonet is not allowed with suppressors, = 6 (Underbarrel) x 5 (Muzzles) = 30, subtract suppressor-bayonet combination = 26 x 6200064 = 161,201,664 (261,436,032 with DLC)
> Heavy Barrels can only put flashlights: 3 x 8 x 9 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 6 x 23 x 3 = 4,292,352 (5,246,208 with DLC)
> Shotgun = 13 x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 3 (Ammo type excluding Explosive Slugs) x 23 x 26 x 4 (Chokes) = 35,822,592
> Heavy Barrel Shotgun: 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 3 x 4 x 23 x 6 x 4 = 2,543,616
> Slug Shotgun (No Snub): 3 (Barrels) x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 2 (Two Ammo types) x 23 x 4 x 6 = 423,936
> Snub Slug Shotgun (No suppressed): 3 (Muzzles) x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 2 (Two Ammo types) x 23 x 4 x 6 (Underbarrels) = 1,271,808
> Snub Slug Shotgun (suppressed): 2 (Muzzles) x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 2 (Two Ammo types) x 23 x 4 x 4 (underbarrel w/o Bayonets) = 565,248

161,201,664 + 4,292,352 + 35,822,592 + 2,543,616 + 423,936 + 1,271,808 + 565,248 = [color=gold][b][size=4]206,121,216[/size][/b][/color][/quote][quote] - Currently, the Pipe Bolt Action has [color=gold][b]hundreds of millions[/b][/color] of possible combinations:

> Basic: = 6 (Receiver) x 13 (Barrels) x 8 (Stocks/Grips) x 4 (damage mod) x 2 (trigger mod) x 3 (frame mod) x 2 (calibration) x 6 (ammo mod) x 23 (Sights/Scopes) = 4,133,376
> Bayonet is not allowed with suppressors, = 6 (Underbarrel) x 5 (Muzzles) = 30, subtract suppressor-bayonet combination = 26 x 4,133,376 = 10,7467,776
> Heavy Barrels can only put flashlights: 3 x 8 x 6 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 6 x 23 x 3 = 2,861,568
> Shotgun = 13 x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 3 (Ammo type excluding Explosive Slugs) x 23 x 26 x 4 (Chokes) = 35,822,592
> Heavy Barrel Shotgun: 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 3 x 4 x 23 x 6 x 4 = 2,543,616
> Slug Shotgun (No Snub): 3 (Barrels) x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 2 (Two Ammo types) x 23 x 4 x 6 = 423,936
> Snub Slug Shotgun (No suppressed): 3 (Muzzles) x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 2 (Two Ammo types) x 23 x 4 x 6 (Underbarrels) = 1,271,808
> Snub Slug Shotgun (suppressed): 2 (Muzzles) x 8 x 4 x 2 x 3 x 2 x 2 (Two Ammo types) x 23 x 4 x 4 (underbarrel w/o Bayonets) = 565,248

10,7467,776 + 2,861,568 + 35,822,592 + 2,543,616 + 423,936 + 1,271,808 + 565,248 = [color=gold][b][size=4]150,956,544[/size][/b][/color][/quote][quote] - Currently, the Pipe Gun has [color=gold][b]BILLIONS[/b][/color] of possible combinations:

> Basic: 9 (Receiver) x 13 (Barrels) x 8 (Stocks/Grips) x 10 (Magazines) x 4 (damage mod) x 6 (trigger mod) x 3 (frame mod) x 2 (calibration) x 6 (Ammo Mod) x 23 (Sights/Scopes)  = 186,001,920
> Bayonet is not allowed with suppressors, = 6 (Underbarrel) x 5 (Muzzles) = 30, subtract suppressor-bayonet combination = 26 x 186,001,920 = 4,836,049,920
> Heavy Barrel can only use flashlights: 9 x 3 x 8 x 4 x 6 x 3 x 2 x 6 x 23 x 3 = 12,877,056

4,836,049,920 +  12,877,056 = [color=gold][b][size=4]4,848,926,976.[/size][/b][/color]

Lots of different possible combinations, lol. You can have Pistol, Machine Pistol, SMG, Rifle, Carbine/SBR, Scout Rifle, DMR, Assault Rifle, Battle Rifle, LMG, MMG, HMG, and Sniper-Rifle, so flexible that you can build your weapon to fit most situations! Provided you take the time to build it[/quote]
modInfo.name: Pipe Weapons Overhaul
modInfo.summary:
Favored by the Commonwealth’s Raider gangs, Pipe weapons are crude, low-tech, widely available... and highly modifiable. Billions of different combinations, it can be configured to function into many different roles, to fit into many different situations.

5,206,004,736 possible weapon combinations to be exact.

fileInfo.changelog_html:
Update 2.1

Added Far Harbor DLC armor and weapon modifications.
fileInfo.description: This file is intended purely for the NMM installer and contains both Main and Lite versions of both BMD and all compatible versions. For manual installation, please see the other files.
fileInfo.name: All-In-One Better Mod Descriptions

modInfo.author: Takaru Minari
modInfo.description:
[color=#93c47d][u][b]DESCRIPTION[/b][/u][/color]
[b]
Update v2.0 (06.04.2016): I love it when a plan comes together. Or when two mods come together. Better Weapon Mod Descriptions has merged with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5028/]Better Armor Mod Descriptions[/url] into this mod: Better Mod Descriptions, combining both mods into a single one. No more having to use both BAMD and BWMD just to get your numbers fix for Legendary Modifications, it's all in one place now.
Update v2.1 (27.05.2016): Reaching even the Farthest Harbor, the newest DLC's armor and weapon mods are now included in this update.

And a bonus for NMM users: There is now a All-In-One NMM file which allows you to install any and all mods from a single download. Because I can. Note that just because you can choose every single compatible file doesn't necessarily mean they're all inter-compatible.

A further note: There's a known bug in Fallout 4 which can cause the game to crash when attempting to load a save file which is missing 4+ plugins. If this happens, you can circumvent this issue by forcibly loading the save file via console commands, use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/838/]F4SGE[/url] to clear your save file of any references to missing plugins or simply rename new plugins to their old names until the bug doesn't trigger.

Compatibility versions only modify the descriptions of modifications that are actually changed by the to-be compatible mod. You need the main BMD file as well as the compatible version. Load Order should be: Main BMD File followed by Other Mod followed by Other Mod Compatible BMD File.[/b]


[b]Additionally, a Google Spreadsheet with all vanilla base & Automatron weapons and their respective modifications as well as
legendary effects can be found under the articles tab.[/b]

Tired of Better Recoil, Exceptional Damage or Poor Range? Want to know how much a Dense Chestpiece actually reduces explosive damage? Try some actual numbers on your mods!

Better Mod Descriptions strives to give you some actual information on what each armor and weapon mod does by changing the descriptions of each and every modification.

It leaves all values at their vanilla setting and merely lists them all - including some which weren't actually noted in the old descriptions but still present. Using BMD does not make your weapon mods stronger or weaker in any way.

So, what does Better Weapon Mod Descriptions do exactly? Here's an example, using the Hunting Rifle .50 Receiver:

[u]Old Description:[/u] Exceptional Damage. Changes ammo type to .50 Caliber. Improved rate of fire.
"Exceptional" they said. "Improved" they said. Join the vaguey, they said.

[u]Better Mod Descriptions:[/u] +75% Damage. Uses .50 Rounds. +25% Fire Rate. -25% Reload Time.
+75% Damage? Don't mind if I do! +25% Fire Rate? Yes please! Wait, .50 Receivers decrease the Reload Time too? Who knew!

These kinds of changes have been applied to all armor and weapon mods (including unique items/effects and legendary modifiers) in the game, revealing actual numbers and sometimes even previously unknown modifiers for those who like their descriptions actually, well, descriptive.

Prefer it in video format? [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/24653189/]Zimta[/url] was so kind as to make a showcase of it:
[youtube]3D-uE_O9j88[/youtube]
Other videos include:
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xtjxAVYe82o]Fallout 4 Top Mods Of The Week #5[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/14127810/]Game0rb[/url]
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PusCLTr5MAY]Fallout 4 Mods Showcase #4[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/8833443/]Atreides83[/url]
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1AhgDpVKF7A]Fallout 4 Mods - Better Armour Mod Descriptions[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/8508739/]Mudcupss[/url]
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tWpat89JaDo]FALLOUT 4 MODS - WEEK #6[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/3388892/]Tyrannicon[/url]
Thanks a lot!

To better understand these new descriptions, there is a list of all the terms used in the articles tab.


[color=#93c47d][u][b]COMPATIBILITY[/b][/u][/color][u][b]
[/b][/u]

BMD could be made compatible with any such mod with a small bit of work, just leave a request via comment or PM.


[color=#93c47d][u][b]KNOWN ISSUES[/b][/u][/color][u]

[/u]-Some Mod descriptions appear fairly small due to increased text length. This cannot be changed unfortunately. Sorry if you find reading small text difficult!
-This mod can be a little overwhelming to get used to. If you don't know what a value does, check the articles tab.
-The following descriptions were left unchanged as their exact effect is difficult to determine: Explosive Vent (Power Armor Legs), Kinetic
Dynamo (Power Armor Torso)
-Attempting to load a save file which is missing 4 or more Plugins can cause your game to crash. This is a bug with Fallout 4 itself - beware when deleting or updating/renaming multiple .esps!


Created with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/]FO4Edit 3.1.3[/url] for Fallout 4 1.4.132

[color=#93c47d]
[u][b]MANUAL INSTALLATION[/b][/u][/color]

Check the following articles with videos by Gopher on how to enable and install mods for Fallout 4:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/news/12645/]Enabling Mods for Fallout 4[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/news/12650/]Fallout 4: Installing Mods on PC (Manually)[/url]

To install this mod, simply place your chosen .esp into the Fallout 4/Data folder.

If you haven't done so already, enable mods by adding the following line to your Fallout4Prefs.ini file under the [Launcher] section: bEnableFileSelection=1
If this line is already present but ends in 0, simply change it to 1.

Once this is done, the mod should automatically be loaded when you next start Fallout 4. If it is not, you need to add it to your load order, found under AppData/Local/Fallout4/plugins.txt in your User folder.
Add a new line with your chosen ESPs full name (e.g. BetterModDescriptions.esp) and save the file. It should now load the mod if it it placed in your Data folder.


[color=#93c47d][u][b]MANUAL UNINSTALLATION[/b][/u][/color]

To uninstall this mod, simply remove the ESP from your Fallout 4/Data folder.

fileInfo.name: Subway Runner

modInfo.author: Ghostfc3s
modInfo.description:
Recommended to create a save before using this mod to revert to if something goes wrong.

[b]Russian Version[/b]

http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/19765/?


Update v7 fixes culling issues in Andrews station attached to the mission "along time coming." This update also added npc control points to prevent the whole map from rushing the player for the whole map. 

Update v6 adds a new station layout, the new layout is used for concord station, airport station, a new station is added at Monsignor Plaza and as well as tunnel connecting Goodneighbor and Malden station. An abandoned tunnel was added to connect Glowsea to West Roxbury Station.

This mod connects 90% of the standard subway stations, and creates a network of subway tunnels filled with raiders, super mutants, synths and ghouls. Subway stations have been added throughout this network. With a focus on survival play through there are easy to access to beds for save points to bunk down for the night. This system once cleared out of enemies allows the player to move quickly across the wasteland. Be warned the battles to take back the network and make them safe for travel will be not an easy one.

The maps are fully nav meshed and companion friendly.
I recommend using companion whistle to keep them close, especially if you are using more the one companion.

This mod is large and modifies some world spaces to allow access to the subway network. I to care to avoid settlement locations and areas that could conflict with other mods.

To gain access to Good Neighbor you must complete the quest “The Big Dig” otherwise the station is inaccessible from the surface.  I did this as 3rd rail is often used by other modders as a player home.

[b][u]Not compatible with underhouse mod.

[/u][/b]There are some issues with other immersive mods, notably stumble upon, interior and bean town. 

You will have to play with load order to get them all to work together. 

Currently I have interior over hall, then subway runner, bean town and stumble upon, I am still playing through a play through with this order but it appears to work.

There is no plans to incorporate dlc. I purchased the season pass for ps4 when we were promised mods, have no intention of paying another $70 for dlc I already own. 

My to-do list for future updates, I will check them off as I go and upload hopefully 1 big update.

Move light sources away from the walls,

Remove 2-3 loot tables from each cell as they are noticeably over represent.

Try to figure out why the grenade arks are not present

Add more rubble to prevent pop up and noticeable draw distance.

[size=5][color=yellowgreen]FO4 NPCs Travel[/color][/size]

Video by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/33197756]Koubitz[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/32558820]JrMods[/url](2:28), [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/36026330]TheWhiteCollarPlayers[/url](7:00), [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/20790749]LadyLilia[/url]:
[youtube]d8WubsmcAnc[/youtube] [youtube]I3hb9goErbI[/youtube]
[youtube]qTRzMXeE5dw[/youtube] [youtube]JVNo4S8YQzs[/youtube]

I rely on machine translation because I am not good at english.

Adds over 300 NPC's who traveling the Commonwealth, Far Harbor, Nuka-World.

Travel extensively and encounter in various places.

Travel destinations are determined randomly.

Travel destinations is more than 400 places.

Some travel destinations are unlocked by quest achievement or specific conditions.

12 Wastelander
- Default 6.
They are tradable.

6 Hunter
- Default 3.
Hunter will travel with a dog and sell items obtained by hunting, such as animal meat.

6 Scavenger (Not hostile)
- Default 3.
Scavenger will travel with a robot and sell mainly junk items.

3 Mercenary squad
- Members: Leader, Doctor, Mercenary, Robot. Default 1.
Mercenary doctor is a doctor and dealing with medical supplies.

3 Minuteman patrol
- Members: Leader, Minuteman, Minuteman, Dog or Eyebot. Default is 1.
Unlocked the first minutemen patrol if the over 6 settlements and the castle has been owned by player. The second is 12. The third is 18. Except DLC.

3 Brotherhood of Steel patrol
- Members: Leader, BoS, BoS or Dog, Mr Gutsy. Default 1.
Unlocked after the brotherhood of steel arrives in the commonwealth.

3 Synth patrol
- Members: Leader, Synth, Synth, Synth. Default 1.
Unlocked after completing the "Unlikely Valentine" or "Road to Freedom" or "Call to Arms" quest.

3 Gunners squad
- Members: Leader, Gunner, Gunner, Robot. Default 0.

3 Group of Raider
- Members: Leader, Raider, Raider, Attack Dog. Default 0.

3 Group of Super mutant
- Members: Leader, Super mutant, Super mutant, Mutant Hound. Default 0.

3 Group of Feral ghoul
- Daytime: 6 to 8, Nighttime: 10 to 12. Default 0.

3 Deathclaw
- Random: 1 to 2. Default 0.
Sleeps by day and hunts by night.

3 Yao guai
- Random: 2 to 3. Default 0.
Sleeps by day and hunts by night.

3 Behemoth
- Members: Behemoth, Super Mutant Suicider, Super Mutant Suicider. Default 0.
Unlocked after kill five giant creatures. This is the same condition as achievement "...The Harder They Fall".

Robot. Default is all disable.
- Protectrons: police, fire brigadier, medical, utility
- Assaultron and Mister Gutsy
- Sentry bot
- Mister Gutsy and Sentry bot
- 2 Protectron
- 2 Mister Gutsy
- 2 Assaultron,
- Assaultron and Sentry bot

Swarm of Bloatfly, Bloodbug, Stingwing (2 groups each)
- Random: 3 to 5. Default 0.

All NPC will affected by the [iHoursToRespawnCell, iDaysToRespawnVendor] of game settings.

In addition, all NPC will reset after a elapse of 10 days.

The mod start after the escape from vault 111.


Automatoron

Unlocked after rescued the robot with "Mechanical Menace" quest.

3 Mech Bot patrol
- Members: Leader, Mech Bot, Mech Bot, Mech Bot, Mech Bot. Default 0.

3 Rust Devil patrol
- Members: Leader, Rust Devil, Robot, Robot, Robot. Default 0.


Far Harbor

Unlocked after the Walk in the Park quest's "Defend the Hull".

2 Harbormen patrol
- Members: Leader, Harbormen, Harbormen. Default 1.
Unlocked after the Echo Lake Lumber is owned by player.

2 Church of the Children of Atom patrol
- Members: Leader, CoA, CoA. Default 1.
Unlocked after player joined Church of the Children of Atom.

3 Group of Trappers
- Members: Leader, Trapper, Trapper, Trapper. Default 0.

2 Group of Feral ghoul
- Daytime: 6 to 8, Nighttime: 10 to 12. Default 0.

2 Group of Super mutant
- Members: Leader, Super mutant, Super mutant, Mutant Hound. Default 0.

2 Wolf pack
- Random: 2 to 5. Default 0.

2 Fog Crawler. Default 0.
They usually stick to the deep fog.


Nuka-World

Unlocked after completing the "Taken For A Ride" quest.

2 Disciples patrol
- Members: Leader, Disciple, Disciple. Default 0.

2 Operators patrol
- Members: Leader, Operator, Operator. Default 0.

2 The Pack patrol
- Members: Leader, Pack, Pack Dog. Default 0.

5 Wasteland Traveler
- Default 0.
They are tradable.

2 Scavenger (Not hostile)
- Default 0.
Scavenger will travel with a robot and sell mainly junk items.

Unlocked after completing the "Open Season" quest.

2 Minuteman patrol
- Members: Leader, Minuteman, Minuteman, Dog or Eyebot. Default 0.
Requirement: The castle has been owned by player.

2 Brotherhood of Steel patrol
- Members: Leader, BoS, BoS, Mr Gutsy. Default 0.
Requirement: The brotherhood of steel arrives in the commonwealth.

2 Synth patrol
- Members: Leader, Synth, Synth, Synth. Default 0.
Requirement: Completing the "Unlikely Valentine" or "Road to Freedom" or "Call to Arms" quest.

2 Gunners squad
- Members: Leader, Gunner, Gunner, Robot. Default 0.


The following features can be configured in the [NPCs Travel Config]:
- Number of NPC
- Relations with Player
- NPC Service
- Settlements visit
- Ignore Location
- Fast Respawn
- Large Group
- Holotape settings

The [NPCs Travel Config] is holotape that will be automatically add to inventory after the mod start.
If holotape is not added for some reason, please craft it at the chemistry station. Then the mod will start in real time within one minute.

fileInfo.description: Gives the player more options when dealing with raiders. You can either infiltrate, kill or talk your way into their camps.
fileInfo.name: Raiders reloaded

modInfo.author: acidgiraffe
modInfo.description:
In fallout 4 a central problem is that more often than not the only option available to the player is to kill everything that moves. This issue is exemplified in the raider faction which will attack the player regardless of what the player does.This mod will allow the player to infiltrate raider camps assuming he can either avoid patrols or talk his way in.


What this mod adds.
-All raiders neutral as standard
-All raider area containers both interior and exterior are now owned by raiders - no stealing!
-Raider crime faction that will make the player hostile for 24 hours if they upset a group of raiders.
-All raiders have guard packages that will warn you off and attack if you dawdle too long.
- Unique lookout npcs that will challenge the player [u]if detected[/u]. The raider will have opportunities in dialogue to talk his way past the guard but if he fails or runs off then the lookout will trigger a nearby siren.
-lookouts have 3 sets of random dialogue (unvoiced)
-Sirens are placed in virtually every raider interior/ exterior as are lookouts who often have guard dog followers.
-4 unique raider npcs with location based dialogue that will give you the opportunity to talk your way into an area.

I'm looking to add to and continue working on this mod over time especially if people like it.
First port of call would be getting some voice actors who sound like they fit in with the fallout 4 raiders!
I am also considering adding more unique raider quests and adding more facets to the raider camps like caged guard dogs that are released by the alarms and perhaps reinforcements!






UPDATES:  The dialogue was wonky and was not working as intended. This should be solved now in the latest version of the mod! I have added blank dialogue as a placeholder which means you can skip dialogue if you want to. I've added Lilly into Corvega interior now. 



REQUIREMENTS: Turn on your subtitles because dialogue is currently unvoiced. No dlc or mod requirements.



Conflicts : Nothing unless it changes the raider actor ai I believe

modInfo.author: ElPolloAzul
modInfo.description:
This is a much weirder "weapon" mod, even by my usual wacky weapon standards.

Do you want your very own extremely graphics-intensive shadows and
crepuscular rays? Grow your own temporary cover and make yourself a
corpse, erm, I mean, copse with "Tree-Fiddy".

Vacuum up some junk (and strip off some NPC equipment) with the
incredible (-ly underwhelming and hideous) "Drek-A-Vak"!

Do you want to be rich? Rich with fire, explosions, and exhaust related
death? Also caps? Kill with illogical falling flaming cars and reap the
sweet, sweet rain of extra bottlecaps using "Caps 4 Junkers"!

Finally, do you want to be a necromancer? Be warned that departed NPCs
"helped" by "He's Undead, Jim..." may never be the same... like they
came from some burial ground or something.

Discover the occult (and ignition, occlusion, and suction, and not much
more!) in the Diamond City Mega Surgery Center's consulting basement!

A TREE GROWS (AND PRESUMABLY ALSO GLOWS) IN BOSTON!

modInfo.description:
[center][size=6][font=Courier New]Companion Status[/font][/size]
[font=Verdana][size=5]Your companions' health and AP on your HUD.[/size][/font][/center]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ THE STORY ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

You finish a tough fight. Phew. It's quiet. Too quiet. You turn and see your companion grovelling about on the floor. Thanks for nothing, Piper - you mutter for the fifteen-thousandth time this week.

In vanilla, there's absolutely no way to know how much health your companion has left. Their HP bar doesn't show when you point at them, and they're not selectable in VATS either. You have no idea if your companion is just fine or right about to go down face flat on the very next hit.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ THE DETAILS ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

This mod adds a HUD widget that displays your companions' health and stats. Up to ten companions can be monitored.

Stats will be displayed when companions enter combat, and will automatically fade out once your companion is at full health and out of combat.

You can now have an improved situational awareness of your team's fighting strength. If they're low on health, call them back or reposition them. Provide support where needed. Know the status and fighting strength of your team at all times.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ REQUIREMENTS ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

This mod requires [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309/]HUDFramework[/url].

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ COMPATIBILITY ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Automatically compatible with all follower systems, vanilla or mod-added, present or future.

All that's required is for followers to have the [i]Treat as Player Follower[/i] flag correctly set on their AI packages. This is set by default on the FollowPlayer package template, so a mod would have to be doing things in a very different way indeed in order to not have it set.

Fully compatible with:
[list]
[*]Vanilla follower system
[*]Temporary quest followers
[*]Everybody's Best Friend 
[*]Unlimited Companion Framework
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ HOW DO I... ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Q. Position the HUD widget?
A: Enter the console command [code][cqf companionstatus setpos <x position> <y position>][/code].
Or the command [code][cqf companionstatus modpos <x or y> <value>][/code] to move the widget relative to its current position.

Q. Scale the HUD widget?
A: Enter the console command [code][cqf companionstatus setscale <value between 0 and 1>][/code].

Q. Set the opacity of the HUD widget?
A: Enter the console command [code][cqf companionstatus setopacity <value between 0 and 1>][/code].

All these commands can be copied and pasted into the console.

Sorry about making you use the console to do things like positioning and scaling. Until we have a MCM with fancy sliders, though, this will have to do! The upside is that you only need to configure just once - your settings are saved. Set and forget.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ GIF ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]
[spoiler][center][img]http://i.giphy.com/KWonzcPlqFCRq.gif[/img][/center][/spoiler]
[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ MORE HUD WIDGETS ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20300/]HoloTime - HUD Clock Widget[/url]

Related mods:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21636/]Nameplates - Floating Healthbars[/url] by expired6978
Great if you want to see the health of everyone in combat! Fully compatible with Companion Status HUD.

[line]

[font=Verdana][size=4][b]You might also like:[/b][/size][/font]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9325/]Bullet Time[/url] - Bullet Time for Fallout 4.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10282/]Outfit Switcher[/url] - Save entire loadouts and swap between them via hotkey. It's like favorites, but entire loadouts at a time.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10875/]Take Cover[/url] - New gameplay mechanic - 3rd person cover system! Take cover behind objects and automatically lean out to shoot when you aim down sights.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11664/]FO4 Hotkeys[/url] - Hotkey anything to any key, including equipment, items, and even console commands.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11784/]Companion Command and Tactics[/url] - Shout to your companion from wherever you are. Position them, switch up their equipment and be a lot more tactical in your fights.

[color=#ff0000][size=4]UPDATE v0.5: New Soylent Cola and Soylent Cola Crate[/size]
[size=3]Texture of soylent soap improved
[/size]Bug with bone meal fixed

[/color]UPDATE v0.4: New Chem Device (Jet, Soylent Jet), soylent soap, boxes and pallets to store soylent green
[size=2]UPDATE v0.3: Two new items added: bone meal and glue
UPDATE v0.2: Food Paste added and XB0X1 upload[/size]


[size=4]It adds three new devices:[/size]

[color=#00ff00]VAULT-TEC Emergency Food Processor[/color]
[size=4]Processes the output of the autobutcher[/size]

[size=2]Input: Meat (all types)[/size]
[size=2]Output: Soylent Green, Dog Food (Mutant&Ghoul Flavor) and Food Paste. All four are consumables
[/size]

Out: Skull Candle (Junk item but placeable via the workshop with a lit candle (Decoration/Misc, after the plants)

[color=#00ff00]VAULT-TEC Chem Processer[/color]

Input: Components for Jet
Out: Jet, Jet Fuel, Ultra Jet, Ultra Soylent Jet 
Input: Bloodbag
Out: Stimpack


[color=#00ff00]New Recipes for cooking station[/color]

[color=#00ff00]Boxes and pallets for soylent green

when scrapped you get the whole input back.
Works like my other mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15289/?]Warehouse[/url] to store the boxes and pallets in shelves



[color=#ff0000]Installation

[size=4]Install both first and keep them in a higher load order.[/size]
[size=4]Install/Uninstall it with NMM.

After deinstallation everything will work as before.

modInfo.author: m8r98a4f2
modInfo.description:
[color=#e69138][size=5][b]FallUI - Workbench[/b][/size][/color]

A optimized Fallout 4 workbench interface for PC.

Overhaul of the workbench for PC. Contains visual updates, functionial updates as well as more data displayed. Full support for FallUI inclusive.

[b][color=#e69138][size=4]Features[/size][/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Full support for FallUI
[list]
[*]Also full compatible with any other def_inv/dev_hud compatible Item Sorter Mod
[/list][*]Multi-language (All languages included)
[*]Covers the weapon and armor workbench as well as cooking and chemistry station.
[*]Greater display size for inventory list, mod list and other displayed panels.
[*]Added data columns to the inventory list, slot list and mod list.
[*]See comparison of all modules compared to your current installed mods in a well-arranged table sight
[*]Fancy item tag icon menu, which allows you to directly click on the icon you want to have for your weapon/armor! (Renaming function)
[*]Multi-craft button: Craft a item up to 10 times with a single button without confirmation (Key: M)
[*]Filtermode: Only show craftable recipes (Key: Q)
[*]Text search in recipe and mod lists (Requires F4SE. Key: F)
[*]Widescreen support (Universal aspect ratio correction available via MCM - support all resolutions)
[*]Customizable interface coloration
[*]Can show up to 8 requirement perks (Some mods use more than 2 requirements)
[*]Optimized the workbench script for a much better performance
[*]Autobuilding of zero-cost modules (like standard modules) is automatic now! (Skipping the senseless confirm box)
[*]Nicer graphical look of whole workbench interface.
[*]Drastically increased max. allowed characters for item names.
[*]Works smoothly together with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22105]Rename Anything[/url]﻿, allowing you to rename any item with item icon tag picker. (Install before FallUI Workbench)
[*]If you have FallUI installed, it will automatically use FallUI style configuration where applicable
[*]Includes MCM configuration menu for more individual settings (English version included, use a translation mod for a translated configuration)
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Use a Mod Manager to install.
[*]Optional but recommended: Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface[/url]﻿.
[*]Optional but recommended: Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48958]FallUI - Confirm Boxes[/url]﻿ to get icons in the "Make" and "Scrap" boxes (or to just skip them)!
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Load order[/b][/size][/color]
[spoiler]
[list=1]
[*] [Any mod you have modifying the workbench]
[*](Optional) [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758?tab=files]FallUI[/url]
[*]FallUI Workbench
[/list][/spoiler]

[b][color=#e69138][size=4]The [size=5]FallUI [/size]series[/size][/color][/b][list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48958]FallUI - Confirm Boxes [/url]- Beautiful message boxes. Unique designs and styles for every box type. Including skip option!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51813]FallUI - HUD[/url]﻿ - Highly configurable HUD for Fallout 4 with in-game HUD Layout Manager.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface [/url]﻿- Just better interface for all inventories
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49920]FallUI - Map[/url]﻿ - Better map for Fallout 4. Including list of locations, colored marker, high-res-support and more!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49070]FallUI - Sleep and Wait[/url]﻿ - Enhances the sleep/wait menu by many quality-of-life features like target hour buttons and daytime graph.

[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49300]FallUI - Workbench[/url]﻿ - Just better crafting, with more display size, more data, and a tag icon picker!
[/list]
[color=#6d9eeb][b][color=#e69138][size=4]Thanks[/size][/color]
[/b][/color]Bethesda
Neanka
FO4Edit team
The whole Nexus community (you are the best!)
