modInfo.author: Gambit77 - Thirdstorm - Valdacil
modInfo.description:
[url=https://www.patreon.com/Gambit77][img]http://i.imgur.com/phGsbyZ.png[/img][/url]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/6091-0-1458709156.png[/img]

[color=#a4c2f4][size=5]Purpose[/size][/color]
---------------------
[size=4]This resource accomplishes the following things:
1) Creates a standardized framework of keywords for: armor and weapon records for use by dynamic naming mods (and other mods that utilize these keywords to do cool things), crafting menus, and a color swap & decal swap framework.
2) Standardizes apparel slot usage to prevent conflicts between mod authors creations to increase inter usability.
3) Creates standardized armor, weapons, ammunition, and explosive workbenches to be utilized for crafting items added by mods.
4) Creates a collection of object modifications for blade weapons to recreate blade tempering from Skyrim for use by weapon modders.
[/size]

[color=#a4c2f4][size=5]Mod Users[/size][/color]
---------------------
Mods you have installed may require this file as a base resource.  Simply download and install the mod using the standard installation methods (recommended NMM: [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]Newbie Guide[/url]).

[color=#a4c2f4][size=5]Bethesda.net Links[/size][/color]
---------------------
Xbox: All-DLC: [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038275]https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038275[/url]
Xbox: No-DLC: [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038282]https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038282[/url]
Xbox: Automatron Patch: [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038285]https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038285[/url]
Xbox: Contraption Patch: [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038287]https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038287[/url]
Xbox: Far Harbor Patch: [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038293]https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038293[/url]
Xbox: Nuka World Patch: [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038289]https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038289[/url]
Xbox: Vault-Tec Patch: [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038286]https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4038286[/url]


[color=#a4c2f4][size=5]Mod Authors[/size][/color]
---------------------
[color=#a4c2f4][size=4]Purpose of this resource:[/size][/color]
Create a standardize framework for armor so that modders can create and modify armor while making edits compatible with mods that adjust dynamic item naming (like Valdacil's Item Sorting).
Adds a standardized set of crafting menu categories for armor/clothing/weapons and adds tow new crafting benches, the Armorsmith and Weaponsmith workbenches.  This was done so that modders could share category menu keywords in order to lower our combined footprint in order to help the community avoid the formlist cap bug.  And as a bonus to consolidate everybody's crafting recipes onto just 2 benches for convenience.

[color=#a4c2f4][size=4]Why create this:[/size][/color]
Problem 1: many users want items sorted better in their inventory
Solution 1: rename items so they start with a tag that groups and sorts them alphabetically
Drawback: modifying the name of the record causes conflict with any other mod that modifies the same record.  As simple rename causes incompatibility

Solution 2: use Fallout 4's dynamic naming mechanism to automatically tag armor and weapons so that the base record need not be modified
Advantage 1: since base records aren't modified, this method is compatible with mods that adjust stats, models, slots, etc
Advantage 2: mods that add new items can be tagged for sorting without addition work or compatibility patches
Complication: keywords on weapons are really consistent, but keywords for armor are far less consistent with many classifications missing keywords altogether.

So this is a resource to fix Bethesda's inconsistent keywords on armor pieces and force all armor items to run dynamic naming rules.  If not using a mod that modifies the dynamic naming rules, then these edits will have no negative effect.  However, by using this resource your mod will the primed for dynamic naming.

Vanilla Fallout 4 gives us the following ways to identify armor
ArmorTypeHat - hats
ArmorBodyPartHead - helmets
ArmorBodyPartEyes - glasses/goggles
ClothingDogmeat + playerCannotEquip - Dogmeat only equipable
ArmorBodyPartChest - chest armor overlays
dn_PowerArmor_Helmet
dn_PowerArmor_LeftArm
dn_PowerArmor_LeftLeg
dn_PowerArmor_RightArm
dn_PowerArmor_RightLeg
dn_Powerarmor_Torso

And that is it.  As you can see we're missing the same left/right arm/leg breakdown for armor overlay pieces (leather, combat armor, etc).  We're also missing an standard keywords on clothing, armor suits, and the like.  The is also no Super Mutant keyword.

This resource solves that problem by adding keywords to tag armor/cosmetics so that mod authors can properly classify their items.  See tutorial article attached to this page for more specifics.

If you are creating a mod that adds new wearable items, use this resource and one of the keywords and follow the instructions outlined in this article, then your new items will be prepared for dynamic naming automatically with no need for compatibility patches.  The resource includes all vanilla items properly tagged and prepared for dynamic naming.

[color=#a4c2f4][size=4]Instructions for Mod Authors[/size][/color]
--------------------
Make ArmorKeywords.esm a master on your .esp and link it as a required file when you upload your mod to Nexus.
To override an item, start with the resource item and copy as override into your .esp.  All pieces to run dynamic naming are already set as detailed below.
To create a new item, start with a resource item that is close then copy as a new item into your .esp.  All pieces to run dynamic naming should carryover.  Adjust community keywords as needed to properly tag and classify your item.

[color=#a4c2f4][size=4]Details[/size][/color]
---------------------
Dynamic naming works off the INNR records in FO4Edit (latest version calls these Instance Naming Rule).  These rules run as If...Then statements looking for keywords on the object and applying a piece of the item's name if a matching rule is found.

However, by default many armor items don't run dynamic naming rules because they didn't have any upgrades available in vanilla.  In order to force them to run dynamic naming rules the INRD of the item records must be set to the EditorID of the rule to run for that item.  Additionally, the OBTS must have a minimal definition as follows (if the item already has OBTE defined, do not change it; below is only for items where OBTE is undefined):

OBTE - Count = 1
OBTS Parts A Count = 0
OBTS Parts B Count = 0
OBTS Unknown (first instance) = 00 00 00 00 FF FF 01
OBTS Unknown (second instance) = 00 00

With INRD and OBTE set, it is then up to the author of sorting mods or mods that modify naming rules how to utilize the keywords the item is tagged with.  In this way, sorting mods do not need to modify armor records to accomplish sorting and mods that add new armor/clothing can be sorted automatically as long both modders use these community keywords.

[color=#a4c2f4][size=4]Mods[/size][/color]
----------------------
This community resource was initially envisioned and realized by Valdacil and Gambit77 in order to make Valdacil's Item Sorting (VIS) compatible with Armorsmith.  Once we got started, we realized this would be a great framework to universalize the armor modding community and make life easier for both armor modders and sorting modders.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654/?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/6091-0-1458806457.png[/img][/url]

[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33383][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/33383/33383-1531962186-1069291878.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11840?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/11840-7-1460311902.png[/img]
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12040?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/12040-0-1460827319.png[/img][/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12041?][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/12041-0-1460827879.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2451][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/2451-0-1448341068.png[/img][/url]

[size=5]Contributors
Plugin work by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2695294]Gambit77[/url], [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/23176]Valdacil[/url], & [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/30287520]Thirdstorm[/url].  Part of AWKCR color swap framework contributed by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/37855955]AndrewCX[/url].
Armorsmith Workbench by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2695294]Gambit77[/url], [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/9388143]Aldebaran90[/url], & [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2117112]Stndmunki[/url].

fileInfo.name: Insignificant Object Remover

modInfo.author: AKcelsior
modInfo.description:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/sSx5eFQ.jpg[/img][/center][line][center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode]
This mod reduces the density of insignificant objects to [size=2]0[/size], effectively removing their existence safely from your game. You choose what to keep and what to get rid of.

Maybe you need that extra bit of performance to run "Sim Settlements", or maybe you think the pebbles and twigs are an eyesore. Whatever your reasoning, this mod will take care of it. 

[color=#cfe2f3]Skyrim Special Edition[/color] version [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/3354?]here[/url]![/font][/center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][line] [/font][center][b][color=#b6d7a8][size=2]Special thanks to [b][color=#ffd966]The White Collar Players[/color][/b][/size][/color][b][size=2][color=#b6d7a8], [/color][/size][/b][color=#ffd966]HTH Mods[/color][size=2][color=#b6d7a8], [/color][b][color=#ffd966]Fonnie Dro[/color][/b][color=#b6d7a8], [/color][color=#ffd966]Tyrannicon[/color][color=#b6d7a8], and [/color][color=#ffd966]SkyttsTV [/color][color=#b6d7a8]for featuring this mod in their videos:[/color][/size]
[/b]
[youtube]X0Nf4CghcD0[/youtube] [youtube]UnCiYiN7k3c[/youtube] [youtube]ESg0Q2N3p28[/youtube] [youtube]B0kY4DgSENw[/youtube] [youtube]7rTPK2UcCAY[/youtube][/center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][line][/font][b][color=#ffe599][size=4]
Install[/size][/color][/b][size=4]:[/size]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Click the download with NMM button and activate.[/font]

[size=4][color=#ffe599][b]Uninstall[/b][/color]:[/size]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Deactivate in NMM.
[/font]
[b][size=4][color=#ffe599]Load Order[/color]:[/size][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]It shouldn't matter. If I had a gamma gun to my head I would say place it after mods that edit landscapes.[/font][i][color=#e69138] [/color][/i]
[line]
[b][font=Trebuchet MS][color=#ffe599][size=4]FAQs[/size][/color][/font][font=Verdana]:

[/font][/b][font=Tahoma][b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]What exactly did you remove?[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8][b]A:[/b][/color] Procedural "grass" that isn't actually grass - These objects are spawned in varying densities in a radius around the player when you load an area. Things like small stones, rubble, concrete debris, the crap underwater, a couple twigs, the stuff you probably never noticed and [u]can't interact with[/u].
[color=#ffd966][size=1]*There are 4 different versions bundled in the installer. Choose which one suits your tastes.[/size][/color]

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Why did you do this?[/color]
[b][color=#b6d7a8]A:[/color] [/b]Because your processing/rendering power is better used generating things you can actually see.

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]How much performance do I gain?[/color]
[b][color=#b6d7a8]A:[/color][/b] Depends on the scene, draw distance, hardware, etc. If your computer is less than 3 or 4 years old, there's a good chance you won't need this mod. If you have a decent rig but use massive mods like "Sim Settlements" that add their own clutter, this mod can help, especially once your settlements upgrade. 

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Does this mess up the new "Weapon Debris" feature added for [b]NVIDIA (PhysX/FleX)[/b] users in patch 1.3.x?[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8][b]A:[/b][/color] Absolutely not. Your weapons will still generate real time debris that can be interacted with. 

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Is this compatible with...?[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8][b]A:[/b][/color] Probably. This mod doesn't actually delete anything so there's no chance of CTD.

[b][color=#b6d7a8]Q:[/color][/b] [color=#fce5cd]Can you provide me with a wall of text explaining EVERYTHING?[/color]
[b][color=#b6d7a8]A:[/color] [/b]Those little rocks, twigs, bits of concrete, and piles of rubble in the screenshots aren't physical objects in the game world. It's actually [url=http://www.creationkit.com/Grass]GRASS[/url] that's generated on the fly using [url=http://i.imgur.com/1HGfDY0.jpg]PARAMETERS[/url][url=http://i.imgur.com/tLekmPt.jpg] [/url]initialized when you launch the game. I'm essentially removing 1/4 of all the grass you don't see to try and net older systems a few additional FPS. 

You won't CTD because I didn't break precombines, swap any meshes or delete any references. Even if another mod uses junk I removed, the engine will still have all the necessary information to attempt to draw that junk at a density of 0. 

In the eyes of the engine it's all just grass to be processed, but to our human eyes it's grass mixed with a ton of insignificant objects. Objects that will no longer exist once you activate this esp.[/font]
modInfo.name: Insignificant Object Remover
modInfo.summary: Safely removes insignificant objects to improve performance without visual degradation.

fileInfo.description:
Workshop Plus - Main Mod File


Patch 1.0.10b - Fixes the MCM config file which was causing issues with hotkeys.
fileInfo.name: Workshop Plus

modInfo.author: kinggath
modInfo.description:
TLDR; Placing down full buildings or creating a bed from cigarette wrappers isn't realistic or immersive anyway, so let's go all out and turn this into a proper tool.  Workshop Mode becomes more like a creative tool, letting you move around freely and take advantage of tons of hotkeys to enhance your building experience.

[center][youtube]oAwOu3hIvAU[/youtube][/center]



[b]Requires: [/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/35004]Workshop Framework [/url][b]

[/b]Some Features Require: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497]Mod Configuration Menu[/url][b]﻿*

[/b]* You can use some features without MCM - but it is highly recommended due to the hotkey system it provides.


[size=5]Features[/size]

[list]
[*][size=3]Freedom of movement without the pains of tcl[/size]
[*][size=3]Autosave feature so you don't forget to save in WS mode[/size]
[*][size=3]Undo/Redo hotkeys[/size]
[*][size=3]Cloning tools - clone single pieces or entire portions of your design[/size]
[*][size=3]Layers to offer complete control over your designs[/size]
[*][size=3]Blueprint your layers and build copies of them in any settlement[/size]
[*][size=3]Free Build Mode without tgm to bypass perks and ignore resource costs[/size]
[*][size=3]Tracking system to activate settlers or workshop items and find the owned items or owner, respectively[/size]
[/list][size=3]

Now open source! If you'd like to contribute to the mod or get some ideas of how you can tap into Workshop Framework (which was used as the foundation for WS+) head to the [url=https://github.com/kinggath/Workshop-Plus]Github repository[/url]﻿![/size]
[size=4]
God Simulator[/size]

Workshop Plus will turn you into an invisible hand in the game world [b]while you are in workshop mode[/b]. All of the options below can be turned off.

- [b]Flight[/b]: You actually fly while in Workshop Mode, no tcl necessary. This means you can still interact with things over and over without having to toggle tcl on and off.

- [b]Super Speed[/b]: You move incredibly fast while in Workshop Mode, to quickly get to the sections of the settlement you want to work on. Can be set to +50%, +100%, or +200%.

- [b]Invulnerability[/b]: You won't take damage, or more importantly rads while in Workshop Mode - no more accidental death when working on your settlements.

- [b]Invisibility[/b]: You will be completely ignored by NPCs while in Workshop Mode, so you can focus on your building. This also gives you the power to convert the game into full blown Tower Defense with the appropriate mods.

- [b]Free Build[/b]: No more building materials required to build and bypasses perk requirements on workshop objects (they will still show the lock icon but can be built anyway). This option defaults to OFF because it prevents scrapping from returning resources which would be confusing.


[size=4]Hotkeys (Require MCM)[/size]

- [b]Clone[/b]: Pick up an item, press a key, you have a copy. If you have Place Everywhere, this even works with things you don't have construction records for - that means you can clone every item in the game, even normally scrap only things, or props and buildings from Sim Settlements!

- [b]Undo/Redo[/b]: Over 1000 levels of undo support! Set up hotkeys and you can undo movements, placements, and scrapping with the press of a button. 

﻿Notes on Undo/Redo 
﻿  ﻿- If you undo the movement of a wired object, the wire will still be where it was when you moved the object - you'll need to reattach the wire yourself - but the power will still run even if you don't.
﻿ ﻿- Each time you enter a new settlement, your undo history is cleared.


[size=4]Layers[/size]

Layers allow you to separate items and quickly hide or even duplicate them! This gives you the power of programs like Photoshop in your settlement.

- [b]Multiple Layers[/b]: Up to 16 layers per settlement (1 is the default layer)

- [b]Duplication[/b]: Entire Layers can be duplicated, allowing you to create a structure, make a copy, and then thanks to the toggle Display/Linking move your copy all at once anywhere you want in your settlement!

- [b]Deletion[/b]: Transfer items between layers or even scrap them all in one go!

- [b]Visual HUD[/b]:  [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309]HUDFramework[/url] integration to provide a visual module to help you use the Layers system.

-[b] Toggle Display[/b]: Hide all of the items on a layer instantly, then re-display them again just as quickly.

- [b]Toggle Linking[/b]: Unlinked items won't be picked up by Group Select, so you can separate out your items on to different levels so you can pull out the groups of items you want and move them in a group.

- [b]Highlighting[/b]: Highlighting tools and toggles help you quickly identify which of your items are on a given layer.


[size=4]Workshop Save*[/size]

*While this isn't the holy grail of being able to actually save in workshop mode and avoid having to wait for the transition - it can at least save you some steps and hopefully prevent you from ever losing much work in your design when the game engine decides to crash.

- Automatically exits you from workshop mode, and then puts you back in when it finishes saving.

- Hotkey available with MCM.

- Autosave option allows you to set a certain amount of time in Workshop mode where the game will automatically save.


[size=6]How To Use[/size]

The "God Simulator" things will happen automatically when you enter Workshop Mode. To control the options, either access the MCM menu, or if you aren't using it, go to a Chem Workbench and craft the Workshop Plus Controls holotape under Utility.

To use the Layer system without hotkeys, go to a Chem Workbench and craft the Layer Control Module under Utility. You can Favorite this item and activate it to bring up options.

MCM allows you to use hotkeys in Workshop mode and is definitely the preferred way to control layers - so if you find it obnoxious to jump in and out of Workshop mode to work with layers - grab MCM and set up those hotkeys!


[size=4]The Future

[/size]- Continue to expand on the features available to make Workshop Mode feel more and more like a creative tool.
- Copy layers to other settlements.
- Export layers for importing into different save files.


[size=4]Special Thanks[/size]

The [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/28599]Rise of the Commonwealth[/url] team for constantly bitching about how bad Workshop Mode is, which inspired me to make this! 

Woodfuzzy, Krazyhorse, and Moonbeam for testing the crap out of this so I could feel comfortable releasing it...

modInfo.author: thelonewarrior
modInfo.description:
Tired of a static, predictable game?

This mod changes that

[color=#ff0000][size=5][b][u]Description

[/u][/b]If updating from 1.3 or 1.4 To a newer version, it requires a clean install (remove mod, load game, save game, exit, check new version. play, save game) Failure to do this will break the mod, as a new spawn system is in place[b][u]

[/u][/b][/size][/color][color=rgb(255,255,255)][size=3]This mod adds a number of encounters, based on level as well as when you obtain certain items, for example taking a high tech weapon or rare item may cause some Stalkers to come after you. New enemies will seek you out and try to kill you and can find you no matter where you are and will find ways into your settlement, after all they didn't make it this far without some skills.
Battles will become unpredictable and you will always be watching over your shoulder for the next Maniac who wants to steal what you have as well as random interactions where they are robbing or trying to attack a settlement.


Simply play as normal and eventually someone will come looking for you, be warned, this mod wasn't made to be easy and enemies spawn at high levels even from a new game. Sometimes you will have to just run, but they wont give up their pursuit once they see your loot.


The aim is to be a realistic mod and may sometimes appear unbalanced as a result 

When resting, enemies that are currently looking for you may catch up and appear when you wake.

[/size][/color][color=#ff0000][size=5][b][u]New enemy types:
[/u][/b][/size][/color][color=rgb(255,255,255)][size=3][b]
[/b][u]Bandits [/u]
The most common type of enemy, they want your stuff. They use anything from Melee to high level rifles and will chase you down.
They have good gear and powerful weapons, and know how to handle a firefight

[u]Cannibals[/u]
Looking to cut your flesh away and eat it, they are recognised by their poor appearance of rags, may carry guns or melee. The weakest of the new enemies they are easy to shoot down but have been known to easily sneak up on people.

[u][b]Maniacs[/b][/u]
[/size][/color]
[size=3]Men and women driven insane by radiation, they are crazy blood seeking murderers. They prefer melee weapons such as rippers and sledgehammers, but don't be fooled. Due to their insane nature they have a 30% increased running speed and attack speed and wont give up easily

[/size][u][b][size=3]Addicts

[/size][/b][/u][size=3]Looking for their next fix, they are fuelled with buffout, med X and any other number of drugs. They have over double the health pool of all the other classes and feel no pain, relentlessly attacking their enemy to get those precious chems[/size]

[b][u][b][u][size=3]Trackers[/size][/u][/b][/u][/b]

[size=3]Not as[/size] [size=3]combat savy as the rest of the classes, but they have perception of 10. Meaning they are almost impossible to hide from. They are tasked by their Bandit group to find new targets and hunt them down, they have also been known to call in reinforcements if they cant take down their target

[b][u]Stalkers[/u][/b]

Carrying advanced tech, these enemies are rare but use stealth tech to hide and ambush you, if you take high tech items (such as an advanced alien weapon) these enemies will seek you out. They are rare, but cannot be targeted in vats, are almost invisible and use high tech grenades and laser weapons

[b][u]Hunter Killers[/u][/b]

Highly dangerous cyborgs, they were once escaped synths but something went wrong. They have upgraded themselves and they only spawn at high player levels. Very tough, high tech weapons and don't give up. Will hunt you down and destroy everything in their path to kill you

[b][u]Titans[/u][/b]
Power armour using bandits, they are the best of the best, even stronger than the boss classes of the human bandits. Very tough, but still use raider weapons. And they are still human, spawn at mid to high level players


[/size][size=5][u][b]Bosses[/b][/u][/size]
[size=3]Each class also has a few bosses that may spawn at higher levels, however these are extremely rare. Just be warned, they have survived a long time in the wastes and have acquired some high level tech[/size]

[color=#ff0000][size=5][u][b]How to play this mod
[/b][/u][/size][/color][size=3]This mod doesn't require a new game, but some of the enemy spawns work when the player levels up (level 3 to level 80)


For example: Attacking a raider dungeon may trigger a few bandits coming after you to get revenge, they will spawn far away and then may take anything from a few minutes to and hour to find you on the map

 Be careful when resting as they may ambush you when you wake up

[/size][color=#ff0000][size=5][u][b]Installation
[/b][/u][/size][/color][size=3]Simple file, place in Data Folder
[/size]

[u][b][color=#00ff00][size=5]Permissions
[/size][/color][/b][/u]
Do not upload this anywhere else and do not edit and upload unless I give permission, if you are just translating it that's allowed just let me know 

[b][u][color=#ff0000][size=5]Known bugs[/size][/color][/u][/b]

1. Do not use the 'kill all' command in the command console, this will break the mod, even If you cant see any enemies around.

2. Sometimes killing an enemy, loading a earlier save and playing again will cause them to never spawn again, unknown why3

3. IMPORTANT, I suggest you turn off sleeping in survival mode and do no rest, as enemies will tend to fast travel to you, this is not intended
modInfo.name: No Place is Safe - Hunted Encounters
modInfo.summary: Bandits want what you have, Drug Addicts want your chems and plain crazy cannibals will hunt you for your meat. Enemies will now seek you out, no matter where you try and hide, bandits will attempt to rob or kill people in populated areas too

fileInfo.name: Fast Corpse Despawn

modInfo.author: Ghostfc3s
modInfo.description:
[size=3]I highly recommend using this towards end game or game saves in which you have been playing a long long time or on survival play through to help combat save bloat. 

Q: What is save bloat?
A: In open world games were everything is moveable the game needs to create a record of that move. For example your in a fire fight and you miss and hit a beer bottle sending it flying. The game with then keep a record where that bottle landed so the next time you enter that cell it will still be there that record is save until there is a cell reset. Every time you build something in your settlement it keeps a record of that. ANNNNDDDD every time you kill something it keeps a record of that. F04 has built in scrubbers to remove dead bodies and cell change records after a period of time. Default is 24 ingame hours for bodies and Cells (world spaces) for non survival is 7 in day games survival is 80 I believe.
As the f04 builds records of all your activities the save file gets larger and larger.  If you have modified time scale and respawn/cell reset mods, save times get even larger.  I use Zombie Walkers mod which is always spawning zombies, (or if you use fo4 76 mod) you will end up with alot of dead bodies quickly resulting in long save time + 3-5 minutes per save. With this activated my save time drops down to under 5 seconds. 

My current save is 2400 hours survival with large settlement builds time scale at 10 and zombie mods, ﻿with this activated my save time drops to under 5 seconds for hard saves.  The only downside is to make sure you loot bodies right away.



This mod is light weight and only changes the iHoursToClearCorpses from 24 hours to 1.

How to use, Install with nmm or Manual install. I suggest dropping it at the bottom of the load order to fight dirty edits. Activate it. Go to a interior cell wait 2 hours then save. When you return to cells that you have previously had engaged in combat and left piles of dead bodies they will now be gone.   

For the change to be effective you must leave the cell wait 2  in Game Hours. If you return before 1 ingame hour is up, fo4 will reset the timer and the bodies will remain.

I included a txt/bat file in the zip archive for people not wanting to increase there mod list. 

Drop the .txt file into your main fo4 directory (not your data directory) start the game open the console type Bat corpse it will activate. You should only need to run it once for a play through. However if it does rest on you just run the bat again. 

To check type ﻿﻿getgs ihourstoclearcorpses and it will show you the value.


 [/size][size=6]Links to GHOST FC3S's other projects[/size]

fileInfo.description: Main File.
fileInfo.name: Game Configuration Menu

modInfo.author: Zzyxzz
modInfo.description:
[center]
﻿[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img][/center]
[b][size=4]What is GCM?[/size][/b]

GCM allows you easily set many game settings without the need of additional ESPs or console commands.

[size=4][b]What can not be changed?[/b][/size]
[size=3]Survival settings (Hunger, Thirst, Fatigue, Sleep, Diseases etc.)
As survival has been added as a brand new script based system by Bethesda, it has been excluded from this mod and released as a standalone mod.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37599]Survival Configuration Menu[/url]
Features a brand new eat and drink system, which relies on weight of the item instead of the caps value and allows you to control it. In addition to that, you can tweak many aspects of the survival added features. Like tweaking disease chance, disabling adrenaline. Choose how long you can maximally sleep on the different bet types. And more.[/size]

[size=4][b]What can be changed?[/b][/size]
There are a lot of settings within the game, this mod does not cover all. This mod will be updated over time and new settings will be added.
Right now the following categories exist to give you an idea:


[b]Barter -[/b]
(buy and sell settings)

[b]Character -[/b]
(Adjust character attributes and formulas)

[b]DLC - [/b]
(Covers only Automatron right now: Disable robot encounters, adjust chances, etc.)

[b]Difficulty - [/b]
(Change the difficutly of each difficutly setting on the fly!)

[b]Experience -[/b]
(Change the exp gain from crafting)

[b]Gameworld -[/b]
(Respawn settings)

[b]Legendary -[/b]
(Adjust legendary chances/spawn rate)

[b]NPCs -[/b]
(Adjust bonus health of NPCs, adjust throw frequency of stuff/explosives, disable the spidy sense dodge)
[b]
Quests & Factions -[/b]
(Covers only BoS for now. Adjust quest item chances and reward amount, unlock railroad armor mods)

[b]Power Armor -[/b]
(Power drain settings, durability settings and settings for the jetpack)

[b]Random Encounter -[/b]
(Disable random encounters, adjust frequency, set level conditions etc.)

[b]Skills -[/b]
(Pickpocket max chance, Hacking settings to set the number of words, lockpick settings)

[b]Sneak -[/b]
(Sneak damage multiplier, reverse pickpocket, detection settings)

[b]Sound -[/b]
(Settings to allow you to disable combat music or tweak it)

[b]Time -[/b]
(Timescale, gamehour, fast travel speed)

[b]VATS -[/b]
(VATS activation distance[can be used to disable VATS!], timeslow, damage reduction)

[b]Visual Settings -[/b]
(Gun shells lifetime, debri amount, ironsight blur)

[b]Weather -[/b]
(Change weathers)

[b]Workshop -[/b]
(Adjust powerline length)



[b][size=5]Future plans:[/size][/b]
-Add more game settings
-Add one button configurations
-Save configs and share them with others


You know helpful game settings, that should be added? Write a comment or send me a message!


[b][size=4]My Other Mods:[/size][/b]

[size=4][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815]Better Locational Damage[/url]
[/size][size=4]Most realistic damage overhaul you'll find on the whole nexus. Promised.
Features: Scripted headshots, scripted dismemberment, bleedings, stagger ,stab
your enemies from behind, Shotgun knockback and more! Balanced melee and
range combat. Settings holotape available to tweak features to your
liking or completely disable them!

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13193]Give me that bottle[/url]
Ever wondered that you drink a beer for example and the bottle is magically gone? With the new survival mode you could use the bottle to
get some water! But how to get this bottle!? Give Me That Bottle fixes
that and gives a bottle in return! This mod adds new water bottles and
cooking recipes to turn your dirty water into purified water

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3648]Better Explosives[/url]
Better Explosives overhauls explosives in Fallout 4.
The aim of this mod is to make explosives deadly, more fun and make them differ from each other.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7515]Better Power Armor[/url]﻿
Your Power Armor will now fully absorb the damage of ballistic and laser weapon types.
Each armor part will work individually and absorb the damage of the bodypart it covers.
When one power armor part breaks, only this bodypart that was covered will take damage.
Keep your power armor in a good state and it will protect you.


[center][size=5][b]Want to support me?
[/b]
[/size]
[url=https://www.patreon.com/Zzyxzz][/url][url=https://www.patreon.com/Zzyxzz][img]https://i.imgur.com/kjUWbXi.png[/img]﻿[/url]﻿

[url=https://ko-fi.com/zzyxzz][img]https://i.imgur.com/thNBDs3.png[/img]﻿[/url]﻿
[url=https://discord.gg/bBMDQUfuMu][/url][url=https://discord.gg/bBMDQUfuMu][img]https://i.imgur.com/xsWPvks.png[/img][/url]﻿﻿[/center] [/size]

fileInfo.description: The framework. This is the main file.
fileInfo.name: HUDFramework 1.0f

modInfo.author: registrator2000
modInfo.description:
[size=15][font=Courier New]HUDFramework[/font][/size]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ ABOUT ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

HUDFramework is a UI framework that makes it possible for mods to add new UI elements to the HUD in a conflict-free way.

Stats, time, widgets... and more! Welcome to a new world of UI modding.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ DETAILS ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Previously, any mod modifying the HUD would necessarily overwrite and conflict with every other HUD mod. HUDFramework solves this by dynamically loading individual interface mods into the HUD at runtime. It gives modders the tools to load custom widgets and communicate with their widgets.

Note that you need to have a mod installed that uses the framework to see any widgets! If you're looking for HUDFramework mods to install, there's a list on the sticky in the Comments section.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ INSTALLATION ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

1. Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder.
2. Activate HUDFramework.esm in your mod manager, or via the Mods menu.

Note: If you receive a message about overwriting HUDMenu.swf, then you have an existing UI mod installed. To use both together, you can inject HUDFramework into the other mod using the HUDFramework auto-patcher. See the Compatibility section.

[line]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ FEATURES (for mod authors) ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*][b]Create HUD widgets[/b] and modify existing UI elements on-the-fly via a Papyrus interface.
[*][b]Write AS3 expressions[/b] directly within Papyrus and have them dynamically evaluated in Scaleform.
[*][b]One framework[/b] for both PC and console. HUDFramework benefits from, but does not require F4SE - you can bring your UI mods to consoles.
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ USAGE EXAMPLES ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Retrieving a reference to HUDFramework:
➲ [size=1][i][code]HUDFramework hud = HUDFramework.GetInstance()[/code][/i][/size]

Load UI Widget:
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.RegisterWidget(Self, "MyWidget.swf", 100, 100)[/code][/i][/size]
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.LoadWidget("MyWidget.swf")[/code][/i][/size]

Communicate with UI widget:
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.SendMessage("MyWidget.swf", UpdateResourceBar, 100)[/code][/i][/size]

Show/hide compass:
➲ [size=1][i][code]hud.Eval("hud.BottomCenterGroup_mc.CompassWidget_mc.visible = false;")[/code][/i][/size]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ WHAT'S POSSIBLE ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*]On screen clock showing in-game/real time
[*]Companion status widget (view health and stats)
[*]Survival stats widget (hunger, sleep, thirst)
[*]Custom crit meter outside VATS
[*]Weapon wheel
[*]Companion wheel
[*]Custom crosshair
[*]Hide specific UI elements
[*]Quest-specific UI elements, such as a radar, minimap, or a timer counting down to detonation
[*]...and more!
[/list]
If you want to see more examples of what is possible with UI mods, see the supported modlists for UI frameworks for previous Fallout games.

[line]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ COMPATIBILITY ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

A DEF_UI patch is provided in the Files section.
If you are using any other mod that replaces HUDMenu.swf, you should merge HUDFramework with the other mod's HUDMenu.swf. This is an automated process - the HUDFramework Auto-Patcher is able to automatically inject HUDFramework into any HUDMenu.swf. [i](In fact, this release itself is an auto-patch on the vanilla HUDMenu!)[/i] Get the auto-patcher in the Files section - instructions are included in the download.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ CREDITS & ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

BISE Scripting Engine for making dynamic AS3 evaluation possible.
RABCDASM for robust, nondestructive SWF disassembly and assembly.
F4SE for Scaleform logging.
modInfo.name: HUDFramework
modInfo.summary: HUDFramework is a UI framework that makes it possible for mods to add new UI elements to the HUD.

fileInfo.changelog_html:

fileInfo.description: Loot Vision main files.  Always required.
fileInfo.name: Loot Vision v1.1

modInfo.author: Baron
modInfo.description:
[size=5][u]Summar[/u]y[u]:[/u]
[/size]
I like looting.  I frequently lose track of all the corpses I create in my adventures which is detrimental to looting.  There are mods out there that highlight corpses, and some also only highlight if the corpse has loot that can be sold for caps but that solution requires you to take EVERYTHING from the corpse that has value (even if it's just 1 caps worth).  If you play in survival you have greatly reduced carry weight which prevents you from taking literally everything which means these solutions don't really work.  So I decided to make a solution of my own.

When using berry mentats, power armor targeting hud, or anything else that grants "detect life" as a feature, slain enemies will highlight orange.  As soon as you investigate the corpse (the second the inventory menu pops up) the orange highlight will disappear.

This effect only applies to enemies killed in game.  It does not show up on corpses that spawn in dead like the dog and wastelander just across the bridge from sanctuary to red rocket.


[size=5][u]Compatibilit[/u]y[u]:[/u]
[/size]
Mods that alter the targeting hud helmet mod for power armor, berry mentats, or the detect life effect will conflict.  I have provided compatibility patches for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8671/]Targeting HUD and Berry Mentats Enhanced[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17374]Horizon[/url].  Choose one or the other as they both override berry mentats.  Install both the main files and the patch file for whichever mod your using.

Special note, it appears to override Horizon's white corpse highlight, even after the corpse is marked as looted.  I'll try to get them to play nice together but I don't really care about corpses I've already looted not highlighting anyways so not a huge priority to me.  Targeting HUD Enhanced on the other hand seems to play both shaders at once so you get blue smoke AND orange smoke which I think is a feature.


[size=5][u]Installin[/u]g[u]/Uninstallin[/u]g[u]:[/u][/size]

Should be safe to install or uninstall whenever.  If you already have targeting hud on your power armor and you're IN your power armor when you load your save for the first time after installing you will have to leave your power armor and re-enter it for the effect to begin.


[size=5][u]Credits:[/u][/size]

I made the shader effect by copying and modifying the base game's detect life shader effect so credit to bethesda for that file.  Also for making a game so easily and readily modifiable.  

I also borrowed inspiration from Targeting hud enhanced so props to Yukichigai, the author, as well.

I used FO4Edit to check compatibility and do general cleanup so credit should be given to the FO4Edit team.  A lot of this stuff wouldn't be possible without them.



Thanks and enjoy!
modInfo.name: Loot Vision - Highlight Unlooted Corpses
modInfo.summary: When using power armor targeting hud or berry mentats, slain enemy corpses will highlight orange.  Accessing their inventory will make the orange highlight disappear.

fileInfo.description: Small batch file to update f4se on your pcs
fileInfo.name: Fallout 4 Script Extender Updater

modInfo.author: crosenblum
modInfo.description:
Tired of having to manually check for latest versions of F4SE, to download and extract to your Fallout 4 folder?

I was too, I wanted to automate it, so that it can be set as a scheduled task once a month or run as needed.

This is a batch file, but requires the following programs to be run effectively:

Wget is a command-line website downloader, parser, etc
http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/wget.htm
https://eternallybored.org/misc/wget/
Or if you use Chocolatey as I do. you can install that from here.
https://chocolatey.org/packages/Wget

This also requires the installation of 7zip. Which you can get from the following sites
http://www.7-zip.org/download.html
or
https://chocolatey.org/packages/7zip

Once you have those installed, you need to modify the folder paths inside the batch file to point to the correct folders for each required file and for Fallout 4 itself.

There is also a logging feature, if you wish to enable it to help diagnose any issues this batch file may have.
modInfo.name: Fallout 4 Script Extender Updater
modInfo.summary:
Tired of having to manually check for latest versions of F4SE, to download and extract to your Fallout 4 folder?

I was too, I wanted to automate it, so that it can be set as a scheduled task once a month or run as needed. This is a simple but useful batch file to help automate the mundane process

fileInfo.changelog_html:
Fixed the elevated left curved conveyor movement direction.
Fixed theWSE patch to change all the misc mods to use the ModCrate nif model not the modbox.nif due to the issues with that nif model blocking conveyor lines
Reduced the scrap out for the ammo scrapper. I felt is was too much compared to average build recipe.
Added in Hans's Lef Sorter nif model to fix the conveyor issue. Now the sorting conveyor moves in the correct direction Thanks again Hans!
Fixed the ammo builder bug in the builder script for too many output items when the builder amount was changed in the holo tape.
Changed the WEaponsmith Ammo Component builder to create the actual components making it easier to use. Meaning primers and gunpowder come directly out of the machine ready to be used.
Changed the way the Casings kit work to be more useful. Now they will create 1000 of a specific selected case in the inventory.
Two separate kits. One for shotgun ammo one for standard brass ammo.
Adjusted the Casings Ammo Kit recipe to reflect the amount of casings recieved.
Added items to the terminal display to display locked recipes with missing perks requirements. This effectively un-hides locked recipes and allows users to see what perks are required.
fileInfo.description: The standard version of Better Manufacturing.
fileInfo.name: Better Manufacturing

modInfo.author: Wrathmaniac
modInfo.description:
[u][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#00ff00][size=6]Welcome to Better Manufacturing![/size][/color][/font]
[/u]
[size=5]This mod adds a TON of stuff for manufacturing! New builders, scrapping machines, item extractors, conveyor pieces, lifts, and general improvements to help you setup the ultimate Fallout 4 factory! [/size]

[size=3]I [/size][b]strongly [/b][size=3]recommend [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15429]Manufacturing Extended[/url][size=3] in Tandem with Better Manufacturing. Kenington did an amazing job and added some really cool stuff. Better Manufacturing was designed around anything MISSED by the Contraptions DLC or Manufacturing Extended, [/size][u]NOT[/u][size=3] as a replacement.[/size]

[size=5]If you like Better Manufacturing please endorse. It will help other people find it too. :)[/size]

[size=5]============================[/size]

[b][color=#3d85c6][i][size=5][u]New Devices[/u]

[/size][size=3]========================[/size]
[u][size=5]Extractors:
[/size][/u][/i][/color]
[/b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Component Extractor[/color][b][color=#3c78d8] Only Linked[/color] [/b]
[/b][/size][b][size=2]Breaks down junk from the workshop's inventory, then outputs components onto its conveyor belt. You can specify which components to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines and when toggled only pulls from those linked settlements.[/size][/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Object Extractor [b]Only Linked [/b][/color]
[/b][/size][b][size=2]Pulls items from the workshop. You can specify which items to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines and when toggled only pulls from those linked settlements.

[/size][/b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Type Extractor[/color]
[/b][/size][b][size=2][b][size=2]Adds a brand new type extractor! That's right a "Type" Extractor! Put an object of a certain type in and this baby pulls all objects of that type out of the local workbench onto a conveyor. Pretty cool eh? [b][size=2][b][size=2][color=#00ff00]WARNING[/color][/size][/b][/size][/b] [color=#00ff00]MUST READ: This Machine required a very heavy operation involving the Workbench Inventory (One of the reasons it does not link). Because of that the machine actually LOCKS the workbench when powered on and running a SEARCH. If you attempt to access the inventory while it's processing all items will "Appear" to be missing. They are not, the workbench is just locked. [b][size=2][b][size=2][color=#00ff00]You will also be unable to access the building menu during that time.[/color][/size][/b][/size][/b] I recommend one per settlement max (trust me, that's all you need). There is a setting in the holotape that will "shut down" the extractor and prevent any more searches until reactivated.[/color][/size][/b][/size][/b][b][color=#3c78d8][b][color=#3d85c6][i]
[size=3]========================[/size]
[u][size=5]Scrappers:[/size][/u][/i][/color][/b][u][size=5]
[/size][/u]
[size=4]Weapon Disassembler[/size][/color]
[/b][b]Removes/scraps mods from a weapon and [/b][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]the weapon to scrap components, I.E. Steel, Screws Ect. Can also scrap explosives![/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Armor Disassembler[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Removes/scraps [/b][b]mods[/b][b] from armor or power armor and [/b][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]the armor to scrap components, I.E. Steel, Screws Ect.[/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Mod Scrapper[/color]
[/b][/size][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]loose mods to scrap components, I.E. Steel, Screws Ect. DISCLAIMER: The mod scrapper has a UI bug where it only shows 2 of the required perks. There is a third perk "Scrapper 2" that is needed to unlock the machine.[/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Ammo Scrapper[/color]
[/b][/size][color=#00ffff][u]SCRAPS[/u] [/color][b]ammo down to[/b][b] scrap components. Amount configurable in a connected terminal. Options for 25, 50, 75, and 100. I.E. Steel, Lead Ect. NOT-RECOMMENDED AMMO: Gamma, Flamer Fuel, Fusion Cells

[b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Body Decomposer[/color]
[/b][/size][b][b][b][b]Only in manufacturing extended patch! [/b][/b][/b]Basically just the butcher and robot disassembler from Manufacturing Extended combined. Also comes in the Large Hopper variety. You know the one with the BIG open top. Nice suggestion [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2398140]Zeroteg[/url]! [/b][/b][b][color=#3c78d8][b][color=#3d85c6][i][size=3]
========================[/size]
[u][size=5]New Builders: [/size][/u][/i][/color][/b][u][size=5]
[/size][/u][/color][/b][/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Full Suit Armor Forge[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Builds full suits of armor instead of one piece at a time. Includes all vanilla armor and power armor. The recipes have been increased significantly. A one in all machine that removes the tedious procedure of building armor pieces one at a time.[/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Chem Building Machines[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Two machines that build chems. A Drug Builder and a Chem Utility Builder. Between the two, builds Addictol to X-Cell. Machines and recipes come with appropriate perks.[/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Ammo Component Builder[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Only in the Weaponsmith Extended Patch! Adds new Ammo Component Builder that builds all WSE ammo components and two BM casing kits. The kits are ingestible items that give you weaponsmith bullet casings. When used the ingestible allows you to select a casing from your inventory and  create 1000 casings of the type selected.[/b]

[b][b][b][b][color=#3d85c6][i][color=#3c78d8][size=4]========================[/size][/color]
[size=5][color=#3c78d8][u]General Contraptions Improvements:[/u][/color][color=#3c78d8] [/color][/size][/i][/color][/b][/b][/b][/b][size=5]
[/size]
[b]
[color=#3c78d8][size=4]Workshop Menu Organization[/size][/color]
[color=#f4f4f4][size=2]Completely reorganized the building menu for Manufacturing objects. Now manufacturing objects are split into further categories making them easier to find and build.[/size][/color]

[color=#3c78d8][size=4]Builder [/size][/color][/b][color=#3c78d8][size=4][b]Improvements[/b][/size][/color]
[b]With the new Better Manufacturing Holotape builders have quite a few new features that gives you whole new ways to setup your building. You can adjust the amount of recipes a builder will output, options for 1, 2, 5, and 10 items at once. There is also a new Cycle feature allowing you to change all builders to be on a cycle rather than one selected recipe. They can also be set to a "Power-Off" state that pushes any items out of their inventory and halts building.[/b]
[color=#3c78d8][size=4]
[b]Better (Faster) Hoppers[/b][/size][/color][b]
Vacuum hopper pulls components from stored containers much faster than the standard one.  Can be changed in a linked terminal to select the amount of components pulled each cycle. [b]Large hoppers are also affected by Hopper Terminal settings.[/b][/b]
[size=4] [/size]
[size=4][color=#3c78d8][b]Converging Conveyors[/b][/color][color=#3c78d8][b]
[/b][/color][/size][size=2][b]Now with all necessary Converging Conveyors by  [/b][url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/2308173-hans199/]hans199[/url][b]! That includes Left/Right C turns, a wire fence to help keep objects on conveyors and converging straight belts. Thank you hans! Please go endorse his mod as well! Full details [/b][u][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#00ff00][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16007]here[/url]﻿.[/color][/font][/u][b]  [/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
"Y" Branch Joining Conveyors[/color]
[/b][/size][b]New Conveyor Belt Y Joiners to combine conveyor lines. In vanilla you could split lines and with these you can reconnect them.[/b][b]Two for directions Left and Right, one elevated, one on the floor. [/b][/size]

[size=4][color=#3c78d8][b]Conveyor Belt [/b][/color][color=#3c78d8][b]Improvements[/b][/color]
[/size][b]Includes the ability to modify the speed and direction of all basic conveyor belts at a linked terminal. However, if you are having bugs my first suggestion is to store and replace the belt and/or connected terminal. I have noticed issues with already placed conveyor belts. [/b]

[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]Upwards Conveyor Belt[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Belts that go up! I can't believe this wasn't added in vanilla. Goes well with the speed increase to get stuff up them. A little buggy but they work. [/b]
[size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Downward Lifts & Lift Improvement[/color]
[/b][/size][b]Lifts that take items from the top and move them to the bottom effectively taking items down floors. Two for each direction (forward, backward. left and right), one elevated, one on the floor. All lifts are improved and move items much quicker.[b][b][b][b][b]
[b][size=4][b][color=#3c78d8]
Left Facing Sorters & Type Sorter
[/color][/b][/size][b][size=2]Left facing sorters for when you want to go, you know, left...... One for each flavor, regular, components, or by type. The type extractor by  [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2652197]steamcanuck[/url], Thank you steamcanuck! Please go endorse his mod as well! Full details [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16966]here[/url]﻿.[/size][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][b][b][u][i][size=5]

[color=#ff7700]New Fat Dynamic with Constructable items [/color][/size][/i][/u][/b][/b][size=2]

[size=2][b]Completely Optional! The feature can be turned on in the Better Manufacturing holotape. Animal Fat can only be found on Dead Animals and through butchery if you have Manufacturing Extended. [/b][/size][b]Adds new recipes to the Chem station and a new Component Animal Fat. Some new recipes are the Blood Draw Kit, Acid Bottle, Ballistic Fiber Roll, Antiseptic Bottle, Large Oil Can and Leather roll. 
Note: It is possible to turn on fat through console. To do that you need to change two Global Variables. [/b][/size][b][left]To find the Globs its "help fat 3"
To make it active you need to set both values. The fat chance value is in reverse, this is very important! It is chance for none. So 100 is 100% chance there is none and 0 is a 0% chance there is none.
The commands are:
set GLOB_BM_Fat_Active to 1
set GLOB_BM_Fat_Chance_Val to 0[/left][/b][size=2][b]
[/b][/size]
[size=4]============================[/size]

[/size]
[size=4]This mod is inspired by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/1179663]Kentington[/url] author of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15429]Manufacturing Extended[/url]. Special thanks Kenington![/size]

[size=4]Special thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2652197]steamcanuck[/url] for allowing me to include his mod, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16966]Equipment Sorter[/url]! Please go endorse his mod as well.
[/size]
[size=4]Special thanks to [/size][b][size=4] [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/2308173-hans199/]hans199[/url] [/size][/b][size=4]for allowing me to include his mod, [/size][u][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#00ff00][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16007][size=4]Converging Conveyors[/size][/url][/color][/font][/u][size=4]! Please go endorse his mod as well.[/size]

[size=4]Also, video making is not my strong suit. I'd love to add a video showcasing Better Manufacturing and will eventually. If there is someone who is willing to do that I would be extremely grateful. Please message me if you are interested![/size]

ME: To the nexus community and all my supporters I want to say thank you! The community is astounding! Your feedback, suggestions and general attitude helped shaped Better Manufacturing to the mod it is today. Knowing that my mod is liked and appreciated makes it worth it!  I may reopen this mod with some of the excellent suggestions I have been receiving, so keep it up! 


[b]==========================================[/b]

[b][u][size=5]General Warnings:[/size][/u]
[/b]
[size=5]Must have [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url] installed. If you are having trouble there are many youtube videos out there to assist you.[/size]

[size=5]Must have Automatron, Nuka World, Far Harbor and of course Contraptions DLCs installed! [/size]

[size=5]As with any mod on the Nexus, I suggest you backup a save before testing any new mod. The usual location is C:\Users\"YourUsername"\Documents\My Games\Fallout4\Saves .[/size]
[b][u][size=5]
[/size][/u][/b][b][size=4]==============================
[/size][u]Compatibility:[/u][/b]
[size=4]
[font=Tahoma][u]Versions 3.0 - 3.2.1:[/u] Minor conflicts with any mods that change, Large Ammo Types, and MISC Object Weapon/Armor [u]mods[/u]. If there are any mods that you want a patch for please don't hesitate to ask.[/font][/size]

[size=4]============================[/size]
[size=5][u][b]Version Update Warnings:[/b][/u][/size]
[size=4] 
Fat is off by default and needs to be turned on in the holotape. Fat will NOT disappear if you already have it. This only removes fat from animal drops and hides all constructable items. 

Version 3.0 changes all builder scripts. If you have issues with ANY contraptions machines I suggest you store them into the workshop and replace them.
[/size]
[size=4]============================[/size]
[u][b][size=5]Mods Worth Mentioning
[/size][/b][/u]
[size=4]Check out this [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4042]Legendary Modification mod[/url], it's excellent!

A great mod for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/19317]storing all junk[/url] that goes nicely with hoppers and containers.

A small mod of mine that improves the Loads Caliber Switchers. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27381]Better Loads Switches[/url].[/size]
[b]

==========================================
[size=4][b][b][size=5][u]Future Plans[/u]:[/size][/b][/b]

I am officially done with this mod! If any major issues or bugs pop up I will fix them. Also, suggestions are still welcome! If you have an awesome idea and I like it I may still add to this mod. Cheers! 

If you are looking for a patch for a weapon mod I suggest looking into basic modding yourself. Take a look at this [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/544/?]Article[/url] I wrote explaining how to add weapons to the scrapper correctly. Everything else should scrap without conflicts unless the Mod Author did not tag them with the vanilla keywords.
[/size][/b]

[b]==========================================
[/b]

[/color][/u]
[color=#00ffff][size=4][u][color=#ffff00]All versions below 2.0.4[/color][/u][color=#ffff00][u] :[/u] I recommend you read through the Version notes in Yellow below. There was a major bug in the disassemblers and scrappers that you need to be aware of. [/color]

[u]Versions 1.5 - 1.9.4:[/u] I highly recommend you update to later versions! See version log in Light Blue and message below for more info.[/size]
[/color][size=2]
[size=2][size=2]v.3.3- Bug fixes, tweaks, and new features
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Fixed the WSE patch to change all the misc mods to use the ModCrate nif model not the modbox.nif due to the issues with that nif model blocking conveyor lines[/size]
[*][size=2]Reduced the scrap out for the ammo scrapper. I felt is was too much compared to average build recipe.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added in Hans's Lef Sorter nif model to fix the conveyor issue. Now the sorting conveyor moves in the correct direction Thanks again Hans![/size]
[*][size=2]Fixed the ammo builder bug in the builder script for too many output items when the builder amount was changed in the holo tape.[/size]
[*][size=2]Changed the Weaponsmith Ammo Component builder to create the actual components making it easier to use. Meaning primers and gunpowder come directly out of the machine ready to be used.[/size]
[*][size=2]Changed the way the Casings kit work to be more useful. Now they will create 1000 of a specific selected case in the inventory[/size]
[*][size=2]Two separate kits. One for shotgun ammo one for standard brass ammo.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adjusted the Casings Ammo Kit recipe to reflect the amount of casings received.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added items to the terminal display to display locked recipes with missing perks requirements. This effectively un-hides locked recipes and allows users to see what perks are missing.[/size]
[/list]v.3.2.1- Menu Organization Option and new Patch
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Added in the menu organization as an option in the installer. This will fix any compatibility issues with other manufacturing mods.[/size]
[*][size=2]Also adds another patch for Crafting Framework.[/size]
[/list]v.3.2- New features, requirement changes, and small tweaks
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Removed the AWKCR dependency! I was able to accomplish the scrapping with just vanilla keywords on items.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adjusted the Constructable Objects recipes to use 1 less Purified Water.[/size]
[*][size=2]Removed unneeded references from esp.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added new help item in the Holotape for Object Extractor-Only linked to help Users understand exactly what it does.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a new setting to the Holotape for builders to "Turn-Off" building and output inventory. This is so users can effectively empty the Builders of components and objects.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a new Setting to the Holotape to "Turn-Off" Component/Object Only-Linked extractors. This goes nicely with the builder "Turn-off" function. WARNING: Does not work with Manufacturing Extended Component/Object Extractors![/size]
[*][size=2]Merged in Converging Conveyors. Thanks Hans119![/size]
[*][size=2]Added more organization to the conveyors. After adding in converging conveyors the menu ingame seemed cumbersome. Now there are 4 categories in conveyors. Elevated, floor, Lifts, Misc.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.3.1- Bug fixes, increased code stability, and some new patches[/size]
[list]
[*][size=2] Completely, fixed the Armor and Disassembler slow down issue. Now the machines will function just like the mod scrapper and ammo recyler outputting many components quickly. [/size]
[*][size=2]Made all builders more reliable when outputting large items. For some reason even the DLC was missing the necessary pieces of information to properly handle outputting large items. Now the builders will check the LargeItemFormList and output items appropriately. Also added a delay for building large items to prevent items from being thrown.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added better checking in the disassembler code to prevent papyrus errors. Also changed the way the disassemblers disposed of items. Now it is using a much more reliable method of removal and deletion of objects.[/size]
[*][size=2]Took another pass at the Armor FormList to ensure more items are correctly scrapped. With the new Code for the Armor Disassembler it will scrap ANY peice of armor, if the armor is not identified it will provide default scrap.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added Metal, Combat, and Synth helmets to full Armor forge.[/size]
[*][size=2]Modified the response for the cycle turn off to include more information with selected recipes.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a patch to the installer to fix Soylent Green Issues with new BM organization.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a patch for Manufacturing Extended Expanded[/size]
[/list]v.3.0- Large Update with new features and improvements
[list]
[*][size=2]Removed All keywords added to melee weapons and added all Melee weapons through AWKCR keywords meaning there are Absolutely 0 possibilities for weapon conflicts with Better Manufacturing![/size]
[*][size=2]Reworked the Mod scrapper code to be more adaptable. Now uses similar code structure to Weapon and Armor scrapper. Modified the default scrap output for Weapon/Armor mods from other Nexus Mods.[/size]
[*][size=2]Reworked organization of Machines in build menu. No more long scrolls left or right searching for your machine. Now things are better organized for easier building.[/size]
[*][size=2]Ammo recycler now has a terminal link to change the total amount of bullets scrapped at once. Settings for 25, 50, 75, and 100 bullets at a time.[/size]
[*][size=2]With the new Settings holotape Fat is 100% optional! Just make sure to turn it on if you update![/size]
[*][size=2]Animal fat is now injected into the Leveled Lists in a Quest script. Removing any compatibility issues with other mods that change Animals Leveled Lists.[/size]
[*][size=2] Modified fat to appear less often on animals and scale with the extra meat perk.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added a settings holotape: Can be built at Chem Stations and should be added the first time you run the game after install. It has some nice features for manufacturing and the mod.[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: You can change the number of output items for builders.Settings for 1, 2, 5, and 10[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: There is also a new cycle feature for builders. When "on" the cycle will ignore the selected recipe from the terminal and build anything possible from it's list of recipes in a cycle. [/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: Can completely disable the "Fat" feature with build-able items. Effectively removes the "Fat" feature along with the constructable items.[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: Added an option to "Power off" the Type Extractor to help with the workbench being locked.[/size]
[*][size=2]IN HOLOTAPE: Added a general help page[/size]
[*]With this latest update Better Manufacturing is almost Compatibility issue free! Possible Compatability issues: Large Ammo Types, Other DLC Contraptions Overrides, and MISC items for Guns/Armor mods.
[/list]v.2.2.3 - Conflict fixes and small scrap tweaks
[list]

[*][size=2]Changed value to fat to make it so it isn't farmed for caps and used more for crafting.[/size]
[*][size=2]Tweaked Ammo Scrap out to include fertilizer as that is common for explosives and crafting recipes for ammo.[/size]
[/list]v.2.2.2 - Some small user requested changes
[list]
[*][size=2]Changed the in-game description for the Ammo Scrapper, Weapon Disassembler, Faster-Hopper, Drug Builder, Chem/Utility Builder[/size]
[*][size=2]Ensure more simularity to weaponsmith Extended output for ammo types being scrapped. That means Nukes, Missles and regular ammo will be better to scrap in the ammo scrapper and are closer to what users would want/expect.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added crystals to good weapons, mods, and armor output to balance the scrap out.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added the hack to the Weapon and Armor scrapping scripts that pfarthing6 pointed out to speed up the weapon and armor scrappers. Thanks for the Assist pfarthing6![/size]
[/list]v.2.2.1 - Some small user requested changes
[list]
[*][size=2]The weapon and armor scrappers now run on a shorter timer. This change is to speed up the scrapping process (Due to a possible engine error with Papyrus, not as fast as I would like). [/size]
[*][size=2]The main "Better Manufacturing.esp" is not tagged as an esm file and will operate like a standard esp file.[/size]
[*][size=2]Added back the standard Cutting Fluid recipe.[/size]
[*][size=2]All "Gun" weapons no longer require the BM keyword "IsMachineScrapable", making them far less likely to have any conflict with other mods.[/size]
[*][size=2]Made some small fixes to the type extractor to ensure it operates correctly. Ammo did not work correctly so I removed the ability to add that type altogether.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.2 - Huge Patch. Adds quite a bit.
[list]
[*]All disassemblers' scrap output has been adjusted to equalize the new armor scrap output. With the great extent of items it was very tedious to make the scrap out for each specific item. What I did instead was create generic scrap recipes and add randomization to them to add variation to scrapping and balance. Before, weapons and armor all scrapped to very close to normal vanilla scrapping on a workbench WITHOUT any randomization. Now they all have a low chance to double up on certain valuable resources, along with other random balances. 
[*]The Armor Scrapper is now full functional on ALL items in the ARMOR category, that includes clothing, hats. facemasks, ect. I even got all of the armor from ArmorSmith extended since I'm using AWKCR keywords including the Jetpacks and weapon aesthetics! 
[*]Armor pieces will also scrap without a BM keyword, meaning ANY other Mod that adds armor should be compatible with the Disassembler WITHOUT fo4edits (As long as they are tagged with AWKCR keywords or Vanilla Armor Keywords). 
[*][color=#3c78d8]There is now a new Scrapper for Ammo! Due to the complexity of ammo scrapping, I had to add a separate machine. It scraps 25 of ANY ammo at a time, with the exception being large ammo items such as mini nukes. missiles, ect. [/color]
[*]Adds a brand new type extractor! Put an object of a certain type in and this pulls all objects of that type out of the local workbench onto a conveyor.[color=#ff0000] [/color][color=#00ff00]MUST READ: This Object required a very heavy operation involving the Workbench Inventory (One of the reasons this thing does not link). Because of that it actually LOCKS the workbench when this thing runs its search. If you attempt to access the inventory while it's processing all items will "Appear" to be missing. They are not, the workbench is just locked. I recommend one per settlement max (trust me, that's all you need)! [/color]
[*][color=#3c78d8]Adds the Equipment Sorter by steamcanuck.[/color]
[*]I also add Left Facing Sorters (All included)! These things are great and allow you to sort left as well. No more weird factory right only setups, or upward lifts everywhere! I also overwrote the scripts to use the BM Faster Hopper Script and tagged them to the Faster Hopper Terminal. That means they are now linked to your faster hopper terminal settings. 
[*]I noticed downward lifts were not grabbing items correctly due to the Trigger point being too high. This patch fixes those so they have lower trigger points on ALL lifts. 
[*][color=#3c78d8]Combined the Butcher and Robot Disassembler into one machine called the Body Decomposer and added a Large Hopper version as well! You know the one with the Huge Open top to make butchering easier. [/color]
[*]Added a bunch of missing items to the LargeItem Form List from the Contraptions DLC . This is aimed at fixing any hopper and builder when outputting large items. I even added Weaponsmith extended Large Items if you get that patch. 
[/list]v.2.1.3 - Small Bug fixes.[color=#3c78d8] Adds ME Power Armor Kits to the Full Armor Builder[/color]
[list]
[*][u]BUG_FIX:[/u] Fixed the missing component value on Fat Scrap. 
[*]This also significantly reduces the weight of fat scrap. From 10 a pound to 100 a pound. 
[*][color=#3c78d8]Adds the ME Power Armor Frame Kit to the Full Armor Builder.[/color]
[/list]v.2.1.2 - The Real 2.1 Release! Adds improvements to the disassemblers and scrappers. New[color=#3c78d8] Ammo Component Builder[/color]. Small tweaks and fixes.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Another fix to the Dissassemblers and Scrapper. This is the best system yet! With the previous version items would disappear well before they were scrapped. Now, items will only disappear right as they are scrapped, this ensures that the machine works as intended. [/size]
[*][color=#3c78d8][size=2]Ammo Components Builder is added to the Weaponsmith Patch. It creates new Items called "BM Ammo Kits" that on use create casings, primers, and gunpowder. This is a way to automate creating ammo components so you don't have to press "e" a thousand times! ;)[/size][/color]
[*][size=2]Separates the lifts and Hoppers again. Adds the Big Open Top Hopper to the faster vacuum hopper control. Changes the lifts to drop more items per cycle to speed them up. Lifts CANNOT be changed in the terminal.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adds fix for Blood Draw Kit with Valdacil Patch.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.1.1 - Small fixes and some new Addons.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Fixes 2.1 broken installer.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adding small fix to armorsmith patch and manufacturing extended patch. There was some unfixed conflicts.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adding explosives to the Weapon Disassembler Machine! Can now scrap Mines and Grenades. [/size]
[*][size=2]Removes DLC's as an option in the installer. All DLCs are now included.[/size]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=2]Add a new Constructable Object Adhesive Bottle to the Chem station and the Chem Utility Builder.[/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.7 -Finishes the Weaponsmith Extended Patch for v2.382 (2.4 Beta 35)
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Now every weapon in the version above will scrap in the machines.[/size]
[*][size=2]Also changes the keywords used for weapon scrapping with Non-Melee weapons. This patch removes all of the weapon scrap keywords for those weapons as they are not needed.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.6 - Bug fixes. Added terminal configuration support to the lifts. Weaponsmith Extended Patch.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b][u]BUG_FIX[/u][/b]: Fixes the issue where items could be lost if processed through the disassemblers or mod scrapper. I replicated the issue on my end and with this version it is fixed.[/size]
[*][size=2]Adds terminal support to the lifts to help speed them up. It is combined with the faster hopper terminal. Also adds some changes to the nif models to pick up items better. [/size]
[*][size=2]Adds a first swing at weaponsmith extended patch. This first patch really just aims to fix any overwrite issues with the two mods. I plan to add full support in the future. That means that for now ALL new (or mod created) weapons are not supported.[/size]
[*][size=2]Tagged "BetterManufacturing.esp" as an esm.[/size]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.5 - Another update to the Disassemblers and Scrapper scripts.
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b][u]BUG_FIX[/u][/b]: Due to the way papyrus handles removing in arrays the queue would slowly shrink. This was a weird find because I expected Array.remove() to just effectively NULL the element but it actually shortens the array. This patch fixes that.[/size]
[*][size=2]Items can now be added directly into the machines and no longer NEED to be belt fed. [/size]
[*][size=2]In the previous version if the queue was full, any items added afterwards would be added to the machine and pushed out, unscrapped. Now even if the queue fills the items will be processed.[/size]
[*][size=2]Increases the output speed of components to speed up the scrapping process when doing large scrapping jobs. The machines now output 4 components per cycle. [/size]
[/list][size=2][color=#ffff00]v.2.0.4 - Update to the Disassemblers and Scrapper scripts. [/color]
[/size][list]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2][b][u]BUG FIX:[/u] [/b]Fixes bug with Disassemblers and Scrappers where items could be lost if too many items are processed at once. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]After updating I suggest storing and replacing the Disassemblers and Mod Scrapper just in case.[/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]After some testing I discovered a MAJOR issue in the Disassemblers and Scrapper objects. If you setup a conveyor and started pushing items in eventually the queue could fill up and any items pushed before the queue has space will be lost. [/size][/color]
[*][size=2][color=#ffff00]This fix adds a[/color][color=#00ffff] [u]FAIL SAFE[/u][/color][color=#ffff00] to prevent any objects from being lost. That[/color][i] [u][color=#00ffff]FAIL SAFE[/color][/u][/i][color=#ffff00] is that if the Queue is full any items that are pushed through will just be added to the builder and pushed out through the other side unscrapped. [/color][/size]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]I also increased the queue size to max (128 is the Max). That means if objects that SHOULD BE scrapped are not scrapping it is because the machine is full. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]I observed this behavior after running my own objects through in my Local game. [/size][/color]
[*][color=#ffff00][size=2]IF YOU already scrapped all your items it is unlikely you would be able to even observe this behavior and probably thought everything was okay. I apologize for any items lost, I was so busy pushing out changes I did not get a chance to fully test for issues and some slipped through. I suggest you revert saves because you probably lost items. [/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]v.2.0.3 - Fixes the Drug Builder. Adds some new recipes to the Builders.

[*][color=#00ffff][size=2]WARNING: If updating from ANY previous version you must store and replace any and all BM machines. This update moves ALL scripts to a new location causing any and all existing BM (Better Manufacturing) Machines to be broken. That includes conveyors as well. [color=#00ffff]
For a deeper explanation of the problem read notes below:

WARNING: If updating you must store and replace ALL machines in an existing save. If you don't it can cause crashes and bugs as the machines are now using different scripts essentially an the ones already placed have no script to point to. This affects ANY and ALL BM machines and conveyors. I realize the hassle this presents and I apologize. These are things I am just now learning. 

If you downloaded any versions 1.5 - 1.9.4 you have a potential for problems with conveyors and builders that had more than 16 recipes. You will probably not see any immediate issues and maybe none at all but it is bad practice to overwrite a Vanilla Script and use that instead of creating your own script. The reason is that it introduces multiple versions  of the same script in your deploy directory. One in the BA2 file and one in Scripts/DLC05. As you can see that is not good, and the only reason it works is because the Scripts/ directory overwrites BA2's. I'm terribly sorry for this mistake, I'm still learning myself and these things happen. I fixed this in 1.9.5, please download the latest version ASAP. Cheers![/color]

[/size]
