[size=4][size=4]Installation
[size=4]----------------------------[/size][/size][/size]
With NMM (highly recommended): 
1. Download the Archive
2. Open Nexus Mod Manager
3. Open the "Mods" tab at the top left corner
4. Click on the green "+" sign near the top left corner.
5. Open the Better Manufacturing archive, after some Loading time it will appear in the mods list under "Better Manufacturing".
6. Right click on the mod and in the list select "Install and Activate"
7. It should pop-up the normal install window. Select the appropriate options and click finish.

Without NMM: 
1. Download the file manually.  
2. Then use your favorite .7z, .zip, .rar program to extract the desired modules from the Data folder in the archive to your Data folder ie: C:\Program Files (x86)\steam\steamapps\common\fallout 4\Data.
3. Then in the Fallout 4 launcher select the hidden plugin manager and select the modules to activate them.

Uninstallation
[size=4][size=4][size=4]----------------------------[/size][/size][/size]
With NMM:[/size]
[size=4]1. Deactivate/Uninstall the mod in NMM

[/size][size=4]Without NMM:
[/size][size=4]1. Delete any file named "Better Manufacturing-*.esp" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.
1. Delete any file named "Better Manufacturing-*.ba2" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.[/size]


[size=4]Versions 2.1.1 and before:
[/size][size=4]1. Delete any file named "Better Manufacturing-*.esp" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.
2. Delete any Folder named "Item Overhaul" or "BetterManufacturing" from folders:
[list]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Meshes[/size]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Materials[/size]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Textures[/size]
[*][size=4]Fallout 4\Data\Scripts[/size]
[/list]
Versions 1.6.1 and before:
1. Delete any file named "DLC Contraptions-*.esp" from your Fallout 4\Data folder.

fileInfo.description: Created by Phakes (thanks!), removes the need to learn the Toughness perk.
fileInfo.name: UNnaked PA without Toughness perk

modInfo.author: Reveurr
modInfo.description:
[size=3][size=6][center]UNnaked Power Armor
[size=3]- Stack your Body and Power Armor Protection -[/size][/center][/size]

In Vanilla, when your enter a Power Armor, the game considers you're naked under it : protections don't stack.
This mod corrects that by stacking Body Armor and Power Armor Protection.
Simply learn the [url=http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Toughness]Toughness perk Rank 1[/url] and you're good to go.



[youtube]40VNebzXV3k[/youtube]



[u]Compatibility with your existing character:[/u]

This mod is fully compatible with any character, whether you allready knew the perk Toughness Rank 1, or not.
Just remember to learn this Perk to activate the mod functionnalities.




[u]How the mod works:[/u]

* This mod constantly searches for your body armor protection, and dynamically adjusts a linked variable accordingly.
This variable can add or delete 2.5 points from its value each second, so in order to find an armor of 20, when you were previously naked, it'll take (20 - 0) / 2.5 = 8 seconds.

Other example : you just equiped a piece of armor and your total resistance went from 100 to 110, the mod will take (110 - 100) / 2.5 = 4 seconds to adjust the variable and detect your new armor.
So, if when entering your Power Armor, the added value isn't the one you're actually looking for, just get out of the PA, wait a few seconds (without looking at your Pip-Boy screen, it freezes time) and reenter it.
The Added Armor will have been updated.[size=3]


* Due to FO4Edit limitations, I had to manually configure each possible Damage Resistance value the player can have, in order for this mod to detect them.
In other words, I configured a specific range Resistance detection, out of which more Protection won't be added.

Here are the Ranges for each Resistance type:
- Damage Resistance: 0-600
- Energy Resistance: 0-600
- Radiation Resistance: 0-200 + 1000
- Poison Resistance: 0-100


* For the same reason, SPECIAL attributes bonuses have a +10 / -10 detection [size=3][size=3]range[/size][/size].
For example, if your character has 7 base agility, the mod will be able to detect the following bonuses :
- 7 -> 8 : Bonus of +1 Agility given by Body Armors
- 7 -> 9[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +2 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size]
- 7 -> 10[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +3 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size]
- 7 -> 11[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +4 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 12[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +5 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 13[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +6 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 14[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +7 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 15[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +8 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 16[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +9 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=3][size=3]
- 7 -> 17[size=3][size=3] : Bonus of +10 Agility given by Body Armors[/size][/size][/size][/size]
- Higher values will stack as a +10 Agility Body Armor Bonus.


* Almost all Legendary Armor Bonuses Stack in Power Armor:
- Exterminator's : Reduces damage from Mirelurks and bugs by 15%.
- Assassin's : Reduces damage from humans by 15%.
- Ghoul slayer's : Reduces damage from ghouls by 15%.
- Hunter's : Reduces damage from animals by 15%.
- Mutant Slayer's : Reduces damage from super mutants by 15%.
- Troubleshooter's : Reduces damage from robots by 15%.  
- Duelist's : 10% chance to disarm melee attacker on hit.
- Powered : Increases Action Point refresh speed.
- Punishing : Reflects 10% of melee damage back on attacker.
- Safecracker's : Increases size of sweet spot while picking locks.
- VATS Enhanced : 10% reduction in Action Point cost in V.A.T.S.
- Sprinter's : Increases movement speed by 10%.
- Sentinel's : Reduces damage while standing and not moving by 15%.
- Cavalier's : Reduces damage while blocking or sprinting by 15%.
- Poisoner's : +25 poison resistance.
- Cunning : +1 Agility and +1 Perception
- Fortifying : +1 Strength and +1 Endurance
- Lucky : +2 Luck.
- Acrobat's : Reduces falling damage by 50%. (Equiping a Power Armor negates Fall Damage)
- Freefall : Prevents falling damage. (Equiping a Power Armor negates Fall Damage)

* The following [size=3]L[size=3]egendary Armor Bonuses don't stack in Power Armor:[/size][/size]
- Bolstering : Grants increasing energy and damage resistance the lower your Health (up to +35).
- Chameleon : Enemies have a harder time detecting you while you're sneaking and not moving.
- Low Weight : Low carry weight.
- Martyr's : Temporarily slows time down during combat when you are at 20% or less Health.
- Piezonucleic Lining : Radiation exposure increases Action Point refresh speed.

This limitation is due to the fact this mod detects actor values, not armor enchantments.
So if there's a condition on activation, the value is only active from time to time, which is not reliably detectable.


* For the same reason as above, [size=3][size=3]almost all Normal Armor Bonuses Stack in Power Armor:[/size][/size]
- BioCommMesh : Increases duration of chems 50%.
- Strengthened : Reduces limb damage.
- Stabilized : Scoped Aiming is more steady.
- Brawling : Improves Unarmed damage.
- Weighted : Unarmed and Melee attacks ignore some of target's armor.
- Muffled : Reduces detection from moving.
- Aerodynamic : Power attacks drain less AP.
- Custom Fitted : Sprinting takes less AP.

[size=3][size=3]* The following Normal[size=3][size=3] Armor Bonuses don't stack in Power Armor:[/size][/size][/size][/size]
- Padded / Dense : Reduced damage from explosions.
- Asbestos Lining : Immune to being set on Fire.



[u]Installation[/u]:

Download only One esp : the latest version.

* With Nexus Mod Manager:
Simply click the download button and let NMM install the mod.

* Manually:
Download and extract the mod, then copy "UNnaked Power Armor.esp" into your Fallout Data Folder.[/size]

modInfo.name: UNnaked Power Armor
modInfo.summary:
In Vanilla, you loose your Body armor Resistances, when entering a Power Armor.
With this mod, they Stack!

modInfo.author: Kentington
modInfo.description:
[color=#00ff00][size=3][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/fallout-4-contraption-mods-add-machines-to-butcher-corpses-create-soylent-green/]Featured in PC Gamer![/url]
[/size]
Want to build your own settlers? [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16354/?]Workshop Synth Production[/url] is just what your factory needs!
Version 1.4 allows the component extractor and object extractor to pull items from linked workshops, among other general improvements. You will need to access the extractor's settings from a terminal.
Version 1.3 adds a generic object extractor and a workaround for Recycler-related lag.
Version 1.2 adds a conveyor intersection, adds an auto-loom to produce faction armor, and allows the explosives mill to produce Nuka Grenades and nuke mines.
[/color]
The manufacturing mechanics introduced in Contraptions Workshop are frankly underwhelming; they require too much manual intervention and tend to be incomplete (ammo types) or annoyingly random (armor manufacturing). This mod aims to fix that.

[font=Courier New][color=#00ff00][b][size=5]New Devices[/size][size=3]
[/size]
[/b][/color][/font][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Component Extractor
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Breaks down junk from the workshop's inventory, then outputs components onto its conveyor belt. You can specify which components to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Object Extractor
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Pulls items from the workshop. You can specify which items to extract by placing them in its inventory. It can also pull items from workshops linked by supply lines.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Recycler
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Junk items passed into it are broken down into components.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Conveyor Workshop Storage
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Deposits items into the workshop's inventory.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Conveyor Intersection
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Allows joining belts at a 90-degree angle.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Vault-Tec Auto-Loom
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Builds jumpsuits and other Vault-related outfits.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Faction Auto-Loom
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Builds Brotherhood, Institute, Railroad, Minutemen, and Atom Cats clothing.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Power Armor Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Builds power armor pieces, fusion cores, and frame kits. With a kit in your inventory, go to the Special workshop category to build a frame.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Melee Weapon Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Builds melee weapons.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Fist Weapon Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Builds unarmed weapons.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Distillery
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Produces alcohol and Nuka Cola products.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Auto-Butcher
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Breaks down corpses into meat, bone, leather, or other resources depending on the type of creature. And yes, it works on people too...

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Robot Disassembler
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Breaks down destroyed robots into junk and components.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Inventory Management Brain
[/b][/size][/color][/font]When power to this device is toggled, components, ammo, and aid items stored in the workbench are consolidated into a single object reference. This can relieve lag caused by how FO4 handles in-world objects.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Far Harbor Ammunition Plant (Requires optional patch)
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Produces Far Harbor ammunition.

[font=Courier New][b][color=#00ff00][size=5]Modified Devices[/size][/color][/b]
[/font][font=Courier New]
[/font][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Armor Forge
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Now allows you to choose which piece is produced. Also can now produce synth armor.

[font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Ammunition Plant
[/b][/size][/color][/font]Now produces fusion cells, plasma cartridges, gamma cells, flamer fuel, cryo cells, and railroad spikes.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Explosives Mill
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Now produces cannonballs, missiles, mini-nukes, nuka grenades, and nuke mines.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Weapon Forge
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Now produces syringers and railway rifles.

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6aa84f][size=4]Energy Weapon Forge
[/size][/color][/font][/b]Now produces Institute laser weapons.

************************************
[size=4]Add-Ons

[/size]Other modders have taken Manufacturing Extended and... extended it. Please message me if you'd like your mod featured here.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15776/?]Soylent Green[/url]

************************************

[size=4][b]You Might Also Enjoy[/b][/size]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5393/?]Moveable Power Armor
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7835/?]Where Are My Provisioners?
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7809/?]Power Armor Delivery[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7835/?]
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8262/?]Power Armor Autopilot[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8347/?]Rip A Guy's Arm Off And Beat Him To Death With It[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8610/?]Repairable Sanctuary
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12858/?]Vertidrones[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14110/?]Portable Junk Recycler[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16354/?]Workshop Synth Production[/url]
modInfo.name: Manufacturing Extended
modInfo.summary: Improves the manufacturing devices from Contraptions Workshop. Now you can choose which armor parts to build, manufacture Vault jumpsuits and energy weapon ammo, and extract components from workshop inventory!

fileInfo.name: ENG for MAIN

modInfo.author: Fo4FI
modInfo.description:
(RUS/ENG)

[b]Описание: [/b]
Данный мод логическое продолжение [url=https://gamer-mods.ru/go?https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/26286?tab=description]Boston FPS Fix[/url] (сам мод Boston FPS Fix больше не требуется), мне очень понравился этот мод, но к сожалению он исправляет только Бостон. И я решил сделать свой мод который бы смог исправить все ошибки и дать большой + к FPS.

[b]Что он делает?[/b]
Немногие знают что создатели Fallout 4 при добавлении DLC сломали самостоятельно около 30 ячеек в мире. Сломанные прекомбинации это то что дает нам огромное падение FPS во многих местах и особенно это видно в Бостоне. Данный мод полностью востанавливает ВСЕ ячейки Содружества. Все 4500 ячеек были сгенерированы с нуля.

[b]Какой плюс от использования? [/b]
У вас будет большой прирост к фпс и абсолютная плавность игрового процесса.
[b]
[/b][b]Что требуется? [/b]
Оригинальный Fallout 4 + all DLC.
Неофициальный патч 

[b]Почему именно так? [/b]
Потому что DLC вносят изменения в ячейки также как патч в некоторые.

[b]Совместимость: [/b]
Мод совместим с любыми текстурами:
[b]
[/b][b]Несовместимость: [/b]
Мод частично совместим с модами которые меняют расположение объектов в мире. 
Если мод добавляет объекты а не перемещает стандартные объекты (столы,стулья,шкафы,стены) то он будет работать на 100%.

[b]Патчи:[/b]
Многие моды потребуют патчи и я собираюсь их сделать со временем.

[b]Порядок загрузки модов: [/b]
Данный мод следует загружать ПОСЛЕДНИМ ПОСЛЕ ВСЕХ МОДОВ и только так.
Все моды которые будут загружены ПОСЛЕ отменят воссозданные прекомбинации и сломают FPS в ячейках.
[b]
Description:[/b]
This mod is a logical continuation of[b] [/b][url=https://gamer-mods.ru/go?https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/26286?tab=description]Boston FPS Fix[/url] (the mod Boston FPS Fix is no longer required), I really liked this mod, but unfortunately it only fixes Boston. And I decided to make my own mod that could fix all the mistakes of the developers and give a big boost to FPS.
[b]
What does it do?[/b]
Few people know that the creators of Fallout 4 when adding DLC broke on their own about 30 cells in the world. Broken recombination is what gives us a huge drop in FPS in many places and this is especially evident in Boston. This mod completely restores all cells of the Commonwealth. All 4,500 cells were generated from scratch.

[b]What is the advantage of using it?[/b]
You will have a large increase in fps and absolute smoothness of the game process.

[b]What is required?[/b]
Original Fallout 4 + all DLC.
Unofficial patch

[b]Why so?[/b]
Because DLC makes changes to cells just like a patch does to some. 

[b]Compatibility: [/b]
The mod is compatible with any textures:

[b]Incompatibility: [/b]
The mod is partially compatible with mods that change the location of objects in the world. 
If the mod adds objects instead of moving standard objects (tables,chairs,cabinets, walls), it will work 100%.

[b]Patches:[/b]
Many mods will require patches and I'm going to make them over time.
[b]
How to load mods: [/b]
This mod should be loaded LAST AFTER all MODS and only so.
All mods that will be loaded AFTER will cancel the recreated recombinations and break the FPS in the cells.
modInfo.name: Fo4FI_FPS_fix
modInfo.summary:
Исправление всех ячеек Содружества

The correction of all the cells of the Commonwealth

fileInfo.name: Equip Settlers

modInfo.author: wim95
modInfo.description:
Required
[list]
[*] DLC Contraptions Workshop (DLCworkshop02.esm)
[*] [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url]
[/list]

Creates a mannequin to equip your settlers with armor and weapons.

1 Create a mannequin in the settlement (found under Special category of workshop menu)
2 Activate the mannequin
3 Put clothes on the mannequin. Use "T) EQUIP" button
4 Place one weapon in the mannequin
5 Exit from Inventory menu. "TAB" button
6 Wait for some time. Read the messages
7 All the settlers in this settlement are equipped. See exceptions below
8 Go to the next settlement. Repeat

Gear are equipped only to Humans and Ghouls (not children, robots, etc)
Companions are excluded from processing
If you need to exclude a settler from processing, then place an "(*) Dressed manually" item in their inventory. Can be crafted at the chemistry station in the UTILITY category.

Weapons with a converted receiver are not supported

Equipment is taken from the player's inventory and the workshop's inventory. From there one round for the weapon is taken.
The collected equipment is distributed among the settlers. The excess is returned to the workshop inventory. Don't forget to pick up your ammo.
If the equipment is not enough, the settlers will be partially clothed or remain undressed



I know about [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25964]Central Settlement Armory[/url] mod and that it stopped working. Therefore, I am interested in positive feedback about the work of my plugin. Until the stability of the plugin is confirmed, I will not change anything (roles, gender, etc.).
It works stably for me. But in the wild anything can happen
So let us know how many hours you played, how many fast travel you made, how many times you saved/loaded the game, and all the other follies too. But the settlers are still dressed after that.




[size=1]

modInfo.author: Madchieften
modInfo.description:
[u]DESCRIPTION[/u]

My first fight with a deathclaw was very fun, but every one after that was underwhelming in comparison. At a high level I can kill them before they get anywhere near me, so I decided to make this mod.

This mod simply reduces the amount of damage deathclaws take.

There are five versions:
25%, 50%, 75%, 90%, and 99% damage reduction

If you would like to see another version, just ask and I may do it.

I may expand this mod to include other creatures/robots, if there is enough interest.

This mod was made with FO4Edit (I simply changed the damage multipliers in Body Part Data)

If anyone knows how to reduce the staggering, and also increase the speed of deathclaws, please let me know. 

[u]INSTALATION

[/u]Simply install with NMM or drop into the data folder[u]
[/u]
[u]COMPATIBILITY

[/u]Will conflict with mods that edit the same Body Part Data for deathclaws such as [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/217]Real World Damages[/url]
modInfo.name: Tougher Deathclaws
modInfo.summary: Reduces the amount of damage deathclaws take.

fileInfo.description: Adds group combat AI to raider gangs, Gunners, and most other NPC groups, based on individual NPC social awareness and tactical combat evaluation.  Now with MCM!
fileInfo.name: Pack Attack NPC Edition

modInfo.author: Greslin
modInfo.description:
[center][size=5][b]Pack Attack Companion Edition Is Now Available![/b][/size]

Want to see PANPC AI applied to your vanilla companions? Now you can!
Go check out my recently released mod, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/52203]Pack Attack Companion Edition[/url] -
and get some well deserved AI backup for the next time you take on a raider encampment.

[center][youtube]Ntb1iI3NzwM[/youtube][/center]

=======[/center]
[i][center][size=3][/size][/center][/i][i][center][size=3][b][size=2]What Nexus gamers are saying:[/size][/b]

"This mod, combined with Horizon, makes for an incredibly tense combination. I am dreading taking on Corvega." - DakkaHarakka

[/size][size=3]"Watching them act more like real AI is a sight and no more shooting fish in a barrel type behavior is great." - Stiffon[/size][/center][/i]

[center][b]Watch Nexus user TacticalAce take on a PA-NPCified Corvega (w/extra spawning):
[/b]
[youtube]cgkDGc2WqSI[/youtube][/center]


[size=4][b]PACK ATTACK (NPC EDITION): Gangs With Group Combat Tactics[/b][/size]
by Greslin
v1.99 - released 5/21/21

I am now available for mod support over Discord. Visit me here about this or any other of my mods: [url=https://discord.gg/jMUnXDV]https://discord.gg/jMUnXDV[/url]

Adapted and expanded from my mod "[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/29957]Pack Attack[/url]", this mod significantly extends the same concepts and ideas into a combat AI mod that specifically applies to biped gang enemies, such as Raiders and Gunners. As in "Pack Attack", enemies using this mod will adjust their tactics based on their social and threat awareness, switching between ranged, melee, defensive, and offensive tactics based on their perceptions of team advantage and individual risk.

[b]Please note: Due to the rapid development and evolution of this mod, this description page may be incomplete, outdated, and/or inaccurate.[/b] For the latest information, please read the comments section. You can also find information about mod compatibility, MCM settings, and playing strategy in the Articles section.


[b]IMPORTANT[/b]
===================================

Do [b]NOT[/b] use this and my original Pack Attack mod together! That one was the original very crude prototype that gradually evolved into this mod, and Pack Attack NPC Edition (or PA-NPC, for short) includes and expands on all that mod's functionality. They will not play nice together!


[b]CHANGELOG[/b]
===================================

To better keep track of everything and maintain my own sanity in the process, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/849]this mod's project changelog can be found here[/url].


[b]DESCRIPTION[/b]
===================================

"[b]Pack Attack: NPC Edition[/b]" applies the basic dog pack AI methodology from "[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/29957]Pack Attack[/url]" to NPC gangs, but significantly expands on it.

This mod makes major changes to how supported NPC groups fight. Rather than simply rushing you in the open as a group, these NPCs will break and cover, retreat and flank, run and hide, and even lie in wait. They're more likely to ambush, less likely to engage in suicidal charges, and more certain to switch to hand-to-hand combat if you get too close and they like their odds. In short, PA-NPC completely overhauls and upgrades the combat AI for all supported NPC groups.

And they will attempt to make these tactical decisions based on what is happening around them.

Each NPC gathers information from their experiences, coordinates information with their teammates, and even learns to a limited degree. This leads to fights that are never the same twice, that actively require you to consider the risks versus rewards of a particular assault or combat approach.

In addition, PA-NPC now contains several features for dynamic enemy spawning, non-combat AI, and upgrades/new abilities for individual NPC groups.  All in all, this project has now evolved into a general NPC upgrade for the entirety of the Fallout 4 experience.


[b]HOW PA-NPC DIFFERS FROM OTHER AI MODS[/b]
========================================

There are many fine AI overhaul mods available on the Nexus. They all basically do the same things: adjust the global game settings and update the combat style definitions.

PA-NPC doesn't change globals, and rather than alter existing combat styles, it substitutes its own. Where PA-NPC differs is that it adds an additional layer of processing on top of the combat style system. Rather than having a single defined combat style (as in vanilla), PA-enabled animals have five of them, and biped NPCs (humans, etc.) have [i]nine different combat styles[/i], switching between them as their combat environment and relative perspective changes. To the best of my knowledge, Pack Attack is the only Fallout AI mod to have attempted this.

[b]Important note: many AI mods, such as Arbitration and Search and Destroy, "improve" NPC attack behavior by making the vanilla system overall much more sensitive.  PANPC doesn't need the help.  Using them together will have unintended consequences.[/b]


[b]SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT F4SE[/b]
========================================

[i]As of v1.7, I have retired the non-F4SE version of PANPC.  The honest truth is that it's a hassle to support both user bases, and the non-F4SE base isn't large enough to justify it.  I may release bugfixes for it once in a while, but for now, v1.69 will be the final, canon non-F4SE version of PANPC.[/i]

The aim of this project is to improve the general enemy AI as much as possible through the use of group dynamics and tactics. To that end, I prefer not to leave any useful tools lying on the table, and without question that includes F4SE.

There are now two general releases of PA-NPC. The main release requires F4SE, and utilizes that additional capability to include factors such as detailed weapon comparison (i.e., don't take a pipe gun to a Gauss Gun fight). This will always be the primary release version, and while not every new feature will be based on F4SE functions, any new features incorporated into this release WILL NOT be backported to non-F4SE version.

The non-F4SE version remains version 1.69, and is available under Optional Files. I will continue to maintain this version only for critical (i.e., game breaking) bug fixes. Do not ask me to backport. If you want the new features, install F4SE.

Beyond simply not wanting to maintain two separate mods here, my other concern is game balancing. I spend a lot of time testing, tweaking, and testing again, and balancing takes a lot of time. As new features are included, I would have to do all that work separately for each version, and I'm not going to do that. Thanks for understanding.


[b]HOW IT WORKS[/b]
========================================

[b]IMPORTANT POINT:[/b] The Fallout 4 engine is designed to allow for the influence of combat behavior, but not the [i]control[/i] of combat behavior (with a few exceptions). All this or any other mod can do is coax an actor into a certain level of aggression and combat behavior. So expect some strange behavior - once the combat starts, the NPCs are making their own decisions, and they may not always be the brightest ones.


This mod had its genesis in its predecessor mod, "Pack Attack". Pack Attack upgraded the Commonwealth's canines, emulating basic pack behavior and social awareness in combat situations. When a PA-enabled Mongrel is loaded into the game, it does an immediate scan for other dogs, and acts more confidently and aggressively when it has company.

In the vanilla game, an Actor (you, me, dogs, robots, etc.) has an Aggression stat (how likely it is to attack), a Confidence stat (cowardly/brave/foolhardy), and a general Combat Style (which specifies combat behavior in more detail). Normally these stats are hardwired into Actors, including dogs. If an Actor is a coward, they're usually - but not always - a coward forever. But those stats can be changed on the fly. "Pack Attack" constantly adjusted those settings for each dog as its fortunes changed in combat.

PA-NPC takes that same basic idea and expands it significantly for use with NPC gang enemies. When a PA-NPC is active, he (or she) will perform regular scans of the local environment and assess the local relative strength of his gang. If he finds other faction-friendly teammates in the area, he will act more confidently and aggressively. If he's alone and hurt, he's more likely to run and hide.

In addition, PA-NPC actors consider:

* [b]High ground advantage[/b]: "Am I fairly safe up on this freeway or rooftop?"
* [b]Visible weapon comparisons[/b]: "Am I bringing a knife to a gunfight?"
* [b]Power Armor advantage[/b]: "Am I wearing power armor? Is my target?"
* [b]Outnumbering advantage[/b]: "Am I feeling pretty good about our numbers here?"
* [b]Group aggression[/b]: "Does it feel like we're winning this battle?"
* [b]Target distance[/b]: "Is my target close enough to warrant a shift to hand-to-hand or melee combat?"
* [b]Self preservation[/b]: "Is the smartest move here to run away and fight another day?"
* [b]Radiation exposure:[/b] "Am I currently taking radiation damage?" (new to v1.7)

.. and much more.

PA-NPC uses more combat styles than the original Pack Attack did, and each NPC will shift styles as necessary between ranged, melee, and evasion tactics. As the gang dwindles in size, it will lose battle cohesion. If, on the other hand, the gang is winning, they will become bolder and more direct in their fire tactics.


Here are the important concepts:


[b]COURAGE[/b]
========================================

Each PA-NPC, when first enabled, is assigned a random value within a faction-specified range that represents their natural courage. This value will rise and fall as the NPC gains experience and faces combat events. In general, a higher courage NPC is more likely to be confident and aggressive, as well as more willing to make command decisions. A lower courage NPC will be a follower more than a leader, be more apt to run and evade than charge and fight, and will more prefer fighting at a distance to up-close-and-personal slugfests.

The rest of this mod is based around this Courage value, which remains as long as the NPC reference is alive. In a very simple but very real way, they "learn" and individualize as they gain experience.


[b]SELF PRESERVATION[/b]
========================================

Countering the NPC's Courage stat is their Self Preservation stat. While not nearly as important to their decisions as is Courage, the NPC's SP stat will generally lower when they make kills or participate in command or revenge actions. It will rise as they take damage and when they flee. Self Preservation generally works against Courage, as the NPC attempts to decide whether to boldly attack, retreat, flank, or run for the hills.


[b]GANG EVALUATION[/b]
===================================

As with "Pack Attack", the heart of this mod is the gang assessment system. Each active NPC is constantly searching within a dynamic radius (based on its Perception stat) for other friends and enemies. When it finds another friendly NPC, it evaluates that NPC's base health in comparison to its own, using that data to get a rough (and relative) collective estimate of the gang strength.

Here is how it works. Imagine we're talking about two raiders: Tiny Tim and Big Bubba.

Tiny Tim has a base health of 50HP. Big Bubba, on the other hand, is a much bigger guy: 150HP base health. Tim is going to look at Bubba and think, "Wow, that guy is three times my size and he's on OUR side. We can't lose!" and be more reckless as a result. Bubba, meanwhile, is more likely to look down at Tiny Tim and think, "I'm surrounded by guys a third of my size, and I'm going to have to do all the work here. This is not a great situation for me." He will be more likely to hang back and fight conservatively.

Each PA-NPC makes this assessment with each allied or friendly NPC in their scan radius, using the sum of those judgments as a base to assess the overall strength of the gang - from their own point of view. There is no "objective" pack strength. It's all relative, each NPC making imperfect decisions based on their own individual perspective.

Each NPC has a random bravery/anxiety factor that will make it a bit more anxious or bold than the others (to avoid duplicating behavior), and utilizes various other data points - wounded enemies (blood scent), its own health, and its most recent combat experience - to decide whether to attack, run away, be cautious, or go completely bloodthirsty insane. That base "courage" value goes up and down as the NPC gets hit, or makes kills. It is then used as the base for future evaluation calculations.

In general, as each NPC senses a weaker and more damaged pack, it will become more and more likely to retreat, evade, and hide. Likewise, if another NPC enters the fray, the other NPCs will react to the gang's suddenly improved fortunes and become more aggressive.


[b]FIGHT/FLIGHT[/b]
========================================

PA-NPC enemies operate in two basic modes: proactive and reactive. A proactive decision is a measured appraisal of the gang dynamics and tactical situation, followed by a random timeout period of up to 30 seconds before reconsidering their decision.

During the timeout period, the NPC is in reactive mode. Their decision making process is much simpler, more fight/flight. In this mode, the enemy NPC is much more likely to do something stupid, more likely to aggressively defend themselves, and more likely to run in panic. They will continue in this reactive decision mode until the timeout expires, at which point they'll make another proactive tactical decision.

Each proactive decision changes the NPC's aggression and confidence stats, as well as their combat style. There are melee and ranged, offensive and defensive fighting styles.


[b]COMMAND (FOCUSED FIRE)[/b]
========================================

Certain factions - Gunners, Minutemen, Brotherhood, and Synths - now have what I call the Command ability. When a member of one of these factions gains a kill or two and raises their courage, the script will sometimes assign them a Command token that they can then spend on a high profile target (such as an enemy in power armor, or someone exposed on high ground). When they spend that token, the target is marked as a Command target, and nearby teammates will prioritize their fire focus on that target. The NPC that makes the kill gets a substantial courage bonus.


[b]FRIENDS AND ENEMIES[/b]
========================================

PA-NPC enemies will only count faction-friendly NPCs as part of their gang. This means in certain situations, it's entirely possible to have multiple NPC gangs slugging it out using PA-NPC tactic sets.


[b]STEALTH, LOW LIGHT, DETECTION[/b]
========================================

PA-NPC enemies make decisions based on what they can see and hear. LOS (Line of Sight) between NPCs is a big deal, and LOS is mitigated by a variety of factors, first and foremost low light. Staying in shadows, moving at night, and generally not making a good target of yourself are all tactics that play larger roles in PANPC than they do in the vanilla game. Crouch-sneaking, Sneak perks, high AGL, and avoiding LOS are all excellent tools for avoiding unprepared-for combat situations.

Likewise, PA-NPC enemies are MUCH more aware of their environments than are their vanilla counterparts. They will investigate noise, set ambushes, and will tend to be quieter (fewer "barks") when they are alone or relatively isolated. So be careful, because your enemies are going to be careful, too.


[b]DAZZLE[/b] (v1.771+ only)
========================================

As of v1.771, PA-NPC enemies can be rendered temporarily (3-5 seconds) blind to the PANPC scanning systems.  During this period, they will take minor Perception damage, their aim will be severely degraded, and a large portion of their attempts to visually identify both targets and allies will fail.  They will take a minor courage hit, and if they are already having courage issues, they will be more prone to panic and retreat.

This effect will naturally trigger from time to time in the regular game when NPCs are exposed to sudden increases in light brightness. 

For players who prefer a more reliable method for dazzling their enemies, the PANPC download now includes an optional ESP that adds PANPC-enabled flash grenades and flash mines to the game.  They're adapted from their pulse cousins, do very little damage, explode with 1/10 of the force, and have about 50% more range.  NPCs caught in the explosion radius have a 50% chance of being dazzled (33% if the NPC is equipped with optics).

PANPC flash weapons should start appearing in loot and vendor lists at around level 10, and I'm not doing injector lists, so you'll need to reconcile the lists in FO4Edit if you have other mods statically adding grenades and mines to those lists.


[b]SNIPER[/b] (v1.78+ only)
========================================

As of v1.78, PA-NPC enemies that are spawned armed with a ballistic weapon equipped with a long range mod (such as long barrel) will adopt an extended set of fire tactics, in addition to their normal actions.  These "Snipers" will crouch when they fire (for an aim bonus), will prefer ranged attacks from held, fixed positions, and will attempt to fight from the rear of groups while their comrades lead frontal assaults.  If a Sniper also has a scope mod on their weapon, they will get an additional 20% aim bonus, stacking with whatever other aim bonuses they currently have.  Finally, they will also have a 50% better view of the battlefield than their teammates.

Synths and super mutants do not use Sniper actions, no matter what weapon they are using.


[b]EXTRA SPAWNS[/b]
========================================

Disabled by default, this feature allows you to automatically spawn in additional enemies when a PA-enabled NPC is loaded into game memory for the first time. The new enemies will be spawned from that NPC's leveled list, each with its own equipment and configuration.

In the MCM menu, you can adjust the odds of each NPC cloning a new spawn, how many possible spawns they can clone, and overall odds for generating the new clone NPC as a Boss, Higher Level, Tougher than PC, or PC-equal level.

For more information about this (or any other) MCM feature, read the MCM instructions in the Articles section.


[b]RAIDING PARTIES[/b]
========================================

Much like the extra spawns/clones, the Raiding Parties option (also enabled via MCM) occasionally sets a small group of enemies against you.  The type of enemy generally depends on the dominant gang in the area, and you can adjust the time interval and makeup of the groups in MCM.  They may come right at you, but they will most likely sneak up on and ambush you from a relatively safe spot. 

You can adjust the time interval as a matter of game hours: every hour, two hours, etc.  But this is only a general time, and a new raiding party will spawn into your vicinity at any point between 30 minutes before or 30 minutes after the set interval.  If you have the interval set to 2 hours, for example, the script will spawn a new raiding party anywhere between 1.5 hours and 2.5 hours since the last one.

If Raiding Parties and Extra Spawns are both enabled, the party will split up and each member will lead their own band of clones against your position. 


[b]INTEGRATION WITH WEST TEK OPTICS[/b]
========================================

As of v1.74, PANPC now includes integration with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12220]"West Tek Tactical Optics" by fadingsignal[/url].  If you have WTTO installed, NPCs (including companions) with WTTO optics gear in their inventories will equip them at night and in low light. NPCs with optics will not suffer from low light LOS (line of sight) penalties, while giving them a 20% aim bonus and greater team cohesion abilities.

The player does not receive any special bonuses in PANPC from West Tek Optics.


[b]CONFLICTS AND ISSUES[/b]
========================================

While fairly stable at this point, this mod is still very experimental and SIGNIFICANTLY changes how NPCs fight. All these changes are bound within the faction system (without changing any factions), and so hopefully should not break any quests. However, I can't guarantee that any particular version of this mod is perfectly ironclad, is save game safe, or won't CTD somewhere.

If you happen to encounter a situation where you believe this mod is breaking your game, please let me know in as much detail as possible. If you think you've found a bug, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/1895]please read this article[/url] as well as the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/821]Compatibility Status[/url] page before reporting it. Thanks.


[b]INSTALLATION/UNINSTALLATION[/b]
========================================

As of v1.7, only the base game and F4SE 0.4.0+ are required. The script will auto detect any DLCs and make the appropriate settings.

Likewise, the v1.69 legacy non-F4SE version is also fully DLC compatible, but does not require F4SE.

While MCM is required to use the MCM features, it is not required for using either version of this mod.

Unpack the RAR to install, disable the ESP in your load order to disable.


[b]DONATIONS[/b]
========================================

Always appreciated, never required.  I do this stuff because I'm a hopeless Fallout addict, have been for a long time, and like pulling out the wires to see what sparks.  Donations via Nexus are awesome and will result in a note of generous thanks.

All donations go directly to an important cause: my personal gaming fund.  Your donations allow me to play better games, use more of my time to play them, and dedicate more of my energy to making cool mods for them.  (And yes, Fallout will always be my first love.)


[b]AS ALWAYS..[/b]
========================================

Thanks to my wife (Borderlands Assist Queen, fellow gamer, console girl, and partner in crime) for tolerating my Fallout fandom.

Thanks to Eden, our yellow Labrador, who is currently away nursing her new puppies and being a good momma. We miss her and look forward to her coming home.

Thanks to everyone who has downloaded, enjoyed, and perhaps even endorsed any of my mods for Fallout 4 and New Vegas. I write these weird little mods for myself, to try things out that hopefully keep the game interesting for me a little while longer, and it's nice to know that some of you good folks enjoy them, too. I appreciate the kind words, support, and occasional gamer angst.

I have no intention of porting any of my mods to console. I'm a PC player, and diving into the Bethesda.net pool doesn't interest me in the least.

This mod is still in regular development, meaning you should expect some bugs and items that need to be rebalanced. Your game saves, however, should be fairly safe at this point. Try it out and leave your feedback in the comments. I want to hear them!



[b]ABOUT ME[/b]
========================================

[b]See my other Fallout 4 mods:[/b]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23558/?]Stash Those Caps[/url] - Makes caps truly portable again, just like in FO3/FNV
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23269/?]Insult To Injury[/url] - Implements a working FNV-like limb damage/recovery system in Survival mode
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22744/?]Companion Heal Thyself[/url] - Give companions the power to patch themselves
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22585/?]Passive Aggressive Piper[/url] - Add affinity checks to Piper's more annoying, sarcastic and flirtatious comments
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22434/?]Ferals After Dark[/url] - Makes feral ghouls a bit smarter and more dangerous after the sun goes down
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22436/?]More Realistic Cats[/url] - Buffs the cat race to make them behave more like, well, cats
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23498/?]Atomic Brahmin[/url] - When cows turn into mean, aggressive, highly unstable nuclear weapons
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/29957]Pack Attack[/url] - Mongrel dogs shift attack behavior based on social awareness and threat assessment

fileInfo.description: A simple mod that makes it unsafe to rest in uninhabited areas at night. Your sleep can be interrupted by an enemy ambush or any number of wasteland creatures.
fileInfo.name: Sleepless Nights

modInfo.author: Dheuster
modInfo.description:
[u][size=6][b]Overview[/b][/size][/u]

A simple mod that makes it unsafe to rest in uninhabited areas at night. Your sleep can be interrupted by an enemy ambush or any number of wasteland creatures. 

[center]
[youtube]MX2pBOFXxzU[/youtube][/center]

[size=4][u]Requirements[/u][/size]

Sleepless Nights was compiled with Fallout 4 patch 1.10.114. It may or may not work with older versions of Fallout 4.

[u][size=6][b]Details[/b][/size][/u]

[b]A) How Often will I get attacked?[/b]

In normal mode, you are safe to sleep in the daytime. The probability of being attacked at night is determined by how long you sleep and your luck:
 
[list]
[*]1 hour   : 10% chance of being attacked
[*]2 hours : 13%  chance of being attacked
[*]4 hours : 20%  chance of being attacked
[*]8 hours : 50%  chance of being attacked
[/list]
    Luck:
  [list]
[*]Poor Luck  (0 -> 3) multiplies odds of getting attacked by 1.25
[*]Good Luck  (7 -> 9) multiplies odds of getting attacked by 0.75
[*]Great Luck (10+)    multiplies odds of getting attacked by 0.50    
[/list]
Example:

If you sleep for 7 hours, normally there is a 20% chance of being attacked. If your luck score is 3 or less, that increases to a 25% chance. If your luck is 10 or more, odds drop to a 10% chance. 

[b]B)  Enemies[/b]

The number of enemies in a wave is determined by your level. After level 35,  there is a 50% chance you will get a second random wave of enemies if the first roll succeeds. IE: You might get a group of deathclaws and a group of raiders all at once. 

[b]C)  Safe Locations[/b]

You are always 100% safe to sleep in big cities such as Diamond City, Goodneighbor, Bunker Hill, Vault 81, Far harbor, Arcadia, Nuka Town and Most Vaults. You are also generally safe to sleep in your Faction Stronghold.

In normal mode, you are also safe to sleep in the daytime and in owned settlements. However settlements are only safe at night if their defense rating is 20 or higher. Night is considered the hours between 9:30 PM and 5:30 AM.

In Nightmare mode, you can be attacked even in owned settlements. However, settlers may help defend the player.

Finally, if you are attacked on a given day, you will not be attacked the next time you sleep unless you enable the option to allow multiple attacks per day. 

[size=4][u][b]Nightmare Mode[/b][/u][/size]

Users can optionally enable Nightmare mode. In nightmare mode:
[list]
[*]You can be attacked anytime you sleep, day or night
[*]Basic settlements no longer offer protection. 
[*]Only big cities and indoor strongholds are safe.
[*]Every 7th day, sleeping carries a 50% risk of being attacked by a Ghoul Horde
[/list]  
Ghoul Horde:
  
A ghoul horde is a sizable group of ghouls that arrive in 3 waves. Each wave is tougher than the previous. Hi-level glowing ghouls can emit a radiation burst that heals and resurrects nearby dead ghouls from earlier waves. This is what makes Ghoul Hordes particularly dangerous. One stray final boss can resurrect all 3 previous waves at once. 
  
So keep an eye on your Game Day. If it is divisible by 7, find shelter or be prepared for a major battle.

[size=4][u][b]Daydream Mode[/b][/u][/size]

An optional mode for users who want sleepless nights to be less challenging so they don't have to reload their save games as much.   In this mode:
   [list]
[*]You can sleep up to 2 hours with 0% chance of being interrupted
[*]Sleeping for 3 or 4 hours is less risky
[*]The Max Number of Sleeps before a mandatory attack is doubled

[*]Sleeping within the boundaries of any settlement is safe. Ownership and defense rating don't matter.

[*]Enemies still level with the player, but the number of enemies stops increasing at level 20. 
[*]No larger-than-man sized enemies. IE: No Behemoths or Deathclaws
[*]No possibility of a second wave of enemies or Ghoul Horde.

[/list]
[i][u]Shameless Self Promotion[/u]

[size=2]This mod was created to complement the mod [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/26976]Amazing Follower Tweaks[/url][/i][size=2][i] in order to increase the value of multiple companions and a portable camp with defensive capabilities. While recommended, AFT is not needed for this mod to work.
[/i][/size]
[size=6]Usage:[/size]
[size=2]
After being installed, you will find a Misc Holotape in your inventory called "Sleepless Nights Settings"
[/size]
[list=1]
[*][ ] Nightmare Mode - Toggle this option on if you wish to play in nightmare mode.
[*][ ] Daydream Mode - Toggle to play in Daydream Mode
[*][ ] Allow Multiple attacks per day -  Toggle if you don't mind being attacked multiple times a day.
[*]Force Attack After [ ] Sleeps - determines max sleeps in uninhabited areas before an attack is forced.
[*]Prepare for Uninstall - Select to shut down Sleepless Nights Scripts. Recommended before disabling the mod. 
[*]Tab to Exit - Reminder, but also offers a back door to the Debug Menu. Click 6 times and it changes to [Debug Menu].
[/list][center]﻿[/center]

fileInfo.name: DDLL 1.1.0

modInfo.author: Otellino
modInfo.description:
[center]﻿[img]https://thomasdavidmitchell.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/DDLL-Poster-Box-e1585438280883.png[/img]

[size=4][b]What is DDLL?[/b]
[size=3]Distributed DLC Leveled Lists, or DDLL, is a script-based mod that dynamically looks at all DLC and CreationClub plugins you have enabled, and dynamically seeds their weapons and clothing throughout Fallout 4 at appropriate levels. Being script-based, DDLL has the benefit of [b]not [/b]requiring specific DLCs and Creations, and [b]not[/b] requiring you to create or used merged patches![/size]

[b]How does it work?
[/b][size=3]Without going [i]too[/i] technical, when you first load DDLL it will scan through your currently loaded plugins and [b]specifically[/b] look for which DLC and CreationClub plugins are enabled. If supported plugins are found, DDLL will dynamically 'fetch' relevant items, place them in DDLL's own, custom Leveled Lists, and then inject those Leveled Lists throughout the game - much like many popular weapon mods do. Best of all, this means there are [u][b]no[/b][/u] hard requirements - you could even load this mod with no DLCs or CreationClub plugins enabled at all, it just wouldn't do anything.
[/size]
[b]Customizing your experience
[/b][/size][size=3]When DDLL starts up, you'll be shown a message box that lets you tailor DDLL to your preference - namely:
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]If you want CreationClub items to inject into your game only [b]after[/b] you complete each Creation's quest (default being no.)[/size]
[/list][list]
[*][size=2]What types of Creations you want to inject into your game (See Item Tiers below)[/size]
[/list][size=3]You can re-open the Customization Menu by crafting the DDLL Customization item from a Chemistry Workbench under the Utilities section.
[/size]
[b][size=4]Item Tiers
[/size][/b][size=3]Every supported CreationClub plugin has been assigned a [b]Tier[/b] - with the Tiers being Standard, Wacky and Unhinged.
Standard items being non-surprising items in the game (The CR-74L, Anti Materiel rifle etc), Wacky being in-lore but silly items (Zetan Arsenal, Pint-Sized Slasher's knife etc), and Unhinged being non-lore items (BFG 9000, Thunderbolt etc). You can choose up to which tiers you want present in your game from the configuration menu. As an aside, Far Harbor and Nuka-World are Standard.

[size=4][b]Currently supported DLC and Creations
[/b][/size][/size][size=2]﻿Far Harbor
Nuka World
Anti-Materiel Rifle
CR-74L Combat Rifle
Captain Cosmos
Doom BFG
Fantasy Hero Set
Heavy Incinerator
Manwell Rifle Set
Pint-Sized Slasher

Off

Native - just show native doll indicator

fileInfo.description: HUD when you need it. Hide when you don't.
fileInfo.name: Immersive HUD - iHUD

modInfo.author: Gopher
modInfo.description:
[youtube]AnIbFgJeTeY[/youtube][youtube]v4PQgf82wVw[/youtube]
The aim of iHUD is to provide the immersive feel you get from having no HUD, whilst keeping the usefulness of having one. It takes the permanantly visible HUD elements such as compass and crosshair, and hides them when not needed. Hence the motto:

HUD when you need. HIDE when you don't.

[color=#00ff00]What does it let you do?
[/color]1. Hides the HUD and lets you set the circumstances under which it re-apears.
2. Lets you set up situations where single HUD elements appear rather than the entire HUD.
3. Toggle the HUD with an in game item. 
3. Toggle the compass with an in game item. 

[color=#00ff00]Requires[/color]
1. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309/?]HUDFramework[/url] v[b]1.0d or later

[/b][color=#00ff00]Recommended[/color]
1. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497/?]Mod Configuration Menu[/url] - Adds a user friendly menu system to control the mod without having to use holotapes.

[color=#00ff00]Installation[/color]
1. Click the Download with Manager button in the files section to download to NMM.
2. Activate the mod from the mods tab.

[color=#00ff00]Load Order[/color]
Please place iHUD below/after the HUDFramework mod in your load order.
modInfo.name: Immersive HUD - iHUD
modInfo.summary: HUD when you need. Hide when you don't.

fileInfo.name: Realistic Conversations

modInfo.author: Gorgulla
modInfo.description:
[font=Verdana][b][size=4][center]﻿[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/1717-0-1477959668.png[/img][/center]

Description:[/size][/b][/font][font=Verdana]
The series continues! From Skyrim to Fallout! Because fallout deserves immersion as well!

[size=3]Ever wondered why [/size][/font][font=Verdana][size=3][font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's [/size][/font]always seems to have a longer pause between each sentence? Well No more, They are actually talking like people should do now.
Every social logic in Fallout for [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] is changed, they talk more often to each others. And will less likely greet to you from a distance, they will also greet less often too, making them to not act as much as robots. [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] are also more clever and will know for example if they talked to a [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC [/size][/font]and will therefore talk to another or not talk at all. After some time, they talk again with each others.
Expressions is also overhauled, they express themselves when they actually should.
Emotions is as well overhauled, You can see how the [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] face look more alive.
The time when NPC's eats is overhauled as well, now NPC's will eat at a more regular time like lunch: 12-1pm, Dinner 4-5pm. Player will comment more when skipping a dialogue and much much more!

Additionally, I included the option to increase the amount of active NPC's at one cell. It doesn't magically add more NPC's it just makes it possible, so enjoy visiting your settlements with many NPC's or running into a battlefield with a huge amount of NPC's fighting.

Did you accidentally run in to some stuff, and [/size][/font][font=Verdana][size=3][font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's [/size][/font]start to yell at you?
Well it won't happen as often now, It happen way too often in vanilla.

This is a must-have mod for anyone that has sound on while playing.[/size]

[size=5][b]What it covers:[/b][/size]
[size=3]This covers all talking/singing [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] ( also new modded [font=Verdana][size=3]NPC's[/size][/font] ), no matter what language you have.
Also covers modded sentences.
[/size][size=6]
[b]Compatibility:[/b][/size]

[/font][list]
[size=3][font=Verdana]Any mod actually.
[/font][/size][/list][font=Verdana]
[size=5][b]Savegame compatible and clean:[/b][/size]
[size=3]The mod is savegame compatible and is also safe to uninstall.
[b]This mod is completely script free.[/b][/size]
[size=5]
[b]Install:[/b][/size]
[size=3]Choose one of the Main files or one from the optional files.
Activate with your mod manager[/size]

[/font][font=Verdana][size=4][b]My other Fallout 4 mods:[/b][/size]
[size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/145/?]Fallout Texture Overhaul Stars
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/160?]Fallout Texture Overhaul Moons
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/449/?]Fallout Texture Overhaul PipBoy (Pip-Boy) UHD 4K
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3344]Fallout Texture Overhaul Power Armors UHD 4K
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/32246]Fallout water overhaul[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/32255]Fallout Texture Overhaul Radscorpions 4K[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/32334]Fallout Texture Overhaul Mole rats 4K[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/32514]Realistic Conversations Fallout 4[/url][/size][color=#ffffff][size=3][u][b]

[/b][/u][b][size=6][b]Permissions:[/b][/size]
[size=3]This mod is made by Gorgulla and is ONLY allowed to be uploaded by Gorgulla on either Nexusmods or Bethesda.
If you find it elsewhere, IT'S STOLEN.
You are not allowed to change my mod and upload it as your own.[/size][/b][/size][/color]
[/font]

fileInfo.name: Caliente's Beautiful Bodies Enhancer - v2.6.3

modInfo.author: Ousnius and Caliente
modInfo.description:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/k2z0DwA.png[/img]
[size=5]The most customizable body mod available is back![/size][/center]

[center]Together with BodySlide, you can customize your character's appearance to the limits of your imagination, and make any outfit fit well!
So be sure to download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25]BodySlide[/url] for maximum potential![/center]
[color=#ffff60]Contents[/color]
[list]
[*][color=#a0fff0]Description[/color]
[*][color=#a0fff0]Options[/color]
[*][color=#a0fff0]Installation[/color]
[*][color=#a0fff0]FAQ[/color]
[*][color=#a0fff0]Troubleshooting[/color]
[*][color=#a0fff0]Recommended Mods[/color]
[*][color=#a0fff0]Uninstalling[/color]
[*][color=#a0fff0]Credits[/color]
[/list]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/JxsH2xL.png[/img]
CBBE replaces the vanilla female body that all adult female characters (player and NPC) share, with one that is fully customizable with the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25]BodySlide[/url] tool. By default there are three nude options available that don't require anything but installation, as well as [url=http://vintagedancer.com/1950s/1950s-lingerie]lore-friendly underwear[/url] styles for these body shapes (using Beth's own unused underwear meshes).

These meshes have a total of over 21k vertices - compared to the vanilla body's modest 1750 - for optimal smoothness. In tests there have been no reports of these high-poly meshes causing any slow down, but may still be too much for weaker systems to use, so be warned.

Included in the main installer are bodies, textures, all vanilla and DLC outfits, and BodySlide addons for the body and outfits.
There are also morph files for the body and the outfits included, which are used for in-game morphing with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12631/]LooksMenu[/url] or other script mods.

Also, in the Optional downloads, are files for the CBBE Reduced bodies. These are lower poly than the main file, but have working dismemberment. [i]Requires main file.[/i]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/yVLswK8.png[/img]
Please note that these shapes are what you get when the [i]very centre[/i] of the weight/body morph triangle is selected. The shape will then morph according to where ever you select in the triangle, just as the vanilla body does.

[color=#ffff60][size=3]Slim:[/size][/color] Slender shape for fans of slimmer ladies.
[color=#ffff60][size=3]Curvy:[/size][/color] Based on the modern ideal.
[color=#ffff60][size=3]Vanilla:[/size][/color] Default body, but better!
[color=#ffff60][size=3]NeverNude:[/size][/color] The above bodies, but with underwear.
Be sure to grab [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25]BodySlide[/url] for 100% customisability with CBBE, including body physics!

[color=#ffff60][size=3]Texture Resources[/size][/color]

Included in the optional downloads is a Texture Resource archive providing the source  photoshop .psd files with Diffuse, Normal, and Specular textures.  These files include the base texture data used by CBBE, as well as the following additional options (as hidden layers that can be activated.) 
[list]
[*]a total of 9 pubic hair options... three by me, three by Jeir, and three by XunAmarox (used with permission and originally part of her "CBBE Innies" mod)
[*]pinker nipple option by Jeir, and another nipple variant with diffuse/spec/normals by XunAmarox
[*]An alternative vulva style by XunAmarox from her [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5659/?]CBBE Innies mod[/url]. 
[/list]If you like XunAmarox's options, please remember to endorse her mod and thank her! [img]http://forums.nexusmods.com/public/style_emoticons/dark/smile.gif[/img]

Permissions to use these textures to create optional variants, including distributing those variants as mods are granted, provided credits are given, and links to this mod as well as CBBEInnies are provided ( if you use those layers ). Please don't redistribute the source .psd files, though!

[b][i]Installation and use of these texture files is detailed in the readme file included in the archive. Software such as Photoshop or GIMP can open the provided .psd files.[/i][/b]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/VvfymCB.png[/img]
Add the following to your "Fallout4Custom.ini" file located in "Documents\My Games\Fallout4". Not your Steam/.../Fallout 4/Data folder, not Fallout4.ini or Fallour4Prefs.ini. Only Fallout4Custom.ini. If you use MO2, then you need to edit the one through its built-in ini editor.

[i][Archive]
bInvalidateOlderFiles=1
sResourceDataDirsFinal=[/i]

[size=1](No, that's not a typo. If the file doesn't exist, you need to create it yourself manually. Make sure it ends with .ini instead of .ini.txt or .ini.ini!
If the lines are already there, you only need to edit their values.)[/size]

[color=#ffff60][size=3]Manual[/size][/color][list=1]
[*] Download the main file archive and open it with 7zip. Do not use anything but 7zip.
[*] Install the [i]contents[/i] of the 00 Required folder into Fallout 4/Data.
[*] Install the [i]contents[/i] of the body you want (one of folders 01-05) into Fallout 4/Data. Skip this if you only want the nude Slim body.
[*] Install the [i]contents[/i] of the outfit replacers you want (06-17) into Fallout 4/Data, according to what body shape you're using and what DLC you have.
[*] Optional: Install the contents of the BodySlide folders (18-21) into Fallout 4/Data. For BodySlide. [b]If you're going to use BodySlide, you can skip the previous two steps.[/b]
[*] Optional: Install the contents of the Tri and F4EE folders (22-26) into Fallout 4/Data. For in-game morphs. Requires BodySlide folders and LooksMenu.
[*]Optional: Download the Optional CBBE Reduced file and open it with 7zip. Copy steps 2-6 to install these files. 
[/list][color=#ffff60][size=3]Mod Managers[/size][/color]
[list=1]
[*]Install the archive to Mod Organizer/Nexus Mod Manager or other mod managers like you would do with any other mod. Always install Optional files after the main file.
[/list]
Note:
The CBBE.esp plugin is optional if you have neck-covering hair or don't use the LooksMenu in-game morphs. See FAQ4.

[color=#ffff60][size=3]Installation Tutorials[/size][/color]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wkwtgp3x25s]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wkwtgp3x25s[/url] by Gopher
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OkAWCayNSSs]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OkAWCayNSSs[/url] by Zimta

[b]Beautiful showcase by Hodilton and an in-depth tutorial by Gopher:[/b]
[youtube]hU8hbYSwivs[/youtube][youtube]Wkwtgp3x25s[/youtube]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/lZ4QzO3.png[/img]
[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q1:[/color] Why are the bodies not changing after I install?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A1:[/color] You didn't follow the instructions in the installation section. Ensure you have entered all three lines into your .ini and all files listed in Troubleshooting are present in your game directory. Make sure the file is called Fallout4Custom.ini, not Fallout4Custom.ini.txt (un-hide file extensions)!
[color=#a0fff0]A2:[/color] If NPCs have changed, but your player character hasn't, you're using a mod that changes the directory for the player body meshes/textures, such as 'Unique Player'. You'll need to install matching meshes/textures manually.
[color=#a0fff0]A3:[/color] If your player character has changed, but NPCs haven't, you're using a mod that changes the directory for NPC body meshes/textures. You'll need to install the meshes/textures manually.
[color=#a0fff0]A4:[/color] You're not looking at a nude female adult character or are currently wearing an outfit that's not CBBE-compatible.
[color=#a0fff0]A5:[/color] Your mod manager is being buggy or there's a user error. The installer is bug free, or there would be more people reporting issues. If you're using NMM, make sure you're using the latest files from GitHub.

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q2:[/color] Why am I getting patchwork body textures (black shoulder, nipple on stomach or painted-on underwear)?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A1:[/color] You didn't follow the instructions in the installation section. Ensure you have entered all three lines into your .ini and all files listed in Troubleshooting are present in your game directory. Make sure the file is called Fallout4Custom.ini, not Fallout4Custom.ini.txt!
[color=#a0fff0]A2:[/color] You have a conflict somewhere. Make sure you don't have any other mods that affect or overwrote the body.
[color=#a0fff0]A3:[/color] You're not using a CBBE-compatible outfit or texture on a CBBE body. At the very least, you should install the vanilla outfits/default textures found in the main file's installer.
[color=#a0fff0]A4:[/color] You're using a mod that changes the directory for the body meshes/textures. You'll need to install matching meshes/textures manually.
[color=#a0fff0]A5:[/color] Elderly women are not officially supported by this mod. Install the elderly textures found [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/7432]here[/url].
[color=#a0fff0]A6:[/color] Mannequins (Contraptions DLC) are not officially supported. Try [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15821]this mod[/url].

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q3:[/color] How do I fix the texture mismatch at the back of the player/NPC head?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A:[/color] Activate the CBBE.esp to fix it. This only works for the player character (see below for more info).

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q4:[/color] Why does FO4's CBBE have a plugin when Skyrim's did not?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A:[/color] A lot of space was wasted on the vanilla body UV map (how a texture lines up on a mesh - the 3D model), and part of the head texture (the rear) was included as part of the body texture. FO4 CBBE's UV map is almost exactly the same as Skyrim's, making it easier for modders to convert body textures over or make new ones, and filling up the wasted space. But as a result, the part of the UV map used for the head is taken up by our leg texture. The plugin corrects this by pointing the head rear to a duplicated, vanilla body texture (femalebhed.dds). The plugin is optional if you have hair covering your head rear or can ignore the issue.

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q5:[/color] Why does the plugin for the head mismatch only work for the player?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A:[/color] Each NPC in FO4 has its own head texture - in Skyrim, the texture was shared with the player, with only skin tone/makeup/scars/warpaint being unique to the NPC. This is why your shiny new face texture doesn't work with NPCs and why fixing the back of the head is harder than just a quick texture swap.

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q6:[/color] Why are some of the vanilla outfits so 'jaggy'?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A1:[/color] Most of the outfits are low poly because they are the vanilla outfits directly edited to work with CBBE/BodySlide. We didn't have time to remake all the outfits with a higher poly count, as it's a lot of work. A few, such as the vault suit or dresses, have been granted additional polygons.

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q7:[/color] Do outfits or body textures not specifically made for CBBE work with it?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A:[/color] Only body textures made to work with CBBE will show up correctly in all places, as CBBE has different UV maps for texture alignment. Outfits that show skin in any way need to be compatible with CBBE to match up. You'll have to (nicely) ask the creator to make a version of their mod for CBBE or convert the outfit yourself using Outfit Studio, or the textures using Photoshop/GIMP/etc.

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q8:[/color] Will there be a male version?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A:[/color] We would like to but are mostly lacking the time. Try the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10360]Super Hero Bodies by smorris2012[/url], which can be customized using BodySlide.

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q9:[/color] How do I make this player-only?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A:[/color] Install a mod like '[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3718]Unique Player[/url]' and follows its instructions. Note that outfits won't be unique unless you duplicate their game entry yourself or have your player character only use standalone modded outfits. The linked unique player mod also doesn't support 1st person meshes properly, so you could get issues with the hand seams in 1st person. Better would be to install one of the default bodies for all NPCs to use, and use the in-game morphs with BodySlide and LooksMenu to make your character have her own shape (this would also mean all compatible outfits will morph to your character's shape when worn).

[size=3][color=#ffff60]Q10:[/color] Will you put this on Bethesda.net?[/size]
[color=#a0fff0]A:[/color]  CBBE and its outfits are[url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4061893] now on Bethesda.net.[/url]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/KhIHYTg.png[/img]
If the mod appears not to be working, the most common cause is incorrectly placed files. Read the FAQ and ensure the files below are in the correct place (you can also use this to find the files to delete if you wish to uninstall manually).

The files you're looking for are:

fileInfo.name: High FPS Physics Fix

modInfo.author: Antonix35
modInfo.description:
[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Features﻿[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[list]
[*][size=3]Unlock FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Untie the game speed from the framerate, [/size][size=3]allowing you to play at any FPS values at normal speed.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixed stuttering. The game will become smoother. No more need for iFPSClamp=60 and it works with any FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixes a problem with dialogs.[/size]
[*][size=3]Jump height fix at high FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Reduces loading time. The effect is especially noticeable if game is on SSD.[/size]
[*][size=3]Ability to disable animation on loading screens to [color=#ffff00]significantly[/color] reduce loading time.[/size]
[*][size=3]Ability to shorten post-loading animation.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix incorrect processor threads allocation at loading time[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix rotation speed of objects.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix [/size][size=3]rotation speed in workshop mode.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixes a problem of stuck NPC and [/size][size=3]getting stuck when you access to the terminal and power armor.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix lockpick rotation speed and sound during lockpicking.[/size]
[*][size=3]Fix wind speed (clothes and hair).[/size]
[*][size=3]Fixed a bug with a white screen when the player falls (from the third person). [/size]
[/list]
[size=3]The mod will be useful for any FPS.[/size]
[size=3]You can customize mod by editing the HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini file, which is located in game folder Fallout 4\Data\F4SE\Plugins or in mod folder: true - enabled, false - disabled.

[/size][size=3]If the EnableDisplayTweaks setting is set to true: 1) The Fullscreen and borderless options in the launcher (bFull Screen and bBorderless in Fallout4Prefs.ini) have no effect. If you want to change the display mode - it must be set in HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini (FullScreen and Borderless settings). 2) If using ENB disable "ForceVSync" in enblocal.ini setting and set "Vertical synchroniztion" to application-controlled in driver settings or your game get black screen.[/size]

[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Requirements[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[size=3]Fallout 4 - 1.10.163.0
A version for VR is available.[/size]
[size=3]F4SE - 0.6.20+[/size]


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Compatibility﻿[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[size=3]The mod must be compatible with others.[/size]


[center][size=4][color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b]My others mods[/b][/font][/color][/size][/center]
[size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/47760]Sprint Stuttering Fix
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48078]Weapon Debris Crash Fix[/url][/size]


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=3][center]Credits[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/36620665?tab=user+files]R3zy[/url] for providing the source of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/18160]Havok Fix[/url] for Skyrim SE.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/5217635?tab=user+files]SlavicPotato[/url] for providing the source of [url=https://github.com/SlavicPotato/SSEDisplayTweaks]SSE Display Tweaks[/url] for Skyrim SE.
F4SE's team.

The source is available on [url=https://github.com/AntoniX35/HighFPSPhysicsFix]GitHub[/url].


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Особенности[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[list]
[*][size=3]Разблокировка FPS (частоты кадров).[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление дрожания изображения\NPC\игрока. Игра станет более плавной. Нет больше необходимости в iFPSClamp=60 и это работает с любым ФПС.[/size]
[*][size=3]Отвязка скорости игры от частоты кадров, что позволит вам играть при любых значениях FPS c нормальной скоростью.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправляет проблему с диалогами.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление высоты прыжка при высоком FPS.[/size]
[*][size=3]Ускорение загрузки локаций. Эффект особенно заметен, если игра работает на твердотельном накопителе (SSD).[/size]
[*][size=3]Возможность отключить анимацию на загрузочных экранах, чтобы [color=#ffff00]значительно[/color] сократить время загрузки.[/size]
[*][size=3]Возможность сократить послезагрузочную анимацию.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление неверного распределения потоков процессора во время загрузок.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости вращения объектов.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости вращения в режиме строительства.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление застреваний NPC, а также при попытке подойти к терминалам/силовой броне.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости вращения отмычкой и звука при взломе.[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправление скорости ветра (одежда и волосы).[/size]
[*][size=3]Исправлен баг с белым экраном во время падения игрока при камере от третьего лица.[/size]
[/list][size=3][size=3]
Мод будет полезен при любом FPS.[/size]
[size=3]Вы можете настроить мод, отредактировав файл HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini, который находится в папке с игрой Data\F4SE\Plugins или в папке мода: значение true - включено, значение false - отключено.
[/size]
Если у настройки EnableDisplayTweaks установлено значение true: 1) Параметры полноэкранного режима и оконного режима без рамки в лаунчере (bFull Screen и bBorderless в Fallout4Prefs.ini) не действуют, если вы хотите изменить режим отображения, он должен быть установлен в HighFPSPhysicsFix.ini (настройки FullScreen и Borderless). 2) При использовании ENB отключите "ForceVSync" в файле enblocal.ini и установите "Вертикальную синхронизацию" на управляемую приложением в настройках драйвера, иначе ваша игра получит черный экран.

[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][size=4][center]Требования[/center][/size][/b][/font][/color]
[size=3]Fallout 4 - 1.10.163.0[/size]
[size=3]F4SE - 0.6.20+[/size]


[color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b][center]Совместимость[/center][/b][/font][/color][/size]
[size=3]Мод должен быть совместим с другими.[/size]


[center][size=3][color=#6aa84f][font=Arial][b]Мои другие моды[/b][/font][/color][/size][/center]
[size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/47760]Sprint Stuttering Fix
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48078]Weapon Debris Crash Fix[/url][/size]
