modInfo.author: shatsnazzle
modInfo.description:
This mod makes it so NPC humans and civilized ghouls will drop their weapon and run away when they are on fire. No more of this, "it's OK that I'm on fire let me slowly strafe, and calmly steady my aim at you," no. fuck that.

YOU. ARE. ON. F I R E .

Drop your gun and act like you give a shit.

[color=#ffff00][u][b]This mod affects:[/b][/u][/color]
Molotovs
Flame thrower
Incendiary shots
Lasers with fire mods
Special NPC fire abilities
Oil traps
Fire hazards
And a few others!
This mod skips altering a few fire hazards that are labeled as having small effects.

There are 2 versions available of this mod.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Version 1 (cool version):[/u][/b][/color]
When hit with a molotov or set on fire, civilized ghouls and human NPCs will be staggered hard, have their shootin' arm crippled, drop their gun, and they will run away. When NPCs run away they zip away at ridiculous speed so I added a slowing effect (curable if the NPC uses a Stimpak) and debuffed their action points for 30 sec so they can't sprint (cannot stimpak out of the action point debuff). Molotovs work the same as vanilla on anyone in power armor because well, it's power armor![color=#00ffff][u][b] All of these new features to fire have no effect on the player[/b][/u];[/color] we're already smart (or dumb) enough to panic when we are on fire.

In order to make this cool version work and make NPCs reliably drop their gun, I made it so humans and civilized ghouls can no longer use crippled limbs. It's awesome.
[color=#00ffff][u][b]Note: you the player are still susceptible to limb crippling from gunfire or anything else that hits you, including fire, you are just immune to the artificial limb crippling added to fire effects.[/b][/u][/color]
If you like crippling enemies but you prefer to be immune to crippling you can either wait until you level up and get the Adamantium Skeleton perk or you download the optional Player Immune to Cripple file.

In order to make crippled limbs unusable I had to edit a HumanRace and GhoulRace value. I have no idea if this will conflict with any anime chick body overhaul cartoon cheerleader boob physics mods you're using but if it does I have a suck version available:

[color=#ff0000][b][u]Version 2 (suck version):
[/u][/b][/color]This version does almost all the same things except instead of enabling unusable crippled limbs and crippling the arm it simply disarms the victim and applies a fear effect to make them run (there's also a fear effect in version 1 for good measure but it's probably redundant with a crippled arm). The downside to this is enemies will very often just pick the weapon right back up or go grab another weapon near their new location after running away. Also sometimes they just don't even run.

[color=#ff7700][u][b]Possibly weird behavior:[/b][/u][color=#000000]
[/color][/color]In order to make NPCs reliably run away I added an effect that actually heals crippled legs. Otherwise the molotov has a chance of crippling their legs and they just sit on the floor staring at you while they roast and it looks dumb. So if you cripple a leg and then decide to set them on fire, this is why they are able to magically run again.

[color=#ff7700][b][u]Other weird behavior:[/u][/b][/color]
Honestly this mod is just changing NPCs from displaying reeeeeally weird behavior to less weird behavior. I don't think it would take much imagination to make something better and I hope someone does. I would love to see NPCs on fire truly freaking out and and flailing or trying to protect their face but I have no idea how to do that and I have no plans of ever learning how to animate stuff.

[color=#ff0000][b][u]Conflicts:[/u][/b][/color]
If you use CROSS Crit Gore overhaul just put this mod somewhere [s]above[/s] below CROSS Crit in your load order. Thanks [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/11355265]DerekUGA[/url].

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Installing:[/u][/b][/color]
Just install as usual with Nexus Mod Manager

[color=#00ff00][u][b]Uninstalling:[/b][/u][/color]
Just uninstall as usual with Nexus Mod Manager. There shouldn't be any residual effects at all. This mod just adds a few tweaked "spell" effects alongside vanilla fire damage over time spells.

[color=#ffff00][u]Requirements:[/u][/color]
Not really a requirement but I highly recommend using this with some damage overhaul or realism mods such as unbogus health scaling and MADNESS to make the NPC's fire-to-death time feel satisfying and believable.
DLC and non-DLC version available.
[color=#00ffff][b][u]
Getting your hott pervy mods to work with version 1.1:[/u][/b][/color]
You'll have to google some mod conflict manager software or just open your body mod in the Creation Kit and remove the checkbox in HumanRace and GhoulRace that says they're allowed to use crippled limbs. Let me know in the comments if you need help.
modInfo.name: More Realistic Fire Behavior
modInfo.summary: This mod simply makes it so that when NPCs have 100% of their skin literally engulfed in flames they care a little.

fileInfo.changelog_html: Perk should FINALLY apply now. Nerfed Synths.
fileInfo.name: BLD- Robot Edition

modInfo.author: Rylasasin Zzyxzz
modInfo.description:
[center][b][size=5]Better Locational Damage - Robot Edition[/size]﻿
[/b][/center]


[size=3]Do you enjoy Zzyxzz's Better Locational Damage? Or at the very least, his "Ghoul Edition" on its own? Do you wish robots also were leveled up? Do you find it odd that blowing a robot's arm up causes it to just die like it was some sort of squishy organic being? Do you find it odd that robots that have been wandering around 200 years can go down with a few pipe pistol shots? Want Sentry Bots to be the monstrous machines they were meant to be?

This mod is for you. 

This "unofficial" addition to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/8515543]Zzyxzz[/url]'s "[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815]Better Locational Damage[/url]" does to robots what "Ghoul Edition" does for ghouls, but much differently. 

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Robots now operate on a sort of "Mechwarrior" type system: Robots no longer take health damage simply by shooting at their arms, legs, and head. [u]They only take damage if you shoot at the torso (where the reactor is). [/u]However, doing so will still cripple them, and blowing their arms off will still cause them to self-destruct. In some cases, it may actually be MORE beneficial to destroy their limbs than it is to destroy the core itself.[/size]
[*][size=3]Affects Protectrons, Handies/Gutsies, Assaultrons, Robobrains, Sentries, and (Gen 1/2) Synths.[/size]
[*][size=3]Robots are tougher to destroy in general. After all, they've been operational for over 200 years in most cases, a raider with a pipe pistol or the stray molerat isn't going to do much to them.[/size]
[list]
[*][size=3]Protectrons and Handies/Gutsies are still bottom of the barrel, but are still tougher than they are in vanilla. You will find it rather difficult to destroy one with a pipe pistol.﻿ [/size]
[*][size=3]Assaultrons are military-grade melee robots. You'll need concentrated fire to take one down.[/size]
[*][size=3]Robobrains are very strong enemies now.[/size]
[*][size=3]Sentry Bots are almost deathclaw-tier level threats. ﻿﻿[/size]
[*][size=3]Synths are a bit stronger than protectrons, but FAR weaker than assaultrons. Keep in mind that they also love to travel in packs. You'll quickly see why the commonwealth farmers fear these things so much.[/size]
[/list][/list] ﻿[font=Tahoma][size=2] ﻿(Keep in mind that in the case of Automatron Robots, a robot's "race" is determined by their [u]legs[/u], NOT by their torsos. A Robot that has a protectron head, a robobrain body, assaultron arms, and sentry bot legs counts as a sentry bot, not as a robobrain or protectron. I know this is weird, but that's something hard-coded into vanilla, there's nothing I can do about this sadly.)[/size][/font]
[list]
[*][size=3]Pulse Grenades/Mines and the Lightning Gun are more effective against robots now.[/size]
[*][size=3]Just to make sure Automatron isn't a complete nightmare, Rust Devil and Mechanist robots take a bit more damage.[/size]
[/list]
[size=4]I recommend you run this with my other mod, [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/39552][size=4]Automatron Randomized Bots[/size][/url][size=4], as well as the aformentioned "Better Locational Damage" mod. [/size][size=3]Neither are necessary, however.

[/size][size=6][b]FAQ:
[/b][/size][list]
[*][size=3][b]"What about Turrets, Eyebots, and Vertibirds? Are those effected too?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]No. They are not effected. Turrets and Eyebots are too weak to be worth the bother. As for Vertibirds, that has its own mod I just released, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41919]Better Vertibirds - A Vertibird Overhaul[/url]﻿. [/size][*][size=3][b]"Are the robots I create affected too?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Yes, yes they are. [i]Keep in mind that as mentioned above, a robot's race (and therefore the amount of protection they get) is determined by their [u]LEGS[/u], not by their torso.[/i][/size][*][size=3][b]"Why do I need Far Harbor?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Because Far Harbor has its own version of the Robobrain race. [/size][*][size=3][b]"Can I use this without Better Locational Damage?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Yes, you can. While it is meant to compliment that mod, just like that mod's "Ghoul Edition," this mod can be used stand alone, so you can use it with something like Unbogus if you wish, or just by itself.[/size][*][size=3][b]"Are there any scripts?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Nope. No scripts.[/size][*][size=3][b]"Load Order?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]On the bottom. It's a ES(L)P, so it will not take up ESP space. Just a bare minimum of ESL space.[/size][*][size=3][b]"Can I port this to Xbox/PS4/Beth.net?"[/b] [/size]
[size=3]Yes, you can. I do not care. [u]Keep in mind that if I do update this, you are responsible for keeping it updated. [/u][/size][*][size=3][b](Zzyxzz only) "Can I include this in the main Better Locational Damage as an addon?"[/b][/size]
[size=3]Yes, you can.[/size][/list]
modInfo.name: Better Locational Damage - Robot Edition
modInfo.summary: Changes the way robots take damage. Robots now operate on a mechwarrior-like system instead of an overall health system.

fileInfo.description: Chose the default mod or customize what tabs you want to sort. Contains a .esp version and a .strings version (you only need to use one of them)
fileInfo.name: Better Item Sorting NMM Installer

modInfo.author: xandarori
modInfo.description:
[center][font=Verdana][img]http://i.imgur.com/R62tgQc.png[/img]
[youtube]_FauNUcyX80[/youtube]

[/font][/center][font=Verdana]

[size=4][b]Stuff this mod sorts
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/b][/size]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/irVJBXW.png[/img]

[size=3]The different tags ( ), [ ] and { } changes the order they show up at in the sorting.

Some head items in game that are being sorted can contain mods but as it was only around 4 items i let it slide (not counting railroad mods)[/size]

[/font][center][/center][font=Verdana][b][size=4]Stuff it doesn't sort atm[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]At first I couldn't sort the prefixes the mods created on armors and weapons as it would ruin the sorting.
But that is now possible with the help of mods that changes the order mod prefixes show up in the item names, like these mods [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5605/?]"Better Armor and Weapon naming and sorting"[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4878/?]"Armor Tag Sorting"[/url]
[/size][/font][font=Verdana]

[/font][b][size=4]
[font=Verdana]Compatibility[/font][/size][font=Verdana][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/font][/b][font=Verdana]
[size=3]The .esp version will conflict with other .esp mods that changes the same FormIDs, depending on load order they will overwrite each other.
The .STRINGS version is compatible with other .esp mods unless they change the item names as those changes are loaded into the fallout4.esm file directly but if a .esp mod changes the item names those changes will override the string files. I have included some compatibility string versions for FDI (you don't need those if you use the .esp version)[/size]
[b][size=4]
[/size][size=4]Translations
[color=#1e84cc]================================
[/color][/size][/b][/font][font=Verdana][size=3]Press the "TRANSL" Button under the "TOTAL D/LS Counter" to see a list of translations.[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/5867/?]
[/url][/size]
[b][size=4]
Installing[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]
[b][color=#ff7700]With NMM:[/color][/b]
[b]ESP Version:[/b]
1. Download with the manager and chose the .esp version you want.
2. Make sure the files are being loaded.

[b]STRINGS Version:[/b]
1. Select the Strings version you need either default BIS or one with FDI compatibility (Install this after FDI).
2. Overwrite any files if needed.

[color=#ff7700][b]Manually:[/b][/color]
[b]ESP Version:[/b]
1. Place the .esp files you want in the data folder and make sure they are being loaded.

[b]STRINGS Version:[/b]
1. Place the strings file you need in the Data\Strings folder. (Install this after FDI if you used a compatibility version)[/size]


[b][size=4]Uninstalling[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3][b][color=#ff7700]With NMM:[/color][/b]
ESP Version:
1. Right click in the mod list and chose uninstall, or deselect the file(s) from the mod load list.

STRINGS Version:
1. Uninstalling with the manager.

[b][color=#ff7700]Manually:
[/color][/b]ESP Version:
1. Remove the .esp file(s) from the data folder, or deselect it/them from the mod load list.

STRINGS Version:
1. Replace the mods string file with the original one found in the mod archive or on the file section.
[/size]
[size=3][b]
[/b][/size][b][size=4]Feedback[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]Constructive criticism and tips are welcome, reporting bugs would be appreciated just make sure you have installed everything correctly and it's my mod that causes the bug. Also compatibility problems with other .esp mods aren't really bugs as it's in the nature of .esp mods please don't report those as bugs.[/size]


[b][size=4]Credits[/size][size=4]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b]
[size=3]Thanks to:
McGuffin that made the tool [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/215/?]Fallout 4 Translator[/url]
Stryke131 that made [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1504/?]Fallout 4 String Patcher
[/url]Delta4873 for pointing me in the right direction in learning how to create .esp files.
[/size]
[color=#00ff00]
[size=4][b]Latest Update 2.6.1[/b][/size][/color][size=4][b]
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/b][/size]
[/font][size=3][font=Verdana]Fixed some bugs.
Added String file versions to the installer.

The small 2.6.1 fix was to update the .esp files to match the changes the latest fo4 update did to the fallout4.esm file.

[/font][/size][b][size=4][color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b][b][size=4]
Thanks to the people that donated! <3
[color=#1e84cc]================================[/color][/size][/b][size=3][font=Verdana]

[b][size=4][b][color=#dd7e6b]Frequently Asked Questions[/color][/b]
[color=#1e84cc]================================
[/color][/size][/b]Q: Can you add new sorting options like sort by newest items?

A: No i can't add new sorting modes, only change the item names to let the games built in alphabetical sorting change the order.

Q: Does this work with other languages?

A: This mod would turn the sorted items into English, If you translate this file please credit me :)[/font][/size]
modInfo.name: Better Item Sorting
modInfo.summary: Adds prefixes to some item names to make the sorting better e.g. (Note), (Holo), {Key}, (Chem), [Food Rad]. The installer contains different sorting options and a .esp version as well as a .STRINGS file version for compatibility.

Vacuum Hoppers from the Contraptions Workshop DLC now remove items from Mr Tidy's chest
fileInfo.description: This is the main .ESP file download -- install this or the alternate .ESL (but not both)
fileInfo.name: Settlement Tidy Bot

modInfo.author: Athelbras
modInfo.description:
[b][size=5][color=lightblue]Settlement Tidy Bot[/color][/size][/b]

Version 2.4


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Description:[/color][/size][/b]

Mr. Tidy "undertaker bot" that scurries around removing "remains" from a Settlement.

[center]---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[i][size=2]Originally created in 2041 by General Atomics International before the Great War, the Mister Helper Type-1b was intended as a supplement to the highly-regarded 2037 Mister Handy Type-1 product.  However, frequent returns for factory maintenance and/or replacement resulted in the Type-1b model being temporarily withdrawn from volume production.

Limited re-introduction occurred in 2042 with rebranding as a Mister Rescue Type-1c "disaster relief" unit in response to the devastating earthquake in Mexico City that year. Mister Undertaker, an early prototype model, was quietly introduced a short while later.

Mister Rescue met with commercial success and was subsequently marketed to consumers as Mister GroundsKeeper in 2045 with notable sales revenue from golf courses, vacation resorts, and daycare centers.

2055 saw the release of Mister Salvage & Reclamation (later rebranded "Mister Salvage").  Revenue for this Type-1d model was modest with purchase orders primarily from construction and landscaping firms.

That same year, the Vault-Tec Corporation acquired exclusive rights for a Mister Tidy Type-1e model (essentially a redesign of the Mister Undertaker prototype) which was subsequently deployed at Vault-Tec's numerous facilities.[/size][/i]

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Key Features:[/color][/size][/b]

• Automatic Operation
• Limited to One per Settlement
• Continues working while its Cell is unloaded
• Recovered items are transferred to the Station Pad's chest
• Waits at the station pad when there is currently nothing to tidy
• Tidying requires wall-clock time and is not affected by Wait, Sleep, or Fast Travel
• The content of Mr Tidy's chest can be extracted using a Vacuum Hopper (Contraptions Workshop DLC)

This mod provides a "lore friendly" approach for removing corpses and other dead things from a settlement by enabling you to assign that task to a Vault-Tec [color=lightblue][b]Mister Tidy[/b][/color] robot.  Just place the 'bot in a central area, instruct it to begin tidying, wait a minute for it to "beep" (or makes cheerful noises when there is nothing to tidy up), and then feel free to resume your adventures.

Mr. Tidy can be directed to tidy things within the boundaries of that settlement, or for a distance that can extend beyond those boundaries, with tidying always centered on its station pad. Mr. Tidy returns to the station pad upon completion.  It then waits there until it is instructed to resume, or is stored in its workshop, or is scrapped.  Items recovered from corpses are stored in the station pad's chest.

There is a brief initial mission / quest which provides a bit of backstory and conveys essential usage information.  It normally begins after escaping from Vault 111.  For those using an "alternate start" mod, it begins while outdoors in the Commonwealth (the main game area) -- or try visiting Sanctuary Hills and stand near the Workshop for a few minutes.

[b][size=3][color=white]NOTE:[/color][/size][/b]  This is a mod for removing dead things, but which also automatically collects items for you from those dead things. It is not intended to be just a looting mod. So players who do not desire dead things to be removed (perhaps because of the behavior of some other mod) should simply not use Mr Tidy.

[b][size=3][color=white]ANOTHER NOTE:[/color][/size][/b]  Create a saved game before tidying a settlement -- one that you can return to if issues are encountered.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]How To Build:[/color][/size][/b]

Mister Tidy is placed in a settlement by using a WorkShop to build a Station Pad. The station pad can be found in the STRUCTURES>MISCELLANEOUS section of the WorkShop's building menu when an initial quest ("Rest In Peace") is completed. The quest appears shortly after leaving Vault 111 for normal play, or when outdoors in the Commonwealth when using an "alternate start" mod. If the quest does not appear when expected, then double-check to confirm that this mod has been enabled.

When opening a workshop to build something, you initially see the user interface positioned at a wooden building with "Structures" as a label above it. Go upwards one row from there, and then go over to the right along that row until you see "Structures>Miscellaneous" as a label; in the base game that label is above a bloodied super mutant pole but may be something different depending on the mods you installed. Now go up one row from there. Everything you then see horizontally in that row is the "Structures>Miscellaneous" subcategory. In that row will be the Mister Tidy Station Pad; perhaps as the very first item.

It is best to position the Station Pad on the ground in the central area of a settlement in such a way that Mister Tidy will have easy access to places within the settlement's boundaries.

If you are not able to find the"Structures>Miscellaneous" subcategory, then you installed a mod that alters the basic construction categories of the game. In which case you may not be able to build the Station Pad, and hence will not be able to use this mod -- if you are lucky, the conflicting mod may have simply rearranged items, with the Station Pad now residing elsewhere in some other category or subcategory instead of where it was intended to be.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Tidying Up:[/color][/size][/b]

Mr. Tidy automatically removes the following "remains" and stores any recovered items that they may have contained in the station pad's Chest:

• Corpses
• Dead Things
• Skeletons
• Bone Fragments


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Mr. Tidy Status:[/color][/size][/b]

Mr. Tidy's station pad has colored indicators which identify the bot's current status:

[b][color=yellow]Yellow[/color][/b] -- Mr. Tidy has not yet been activated.  Interact with the station pad to begin tidying.  The colored indicators will then become Blue.

[b][color=lightblue]Blue[/color][/b] -- Mr.Tidy is currently gathering cleanup information.  The player should remain in the settlement while the indicators are Blue.  When the cleanup information has been collected, the indicators will become Green if there are "remains" to be tidied, or will become White if there is no work to be done.

[b][color=lightgreen]Green[/color][/b] -- Mr. Tidy is currently analyzing cleanup information or actively traveling around to tidy things up.  Mr. Tidy will Beep when the indicators become Green.  The bot will now be able to continue tidying while the player is away from the settlement.  The indicators will become White when cleanup has been completed.

[b][color=white]White[/color][/b] -- Mr. Tidy is currently idle while waiting to begin the next tidying cycle.  This is the time to store (or scrap) a settlement's Mr. Tidy when its job is completed.  Tidying is resumed by interacting with the station pad.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Scan Range:[/color][/size][/b]

The scan range for both "long range" and "within settlement boundaries" is 10,000 units of game-world distance. So the difference between those choices is simply whether particular remains are processed (inside the bounds) or not (outside the bounds) when Mr Tidy's station pad is positioned in a settlement's central area. Short Range is 3,500 units. Medium Range is 6,000 units.

10,000 units is far enough to span the interior of base-game settlements when Mr Tidy's station pad is centrally positioned. I have never used the DLCs so do not know the coverage for their settlements. And of course coverage will vary when using mods that alter settlement boundaries or add new settlements.

As an example, just over the bridge from Sanctuary there is initially a dead NPC and a dead dog. They are outside Sanctuary's settlement boundary and so are never processed when using "within settlement boundaries", but are processed when using "long range" with Mr Tidy's station pad positioned near Sanctuary's workshop. The distance from that workshop to the corpses is approximately 8,500 units.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Installation:[/color][/size][/b]

Install using a mod manager, or unpack the mod and copy the .ESP/.ESL and .BA2 files into the game's \DATA folder, then enable the mod.

Position this mod's .ESP/.ESL file to be as low as it will go in your "Load Order" sequence.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Install ESP or ESL?[/color][/size][/b]

If you are reaching the maximum allowed number of .ESP installs, and want to install more mods, then install the .ESL versions of those new mods ...

Back-in-the-day, many players were reaching the maximum number of allowed .ESP installs, so Bethesda introduced a way to permit more via .ESL files.

The Light Master (.ESL) file is an optimized file format introduced in the Fallout 4 v1.10 update. Using Light Master files allows more plugins (mods and patch mods) to be installed than previously possible with .ESP files. For .ESP files there is a limit of 255, whereas a maximum of 4096 .ESL files can be loaded (but in practice is difficult to achieve due to other technical constraints).

Both file types can be used together, which means you can install just .ESP files if your install count remains below the .ESP maximum, or just .ESL files if your count remains below the .ESL maximum, or some of both such as using .ESP files initially and then adding .ESL files thereafter when the maximum for .ESP has been reached.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]ESP/ESL Compatibility:[/color][/size][/b]

Saved games that currently use an .ESP mod are not compatible with an .ESL of that same mod. Similarly, saved games that are currently using the .ESL for a mod are not compatible with an .ESP of that same mod. That is a basic game restriction in terms of switching between .ESP and .ESL versions of a mod. There is no "fix" or workaround -- it is inherent in the game's design.

So, to switch from .ESP to .ESL, or from .ESL to .ESP, you must:

1 ) uninstall the mod
2 ) load the current saved game
3 ) create a new saved game (while that mod is not installed)
4 ) install the other download of that mod
5 ) resume play with that newly created saved game

Objects and NPCs provided by the mod will not be there now and must be created once more. Similarly, quests will need to be done again.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Requirements:[/color][/size][/b]

No special requirements. DLCs are not needed.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Known Issues:[/color][/size][/b]

The game can be a bit quirky at times, which can result in an NPC becoming a bit confused (or even stuck) when traveling from one place to another.  When this happens for a Mr. Tidy, it automatically performs "fast travel" (teleports) back to its Station Pad.  So if you are watching Mr. Tidy, and it suddenly disappears, it has returned to its Station Pad and resumes its tidying activities from there.

Mister Tidy, by necessity, uses a pathing mechanism that is less robust and more error prone than the one that NPCs and other Robots typically use.  As a result, Mister Tidy can be more readily befuddled by obstacles, especially with regard to fencing and walls that surround a settlement -- they will hinder its ability to enter and exit that place.   So an "open" settlement environment is generally best.

If this mod's initial quest is not starting for you after being installed with the Vortex mod manager, it might be because it has not been properly activated/enabled.  If you click PLUGINS within Vortex, you will then see which mods are truly activated/enabled or not (whereas the MODS section sometimes shows incorrect information). Within that PLUGINS interface you can activate/enable the mods that were not properly set when installed.

Corpses for NPCs created by the NPCs Travel mod are intentionally not removed because it breaks that mod by preventing those NPCs from re-spawning as intended.  So depending on the frequency/quantity/importance of NPCs Travel's enemies for a player's settlement fights, this mod might not be very useful.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Known Conflicts:[/color][/size][/b]

There is a conflict between this mod and War Of The Commonwealth which can result in crashes. I have identified the specific conflict, but at present there is no fix or workaround that I can provide. So it is best to not use the two mods at the same time.

[s]Corpses for NPCs created by the NPCs Travel mod will no longer re-spawn as originally intended if those corpses are tidied-away by Mr Tidy.[/s] Fixed by NPCs Travel v2.95.

The initial quest can be prevented from starting, or become stalled part-way through, when using a buggy "quick start" or "alternate start" mod.  The quest normally begins a short while after exiting from Vault 111 for the first time, or a short while after loading a saved game when already outdoors in the Commonwealth.  Otherwise, it might (or might not) begin when standing for a few minutes outdoors at the Sanctuary Hills workbench.

If you experience crashes while traveling during the initial quest, or are unable to complete that quest, it is then highly likely some other mod has been installed that "breaks" the Vault 111 area (or possibly the Sanctuary settlement) thereby preventing this mod from working correctly.

If you are not able to find the "Structures>Miscellaneous" subcategory, then you installed a mod that alters the basic construction categories of the game. In which case you may not be able to build the Station Pad, and hence will not be able to use this mod -- if you are lucky, the conflicting mod may have simply rearranged items, with the Station Pad now residing elsewhere in some other category or subcategory instead of where it was intended to be.

[s]Please be aware that "Anom's Sanctuary Hills Overhaul" has been reported to conflict with some of my Settlement mods, such that when both are installed the player is then no longer able to create a new saved game. This might (or might not) be the case here as well.[/s]


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]To Uninstall:[/color][/size][/b]

Uninstall with the mod manager that was used for the original install, or delete SettlementTidyBot files.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Permissions:[/color][/size][/b]

This mod may not be reused in part or whole for any purpose other than its original intent.  It may not be uploaded to any other web site.

Get in touch with me if you wish to discuss translation into a non-English language; prior approval is mandatory.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Change Log:[/color][/size][/b]

See the Change Log to review what is included in each update.


[b][size=3][color=lightgreen]Credits:[/color][/size][/b]

Bethesda Softworks - for the original Models and Textures [I merely provided the ingenuity and scripting to bring Mister Tidy "to life"]

fileInfo.description: Feral ghouls become more dangerous at night.
fileInfo.name: Ferals After Dark

modInfo.author: Greslin
modInfo.description:
[size=3][b]FERALS AFTER DARK[/b][/size]
by Greslin

As anyone who watches zombie movies knows, the zombie apocalypse doesn't get any easier after the sun goes down.  28 Days Later, Walking Dead, I Am Legend, you name it.  Who knows why it gets worse at night.  Perhaps the sun makes them a bit sluggish, maybe it's the cooler air. 

This mod adds a version of the Night Person perk to feral ghouls.  From 6pm to 6am, ferals get a health boost, a bit more unarmed damage, and a +2 Perception bonus.  This should make them more likely to notice you at night, more likely to hit you hard, and a bit harder to put down.  Affects ferals and Glowing Ones, but not regular ghouls - only ferals that belong to the vanilla feral ghoul race group.  It shouldn't matter whether combat is happening outside or indoors.

Installation: Drop the .ESP into your load order.  That's it.

Compatibility: This will conflict with any other mod that alters the feral race records.  The feral NPC records should be fine.  To fix it, simply either load the ESP after any other feral race edits, or add the NightGhoul effect to the race records manually with FO4Edit.


[b]ABOUT ME[/b]
=========================

I am now available for mod support over Discord.  Visit me here about this or any other of my mods: [url=https://discord.gg/jMUnXDV]https://discord.gg/jMUnXDV[/url]

[b]See my other Fallout 4 mods:[/b]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23558/?]Stash Those Caps[/url] - Makes caps truly portable again, just like in FO3/FNV
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23269/?]Insult To Injury[/url] - Implements a working FNV-like limb damage/recovery system in Survival mode
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22744/?]Companion Heal Thyself[/url] - Give companions the power to patch themselves up in Survival mode
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22585/?]Passive Aggressive Piper[/url] - Add affinity checks to Piper's more annoying, sarcastic and flirtatious comments
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22434/?]Ferals After Dark[/url] - Makes feral ghouls a bit smarter and more dangerous after the sun goes down
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22436/?]More Realistic Cats[/url] - Buffs the cat race to make them behave more like, well, cats
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23498/?]Atomic Brahmin[/url] - When cows turn into mean, aggressive, highly unstable nuclear weapons

[b][i]==== What the gaming media is saying[/i]! ====[/b]

"Cat-Mod takes care of the cats of the end time"
- Gamestar.de (Google translated from German) March 27 2017
about "More Realistic Cats"

fileInfo.name: Crafting Framework

modInfo.author: Dank Rafft
modInfo.description:
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/40650/40650-1587550224-779473014.png[/img]
Extensive but lightweight expansion of the crafting system. Everything tightly packed into a single plugin. A [color=#00ff00]multi-purpose and mobile workbench[/color] allows crafting of any kind. Modifications are [color=#00ff00]compatible with every piece of equipment (vanilla and mod)[/color] right out of the box as long as the item sports a legendary attachment point. [color=#00ff00]Fully modular and customizable to your own needs[/color]. Every feature can be enabled or disabled in the blink of an eye via [color=#00ff00]holotape or optional MCM[/color].

[b][color=#00ff00]Workbenches[/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Universal Workbench: This new bench is multi-functional, you can craft and modify everything with it.
[*]Mobile versions of the Universal Workbench and PA Station, can be transported in your inventory.
[*]Multiple new recipes for ammo, armour, junk, weapons, etc.
[*]Workbench Patcher: Get a clean Chemistry Station with only recipes that belong there.
[/list]
[b][color=#00ff00]Legendaries[/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Craft, disassemble and swap all the legendary mods the game has to offer, including DLC and a plethora of custom ones.
[*]Add an optional second legendary mod slot to your armour and weapons.
[*]Fallout 76's legendary effects for armour and weapons.
[*]Optionally inject new legendary effects into the legendary loot pool, find these effects naturally on legendary enemies.
[/list]
[b][color=#00ff00]Equipment Modifications[/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Make your items unable to be scrapped and/or add a star symbol to them. No more accidentally scrapped valuable items.
[*]Change and enhance mechanics of your weapons: ammo conversion, projectile override, firing modes, damage, recoil and firerate modifiers, etc.
[*]New unique effects (e.g. jetpack) for your armour, modify jump height and resistance values.
[*]Second material and misc effect for your Power Armor and modify it the same way as your armour.
[/list]
This mod is a framework and was designed to be easily expandable. A few guides for the most common tasks can be found in the articles section of this page.


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/40650/40650-1587550218-801393958.png[/img]
[u][b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Workbench[/size][/color][/b][/u]

You can place stationary workbenches in settlements and player homes via the workshop menu, found under the Crafting category. The mobile versions can be crafted at any Chemistry Station in the CRAFTING FRAMEWORK category.
When starting a new game (upon leaving Vault 111) a single instance of the mobile Universal Workbench gets automatically added to the player's inventory. Those benches can be placed anywhere in the world by either dropping it from your inventory or using the AID items as a favourites hotkey (or MCM hotkeys). When you activate the workbench a menu appears. Every menu item can be disabled via holotape or optional MCM. Once you're done with crafting you can pack it up and transport in your inventory until you need it again.
The mobile power armor workbench works a bit different. It gets automatically packed up and send to your inventory once you leave the power armor crafting menu.

[color=#00ff00][b]Menu Structure (click on Show to expand)[/b][/color]
[spoiler][list=1]
[*]Exit Menu
[*]Pack Up Workbench (only on the mobile version)
[*]Armor - Create
[*]Armor - Modify
[*]Weapon - Create
[*]Weapon - Modify
[*]Ammo Station
[*]Chem Station
[*]Junk Station
[*]Utility Station
[*]Cooking Stove
[/list][/spoiler]
[u][b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Equipment Modification[/size][/color][/b][/u]

Crafting Framework uses the vanilla legendary slot as an entry point for its mechanics and functionality. Because of that, the mod is able to modify all kind of equipment without requiring patches for other mods or Creation Club content. Getting this feature up and running is simple:
[list=1]
[*]Go to a workbench of your choice and choose any kind of legendary mod option (even "No Legendary Effect" works here).
[*]This adds the main mod slot "Legendary Enhancements" which lets you pick and choose which additions you want to add to the item.
[*]Once you've selected one of the options new mod slots will be added to the item that hold a bunch of additional modifications for you to utilise.
[/list]
All the modifiers (damage, protection, recoil, etc.) aren't meant to be used as an additional progression system but rather tools to balance your items. In case you're applying a second legendary mod be aware that those effects won't show a legendary mod description but the effects will still apply.

[b][color=#00ff00]Menu Structure (click on Show to expand):[/color][/b]
[spoiler][code]L1: Legendary Mod Slot
├─ UO: Unscrappable Option
└─ LE: Legendary Enhancements
├─ Armor Options
│ ├─ AE: Armor Enhancement
│ ├─ PM: Protection Modifier
│ └─ JM: Jump Height Modifier
├─ Power Armor Options
│ ├─ MA: Second Material
│ ├─ MI: Second Misc
│ ├─ PM: Protection Modifier
│ └─ JM: Jump Height Modifier
├─ Gun Options
│ ├─ AC: Ammo Conversion
│﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ ├─ PO: Projectile Override
│ ├─ FM: Firing Mode
│ ├─ ROF: Rate of Fire Modifier
│ ├─ AM: Accuracy Modifier
│ ├─ RM: Recoil Modifier
│ ├─ RaM: Range Modifier
│ ├─ RS: Reload Speed Modifier
│ ├─ ZM: Zoom Modifier
│ ├─ STM: Sighted Transition Modifier
│ └─ DM: Damage Modifier
├─ Melee Options
│ ├─ ME: Melee Enhancement
│ └─ DM: Damage Modifier
└─ Second Legendary
└─ L2: Legendary Mod Slot
[/code][/spoiler]
[color=#00ff00][b]Different ways of crafting and swapping legendary effects[/b][/color]
[list]
[*]The easiest and most natural way of utilising legendary effects is by acquiring legendary items from enemies or other sources. Go to the workbench with them and remove the legendary effect by selecting "No Legendary Effect" in the menu. This will add the effect as a loose mod to your inventory. And that loose mod with its effect can be applied to other items you have without any requirement.
[*]The second and more advanced way is by scrapping legendary items (items which have a legendary mod applied). You'll receive "Legendary Microchips" for that process. They can be used to craft any legendary effect the mod has to offer, provided you meet the requirements (amount of Legendary Microchips and perks).
[*]There's an optional plugin in the "Expansionsand Patches" pack/download that adds Microchips to several chests/trunks/safes.

[/list]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/40650/40650-1587550212-1118533145.png[/img]
You can configure and customize the mod to your liking. There are two ways to do that directly in-game.

[b][color=#00ff00]Holotape[/color][/b]
The holotape gets added to the player's inventory when starting the game for the first time after installing the mod given that you already left Vault 111. It can also be crafted at the Utility Station under the "Crafting Framework" section. All the available options have descriptions. Tweak available slots, recipes, inject the new legendary effects into the game's legendary loot pool, tweak microchip returns when scrapping legendaries, etc.

[b][color=#00ff00]Mod Configuration Menu (optional)[/color][/b]
This is optional. The MCM configuration becomes available as soon as you install [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497]Mod Configuration Menu[/url]. This menu sports exactly the same options as those in the holotape plus two hotkey options that make the "drop workbench" items obsolete.


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/40650/40650-1595604234-1314529199.png[/img]
This is a xEdit script that automatically scans your installed mods for crafting recipes and adds them to Crafting Framework's multi-functional workbench. You may patch only a few mods or your entire load order. You'll no longer have a cluttered Chemistry Station with lots of different armour, weapon, ammo or other random recipes. You can even let the script include recipes made for other custom benches, e.g. the ones from AWKCR.

[b][color=#00ff00]Usage Instructions[/color][/b]
[list=1]
[*]Install Crafting Framework, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737]FO4Edit[/url]﻿ and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617]MXPF[/url]﻿.
[*]Download the Workbench Patcher archive on this page and extract its content into your FO4Edit root folder.
[*]Stay in that folder and run [i]CF_WorkbenchPatcher.bat[/i]. When all required files are in place you can hit Y and Enter to continue.
[*]In FO4Edit's plugin selection keep your entire load order selected and hit OK.
[*]Wait for the loading process to be finished and a menu will appear. In this menu, you can hover over the options to get a tooltip with additional information.
[*]Start the patching process. If that's the first time you're creating a patch the script will ask you for a plugin name.
[*]Afterwards, you can select the plugins you want to be included in the patch.
[*]Follow the instructions and wait until the message box says [i]Patching Complete[/i].
[/list]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/40650/40650-1595605248-326221847.png[/img]
[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/1979]FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/1980]Compatibility - Crafting Framework and other Mods in Detail[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/1985]Switching from another legendary crafting mod to Crafting Framework mid-playthrough[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/1981]Guide: Adding Crafting Framework support to custom legendary effects[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/1982]Guide: Adding legendary attachment points to items[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/1983]Guide: Tweak Crafting Framework's slot and recipe visibility independent of savegames or playthroughs[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/2320]Guide: Identifying duplicate recipes from other plugins that interact with Crafting Framework's legendary effects[/url]
[*]﻿[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/2351]Guide: Adding new workbenches (modes) to the Universal Workbench[/url]
[/list]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/40650/40650-1595605252-380620919.png[/img]
[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/40919]Armor and Clothing Overhaul[/url]: If you want to use CF's functionality with clothing but don't want to use Armorsmith Extended or Unified Clothing Overhaul (UCO) check this out. It's lightweight but features a lot of the functionality of the mods mentioned before.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41511]Global Stash[/url]: For your storage and junk scrapping needs. It automatically connects to CF's workbenches (even the mobile ones) and also allows you to scrap junk automatically.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33983]Ruddy88's Simple Sorter[/url]: If you don't like VIS or VIS-G I can highly recommend ﻿this one. It automatically generates a single plugin for your entire order. You'll no longer need to create or download patches for your other mods.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/47345]Quick Gun Modification[/url]: Modify various properties of your guns on the fly without having to use a workbench. Especially useful in combat situations. Works with vanilla and mod-added weapons. Modular and easily expandable.
[/list]
modInfo.name: Crafting Framework - Ammo . Armor . Junk . Legendary . Weapon
modInfo.summary: Extensive and fully modular but lightweight expansion of the crafting system. Compatible with every piece of equipment (vanilla and mod). Configure the mod to your liking via holotape or MCM.

fileInfo.changelog_html:
Tweaked for play without armorsmith extended.
removed farmers clothes and greaser jacket from raider underarmors.
Edited gasmasks to not take up a 'headband' slot so they can be worn with most helmets.
The leveled lists for raider armor pieces were weighted heavily towards combat armor past level 17. I have changed this to be less the case so that higher level raiders will simply have a more diverse selection of armor pieces.
Buffed the raider class stats to give them 20 damage resist instead of 15 and raised some special stats like strenght and agility some.
fileInfo.description: no longer needs Armorsmith Extended. other tweaks
fileInfo.name: Desperate Raiders 1.3

modInfo.author: Moonracer
modInfo.description:
Requires base game only
[center][u][b]
[size=4]Description[/size][/b][/u][/center]
Raiders wear a greater variety of clothing, are a little tougher, and drop fewer stimpaks. All with base game equipment.

[u][b][center][size=4]Details[/size][/center][/b][/u]
I added a few SPECIAL points to ClassRaider. In particular 4 points of Endurance, since otherwise raiders don't get any. I also added 15 points of bonus damage resist to ClassRaider. This makes raiders a little more durable without changing their equipment stats.

I edited the leveled lists that determine a raider's underarmor and headgear. Adding some appropriate outfits. They still primarily spawn with vanilla items, but you might see a raider with civilian clothes. Some clothing will not appear until you meet higher level raiders. There should also be fewer raiders with full armor in early game, but more in late game.

I edited the leveled list that determines what items spawn on death. Unchanged you might get brass knuckles or a stimpack. Now you might get 0-5 items. Some low quality food, junk or jet. Mostly junk. This will greatly reduce the number of stimpaks you collect in a game considering how many raiders you typically encounter. However some raiders spawn with stimpaks to use in combat, so you might still find them if you are stealthy or quick to kill them.

1.4 Adds a rare "raider chemist" with special gear. They are part of the legendary raider pool (but I don't believe they drop legendary equip) and should show up after level 25. Hard to play test, but should add an appropriate risk/reward factor as well as adding more flavor to raiders.
I've also updated the mod to AWKCR 6.0+ keywords.
[center][u][size=4][b]
Optional/Experimental[/b][/size][/u][/center]
I added an optional file that is just the LLD_raider leveled list that determines what spawns on raiders when they die. If you just want that, there you go. I also made a duplicate of the main file, only with the change that on spawn, raiders will have different body shapes (exactly like the bodyslide triangle in player gen at the start of the game). Even if it doesn't cause compatibility issues, the results can be a bit off so I'm just putting it out there if people want chunky raiders.

[size=4][b][u][center]Goal[/center][/u][/b][/size]
I imagine raiders as being desperate and disorganized, yet at the same time hardened by circumstance. Some are settlers or scavengers still wearing whatever they could scrap together, rather than all wearing the same four outfits. They don't have good equipment or medical supplies. Barely scraping by and desperate enough to do anything to get through the next day. Game play wise I just got sick of finding a stimpack on every other dead raider.

[size=4][u][b][center]Compatibility[/center][/b][/u][/size]
Raider Overhaul changes everything that this does, so they are not compatible. At best you can load my LLD_raider file after and it shouldn't cause problems. I didn't touch weapon or armor lists (other than underarmor and headgear) so mods that give raiders weapons should be fine. Mods that add new raider faces should also be fine. I'm using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15780/?]Varied Raiders[/url] and not having issues.
Version 1.3 and beyond changes stats on two base game gasmasks so that they can be worn with hats/helmets. I will add a compatibility version for AWKCR.
modInfo.name: Desperate Raiders
modInfo.summary: Raiders wear a greater variety of clothing, are a little tougher, and drop fewer stimpaks. All with base game equipment.

fileInfo.name: Take Your Cores

modInfo.author: darkconsole
modInfo.description:
[img]https://67.media.tumblr.com/e692bc2506fc9dcde53b36a3dbe5193d/tumblr_o8cqzsQD6n1u8cymno1_r1_1280.png[/img]


[b][color=#e06666][size=6][u]
About[/u][/size][/color][/b]

This mod automatically pulls all Fusion Cores out of your power armor when you get out of it. It has two modes, timer (default) and distance. Because we have no MCM yet for Fallout, you will have to update and change its settings through the console. Don't worry, I've made it easy. See the Settings section for more info.

[quote][color=#f1c232][b][u][size=5]Timer Mode[/size][/u][/b]
[/color]
Gives you the cores from the power armor X seconds after getting out of the frame. This mode is the default. Note that pulling the core before the shut down sound finishes, causes the shut down sound to stop. See the settings section for more info if you are using shorter animations or longer sounds, and you wish to hear it t

[youtube]s_Ix1vOV3iQ[/youtube][/quote][quote][b][u][color=#f1c232][size=5]Distance Mode[/size][/color][/u][/b]

Gives you the cores from the power armour after you walk X meters away from the frame. This allows you to keep the core in while staying nearby to do your charisma checks or whatever, and hopping back in without having to reinsert. Or if you are Eric and apparently constantly just accidentally jump out of your armor on accident. Honestly depending on feedback distance mode will probably become the default in future versions.

[youtube]HI0gox4KNZA[/youtube][/quote][b][color=#e06666][size=6][u]
Settings[/u][/size][/color][/b]

Because we have no MCM all settings are done through changing variables from the console. The pattern looks like this:

[center][b][font=Georgia][size=4]set VariableName to Value[/size][/font][/b][/center]
So you literally type set, the variable name, the word to, and then the value you wish to set. Then hit enter.[quote][list]
[*][b][color=#f1c232]Switch to Timer Mode[/color][/b]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockMode to 1[/color]
[/list][color=#ffffff]
[/color][list]
[*][b][color=#f1c232]Switch to Distance Mode[/color][/b]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockMode to 2[/color]
[/list][color=#ffffff]
[/color][list]
[*][color=#f1c232][b]Timer Mode: delay before removing core. (in seconds)[/b][/color]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockDelay to 5.5[/color]
[*]This is the value (5.5) I use for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2920/?]Car Sounds for Power Armor[/url], the most immersive mod on the Nexus, to get that beep beep at the end. If you aren't using that mod you might as well just go throw your power armor in the ocean and give up ever being accepted in the Atom Cats.
[/list][color=#ffffff]
[/color][list]
[*][color=#f1c232][b]Distance Mode: Distance before removing core. (in meters)[/b][/color]
[*][color=#ffffff]set PALockDist to 8[/color]
[/list][/quote][color=#e06666][size=6][b][u]
Update Notes and Instructions[/u][/b][/size][/color]

Because we have no MCM I have included two bat files with the mod. Every Time You Update you should run the PALockUpdate file, and if you want to reset the options to defaults then you can run the PALockReset file. These are TXT files which sit next to the ESP file, if you care to inspect them.
[quote][b][color=#f1c232]DO THIS IN THE CONSOLE AFTER YOU INSTALL THE UPDATES. NO EXCEPTIONS.
[/color][/b]
[color=#ffffff]bat palockupdate[/color]

[img]https://66.media.tumblr.com/08a587a3305f27bc33f164d08706bd9b/tumblr_o8cqzsQD6n1u8cymno3_r1_1280.png[/img][/quote][b][u][color=#e06666][size=6]
Permissions[/size][/color][/u][/b]

Under no circumstances is this to be uploaded to any other sites by anyone other than me.
[color=#e06666][size=6][u]
[/u][/size][/color][b][color=#e06666][size=6][u]See Also.[/u][/size][/color][/b]

I have a [url=http://darkconsole.tumblr.com/mods/fallout4]bunch of other mods[/url] too.

fileInfo.description: Read Known Issues on Description. Allows the player to fill bottles, just like in Survival Mode, when playing on any difficulty setting. Adds more Water Sources to fill bottles.
fileInfo.name: FillBottleAnyDifficulty_v0.2

modInfo.author: Rivelle
modInfo.description:
***********************************************
Fill Bottle while playing on any difficulty.
***********************************************

[b]You should be able to install/uninstall this mod without problems, but to minimize the possibility of breaking your saved game, always make a backup before installing any mod and use the Nexus Mod Manager Profiles.[/b]

[b]IMPORTANT -> Read Known Issues.[/b]

The basic version (the same than v0.1) its just an edited version of the perk HC_FillWaterBottlePerk, so it doesn't check if you are playing on Hardcore (Survival Difficulty).
It should work the same way, so if you have an empty bottle you should be able to fill it at a Water Pump for example.
Starting in version 0.2, adds the option to fill empty bottles with water from other sources not included in Vanilla.

[b]As in a vanilla game, if you don't have empty bottles the Fill option will not appear.[/b]


It should work with any bottle that is added to the ingame "fillable with water" bottle list (HC_FillableWaterBottlesList).
It'd be useful on a vanilla game, but mainly if you are using mods like [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8791/?]Hobo-Scavenger[/url] or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13193/?]Give Me That Bottle[/url] so you recover the bottles after drinking its content.
It can be useful in Survival too, if you want the extra water filling sources.


[b]***************
Known Issues:
***************
If you have played in Survival and changed to another difficulty, it should work because you already have the hidden perk HC_FillWaterBottlePerk. If not, you will have to add the perk via console: player.addperk 00249f55[/b]



***********
Versions:
***********
Ver. 0.1:
Allows the player to fill bottles, just like in Survival Mode, when playing on any difficulty setting.
Ver. 0.2:
Allows the player to fill bottles, just like in Survival Mode, when playing on any difficulty setting.
Adds the option to fill empty bottles with water from other sources not included in Vanilla:
- Water Purifier.
- Water Purifier - Industrial.
- Water Pump - Powered -> Requires Wasteland Workshop (DLCworkshop01.esm).
Ver. 0.3:
Working in a new version with more options. If almost any water source is radiated, how do you get clean water with just a pump? I think that you would need to purify it first, so...
It'll add a new version of the the water source, when it makes sense, so one version provides dirty water and the other purified water.
I'm deciding the best way to make the two versions of the pumps (prerequisites and materials), and which options the installer should have to be user friendly.
I'm testing it for now.



**************
Installation:
**************
Nexus Mod Manager (Recommended): The mod is provided with an installer with all the options, thanks to the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821/?]FOMOD Creation Tool[/url] by Wenderer.

Manual installation: Copy the chosen version of the file "FillBottleAnyDifficulty.esp" to your Fallout 4 Data folder:
From the folder FillBottleAnyDifficulty_Perk -> to get just the modified perk so you can fill empty bottles while playing on any difficulty.
From the folder FillBottleAnyDifficulty_Extra -> to get the perk and some extra water filling sources.
From the folder FillBottleAnyDifficulty_Extra_DLC (recommended)-> to get the perk and some extra water filling sources, including the Pump (Water Pump - Powered) from Wasteland Workshop (DLC required).

***********************
Recommendations:
***********************
[b]You should be able to install/uninstall this mod without problems, but to minimize the possibility of breaking your saved game, always make a backup before installing any mod and use the Nexus Mod Manager Profiles.[/b]
I'm using a lot of mods and would like to recommend them all, but for that will need a recommendation page and time to work on it (maybe on the future).
The must have (for me) in order to get a Hardcore/Survival realistic experience:

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10399/?]Hardcore Mode [ON][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3815/?]Better Locational Damage[/url]

The names are self-explanatory. You should take a look at them, and to the other mods from their authors and to their recommendations.

**********************************
Credits (in alphabetic order):
**********************************
Bethesda: For the game and the Creation kit.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/?]FO4Edit[/url]: A very useful tool for the modders, and users or wanna be modders.
Nexus community: For allowing to convert good games in great games with their work and for the help offered to users and modders.
Wenderer: For the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821/?]FOMOD Creation Tool.[/url]

modInfo.author: Azhadi
modInfo.description:
[b][color=#dd7e6b][size=6]More Settlement Attacks![/size][/color][/b]

This mod rises the basic change for a settlment to be attacked from 1% to 5% and reduce the cooldown from 7 days to just one day. Because 5% is still not that much, the mod also rises the amount for resources to generate "danger" and reduced the amount of "savety" at the same time. So how more resources your settlment has, the more it is likley that a attack event may trigger - to keep it immersive.


[color=#ffd966][b][size=4]Modifiervalues[/size][/b][/color]

The values to rise/decrease the chance to be attacked are altered ([b][color=#ea9999]+[/color][/b] for more Attackchance, [b][color=#b6d7a8]-[/color][/b] for less):

[color=#ea9999][size=4]+[/size][/color] 5% per Resource-Point (Water, Food, Energy)
[color=#b6d7a8][size=5]-[/size][/color] 1% per Savety-Point
[color=#b6d7a8][size=5]-[/size][/color] 2% per Settler


[u][b]Notice:[/b][/u]
I hope the bug with the stuck happiness or attacks simply to not triggerd is solved with this, since i took extra care to not touch anything else (i even cleared my whole scriptfolder to do so!).

[center][color=#00ff00][size=5][b]How to install[/b][/size][/color]

[i]first, make sure modding is enabled by following the steps in this wiki guide:

[url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation[/url][/i][/center]


[i][b][i][color=#00ff00][size=3]Default Vanilla Install: [/size][/color][/i][/b][/i]

Download with NMM (recommended)
- or download 'NUCLEAR Nude NMM Installer' from file section and from NMM choose 'Add mod from file' and select the .zip

That's it!

[i]for manual install:[/i]

download the file NUCLEAR Nude MANUAL Install version and extract it somewhere. inside are all the skins each in their own archive. Unpack your skin of choice and copy the Data folder into your Fallout4 game folder.

since v3.3 the manual install version has been split into 3 files:
one containing the player normal skins, one with the thong skins and the last one the raider skins.


[b][i][color=#00ff00][size=3]NUCLEAR CBBE Install:[/size][/color][/i][/b]

1. Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15/?]Caliente's Beautiful Bodies Enhancer -CBBE-[/url] first
2. Download and install NUCLEAR Nude CBBE NMM Installer
3. Select 'Yes to All' when asked to overwrite
Enjoy!

[b][i][color=#00ff00][size=3]NUCLEAR JB Install:[/size][/color][/i][/b]

1. Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8288/?]Jane Bod -JB- Rev[/url] by [b]Nightasy[/b] first
2. Download and install NUCLEAR Nude JB
3. Select 'Yes to All' when asked to overwrite
Enjoy!


[size=3][center][/center][/size][color=#cc4125]Known issues:[/color]

regarding the raider skins, if you are using the new thong skins the raiders will appear to be wearing transparent thongs as well!

this is due to Bethesda using the same normal map for the raiders and player/female characters, hopefully they will patch this soon so raiders can have a unique normalmap!

as of v3.5 the NN installer now includes an optional tiny .esp plugin to let raiders have a unique normalmap to fix the issue.

CBBE backhead fix:

cbbe uses separate textures called femalebhed_d.dds and femalebhed_s.dds in order to fix a backhead texture issue. Nuclear nude does not replace these files by default (since it would increase filesize considerately) but you may experience a small seam/lighting issue in the backhead area when using some skins (or missing backhead tattoos on phoenix skins). 

the current solution is:
download the vanilla 'NUCLEAR Nude Main Skins MANUAL Install Files',
extract the skin that matches your currently installed cbbe skin
rename the file 'femalebody_d.dds' to 'femalebhed_d.dds'
rename the file 'femalebody_s.dds' to 'femalebhed_s.dds' 
copy both of those files to Fallout 4/data/textures/actors/character/basehumanfemale/ and overwrite

[color=#cc4125]How to uninstall:[/color]

If you use NMM, simply right-click the mod and select 'Uninstall Mod'

[i]manual uninstall:[/i]

1. Navigate to \Fallout 4\Data\textures\actors\character\basehumanfemale\

2. For the skin - delete the files: 
femalebody_d.dds, femalebody_s.dds, femalebody_n.dds, BaseFemaleHands_d.dds, BaseFemaleHands_s.dds

3. For Raiders - delete the files: 
FemaleBodyDirty_d.dds, FemaleBodyDirty_s.dds, FemaleBodyDirty_n.dds, BaseFemaleHandsDirty_d.dds, BaseFemaleHandsDirty_s.dds

That's it


[size=3][b][color=#d9ead3]Mini screenshot guide & tips:[/color][/b][/size]

1. look for a nice spot with good dynamic lighting and make sure you are in 3rd person view
2. open the console
3. type 'tfc 1' - this will enable free moving camera and pause all action
4. type 'sucsm 1' - this controls the speed of the free camera and brings it to a level where you can make good adjustments
5. optionally you can change the field of view with the command 'fov xx' where xx is the fov (ex 'fov 70')
6. close the console and use the controls to find a nice angle for a screenshot
7. when you found a good spot, open the console again
8. type 'tm' - this will hide all user interface and lock your current view, including the console so be warned! it is still active even tho you can't see it!
9. take screenshot by hitting print screen key
10. type 'tm' again to unhide the user interface - if you by accident closed the console, just hit the open console key and type 'tm'
11. type 'tfc' to return to normal game camera mode
12. your screenshot is saved in your fallout 4 game installation folder!

Happy snapping!

If you have any interest in doing anything with it, see the permissions section below.[/size][/b][b][size=4] If you have any questions related to it, send me a private message.[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=4][/size][/b][/u][/center][u][b][size=4]

A Homemaker update (v1.37/38) has been released that fixes the Vault-Tec Workshop menus making this mod no longer needed. Thank you all for your
endorsements and words of gratitude, I'm glad I was able to actually do something /for/ the community for once. :)

Download the official update now at: http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1478/?

As this is no longer needed, there will be no further updates or fixes (And likely support) for it. It will however remain up for the time being in case anyone still needs it.[/color][/color]

---

[color=#999999]This is just a quick edit that will add the Vault-Tec Workshop's (DLCworkshop03) "Vault" menu to the Structures workshop menu if you are otherwise not able to use it because of using the mod Homemaker. At the time of posting this, I got tired of waiting for someone else to do it and as I'm sure all other Homemaker users know, temporarily removing/disabling the mod to play the new DLC isn't really an option.

Homemaker will eventually be updated and this will no longer be needed. This shouldn't cause any problems but you still use it at your own risk as it could eat your dog or burn down your swimming pool.

[color=#999999][u][size=5]Permissions:
[/size][/u][size=2][color=#dd7e6b][color=#999999]You are free to do what you want with the mod and all included assets
providing it is for non-profit use (As in you can't charge people for it).[/color][/color][/size]
I'd also be grateful if you credited me for anything of mine you use, and
although not a requirement it would also be nice if you sent me a
message letting me know if you publish something using these assets
(Note that you do NOT have to wait for a response to use anything, I'd
just like to know so I can check it out myself!).[/color][/color]

modInfo.author: Striker118x
modInfo.description:
I did not realize that Shambles1980 created a mod like this until I finished and was about to publish mine. I recommend you check his out to see if that is what you would prefer it.
Shambles1980 bat - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/24315/?tab=description]Bat File installer for Fallout 4 - Texture Optimization Project by torcher[/url]
After looking into what his bat did, I determined that my code was different allowing me to publish. The primary difference is that my code will work with anything Archive2 does, not just Fallout 4 while also avoiding folder permissions altogether. This is because Shambles1980's bat works with TOP and Fallout 4's internal Data folder making the install even easier than mine and you don't have to touch Archive2 because it does that step for you.
modInfo.name: (AutoTOP) Bat for Fallout 4 - Texture Optimization Project by torcher installation
modInfo.summary:
The autoTOP is a batch (.bat) file that will make installing Fallout 4 - Texture Optimization Project by torcher easier.

This easy install is accomplished by automatically running the required programs and commands leaving the user to select the correct files.

Any texture optimization can be used if you prefer something else.<

In addition to the radio - which is always expanding - I'm working on quest mods and NPCs, which I'll upload beta versions for here. If interested, please contact me at kristakahashi@gmail.com with a demo or an audition.
You can find [url=http://3dnpc.com]all pertinent info on the site blog.
[/url][/b]

[center]***[/center]
[b]ON BUG REPORTS AND COMMENTS[/b]
In all honesty, I don't have time to manage this site. I will check it periodically at best.
[b][url=http://3dnpc.com]However, if you leave bug reports on the blog, I will answer within 24 hours guaranteed, as I get an email[/url]. [/b]
It helps me manage both Interesting NPCs and the FO3/FNV/FO4 mods in one place.

modInfo.name: Atomic Radio and Tales from the Commonwealth
modInfo.summary:
The Tales from the Commonwealth mod adds quests and companions.
The Atomic Radio mod adds a radio station.
The Settlers of the Commonwealth mod adds settlers with interesting dialogue.

Go to 3dnpc.com for details.

fileInfo.changelog_html:
Refactored code again again again again again again again
Plugin is now compiled against CommonLibF4 as of 2020-10-28.
fileInfo.description:
New version with a different patch method, built against the most recent (circa 2020-10-28) version of CommonLibF4.
Might fix the impossible to reproduce, and otherwise inexplicable crashes some users have reported.
Make sure to install the dependencies.
fileInfo.name: Baka ScrapHeap

modInfo.author: shad0wshayd3
modInfo.description:
This mod is primarily a fix for a problem with Sim Settlements, and other incredibly script heavy mods. However, many people have reported increased stability and performance with it, so feel free to try it for yourself. Having a larger sample size to report their experience with it can't hurt anything.

The plugin is version independent and should work with any version of Fallout 4 that has an [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/47327]Address Library[/url] available.

[size=4]FAQ:[/size]
Q: What's the problem Sim Settlements causes?
A: The game allocates ~70mb of memory when reading script properties and normally that's more than enough for the vanilla game, but Sim Settlements eats a ton of that, and with too many city plans, the game won't load saves anymore. This plugin doubles, triples, or quadruples that memory allocation to ~130mb, ~200mb, or ~270mb.

Q: Will this mod help with x, or fix x?
A: I don't know, maybe? This patch will affect many things, and I don't know the full of extent of what it'll affect, and whether it'll cause problems or fix existing ones. Let me know how it works for you, if there are problems I can look into them, and if there aren't- that's great.

Q: Source?
[url=https://github.com/shad0wshayd3/BakaScrapHeap]GitHub[/url].
modInfo.name: Baka ScrapHeap - Script Memory Limit Expander
modInfo.summary: A version independent F4SE plugin that expands the default size of ScrapHeap allocations.

fileInfo.description: Removed unnecessary requirement of Automatron DLC from Head of esp-File
fileInfo.name: Companion Whistle

modInfo.author: Raumfliege
modInfo.description:
Do you hate it, when you can't find your active companion(s), then this is the mod for you. The Companion whistle teleports your active Companion to you.
It also works with non Companion followers.
It does not alter the follow/stay state. This means, if it was in stay mode before teleport, it wil be so afterwards too.

[u][color=#6d9eeb][size=3]How to use the Companion Whistle in Game:[/size][/color]
[/u]
[list=1]
[*][size=2]Go to your neares Chemistry Station and look for it under the Utilities section[/size]
[*][size=2]Craft "Companion Whistle" with 1 Steel[/size]
[*][size=2]Open your Inventory and goto the Aid section[/size]
[*][size=2]Favorite it for easy access.[/size]
[*][size=2]Done[/size]
[/list]
[u][color=#6d9eeb][size=3]Changelog:[/size][/color]
[/u]
See Posts

[u][color=#6d9eeb][size=3]Compatibility:[/size][/color]
[/u]
Works fine with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13459/?]Everyone's Best Friend[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/23176]valdacil
[/url](It's a Dogmeat and 1 Companion Mod)

Also works with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11829/]Unlimited Companion Framework[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/2950481]expired6978[/url]
(It's an unlimited Companion Mod)

[u][color=#6d9eeb][size=3]Reviews:[/size][/color]

[/u][youtube]w7oj04w4FQQ[/youtube]
Starts @[url=https://youtu.be/w7oj04w4FQQ?t=32s]0:32[/url]

[u][color=#6d9eeb][size=3]My other Mods:
[/size][/color][/u]
To see my other Mods click [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/31404765/?tb=mods&pUp=1]>> here <<[/url] !

[size=5][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654/?]DEF_UI[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3877]Valdacil's Item Sorting[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6091]Armor and Weapon Keywords Community Resource[/url][/size]


[size=5]Also mess around with your load order!
A majority of issues such as missing item effects are caused by

1.) Load order
2.) Mod conflicts
3.) Outdated Resources
4.) Bad installs from FOMOD installs[/size]











[img]http://i.imgur.com/iMX3JbS.png[/img]
[size=5]If you are coming from another sorting mod some of your items will not update. Unfortunately once the records are altered it's stuck (just like when custom naming items).[/size][size=4] [/size][color=#ffffff][size=4]

[/size][/color][size=5][color=#00ff00]The best way to get your items to regenerate the names is to go to a settlement (with workshop access) drop the items on the ground, go into build mode, Hit Tab on each item to store it in the workshop. Retrieve the items from the workshop. This is [/color][b]guaranteed[/b][color=#00ff00] to work. 

[/color][b]If you find an item that doesn't generate the tag/icon with this method. let me know and I will add it to the patch.[/b][/size]

[size=1]The following Image is property of MadMAX713 author of Raider Overhaul - 2016[/size]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/9103-0-1455138705.png[/img]
[size=6]If you haven't heard of [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9103/?][size=6]Raider Overhaul[/size][/url][size=6], Check it out now! Adds enough content that it [actually] made me want to click New Game...[/size]












[img]http://i.imgur.com/3jDiv9O.png[/img]
[size=4]None...yet







[/size]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/qdWtxKO.png[/img]
[size=5]Reaching out to those of you who have requested patches. I am away on business roughly 70% of the time. I will do my best to get to your patch requests for other mods. Have patience your patches will come eventually, Also the ones with more requests will more then likely get done first. Thanks for understanding![/size][/center]
