fileInfo.changelog_html:
(2016-09-08) General:
Formalized placement of the tools' utility actors, and tweaked those actors themselves again.
Introduced a shared framework for updates by compatibility patches; this is less error-prone, is much easier to maintain, and slightly reduces the size of this mod.
Transitioned existing patch logic in all DLC compatibility patches to the new, shared framework.
Edited out lingering debug code both from all DLC compatibility patches and from all terminal fragments.

Tool - Mass Harvester:
Corrected edge case where the game might lock up if the tool is active or finishes operating while the user is in VATS.
Added first pass at a workaround for a base-game bug whereby corpses might be incompletely emptied of all items.

Tool - Junk Vacuum:
Corrected script logic that was leading to missed allocation of an array; this was causing script errors, but the issues should be resolved now.
Added new activation sound effect; this alternates between two files on successive activations of the tool, and should help to distinguish when this tool is toggled.
Added support for some missing base-game items, in particular the Fusion Core; note that fusion generators in the world, which contain Fusion Cores too, are ignored by the tool.
Added support for new items from the base-game, larger-shipments update.

DLC 03 patch - Far Harbor:
Fixed script problem leading to the wrong timer ID being used for the spinlock's busy-wait timeout: the need to fix this separately was obviated by using the new shared framework, instead of an independent script.
Removed some non-junk items from the list of new items to add and patched them out from existing partial lists; the Junk Vacuum should not have been trying to collect these items in the first place anyway.

DLC 06 patch - Nuka-World:
Introduced; adds support for Nuka-World flora harvesting, etc. activators harvesting, junk vacuuming, and misc. items vacuuming.
fileInfo.description: Main file; includes optional support for various DLC packs
fileInfo.name: Collection Tools

modInfo.author: Raider480
modInfo.description:
[color=#b6d7a8][size=4][b][color=#980000]Please be sure to check the configuration holotape! Collection from corpses has to be enabled here before it will function - the default behavior is to only collect from harvestables that can be activated, like flora.[/color]

Summary
[/b][/size][/color]
Adds a "[Utility] Mass Harvester" item to the game, with a corresponding recipe under "[UTILITY]" at the Chemistry Station, along with its configuration holotape.
[list]
[*]This tool operates as an on-demand pulse - activating runs a single check for all nearby flora/misc. items, before harvesting all candidates found as appropriate
[/list][list]
[*]This will harvest and collect items within a configurable radius, and then open a container interface showing the acquired items; once this is closed, the player will receive those items
[/list][list]
[*]The FormID and EditorID for this tool are xx000800 and RdrHarvesterItem respectively (the xx prefix corresponds to this mod's position in your load order)
[/list]Additionally, adds a "[Utility] Junk Vacuum" item to the game, craftable in the same category and using the same configuration holotape.
[list]
[*]This tool operates as a toggle - activating it turns junk collection on or off until the next time it is used; it is probably best to not leave this running
[/list][list]
[*]When activated, this will automatically add any loose junk items to the user's inventory
[/list][list]
[*]The FormID and EditorID for this tool are xx009875 and RdrHarvestJunkVacuumItem respectively (the xx prefix corresponds to this mod's position in your load order)
[/list]The tools are technically "ingestible" aid items, found in the inventory amongst other consumable items (like Stimpaks or food), and are reusable in the sense that they are not consumed after use.

Also contains optional files to add support for DLC content.

[color=#b6d7a8][size=4][b]Description[/b][/size][/color]

The recipes for the items are configured to disallow crafting more if one of any given item is already in the player's inventory, like that for the configuration holotape.
This is to discourage having more than one at once. There should be no reason to run more than one of any given item simultaneously, and the corresponding logic is coded to catch this, in order to help prevent potential issues.

Activating a tool will "consume" it but then return another almost immediately afterward.
Then, the corresponding script will then search the area in a radius roughly equal to what can be chosen from the holotape.
These values are very loose approximations, and were formed from documentation for the Skyrim version of the Creation Kit; they should still be suitable, but don't rely on them for any sort of precision.

A notification will appear in the corner of the screen indicating the progress of various collection routines within the given radius.
Then, each appropriate item will be processed, and anything yielded will eventually make its way to the user.
The transfer interface for a container may open to show some collected items, depending on the tool used, but no items can be put into it or taken out from it - just close this and the items will be added.

The configuration holotape supports various options for each tool added, including configuring the harvester to harvest flora, or to harvest corpses as well.
The items on any corpse within the harvesting radius will be pooled and presented to the player in the same manner as other yielded items.
Additionally, the holotape supports running both flora and corpse harvesting "at the same time".
[list]
[*]This will in reality run first the flora harvesting and then the corpse harvesting back-to-back, saving the user from having to change the configuration every time if they want to use all features from this mod.
[/list]Flora harvesting can be set to ignore or enforce a requirement that flora not be harvested if that would be stealing for the user; the default behavior is to ignore this requirement.
Corpse harvesting can be set to ignore or enforce a requirement that the actor in question have been killed by the user; the default behavior is to ignore this requirement.

The Junk Vacuum will always collect loose items lying in the world around the player, and uses its own, separate radius.
The Junk Vacuum can be configured to either process or ignore items considered stealing for the user, or even to strip ownership information.

[color=#b6d7a8][size=4][b]Compatibility[/b][/size][/color]

This doesn't alter anything from the base game, so it should be fairly compatible with most mods.
As such, the load order shouldn't matter too much, but any optional patches will of course need to be below both the base plugin for this mod and the DLC/mod agains which the compatibility patch should run. For example, something like this:
Fallout4.esm
[...other DLC...]
DLCCoast.esm
[...other DLC...]
[...other ESMs...]
Homemaker.esm
[...other ESMs...]
[...other ESPs...]
Rdr-Harvesting.esp
Rdr-Harvesting-DLCCoast.esp
Rdr-Harvesting-Homemaker.esp
[...other ESPs...]

Any mod that adds custom flora or junk items won't work without a patch.
If you have a mod that you really want added you can add a comment or PM me and I can have a look, or you can just make your own patch that adds the new flora to the form list of flora from the base plugin file.
Any mod that changes the ingestible yielded by pre-existing flora records should work, however, provided that it is against the same flora base object and loads before this mod.

This should be compatible with most mods that add new NPCs, provided that they use the keywords shared by other NPCs in the game.
Custom races may possibly introduce problems with being harvested, however, though the scripting tries fairly hard to find all valid corpses.

This mod is compatible with the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4397]Graygarden Planters - Quest Reward[/url] mod, without any patch being necessary, as tested with version 0.3.0 of that mod.

[color=#b6d7a8][size=4][b]Disclaimers[/b][/size][/color]

Try to be gentle with the scripts; I tried to account for most situations, but some activities might cause some trouble, like the following:
[list]
[*]Fast-travelling away from the activation area immediately after using the item
[*]Spam-activating multiple tools within a very short period of time, or quickly changing the harvesting radius between these
[*]Trying to coerce actors other than the player into using the tools; while the scripts were written the be agnostic to whoever used it, this has not been tested
[*]Installing/uninstalling the mod or DLC plugins, or saving and exiting, while the tools are running; saving and exiting should work, but is not recommended (especially between updating the mod)
[/list]
The harvester should never take very long to finish, and if it does then something has probably gone wrong; corpses may take longer though.
You may want to consider saving before each activation, because I had some early issues in testing with the game freezing after collecting from larger numbers of harvestables.

This mod has had some light testing to ensure that it functions as expected, but keep in mind that this is just an early release and bugs are very possible.
Please send any suggestions/bug reports my way, and I will do my best to address them.

Try not to travel too far too quickly while the harvester is running; it uses an invisible container to give items to the player, and if this is inaccessible at just the right moment the mod may have unpredictable behavior.

The usual warnings for mods apply - I am not responsible for anything bad that may happen to your saves/game/computer/etc., use at your own risk, ...

Please do not upload this elsewhere.

[color=#b6d7a8][size=4][b]Plans[/b][/size][/color]

[list]
[*][s]Looking into adding rudimentary support for junk collection.[/s] Done! Introduced in V0.3.0 (2016-07-19)
[*][s]Generalize harvesting script to allow for items that aren't strictly flora, or in corpses.[/s] Done! Introduced, with just Mirelurk Eggs to start, in V0.2.2 (2016-06-30)
[*][s]Looking into adding experimental support for corpses.[/s] Done! Introduced in V0.2.0 (2016-06-30)
[/list][center]
My Fallout 4 mods:
[list]
[*]Collection Tools
[/list][list]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17043]Settlement Equipment[/url]
[/list][list]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20367]Curie Romance Dialogue Fix[/url]
[/list][/center]

fileInfo.name: FallUI - Map

modInfo.author: m8r98a4f2
modInfo.description:
[color=#e69138][size=5][b]FallUI - Map[/b][/size][/color]

Overhaul of the Fallout 4 map. Added list of locations and workshops including text search. Add favorite locations to fast travel with one click. Many
Quality-Of-Life features like disabling the popup on empty map space click, better map zoom steps, travel and arrival time. Colored marker support. Including high-res map texture support.

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Features[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Multi-language (All languages included)
[*]List of marker locations.
[*]List of workshop locations.
[*]All lists are searchable by text input (Feature requires F4SE)
[*]Calculation of estimated travel time and arrivel time (approximately - should match time +/- 15 minutes )
[list]
[*]Including modded fast-travel-speed and game timescale support for adjusted travel time calculation
[*]Arrivel time will be displayed in the new action popup menu
[*]Times can be displayed in 12h am/pm or 24h format.
[/list][*]Allows fast travel without confirmation dialog
[*]Configurable favorites
[list]
[*]Setup up to 5 locations to your favorites! Your favorites will be shown as buttons in the interface, allowing quick access to fast travel.
[/list][*]Colored map markers. (Requires PipboyFX to be disabled)
[list]
[*]Three pre-defined color sets included: None, Colored and Colored (pastel)
[*]Support for custom color sets you can change by yourself or shared by others.
[/list][*]Configurable max allowed zoom-in and zoom-out range.
[*]Disables the annoying popup when clicking on an empty space in the map. Replacing it with a one-click set marker action. Click twice to remove marker. (Fully configurable)
[*]All click actions can be configured in the MCM configuration to like show a menu, instantly fast travel, show location on map etc.
[*]Much more intuitive logarithmic zoom steps. Allowing consistent and smoothly zooms from farest to nearest.
[*]Full support for high-res map texture mods. (Recommendations for setup values are visible in MCM menu.)
[*]Gamepad support (keys for lists, use dpad to move map)
[*]Fully configurable over MCM (Configuration in english - use a translation mod for locale translation in configuration)
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Required Mods[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface [/url]﻿
[/list]
[b][color=#e69138][size=4]The [size=5]FallUI [/size]series[/size][/color][/b][list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48958]FallUI - Confirm Boxes [/url]- Beautiful message boxes. Unique designs and styles for every box type. Including skip option!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/51813]FallUI - HUD[/url]﻿ - Highly configurable HUD for Fallout 4 with in-game HUD Layout Manager.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface [/url]﻿- Just better interface for all inventories
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49920]FallUI - Map[/url]﻿ - Better map for Fallout 4. Including list of locations, colored marker, high-res-support and more!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49070]FallUI - Sleep and Wait[/url]﻿ - Enhances the sleep/wait menu by many quality-of-life features like target hour buttons and daytime graph.

[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49300]FallUI - Workbench[/url]﻿ - Just better crafting, with more display size, more data, and a tag icon picker!
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Recommended[/b][/size][/color][color=#e69138][size=4][b] Mods[/b][/size][/color][list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497]Mod Configuration Menu[/url]﻿ - Allows you to configure all settings of FallUI - Map in-game.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8989]Satellite World Map[/url]﻿ - High-res map texture mod with satellite world map (Uses ESP for extending outer map area)
[*]or: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9414]Satellite Color World Map Combo[/url]﻿ - Extended High-Res map. Dont need a ESP. Optional POI/magazines/bobblehead/road locations.
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI - Inventory Interface[/url] (Min. version [b]1.12.1[/b])
[*]Install this mod with any ModManager
[*]Done.
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Load order[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*](Anywhere) FallUI - Inventory Interface
[*](Optional) High-res map texture mod
[*]FallUI - Map
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Savegame safety[/b][/size][/color]
Absolutely safe. Does not change or modify anything in your game or savegame data. You can install and uninstall it at any time.

Bethesda
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/46870918]MasterLix[/url] and his whole discord server for the big support and beta testing
The NEXUS community!

fileInfo.description: For Fallout 4 game version 1.10.163.
fileInfo.name: Mod Configuration Menu 1.39

modInfo.author: reg2k - Neanka - shadowslasher410
modInfo.description:
[img align=right]https://i.imgur.com/yThthRV.png[/img]
[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ About ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

The Mod Configuration Menu is a settings page for mods!

It provides a central location for mod configuration, accessible via the Pause menu.

ModSettings are stored in per-mod INI files under Data\MCM\Settings, making it easy to backup and restore settings and even change them outside the game if so desired should the mod support it.

Are you a modder? Check out the [url=https://github.com/Neanka/MCM_0.1_AS3/wiki]documentation[/url] for detailed information on creating MCM menus.

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Features ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*] Configure more aspects of your mods than ever before - the MCM provides a range of controls such as checkboxes, steppers, dropdowns, sliders, buttons, text, and keybinds.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Optimized for PC[/b]. The MCM steps far beyond what is allowed for consoles.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]No ESM/ESP[/b]. The MCM does not count towards your load order.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Save-safe[/b]. The MCM never sinks its teeth into your savegame - any modifications, as with most F4SE plugins, are done in-memory.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]File-safe[/b]. No vanilla forms or files on disk are overriden. The MCM is completely standalone.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Hotkey support and conflict detection[/b]. Assign hotkeys to mod actions to activate them on-the-fly.
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Details ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Each mod's menu lives in its own directory in [code]Data\MCM\Config\ModName[/code].

User settings are located at [code]Data\MCM\Settings\ModName.ini[/code].

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]FOLDER STRUCTURE[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[spoiler][font=Courier New]Data/
└── MCM/
    ├── Config/
    │   ├── Mod1/
    │   │   ├── config.json         (Required) Menu Layout
    │   │   ├── lib.swf             (Optional) Image library
    │   │   ├── keybinds.json       (Optional) Keybind Definitions
    │   │   └── settings.ini        (Optional) Mod Setting Defaults
    │   ├── Mod2/
    │   │   └── ...
    │   └── Mod3/
    │       └── ...
    └─── Settings/
         ├── Mod1.ini               Mod Settings for Mod1
         ├── Mod2.ini               Mod Settings for Mod2
         └── Mod3.ini               Mod Settings for Mod3[/font][/spoiler]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Installation ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder for a manual install.

You should see a new option in the Pause menu in-game.

If there is no Mod Config option, double-check that you have [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url] installed and running!

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Requirements ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Fallout 4 (check Files tab for version requirements).
[url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url], 0.4.2 or higher.

modInfo.name: Mod Configuration Menu
modInfo.summary: The Mod Configuration Menu is a settings page for mods! It provides a central location for mod configuration, accessible via the Pause menu.

fileInfo.changelog_html:
This v1.01 is a quality of life update. Changes are:
1) Settlers are more useful and grateful. With a high enough Settlement Happiness rating (usually above 80), settlers will occasionally give you gifts when they express their thanks. For example, when they say, "We just wanted to say how grateful we are for the opportunity", there is a chance they will give you a gift of crops, medicinal items, ammo, or small shipments of certain building materials.
2) Updated SCDO to conform with changes from the December 2020 version of Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch (that mod is not required for this). That mod makes lots of grammar edits to vanilla lines with each update it does, so now SCDO conforms with the latest batch of changes from that mod.
3) In COMDanse, the following Danse lines that compliment the player right after combat finishes will now only be said after the quest "Call to Arms" (at Arc Jet Systems), because Danse wouldn't likely feel enough admiration for the player before then to say the following lines:
"You're one hell of a soldier, you know that?"
"I feel better knowing you have my back."
"I have to admit, I'm very impressed. You're quite a soldier."
"It's a pleasure to be a part of a team you can depend on."
"You were born to be a soldier."
"I have to admit, I feel pretty damn secure when you've got my back."
4) In DialogueFarmGeneric, adjusted conditions on "Didn't expect help from a stranger. Thanks" and "Hey, thanks for your help" so that only appropriate NPC's say it.
5) In DialogueGoodneighborGuards, adjusted the following highly-specific dialogue lines so instead of repeating every few minutes, they are only said once:
- "Might stop by the Memory Den later. There was this girl, few months ago? Man oh man, wouldn't mind seein' those curves again."
- "The Memory Den's great, just don't get hooked like old Kent. Poor bastard's practically stuck in the past."
- "Fred Allen at the Hotel Rexford, he can hook you up with chems. Irma at the Memory Den... she offers a whole other class of drug."
- "So not only is Diamond City's mayor dead... turns out he was a synth all along. And they say Goodneighbor's crazy..."
- "You know who kicked the Ghouls out of Diamond City, right? That blowhard, Mayor McDonough. He'll get his one day, you watch."
fileInfo.description: Thanks for downloading. Install like any regular mod. There is a green "Track" button above to be notified of content updates, and an "Endorse" button if you enjoyed the mod.
fileInfo.name: Settler and Companion Dialogue Overhaul

modInfo.author: Project Valkyrie Discord Server
modInfo.description:
[center][b][color=#6aa84f]"Fallout 4 companions play like a great first effort from a gifted modder."[/color][/b]
- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/1200978?tab=user+files]llamaRCA[/url]﻿, author of the #1 companion mods [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/41779/?]Willow[/url]﻿ and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/23273]Heather[/url]﻿.[/center]
[center][color=#ff7700][b]﻿Let's add some polish.[/b][/color][/center]
[center][youtube]2_AZ0Poyp-M[/youtube][/center][center][color=#00ffff][b]﻿November 2019 Mod of the Month[/b][/color][/center]
[color=#00ff00][b][u]What this mod does[/u][/b][/color]

1) Reduces or eliminates repetitive companion dialogue.  How many times do you need to hear Cait say "Can't wait to get out of this goddamn heat" at 2 a.m. when it's raining? Now she'll only ever say that line once, and at the right time. Same with comments about looting, crafting, chem use, etc.

2) Adds new situation-appropriate dialogue for companions. They'll have more to say and seem more aware of their surroundings.

3) New dialogue menu options for Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, Hancock, Danse, Deacon, and Gage. They all give side quests now, except Curie, who can serve as a vendor and combat medic once she's converted to a synth.

4) Generic vanilla settler dialogue now pulls from a bank of over 150 lines instead of just 21, multiplied by up to 10 different potential voice types for each line.

5) Settlers are aware of your quest progression, and while they still occasionally complain about "my back hurts, my feet hurt...", they display increased awareness of the dangers lurking in the Commonwealth, expressing gratitude for the protection you've provided them, with a more tolerable balance between positive, neutral, negative, and snarky comments. If your settlement happiness is high enough, they will occasionally give you small gifts when expressing their gratitude.

6) Adds additional combat dialogue variety to Raiders and Gunners.

In total, the mod adds over 2,300 voice lines to companions, settlers, and enemies.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]How it works[/u][/b][/color]

This was accomplished with vanilla dialogue by:

[color=#9fc5e8][color=#ea9999]- Incorporating content that was cut from the game[/color]
[color=#b6d7a8]- Editing and splicing existing lines to create new ones[/color]
- Re-purposing hidden or rare dialogue to apply to new situations
[color=#b4a7d6]- Flagging certain annoying/repetitive lines to only be said once (e.g. loot junk comments)[/color]
[color=#ffe599]- Adding cool-down timers to other repetitive lines (e.g. combat taunts)[/color][/color]

No NPC records were edited - only companion dialogue quest records and the 'DialogueFarmGeneric' quest (for settlers). No vanilla scripts were touched. NPC appearance mods are fully compatible, as are mods that affect NPC stats, NPC leveled lists, and companion affinity.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Companions[/u][/b][/color]

Companion dialogue diversity is only as good as the most repeated line. Piper has over two-thousand lines, but you hear only a small fraction of those on a typical play-through. Some of her wittiest lines trigger only if she's with you on a particular quest, while some of her combat lines she says dozens of times.

I've traveled with Piper over 200 hours. Sorting through the raw audio files to make this mod, I was shocked to find hundreds of lines I'd never heard her say before.

A lot of us travel with companions for as long as they're interesting and not annoying. When they start repeating the same lines over and over, we lose interest and dismiss them. With this mod, that happens much later into the game.

The companion dialogue that is added here doesn't change their characters. It's the same companions you're used to, just with more content. Specifically:

[color=#00ffff][color=#00ff00]- Triple the amount of general combat lines (detect enemy, taunt enemy, victory line) for Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, Hancock, Danse, Deacon, and Gage.[/color]

- Lots of new random idles, especially in dungeons, and sometimes with a sarcastic slant if it suits the character.

[color=#ffff00]- Certain vanilla random idles that tend to repeat often will now only be said once.[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]
- When you loot, pick a lock, hack a terminal, use a workbench, take drugs, eat a corpse, walk around naked, enter power armor, etc., your companion will comment, but they will never repeat that same comment again.[/color][/color]

[center]﻿[youtube]TXVtZTQTRiI[/youtube][/center][color=#00ffff][u][color=#00ff00][b][u]Settlers[/u][/b][/color][/u][/color]

I was trying to figure out why I lost interest in settlement building about 6 months after the game launched. The settlement mods that have released since then are incredible. Why am I not motivated to engage with that part of the game anymore?

Partly because it doesn't feel like my actions matter. Not only does the game not in any way react to the massive colony I've built on Spectacle Island, the settlers there don't care either. They're still complaining about the same old things.

I wanted the game to feel like the settlers were on the same team as me, functioning as more than professional mooches. If I'm General of the Minutemen, call me "General" once in a while, and talk to me about tactical stuff. Acknowledge the threats we face and the things we're doing to solve problems. Or barring that, at least be semi-interesting and make me laugh occasionally.

So that's what I tried to implement via more dialogue lines, much of it conditioned upon what's going on in the game and/or the settlement. The increased variety in settler dialogue only occurs if a settlement's happiness is above 60, and some of the lines won't trigger until happiness is closer to 100.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Raiders and Gunners[/u][/b][/color]

Raider and Gunner combat lines have been tweaked to make them sound a little smarter, and to increase variety. This was done by adding lines (over 130) from cut content, DLC, and re-purposing voice files from quests where lines are only said once in specific areas (e.g. Museum of Freedom, Combat Zone, Cabot quest line).

The new lines are general in nature, not location specific, and it's stuff like: "You're goin' nowhere", "C'mon, I got places to be!", "Get it over with and die already!", "God dammit! You're gonna regret ever comin' here!", etc. It sounds indistinguishable from the vanilla combat, there's just more of it.

Also, Raiders won't call you "Rookie" once you're not a rookie anymore, and several of the lines that make Raiders sound comically obtuse have been flagged as "say once": e.g.  "Hiding? From me? Not even possible..."", "What the...!? No, no, it's nothing.." Raiders will still sound dumb, saying lines like "Huh?", Wha?", "What the...", but it won't be quite as over-the-top as it is in the vanilla game.

When stalking Gunners, they'll no longer say a few of the lines that make them sound incompetent: e.g. "Huh?" "Wha?", so it feels more like you're encountering trained mercenaries instead of dumb Raiders.

[left][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41785/41785-1575190586-1130611822.png[/img]﻿[/left][center][/center][color=#00ff00][b][u]Quests[/u][/b][/color]

Certain companions give repeatable quests now:

- Piper gives you the quests "[color=#93c47d]Anything for a Story[/color]" to explore places you haven't cleared yet and "[color=#93c47d]You Can't Stop the Press[/color]" to gather supplies for her newspaper business.

- Cait offers a quest "[color=#93c47d]Lookin' for Trouble[/color]" to hunt down those Raiders she talks so much about hating.

- Danse assigns you the quest "[color=#93c47d]Outstanding, Soldier![/color]" to eliminate Super Mutants and Feral Ghouls.

- Hancock has a quest "[color=#93c47d]Because I Got High[/color]" to track down chem stashes.

- Nick gives the quests "[color=#93c47d]Lost and Found[/color]" to track down stolen property for Diamond City residents and "[color=#93c47d]Commonwealth Justice[/color]" to complete bounties on behalf of the Diamond City Council.

- Gage gives the quest "[color=#93c47d]Let's Go Kill Some Sh*t[/color]" to wipe out rival gangs.

- Deacon also gives a non-repeatable quest called [color=#93c47d]"Coming Clean"[/color] once you've maxed his affinity. Ask him "What's News?" and cycle through all the dialogue to start the quest and experience a new chapter of his never-ending stream of B.S.

[color=#00ffff][u]Radiant quests are lame[/u][/color]

[color=#ea9999]Typical BoS/Institute quest[/color]: Talk to Quest Giver > Travel to Dungeon > Kill bad guys > Travel to Quest Giver > Talk to Quest Giver.

[color=#f6b26b]Typical Preston quest[/color]: Talk to Preston > Travel to Settler > Talk to Settler > Travel to Dungeon > Kill bad guys > Travel to Settler > Talk to Settler > Travel to Preston > Talk to Preston.

That's a lot of talking and load screens for not much action. It's more fun when the quest giver travels with you to do the quest: Talk to Companion > Travel to Dungeon > Kill bad guys > Talk to Companion.

These new quests are optional, nothing is forced, and you can cancel the quest by talking to the companion. The side quests are accessed via the 'More Options' dialogue menu. Completing a quest for a companion will raise their affinity ("like" or "love" event), grant a small amount of XP, and yield caps or a custom reward.

This gives you potentially a new way to explore the Commonwealth and discover most locations naturally without needing to do the main quest.

[color=#00ffff][u]What else?[/u][/color]

Beyond quests, this mod didn't fit well into an existing category. It's similar in spirit to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/1187]Relationship Dialogue Overhaul [/url]for Skyrim, but "Overhaul" typically implies something that edits a lot of things and requires a slew of patches. This has a light footprint- shouldn't require any patches. Doesn't add a new companion, or new NPC's, or conflict with any mods that alter companion/NPC appearance or stats.

[center]﻿[youtube]gMtn-nGmTDg[/youtube][/center]
[color=#00ff00][b][u]Load Order and Compatibility[/u][/b][/color]

There are various mods that add or edit Fallout 4 dialogue. If you run one of those mods, here's where they go in load order relative to this mod (SCDO) so that it all plays nice together and you receive the benefits of both mods. "Below" means "After", and "Above" means "Before".

[b][i][color=#f6b26b][u]Below SCDO in load order[/u][/color][/i][/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25050]Deeper Thoughts Curie[/url] - Adds some additional dialogue to Curie. Mostly redundant with SCDO installed, but will add a little extra variety to idle comments.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25525]Icebreaker Piper - Companion Dialogue Overhaul[/url] - Adds more dialogue to Piper. Largely redundant with SCDO unless you would like more Piper responses to specific player actions (e.g. loot junk, swim, eat corpse, pick lock, etc), and some additional greetings.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13717/?]Nick Valentine Romance [/url]-  Allows you to romance Nick Valentine. Load order shouldn't matter, but put it below SCDO to be safe.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10365]No companion junk comments[/url] - Companions never comment on looting junk at all (versus in SCDO they'll say it once). Load order shouldn't matter, but place below SCDO just in case.

[b][i][color=#f6b26b][u]Above SCDO in load order[/u][/color][/i][/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/26638]Flirty Commonwealth[/url] - Edits and adds some flirty some companion idle comments. The Raider taunts it adds play really well with this mod (no overlap).

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14108]Immersive Generic Dialogues [/url]- Edits some settler idle comments and companion idle comments.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/22166?]
Player Comments and Head Tracking[/url] - Edits some companion idle lines by adding player responses to them. If you place this, or its patch, below SCDO in load order, the repetition that SCDO removes from certain companion comments (e.g. Loot junk, pick lock, eat corpse, walk around naked) and idle comments (e.g. Cait's "we'd move faster if you kept your eyes on the road and off me arse"), will be reintroduced. For best results, do not use the unauthorized SCDO patch available for download on the Player Comments mod page.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4598]
Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch[/url] - Fixes typos on companion idle lines, and these fixes have been incorporated into SCDO, without requiring UF4P to be installed (although you should probably have it installed for a plethora of other reasons).
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/25972/?]
Icebreaker Settlements - Settler Dialogue Overhaul [/url]- Adds more dialogue to settlers via the 'DialogueFarmGeneric' quest. Largely redundant with SCDO. Load order shouldn't matter, but as SCDO has more variety in settler dialogue, place SCDO lower in load order to be safe.

[b][color=#f6b26b][i][u]In General[/u][/i][/color][/b]

As a starting point, put SCDO below your quest mods.

Except as noted above, place SCDO [color=#00ffff]below[/color] anything else editing the [color=#ffe599]companion dialogue quests[/color]. (ComPiperTalk, ComCaitTalk, etc). If you screw up, not a big deal, the result is that you may not see 100% of the features from this mod for a particular companion if another mod is overwriting the same dialogue topic.

You can check whether a mod edits a quest by loading all your mods in FO4Edit, clicking on the Quest records in this mod, and seeing whether any other mods edit the same Dialogue Topic within a quest (i.e. look for red and orange records when both mods are loaded in FO4Edit).

Other than that, SCDO should be [color=#00ffff]compatible with everything unless explicitly stated otherwise.  [/color]

Compatible with mods that edit NPC appearances, mods that edit leveled lists, mods that affect companion affinity or companion stats, multi-follower mods, Horizon, Sim Settlements/Conqueror, Start Me Up, Better Settlers, No Negative Affinity, Visible Companion Affinity, Full Dialogue Interface, Extended Dialogue Interface, Realistic Conversations, Amazing Follower Tweaks, Unlimited Companion Framework, Combat Zone Restored, Keep Both X6-88 and Porter Gage Plus Deacon, Danse Dialogue Overhaul, and the other 30,000 or so mods for Fallout 4, unless stated otherwise on the mod page.

[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41785/41785-1573848586-1768463613.png[/img]﻿﻿[/center][color=#00ff00][b][u]Requirements and Installation[/u][/b][/color]

The base game, Automatron, Nuka World, and Vault-Tec Workshop are required. No other mods are required.

Install like any regular mod. You can use the mod at any point on an existing save game. It also works on a new save game.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Translations[/u][/b][/color]

Check the Translation drop down menu at the top of the mod page for an updated list of available translations.

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Troubleshooting[/u][/b][/color]

- If a companion's buy/sell vendor menu comes up empty the first time, exit the conversation and try again. If Gage isn't selling chems, dismiss him and re-recruit.

- If Gage turns hostile in "Open Season", use the "Make Gage a Companion Again" holotape on the counter in Fizztop Grille to restore him, or craft the holotape at a chem station under "Utility". If you never want Gage to become hostile in the first place during "Open Season", use the mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/29192?]Keep Both X6-88 and Porter Gage Plus Deacon[/url].

- If a companion gives a quest, but no quest comes up, it's possible you've cleared all the eligible quest locations and may need to wait for them to respawn. Try asking again, and if that doesn't work, fast travel somewhere else, wait a day or so, then ask again.
[color=#00ff00][b][u]
XBox, PlayStation?[/u][/b][/color]

PS4: not possible due to voice files.
XBox: Yes, [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4133638]here[/url].

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Additional dialogue for other companions?[/u][/b][/color]

Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, and Danse were initially chosen for additional dialogue and new content based on a Discord poll asking the question, "[color=#ffd966]Which companions do you still play with for 6 hours or more on a Fallout 4 play-through? (Check all that apply)[/color]". There were over 100 responses, and those were the five companions people still actually use long enough for dialogue repetition to matter. And Dogmeat, but he doesn't talk. Hancock was also given additional dialogue because I like Hancock. Same with Gage, Deacon, and MacCready.

As it stands now:

- Companions with additional dialogue and new content: Cait, Curie, Piper, Valentine, Danse, Deacon, Hancock, Gage, and MacCready
- Companions adjusted to avoid/reduce repetitive dialogue: All of the above plus Ada, Preston, Codsworth, X6-88, and Strong.
- Companions for whom no adjustments were made: Dogmeat and Old Longfellow

[color=#00ff00][b][u]More Quest Content?[/u][/b][/color]

This mod plays nice with the following quest mods if you want another 60+ hours of Fallout 4 content:

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/35513]Depravity[/url] - (August 2019 Mod of the Month)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/28085]Project Valkyrie[/url] - (August 2018 Mod of the Month)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21469]Outcasts & Remnants [/url]﻿- (April 2017 Mod of the Month Runner Up)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16423]Fusion City Rising[/url] - (September 2016 Mod of the Month)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/45546]Diary of a Madman[/url] - (Alternate path to Depravity's evil ending to the vanilla game)

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/xrT20hp.png[/img]﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿[/center]The quest locations in this mod have very little overlap with the locations in the mods above. If you are looking for a workable Fallout 4 mod list based on flexibility, fun, safety, ease of install, and popularity over personal preference, check out [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/41435]Thuggyfied[/url].

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Donations?[/u][/b][/color]

[color=#00ff00][color=#ffffff]We do not accept donations, nor is the mod opted in to receive Donation Points from Nexus. However, we'll take endorsements and game-play screenshots if you've got good ones.

Another way to support what we're doing: we have a [url=https://discordapp.com/invite/gMpaxn3]Discord Server[/url] where we answer questions about these mods + provide general mod support, help people with making mods, discuss mod ideas, do play-testing and early access to upcoming mods, etc.

It helps us if you boost that server (visit the [url=https://discordapp.com/invite/gMpaxn3]Discord Server[/url], Click on Project Valkyrie in the upper left, then click on 'Server Boost', and then 'Boost This Server'). 

We don't receive any money from that, it all goes to Discord, but it helps us and all the Discord users by allowing access to more Discord features (e.g. uploading larger files, streaming at high resolution directly into the server, better user interface, etc). So huge thanks in advance if you do it!

If you're a [url=https://discord.com/nitro]Discord Nitro[/url]﻿ subscriber, they give you 2 free boosts with which you can boost any servers you'd like.[/color][/color]

[color=#00ff00][b][u]Credits[/u][/b][/color]

[url=https://discordapp.com/invite/gMpaxn3]Project Valkyrie Discord Server [/url]for play-testing and feedback. LlamaRCA, Flashy(Joer), Nika Cola for technical help. Sacremas for content help.
[color=#e69138]Mod page art[/color]: @Raikou.ff for Cait, [url=https://pain-art.tumblr.com/archive]Pain-Art@Tumblr[/url] for Curie and Piper, [url=https://girlandgeese.tumblr.com/archive]GirlAndGeese[/url] for Nick, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9740/?]ItsPreciousTime.Tumblr[/url] for Danse, [url=https://yuhimebarbara.tumblr.com/]Yuhimebarbara[/url] for Hancock, [url=https://www.deviantart.com/odme1]Odme1[/url] for Gage, Bjorn Kissel for settler comic, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/4304289?tab=user+files]SMB92[/url] for city skyline.

modInfo.description:
[font=Arial][size=5][color=orangered][center][b]DO NOT FLAG THE UFO4P-FDI PATCH AS AN ESL. IT'LL BREAK THE PATCH.[/b][/center][/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]DESCRIPTION[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]It's a strings patch for Full Dialogue Interface, I recreated the strings from the base game + DLCs with xTranslator, then edited many of them by hand. And it's English only, I'm unable to do it for other languages. Actually I made it for myself but I decided to share it with my fellow wastelanders.
[color=#ffff00]TL;DR: You'll have your FDI compatible with the latest FO4 (v1.10.163)[/color]

[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41659/41659-1574435733-1516041926.gif[/img][/center]
[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]FEATURES[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#aaaaaa]1.[/color] Replaces FDI's old version of strings with the recent version of the game.
[color=#aaaaaa]2.[/color] Corrects issues of the vault suit names and pip-boy names because of the old strings.
[color=#aaaaaa]3.[/color] I had always "Sturges tell him/her." dialogue stuck during entire conversation in the Museum of Freedom, this patch corrected this one for me. It'll correct some weird dialogue issues here and there caused by FDI but it's impossible for me to list all of them here.
[color=#aaaaaa]4.[/color] Corrects shortened dialogues of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4598][color=#ffff00]Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch[/color][/url] version 2.1.0 (if you have it).

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]REQUIREMENTS[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#ffff00]Fallout 4[/color] (Game version 1.10.163)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/1235][color=#ffff00]Full Dialogue Interface[/color][/url] (You only need the main mod)

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]COMPATIBILITY[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]It's compatible with anything, it does not affect save games, and perfectly safe to uninstall or reinstall whenever you want.

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]INSTALLATION[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]Use a mod manager like MO2/Vortex; it has a fomod installer.
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/41659/41659-1575294472-1300168992.png[/img]

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]FINAL NOTES[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3]A bit rant here: I'm surprised when I checked the strings; because since 2016 (when FDI last updated), Bethesda only changed the strings of vault suits and pip-boys for their creation club contents, and some tiny dialogues here and there, that's all... Then I realized that all the updates we had in the last 3 years were probably unnecessary. I even don't believe they made any bug fixes, it was just for their CC content... It's sad.

[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][b][color=#008000][size=5][center]THANKS[/center][/size][/color][/b][/font][font=Arial][size=3][color=#ffff00]Gentester[/color] for correcting UFO4P patch and saving me.
[color=#ffff00]Bethra[/color] for reporting issues and pointing me in the right direction.
[color=#ffff00]Cirosan[/color] for FDI that I still use it.
[color=#ffff00]Bethesda[/color] no matter what they do I'm still grateful for Fallout games.

[/size][/font]

fileInfo.description: Place everywhere - precise rotation+movement+scaling
fileInfo.name: Place (Fallout4 1.10.163 - latest release)

modInfo.author: TheLich
modInfo.description:
[b][size=3][color=#ff0000]If your Fallout4 game version is beta or one of previous release version (not latest) - look for right plugin version in Files section.[/color][/size]

[size=4][center]Описание на русском ищите в разделе Статьи (Articles).[/center][/size][/b]

This F4SE plugin allows building and placing objects in workshop mode everywhere (see note below) you want. Inside other objects, in water, even at air. Also makes almost all scrap-only objects (yellow) selectable/movable. Also you can move objects out of green zone and leave them there, while I do not recommend do this - if you think your settlement borders are too tight, just use border expanding mods like [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3528/?]Build High[/url] (be careful though, as that mod conflicts with scrap mods and can cause reset bug).

Allowing building in water has a side effect - all objects which requires water to be placed in, now can be build/placed everywhere also.
Put water-purifiers everywhere!

You can [color=#00ff00][size=5]move workshop workbenches, power armors [/size][/color]and pretty much many other, previously unmovable objects (by default this mode is off - press INS to enable). Be careful, though, [color=#ff0000][size=4]save before moving/deleting such objects![/size][/color]

Build restrictions (only in dirt, out of green zone) still there. The only problem is that objects with such restrictions (and all if outside workshop) will still be highlighted as able to build, but in fact they are not. You just have to remember - no building outside of green zone and if object says it has to be build in dirt, then so be it. You can build such objects in valid place first, then move them anywhere your like.

You can toggle on/off out-of-workshop-zone timeout, so you can move built objects from your settlement as far as you like. Though, I'm not sure if placing settlement objects outside of settlement will not cause any issues, so do it on your own risk

You can precise rotate objects by X, Y and Z axis via mouse buttons (default) or mouse wheel (see config option). Tapping ctrl key changes rotation axis. Numpad + and - changes rotation angle step.
You can precise move objects by X, Y and Z axis via numpad keys. 2,8 - up and down, 4,6 - left and right, 7,9 - to and from player. Numpad / and * changes movement step.
You can change scale of objects via numpad keys. 1 - scale down, 3 - scale up, . (dot) - reset scale to 100%. PgUp and PgDown changes scale step.

You can make movable objects like armor, weapons, junk, e.t.c static (kannot be kicked and don't fall) and back. Default hotkeys - 'Home' turn object physics on (make it movable/droppable if possible), 'End' turn object physics off (make it static if possible).

[size=4][center][color=#00ff00]For scaling, precise rotation and movement work, make sure object you want to move/rotate is just highlighted (outlined), NOT selected (floating in front of player).
For ANY numpad actions to work - check if NumLock is ON.[/color][/center][/size]

Last 10 actions (precise movement/rotation/scaling) can be undone with Backspace key (default).

You can save some object's parameters (position, rotation angles and scale) with '=' key and set all or some of this info to other objects. 1,2,3 - set X,Y,Z position, 4,5,6 - set X,Y,Z rotation angles, 7 - set scale, 0 - set all parameters.

All hotkeyed actions shows notification when activated.
[size=4][color=#ffff00]ALL hotkeys and notification messages can be changed in config file ([/color][color=#00ff00]Data\F4SE\Plugins\place.ini[/color][color=#ffff00])[/color]
[/size][color=#ffff00][size=4]If you don't have place.ini yet, rename [/size][/color][color=#00ff00][size=4]place_example.ini[/size][/color][color=#ffff00][size=4] to place.ini
[/size][/color][color=#ffff00][size=4]Information about what any option do can be found in [/size][/color][color=#00ff00][size=4]place_ini_help.txt[/size]
[/color]

If you don't want any additional  features, except 'no-red' functionality - you can install one of predefined config files (see Misc section if Files).

Look at changelog for latest changes.

Be sure to visit [color=#00ff00][size=4]image gallery[/size][/color] - you'll see what can be done with this mod. [color=#00ff00][size=4]No limits for your imagination![/size][/color]

Check a brief spotlight made by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/31476085/?]YTAtlasGaming[/url]
[youtube]Kz-rexmSD7g[/youtube][center][/center]
Also a good video with install instructions by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/15258994]ZAYNORI[/url]
[youtube]BYfGieJXfOM[/youtube]

And another simple one by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/26921039]pixelgamerch[/url]
[youtube]8ACHd2pClB8[/youtube]

Fallout 4 Weekly Mods show #14 by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/3388892/?]Tyrannicon[/url]
[youtube]gXkfcgq0tQk[/youtube]

Installation:
1. Find out your Fallout4 version: start game, main menu->settings->lower-right corner
2. Make sure you have [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url], suitable for your game version.
3. Install plugin for your game version with NMM (or other mod manager) OR extract contents of archive into Fallout4 game dir.
4. Check that place.dll is located at [color=#ffff00][size=4]Data\F4SE\Plugins[/size][/color][size=2] in Fallout4 game directory.
[/size]5. Run game with f4se_loader.exe

There is configuration file [color=#00ff00][size=4]place.ini (if there is no such file - rename place_example.ini to place.ini)[/size] [/color]in [color=#ffff00][size=4]Data\F4SE\Plugins[/size][/color], where you can configure 'place everywhere' mode by default and hotkeys:
1. mode by default can be set to - always enabled (no toggle hotkey and console command); toggle enabled, on by default (hotkey and console command enabled); toggle enabled, off by default (hotkey and console command enabled).
2. You can configure hotkey for mode toggle (if enabled), object snapping toggle, ground and surface snapping toggle.
3. You can configure messages shown when hotkeys were used.

Hotkeys by default:
F8 - toggles "Place Everywhere" mode (if you enabled toggle in config)
F1 - toggles object snapping (you have to cancel current object if you have any selected, for this to work)
F2 - toggle ground and surface snapping
F3 - toggle workshop grid snapping
F5 - toggle out-of-workshop timeout
F6 - toggle storing clamped objects in workshop storage, when underlying object is scrapped or stored in workshop storage
F7 - lock/unlock hightlighted object selection. While selection locked, no other object will be hightlighted, when your move your aim on it.
INS - toggle extra objects selection.
F11 - change timescale to 0.01 (can be changed in config) while in buld mode
ALT - set object movement relative to player (by default) or global world axis

Numpad 0 - reset rotation angles X and Y to 0
Numpad 5 - remove 'tremor' effect
Numpad 2 - move outlined object down
Numpad 8 - move outlined object up
Numpad 4 - move outlined object left
Numpad 6 - move outlined object right
Numpad 7 - move outlined object to player
Numpad 9 - move outlined object from player
Numpad 1 - scale down oullined object by 10%
Numpad 3 - scale up outlined object by 10%
Numpad dot - reset scale of outlined object to 100%
Numpad minus - decrease rotation angle step
Numpad plus - increase rotation angle step
Numpad divide - decrease movement step
Numpad multiply - increase movement step
PgUp - increase scale step
PgDown - decrease scale step
Ctrl - change rotation axis.
Backspace - undo last precise movement/rotation/scaling action.
'=' - store outlined object position, rotation and scale info
1,2,3 - set X,Y,Z position of stored info to outlined object 
4,5,6 - set X,Y,Z rotation angles of stored info to outlined object 
7 - set scale of stored info to outlined object
0 - set all stored info to outlined object
Home - turn object physics on (make it movable/droppable if possible)
End - Home - turn object physics on (make it static if possible)

My other mods:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/3938]PerkPointsPerLevel[/url] - let's you configure how many perk point you will gain at level up.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8119]Wasteland Scarves Extended[/url] - add modding options for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4317]Wateland Scarves[/url].

[size=3][center][/center][/size]

For Fallout 4 game version 1.10.163.

fileInfo.name: Extended Dialogue Interface 1.3.6

modInfo.author: reg2k and Neanka
modInfo.description:
[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ About ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

In the vanilla game, player dialogue requires exactly four response options - the game would not accept any more, nor any less. This system also shoehorned most dialogue into one of four types: Yes, No, Neutral and Question. As you might imagine, dialogue doesn't always fall neatly into these categories!

The [b]Extended Dialogue Interface[/b] ([b]XDI[/b]) is a community framework that removes the hardcoded 4-option limit on dialogue and adds engine support for any number of player dialogue options.

Mods can now create new dialogue experiences that emphasize player choice and have dialogue options that truly reflect their intent.

XDI does not modify vanilla dialogue on its own but will display full-text for vanilla dialogue choices.

Interestingly, in several vanilla scenes, Bethesda themselves have additional dialogue options recorded! In many cases, these are not wired up correctly for XDI (no associated responses, etc.) so they cannot simply be turned on globally. However, it is possible for modders to modify such vanilla dialogue scenes to wire them up correctly and expose additional voiced dialogue lines that are already part of the base game.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Features ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[list]
[*] [b]Full dialogue text[/b]. View your dialogue options with full certainty of what you're going to say.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Dialogue cues[/b]. A question icon can be optionally displayed for dialogue options that do not advance the conversation. No more accidentally making a choice when all you wanted was to get more information. Options that end the conversation will have a door icon displayed beside them.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Flexible dialogue options[/b]. Modders: have less than four things to say? Have just two options, Or add as many options as you'd like.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]No player voice, no problem[/b]. Skyrim and New Vegas didn't have a voiced player either! XDI makes engine modifications to overcome this. For unvoiced player dialogue, NPC dialogue starts right after option selection. The dialogue camera is hot-patched to keep focus on the NPC instead of (in vanilla) looking at the player's unmoving mouth. No more awkward pauses.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]Configurable via MCM[/b]. XDI comes with a MCM menu for easy configuration.
[/list]
[list]
[*] [b]No hacks[/b]. These changes are integrated into the engine - no need for workarounds, 'blank voice files', patching STRINGS files, etc.
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Who's using XDI? ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

XDI is proud to power dialogue for the following large-scale quest mods currently in development:

[list]
[*]Fallout Cascadia ([url=http://www.falloutcascadia.com/]website[/url]﻿, [url=https://discord.gg/FalloutCascadia]discord[/url]﻿)
[*]Fallout 4: New Vegas ([url=http://www.moddb.com/mods/fallout-4-new-vegas]moddb[/url]﻿)
[*]Fallout 4: Capital Wasteland ([url=https://capitalwasteland.com]website[/url]﻿)
[*]Fallout 4: E Pluribus Unum ([url=https://falloutepu.tumblr.com/]website[/url]﻿)
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Installation ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Install with your preferred mod manager, or copy the files in the download to your Fallout 4 Data folder and activate XDI.esm.

Make sure that you start the game with the F4SE loader.

If you get an error about the XDI plugin not being loaded, double-check that you have [url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]F4SE[/url] installed and running!

When installing XDI, make sure there is no DialogueMenu.swf file in your Data\Interface folder. This file is provided in XDI's BA2 archive. Any loose interface file in that folder will take priority and override XDI's file.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Requirements ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Fallout 4 game version 1.10.50.

[url=http://f4se.silverlock.org/]Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE)[/url], 0.6.0 or higher.

The [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/21497/]Mod Configuration Menu[/url] (1.2 or higher) is highly recommended if you want to configure XDI in-game. Alternatively, you can modify XDI's INI file manually at [code]Data\MCM\Settings\XDI.ini[/code].


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Compatibility ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

XDI replaces the DialogueMenu.swf interface file and is not compatible with mods that do the same. (This means the Full Dialogue Interface mod is incompatible.)

Other than the menu, XDI does not modify any vanilla forms or dialogue and will not conflict with other mods.

XDI dynamically retrieves full text dialogue from the game and is automatically compatible with all DLCs and mods that add dialogue - no patches are required.


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Team ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/17152929/]registrator2000[/url] - F4SE plugin and backend work
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/users/6719842/]Neanka[/url] - Dialogue menu interface and additional class decoding


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ More ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Check out the Articles tab for more information!
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/551/]Background Information[/url] describes the motivation behind the creation of XDI.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/552/]Guide for Modders[/url] is a modders' guide to XDI.

Suggestions? Thoughts? Join the XDI Discord here: [url=https://discord.gg/BSSm9m9]https://discord.gg/BSSm9m9[/url]

Source code:
[url=https://github.com/reg2k/xdi]Github[/url] [C++] (F4SE plugin)
[url=https://github.com/Neanka/DialogueMenu]Github[/url] [AS3] (Dialogue menu interface)


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Acknowledgements ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Many thanks to the xSE team, for F4SE.
Thanks to the [url=http://www.falloutcascadia.com/]Fallout Cascadia project[/url] for initial ideas and suggestions.

modInfo.description:
[b][color=#00ffff][size=4][center][url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4019243]Now Available For Xbox One[/url][/center]
Update 1.6
[/size][/color][/b]-Added new options in Configurator like Oswald teleport effect from Nuka-World. (DLC is NOT required as it uses effect from vanilla game)
-Optional land animations now work only in third-person as they were needless in first person
-Fixed issue when player was able to shoot Blink Grenades in VATS.


[b][color=#00ffff][size=4]Update 1.4
[/size][/color][/b]-Added the unique version of blink grenade - "[color=#00ffff]Infinity[/color]", which returns back to player inventory after throw, but drains action points per throw. Can be crafted on Chemistry station under Grenades section. (Action points Cost can be changed from Configurator)
-Added custom textures for Blink Grenades
-Other Minor fixes
[color=#00ffff][size=4][b]
Update 1.2[/b][/size][/color]
[color=#efefef][size=2]-Fixed permanent falling animation issue (Big Thanks to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/1675697/?]Jojash[/url] for simple and elegant fix suggestion and help, also to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/4405062/?]KataPUMB[/url] for help and figuring out what actually was causing that problem)
[/size][/color]-Added a Configurator, which allows you to control some aspects of the Blink Grenades, like changing teleport animations (three land animations added), sounds, effect e.t.c. Configurator will be automatically added to your Pipboy/misc section once you complete the quest from this mod (If you have already completed it the Configurator will be automatically added to you when you start your game)
-Blink Grenades now don't have an impulse so they won't damage or alert any NPC in any way.
-Now you can also buy Blink Grenades from Synth merchant in the Institute (after finishing the quest from this mod)(Grenades were added in leveled list by script so there won't be any issues with other mods that edit the same leveled list.
-Other small fixes

The mod Adds a new type of grenade which teleports the player to its throw location.

[/color][/b]To be able to craft them, you have to complete a small miscellanous type quest (which starts automatically and was made just for immersion). Then Blink Grenades will be available to craft on Chemistry station under Grenades section.

fileInfo.name: Scrap Everything

modInfo.author: shadowslasher410 and VIitS
modInfo.description:
[center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/5320-0-1454899189.png[/img][/center]
[center][color=#00ff00][size=5]LIKE IT? Please endorse![/size][/color][/center]

[size=4]To use this mod across the entire wasteland (with mods that let you build anywhere) change the following line in your fallout4.ini (under the heading [general] ): [color=#00ffff]bUseCombinedObjects=1[/color] to [/size][size=4][color=#00ffff]bUseCombinedObjects=0[/color][color=#1e84cc]. [/color][color=#ff0000]Do not use the ini edits otherwise, they hurt more than they help.[/color][color=#1e84cc] This can also be set using the FOMOD installer. [/color][/size][color=#0000ff]

[/color]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/5320-1-1454899188.png[/img][/center]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[size=4][size=5][color=#ff0000]
Put this file at the absolute END of your load order, or else you will get areas in which scrapping doesn't work as advertised![/color][/size]

This mod fixes the glaring oversight Bethesda made when they chose to only make a small fraction of objects able to be scrapped. With Scrap Everything, you, the user, has the final say on what stays and what goes. Want to scrap your settlement down to the bare bones and have yourself a whole bunch of empty land to go wild on? Done. Want to scrap things like trash, debris, vines, bushes and even dead machines, animals, and people, but leave the buildings and trees? Done. This mod allows you to scrap literally everything in each and every one of your settlements, should you so choose. 

[size=4][color=#f4f4f4][color=#ff7700][b]This mod scraps everything that these mods do (and more):[/b][/color] Spring Cleaning, Scrap Dead Things, Scrap Scrap, Scrappable Commonwealth
[/color][/size][b]
[/b][color=#f4f4f4][color=#ffff00][b]Permissions:[/b][color=#ffffff]Users may [/color][/color]change, modify, add, remove, etc. whatever they want for PERSONAL USE. modInfo.name: Scrap Everything
modInfo.summary: Ever feel like scrapping everything in your settlement? With this mod, you can scrap houses, grasses, trash and debris, roads, sidewalks, and much more!

modInfo.author: Cthorthu
modInfo.description:
This mod adjusts raiders level, to allow them to use different weapons throughout the progress of the game.

Raiders level is increased, and their health value is manually adjusted to not make them overpowered. The result is: They use a larger variety of weapons.

At level 1, raiders use level 1 weapons. But while the player character levels up, the weaponry of the raiders starts being more varied.

Also, the raiders health is increased a bit when the player levels up.

Raider: Vanilla level 1 (health 30) >>> Modded level 1-10 (health 30-75)
Raider Scum: Vanilla level 4 (health 45) >>> Modded level 5-15 (health 45-75)
Raider Psycho: Vanilla level 9 (health 70) >>> Modded level 10-20 (health 70-120)
Raider Scavver: Vanilla level 14 (health 125) >>> Modded level 15-25 (health 125-175)
Raider Waster: Vanilla level 21 (health 175) >>> Modded level 25-35 (health 175-225)
Raider bosses[b]*[/b]: Vanilla level 10 (health 85) >>> Modded level 25-35 (health 85-135)
Raider Survivalist and Raider Veteran: No modfied (they have levels 30 and 39 in vanilla)

[b]*[/b][size=1]("Raider bosses" includes unique named raiders, but unique raiders have their own bonuses, and this is not modified by this mod.)[/size]

As you can see, raiders will have a bit higher health value, but only when the player character has a higher level.

In vanilla, basic raiders have pipe weapons and double barrel shotguns (and melee weapons). With this mod, basic raiders also can have 10mm pistols and hunting rifles, but only when the player character has a higher level. Other types of raiders get [b][u]larger[/u][/b] variety of weapons.



[size=3][b]Compatbility[/b][/size]

This mod makes raiders have higher level weapons from the "raiders weapons list", but this mod doesn't modify this list. It is compatible with mods that modify weapons and leveled lists, but it may be not compatible with mods that modify raiders characters stats.

This mod is fully compatible with Varied Raiders.



[b][size=3]Miscellaneous things[/size]
[/b]
If you install this mod mid game, I recommend to wait more than 20 days in a inner cell (all respawnable things will be respawned).





[font=Georgia][size=4][i]Would you like to know more?
[/i][/size][/font]
In a modded playthrough, with weapons added lo leveled lists, a higher levels means: Raiders will use many different weapons, specially at high levels. But it depends on what weapon mods you are using.

Also, this mod can be used as a part of [b]Redistribute Weapon Lists - Pipe guns removed[/b] (only if you don't like pipe weapons).
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/44724/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/44724/[/url]
Used this way, raiders and you will enjoy every battle. Promised.
If interested, read locked post.

modInfo.summary: This mod makes some tweaks to raiders, to bring them more weapon variety.
