modInfo.description:
[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-0-1453151660.jpg[/img]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-0-1472526173.jpg[/img]


[center]™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™[/center]
Note: most these videos are out of date, and the mod has been updated quite a bit since most were made.
[youtube]Tm5Be4oFh9s[/youtube][youtube]xLUkMzQyIqE[/youtube]
[youtube]7trxvJEUEgg[/youtube][youtube]yM3JCsTfAjw[/youtube]


[center]™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™[/center]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-0-1453151432.jpg[/img]

Pre-war Cybernetics come to the commonwealth wasteland. This mod adds the Cybernetics Lab Workbench, and several pieces of armor (and a pair of RoboHand-gloves), each with a significant amount of customization including vanilla lining mods, special Gadget mods, advanced Frame mods, cybernetic implants, firmware upgrades, and 20+ paint/pattern options. The main pieces have light/medium/heavy variations, and the 'RoboHand' gloves can be modded to be exclusive to either the left/right hand. Most items are worn as armor and generally will fit with vanilla outfits (RoboGloves cant be worn with some vanilla 'gloved' outfits)

A note on Bodyscales:
The vanilla game uses a funky system to scale over-armor to fit cleanly over under-clothing, this system works alright for the relatively small armors of the vanilla game, but for the Cyber armatures it can be a little aggressive. You might notice while wearing certain under-clothes (army fatigues) you will get massive scaling on Cyber Armatures. There's no way to avoid this without editing vanilla items. My best advice is to stick to thin under-clothes like Vault suits, harnesses, and BoS uniforms. Additionally you can scale down your characters weight to average/skinny to offset most strange scaling. The first-person models Have been specially made to not clip over the pipboy at any size. You will need another mod if you wish to hide the
pipboy in 3rd person, this mod will not do that for you.


CBBE Bodyslide files are included for female versions, these may help with clipping, but are not necessary.

Screenshot auto-approve is turned on, I'm sure most of you can take better screenshots than my potato computer can!

There is a Palette guide in the screenshots that can help you find the color you want.

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-0-1454997180.jpg[/img]

[center]™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™[/center]
[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-1-1453151432.jpg[/img]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-0-1453155310.png[/img]

All of the main items of this mod are made at the Cyber Crafting Bench. Once made they can be customized at an armor bench, paint/palette swaps cost nothing, some of the more advanced mods and armors have long parts lists, so remember to scroll the component list!
[center]™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™[/center]
[size=5]Version notes:[/size]
[size=5]v1.06c
[/size]Fixed a bad Bodyslide project on the Marine armor left arm
Reshaped the Marine armor 1st person mesh to fit the pipboy better

[size=5]v1.06b
[/size]fixed a missing Palette Texture

[size=5]v1.06a[/size]
[b]Added a new Palette version[/b]: v4 Vibrant
-These colors are generally brighter than the other palettes, but not all are, one example is pictured above.
[b]Added Marine armor[/b]
-Better stats than top end Combat armor, Marine armor is the new top tier medium armor for Cybernetics.
-Note that this tier requires Far Harbor assets to display correctly, the stats will still work but the meshes will not display correctly.
[b]Rebuilt the male arm meshes[/b]
-Much less bulky
-Still looks best with an 'average' body type with the in-game slider, though high muscle builds can still work without excessive scaling
-Some outfits (ie: army fatigues) still have strange scaling, this is a vanilla issue
Reworked some component costs of Armor mods
-Most notably removed the need for Ballistic Fiber when crafting Raider Style armors
Fixed some object mod descriptions
Big nerf to Antimicrobial Cleanser
-This was hilariously overpowered in Survival
-Heals rads at about .3 rads persecond down from 3 rads per second
-Still retains its usefulness, but the heal is much more passive and gives radaway some value back
Removed the tiny 1 extra value/armor/energy resist/weight from palette mods

[size=5]v1.05a[/size]
[size=3][b]REMOVED the need for AWKCR and Cosmetic Framework[/b][/size]
--The mod is 100% standalone now, no other mods or masters needed.
[size=3][b]ADDED T-51 heavy tier armor[/b][/size]
--makes full use of all palette colors
--unpainted allows you to use the classic coloration with a green chest and steel arms/legs
ADDED jump height leg gadget
--roughly doubles your jump height
ADDED Auto-medic Torso Gadget
--Unlike the PA version, the Auto-Medic still plays the stimpack animation
ADDED more stat bonus psudo-legendary mods
--Also reworked the recipe costs of the original Uni mods
--Generally each stat requires a large investment of a specific material, and a handful of nuclear material
--These are still interchangeable, and can be moved between armatures
--The Upper-Lower Connector also had a slot added for UniFrame mods, to make up for only having one for both legs
ADDED Inventory and ground models for most items
REWORKED most crafting recipes
--Lists should be MUCH shorter
--Rather than small amounts of lots of different things, most items now require a moderate amount of a few different things
REWORKED the Cyberlab
--With the keyword cap issue resolved the workbench can return without bloating keyword usage
--All armatures and extras (Belt/hands) are crafted at the new (old) workbench now
--The workbench can also be used to craft stuff from other CROSS mods that have been updated for it
--Not all CROSS mods are updated to use this yet, but its worth checking if you hate making cool stuff at the boring chemlab!

[size=5]v1.03a[/size]
[b]Added the much requested feature to hide the chest straps on the arms.[/b]
-This shows up like a new mod category in the mod menu for each arm
-by default on newly crafted armatures they are enabled
-on updating you should see an extra "material" category at the bottom of the the armor-mod list, this is where the toggle for the straps is.
All Torso meshes were updated to work with the Jetpack (and any other addons I might add down the line)
-They won't look any different, but trust me they are.
-If you've customized any torso meshes from this mod they likely won't work with the Jetpack mod without being tweaked.

[size=5]v1.02a[/size]
[b]Added Raider armor mods[/b]
-Includes medium and heavy versions for arms/legs, and lite/med/heavy torso (lite has less garbage over the head)
-These use v1, v3, and vBoS palettes
-Polished/chrome versions can still be used, but they will not effect the raider armor, just the baseframe.
-Balance wise the raider versions are about the same as combat med/heavy, and slightly easier to make, with the major caveat of being extra heavy.
Cleaned up a few first person meshes that were still clipping occasionally
Moved Material swap records off of the Cosmetic Framework and back into the ESP for ease of updating.
[b]Combined exo-frame and Unibelt optional addons into Cybernetics[/b]
-You'll have to remake items from those addons, and Robohands may need to have color/texture reconfigured.
-you should disable those addons if you were previously running them, but other than losing the exo-frame/belt there shouldn't be any issue.
-If you don't disable those addons you will have duplicates in the AWKCR crafting menu, and existing items will likely be unmoddable.

[size=5]v1.01b[/size]
Moved several shared components to a master file which further helps deal with the keyword cap.
-this also makes some of my other mods no longer dependent on this one.
Added a Chrome version of the BoS Palette, shiny!
More back end cleanup

[size=5]v1.01[/size]
Added Light Combat Armor Arms
Dropped the unique crafting bench
-All wearables are crafted under CYBERTECH category of AWKCR armorsmith bench
-All mods are crafted at armor workbench
-Make sure to update exo-frame addon otherwise you will no longer be able to craft the exo-frames.
Re-added the unique crafting bench as an alternative armorbench
-functions exactly like a vanilla armor modding bench
Fixed a bad IsMoving comparison that was draining stamina incorrectly on movement based gadgets
Fixed Low Noise conversion's description to include the 10% movespeed while sneaking it has always provided.
Significant clean-up of torso/arm meshes
-Better rigging overall, less twisting metal parts
Minor adjustments to the v3 baseframe diffuse map
Included a "NoRobotFootStepSounds" esp file that removes the robotic noise when running/walking with leg armatures equipped (effects exo-legs as well)

[size=5]v1.00[/size]
Added full legs
-Leg armatures are a single piece of armor for both legs, because it looks ridiculous to only wear one at a time
-armor values on are generally double their vanilla equivalent because obviously they are 2 armor slots in one
-natural +50 carryweight
-Robot footsteps!
-Full Palette/Index mod support
Added a lower torso item that works like the lower exo-legs to connect upper/lower frames
-uses the same slot as exo-legs, and can be palette/index modded
-Animates better for the cyber-legs than the exo-leg connector, though exo-legs provide the same functionality
Added Lite/Med/Heavy Combat armor upgrades for legs
Added t45 armor upgrade for legs
-Connect to upper frame via a secondary torso armature, or with exo frame to negate mobility penalty
Reduced mod category keywords for general keyword cap compatibility
Removed the 'friendly-names' of palette index mods
-these were never very accurate, read the area below the description for a more accurate description of color placements.

[size=6][size=5]v.094[/size][/size]
Enabled the 'full-support' system
-full-support is provided by wearing linked leg armatures as well as either (or both) a linked exo-arm frame, or the Pre-war Cybernetics Torso.
Enabled two new arm gadgets that require full support. (Currently you will need the exo-frame addon to use legs mods, until full pre-war cybernetic legs are finished)
-Grounded Stabilizer -Eliminates all scope sway, and reduces bullet spread by 20% while crouched and not moving. Requires connected spine and leg supports.
-High Impact Reinforcement -Sprinting into enemies can stagger them. Requires connected spine and leg supports, as well as secondary gadget on arm/legs.
Enabled new unique mods for leg armatures. (currently requires exo-frame addon)
-Load bearing 1, 2, and 3, - provides 25, 50, and 100 carryweight.
-HighSpeed Servos - Movespeed increased by 10%. VATS Melee distance increased by 100%.
-Pneumatic Upgrade - Negates 80% of fall damge, and increases Swim Speed by 15%.
-Move assist Actuators - Reduced Sprint cost by 50%
-Low Noise Conversion - Sneaking is 40% quieter, but drains 4 AP per sec while moving.
-High Impact - Sprinting into enemies can stagger them. Requires connected spine and leg supports, as well as secondary gadget on arm/legs.
Power Armor modded armatures now have a mobility reduction mechanic for each piece equipped.
-this mobility penalty can be negated by wearing a full frame (Connected legs as well as a torso support item).
Improved on the Robo hand meshes for male and female.
-better overall shape.
-No more bulky wristwrap.
Updated Combat armor torso texture.
Added a BoS themed Palette
Altered how Palette Indexes are described, which should give a better idea of the colors they apply and where they are applied.

[size=5]v0.93[/size]
ADDED palette v3. This is a further cleaned up texture/palette. v1 and v2 are still available.
Finished the t-45 PowerPlated Chest, which now has (the good parts of) a proper t45 torso.
-the Included bodyslide files for the t45 chest have 'size limits' so as to keep their overall shape up to a decent size.
Power Armor modded armatures have had their armor value increased significantly.
MOVED Synth hands into the regular PA hands
-Synth versions are now variations of the original hands (similar to how you switch between left/right/both).
Implemented Dynamic Naming for weight/style/Palette Index.
-You will probably have to rebuild armatures if updating from previous versions to get dynamic naming working.
Altered the 'winterized' palette index
-this was basically a third 'white' option and didnt look as good as the other two.
-while on the v2/3 palette this is nowa vibrant purple-yellow
-unchanged on palette v1
Significant file clean-up and reduced keyword usage
-All armature mods now ride on vanilla keywords now.
-This has the added bonus of making the mod menu list more ordered.
Removed the belt from Combat armor variations of the Torso armor
Fixed an issue with hands showing through gloves when using other mods that split up the hand meshes.
Fixed a filepath issue with high specular synth hand textures.
Altered the stats on base armors/mods to bring them more in line with similar vanilla armors.
Added some behind the scenes stuff to set up for legs.

[size=5]v0.92[/size]
Added medium and lite Combat armor torso mods
Added medium combat armor arm mod.
Added a poison resistance spine implant.
Added two new "entry level" firmware mods
-LockBumper, while equipped all novice locks are impossible to fail. Easier to make than the other lockpick firmware.
-Trajectory Calculator, enables the throwing arc on grenades/Molotovs while equipped.
Cleaned up some old paint jobs to make use of Palette mods on parts they normally would leave at default.
--IE you can now have the Red forearm paint and still change the color of armor over the top of the painted frame.
Added Palette version 2.1
--This is an updated frame texture, other textures still on v2. Includes a Chrome 2.1
Cleaned up some records in the RoboGloves reference. Might help with crashing some people seem to have.
Added Synth hands.
--These function exactly like the regular the PA Frame hands.
--Can be swapped between Both/Left/Right at an armor bench.
--Can use Palettes, or be left unpainted.

[size=5]v0.91[/size]
Added Heavy Combat armor versions of the medium armor.
-These are a heavy weight alternative to the kelogg armor and can be crafted with armorer rank 3.
Marked the "brace" center size options as WIP.
-These still need the t-45 chest and some other kind of armor added to these. For now they retain stats as if they had proper armor.
Removed the extra workbench entry which should clean up the workshop bloat a bit.
Moved Paletted 'material' mods to a new Armor-mod class: Palette Index.
-This allows more universal color swapping across palette versions.
Added a second palette version, which can be swapped to like custom paint jobs.
Renamed palette colors slightly, generally the colors are the same across v1 and v2, but colors with color1/color2 are respective to v1/v2.
Renamed "polished" custom paint and added Chrome Paint.
-These are now based on Palette versions.
-Polished applies a brighter specular map than normal to v1.
-Chrome applies a very bright specular map to v2.
-Because these work like palettes any palette index color can be polished/chromed.
Added an amateurish attempt at upping the resolution of the Frame/Gloves, only applies to v2 palette and v2 Chrome.
Paint and palette index changes are now free.
Fixed some 1st person clipping issues with specific guns.

Added a second ESP for people having issues with the unique crafting station.
-This ESP makes all armatures and advanced mods craft-able at the CHEMLAB, they must still be APPLIED at the armor bench.
-If you are still having issues with crafting items with this debug-esp the issue is likely related to overall bloat from large amounts of mods.
[center]™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™[/center]
[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-3-1453151432.jpg[/img]
The base limb armatures are nearly free and buildable easily at early levels, with the torso piece being the first major upgrade. Vanilla-standard armor mods/Paint/Size-mods can be applied for standard progression. From there things get more complex, the more unique Firmware/Implant/gadget/frame mods are significantly more powerful than vanilla armor mods and require more than just Armorsmith and Science perks, as well as large investments of rare components.

Many of the unique mods require more than just the basic crafting perks, for example the lockpicking auto-picker mod requires both locksmith1 and robotics-expert1. The general idea is that CyberArm mods support a more role-playing playstyle and reward you for branching out your perk tree instead of just taking the few perks that really matter. Think of it this way: A Sole-Survivor who barely understands how to properly apply a stimpack probably shouldn't be tooling around with Implants attached directly to the spine!

All of this is subject to change, feel free to comment on balance issues.
[center]™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™™[/center]
[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1151/images/8609-2-1453151432.jpg[/img]
Examples of just a few of the unique mods at release:


Arm Firmware mods
Tracking Matrix -Recon Spotting on all weapons.


Arm Gadget mods
Lifting Servos -Full mobility while holding Heavy Weapons.
Overpressure Pneumatics -Unarmed attacks do +10% damage, and can explode heads.
Magazine Auto-Ejector -Reloading costs no Action Points in V.A.T.S.


Body Implant mods
Dialysis Implant -Regen 20 HP per minute.
Bioelectric Acvtive Camo Mk.I -Visual distortion while sneaking. Drains 1.5 AP per sec sitting, 6 AP per sec moving.


Body Gadgets
Stim Enhancer -Stimpacks heal for 10% more


Uniframe mods (fits on body and arms):
Balanced Frame -5% movespeed
Precision Linear Actuators -+1 Agility

fileInfo.name: Explosion Knockdown FOMOD

modInfo.author: Sensei Shisha
modInfo.description:
[size=4][center][b]Description[/b][/center][/size]
Explosion Knockdown changes the behaviors of ballistic explosions so they send their targets flying. Grenades can be used now to interrupt your foe movement, incapacitate them for a while, or just used to see how they helplessly go through the air while you do some target practice on them. As in version 1.3 and above, Explosion Knockdown features support for Canary Save File Monitor.

[center][size=4][b]Features[/b][/size][/center]
To prevent silly situations like a cherry bomb throwing a behemoth all across the Commonwealth, I created three tiers of explosion forces:

[b]Small explosions[/b] only knocks off [b]normal-sized NPC without power armor[/b]. They now provide a excellent tactical distraction against a group of foot soldiers.
[list]
[*]Frag Grenade/Mine, ...
[*]Oxygen Tanks, Small Cars, Turret Explosions, ...
[*]Gauss Impact Explosion
[*]Power Armor Explosive Vent
[/list]
[b]Medium explosions[/b] can also ragdoll [b]Power-Armored NPCs[/b], but not large enemies (Yao-Guais, Behemoths and such). Now those Brotherhood mooks will never dare to disturb you anymore while you chill out with your buddy Danse!
[list]
[*]Missile, Broadsider
[*]Large Vehicles, Vertibird Crash, ...
[*]Behemoth Slam and Stomp
[/list]
[b]Large explosions[/b] knock [b]all NPCs[/b] down, including those normally immune to staggering. Use these if you really need to loose that Deathclaw that is chasing you for the last ten minutes.
[list]
[*](Mini) Nukes, Nuka Grenades, Quantum Thirst Zapper
[*]Artillery and Homing Beacon (which uses the Fat Man Explosion)
[/list]
Energy explosives like Pulse and Plasma Grenades, but also the Molotov, aren't affected by Explosion Knockdown, since they don't seem to exert an excessive force on the victims (for me, at least).

Optionally, you can enable knockdown for the player via MCM, and change whether wearing Power Armor should make the player immune to knockdowns. This is not recommended though since the camera forces to 3rd person on every knockdown, potentially causing problems like stuck camera (at least on my end). You can also turn off the knockdown effect anytime and adjust the knockdown chances of each tier (they're 100% by default).

As in update 1.5, you can turn off friendly fire against non-hostiles (they will respond to your explosion though and turn hostile) and your companions in the MCM.

Watch the videos to get an idea how the mod works in-game!

[b][center][size=4]Compatibility[/size][/center]
[/b]Conflicts with mods that edits the same explosion records. Mod added explosions also need patching. The base plugin only covers vanilla explosions. Patches for the following mods are included in the FOMOD:
[list]
[*]Better Explosion Redux
[*]Wasteland Imports
[*]Remote Explosives 
[*]True Frags
[*]RPG-7V2
[*]M79 Grenade Launcher standalone
[/list][u]All plugins are marked as ESL. [/u]

To patch custom explosions yourself, fill the object effect field with one of the knockdown enchantments (or add the knockdown magic effect to the existing enchantment) and fill the Placed Object field with one of the temporary xmarkers.

[center][size=4][b]Known issues[/b][/size][/center]
None currently. Any bug reports and/or improvement suggestions are welcome! Just leave a note in the corresponding sections and I'll try to answer :)
modInfo.name: Explosion Knockdown
modInfo.summary: Explosives now can knock enemies off their feet.

fileInfo.description: Heavy weapons
fileInfo.name: Manufacturing Extended expanded

modInfo.author: Crazy sam10
modInfo.description:
Alright, I've had to overhaul the description page due to the most recent update, which is a major overhaul.

This mod now adds the following:
*All DLC Support for ammo machines and the ballistic weapon machine.
*A Chem machine.
*A "Nuka-Loom" machine.
*New Textures
*Tweaked ammo recipes from Manufacturing Extended.
*Armour machines allowing the construction of full armour sets.

That's right. This mod builds upon the mod, Manufacturing Extended, by Kentington by adding and tweaking where he left off. Firstly, it's added the DLC ammo in to the base ammo machine, now called the Ballistic Ammo Machine. It has also added some new machines, the much requested Chem station, and the Energy Weapon ammo machine. As of right now, only the Ballistic ammo machine has its unique texture, but that is scheduled to change as the mod grows. It should also be noted while this builds upon Manufacturing Extended, it is [b]not [/b]required to use this mod. So if you're only after the DLC support, then this mod works just as well on its own.

I have also played around with a few of the recipes that Kentington had provided when making the ammo because I felt they didn't fit. Such an example is replacing the copper in Plasma Cartridges to plastic, because they look more plastic than coppery.

The chem machine at present only has base game chems, nothing from DLC. But it does allow the creation of Med-X, Rad-X and Buffout, recipes not in the base game. The Energy Weapon ammo machines does what it says on the box, and it now allows the creation of flares and fusion cores. All with balancing of course.

Huge thanks to Cartman1975 to helping me figure out how to add recipes, as well as making me the new textures. As well as Kentington for making the original Manufacturing Extended mod.

[center][/center][u][b][center]Recommended mods[/center][/b][/u][list]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16810/?]Growable wild plants[/url] - Great for growing plants for the chem machine such as brain fungus and hubflower.
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15429/?]Manufacturing Extended[/url] - Goes without saying really.  This mod builds upon said mod, so I recommend it if you don't yet have it. Just ensure this mod is loaded over it however, as this mod fixes a few bugs that one had.
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/14996/?]Worthwhile Eyebot Pods[/url] - Great for getting components for the manufacturing machines. Especially lead and fertilizer.
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/16040/?]Power Armour Forge[/url] - Adds machines for all 4 power armour types. Saves myself having to make these machines.
[/list]
[center][u][b]Load Order[/b][/u][/center]
Thanks to GenericFallout for finding this out.

Working Load Order for Manufacturing Extended Expanded:
--------------------------------------------------------------
Your .esms (as you can't really move them...)

Amorsmith Extended.esp

ManufacturingExtended.esp (Kentington's mod)
DLC items to manufacturing.esp (from this mod)

<.esps that add/change ITEMS you can make (Armor, weapons, and such)

ValdacilsItemSorting-00-ValsPicks-DLCVersion-VanillaWeight.esp (Your ViS picks might change the name here)

<.esps that change/add settlers (Better Settlers, Don't Call me Settler, those kinds of mods)

Radrose Usability Enhancements.esp
Radrose -Valdacil Patch - Armorsmith Extended.esp
Radrose - Vladacil Patch - SettlersRename.esp

<.esps with regards to your workshop/settlements

Scrap Everything... if you use it! (j/k, it should already be dead-last )
---------------------------------------------------------------------

This load-order MIGHT work for you, if you use AWKCR, a bit of AE, some settlermods, and the ViS/DEF_Inv/Radrose package.

YOUR mileage may vary.

Of course, I also highly recommend using LOOT as well.
modInfo.name: Manufacturing Extended expanded
modInfo.summary: Adds multiple new additions and tweaks to Manufacturing Extended. Such as DLC support and Chem machines!

fileInfo.changelog_html: Increased power armor walking speed and power armor sneaking
fileInfo.name: Immersive Movement Tweaks

modInfo.author: Hamper
modInfo.description:
[b]UPDATE:
Now also included in my [/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/45944][b]Complimentary Gameplay Enhancements[/b][/url][b]﻿ mod, give it a look!
[/b]

This is what I feel is the most realistic, fun and immersive way to tweak the movement speeds.

Your character now actually feels like he/she has some weight behind his/her movement, like in recent 2020 games.

You are now running around 10-15% slower than vanilla. You are walking 10-20% faster though.
One-handed weapons slow you less than two-handed weapons. Backward speed is reduced, sideways is slightly reduced.
Power armor does not become much slower when unholstering any weapon, since it is a powerful machine.

Includes no NPC movements edits, since that is now known to cause fps drops and quest bugs.
Includes the sprint stutter fix, so sprint is max 470.

Give it a try. Safe to install/uninstall mid-playthrough.
modInfo.name: Immersive Movement Speed - 2020 Style
modInfo.summary:
This tweaks the movement of the player and power armor to be more realistic.
You are now slightly slower, 2handed is slower than 1handed. Backwards and sideways movement are slightly slower than forward.
Everything balanced to not be too slow either.
Power armor are more consistent in speed.
(Includes the fps stutter sprint fix

fileInfo.description: Latest (DLC) version. Includes a Galactron roboid health bugfix [thanks to Nexus member @zappiron]. Only applicable to the DLC version of the mod.
fileInfo.name: Stronger Robots - Synths - Turrets v1.1.1

modInfo.author: KeyC0de
modInfo.description:
[b][size=3][img]http://i67.tinypic.com/5c0gfl.jpg[/img][/size]

[size=3]Were you always bothered by the weakness of the robots in Fallout games? [/size]
[size=3]I feel that a robot, even the most simple robot, should be formidable. [/size]
[size=3]Consider that it's basically full plated armor, with no weak points (especially the combat robots). [/size]
[size=3]It can't be bargained with. It can't be reasoned with. It doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. [/size]
[size=3]And (if provoked) it absolutely will not stop, EVER, until you are dead. [/size]

[size=3]Now only very capable adventurers (or other robots) should mess with a combat robot, or synth. [/size]
[size=3]Which means having power armor would definitely be useful. I strongly recommend [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2249/?]WIPAG[/url][size=3] mod for some proper Power Armor gearing. [/size]

[size=3]A sentry bot should now be pretty much the toughest (non-Boss) opponent you can face in the wasteland. Well, it's a monstrous nuclear powered ([b][size=3]judging from the explosion)[/size][/b] electro-mechanical [/size][color=#cc0000][size=4]DEATH machine![/size][/color][size=3] It deserves all the bonuses. [/size]


[size=3][img]http://i64.tinypic.com/20pbuc5.jpg[/img][/size]

[size=3]In case you didn't realize from the intro, this mod makes all robots SUPAPOWERFUL, but not ridiculously so. I believe they are now as strong as a (Fallout) robot should be. [/size]

[size=3]Specifically all roboids get the following benefits: [/size]
[/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x4 health [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 damage resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]75+ unarmed damage (where applicable)[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]Sole exception to the damage and energy resistance bonuses is the robobrain race. 
That's because they are too "exposed", as one can easily shoot their "brains" [i]clean off[/i]. 

The Sentry race of Robots gets the following benefits instead: 
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x8 health [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x4 damage resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]Double damage output to all its ranged damage dealers (from its miniguns to rockets etc) [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x4 unarmed damage[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x1.25 scaling of model dimensions[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]
All synths get the following benefits: 
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x2 health[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 damage resistance[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]75+ unarmed damage (where applicable)[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]Coursers get all the synth's benefits and in addition:
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance[/size][/b]
[/list][b][size=3]
All turrets (which are completely ridiculous in vanilla) get the following benefits: 
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=3]x10 health[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 damage resistance[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x2 energy resistance[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x3 base damage output[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]x1.4 increased range [/size][/b]
[/list][size=3][b]Turrets were positioned there to cover the area for a long time. Now they should do that more effectively. [/b]
[b]They are also relatively rare which compensates for the big bonuses. [/b]


[b][img]http://i66.tinypic.com/21ctfe8.jpg[/img][/b]

[b][size=3]Added new Non-DLC version fully updated. [/size][/b]

[color=#ff7700][u]v1.1 Released[/u]![/color]

[b]New Features: [/b]
[list]
[*][b][size=3]Tweaked Sentry Bot leveled lists such that their loot will be MUCH more rich to reward those who manage to defeat them. Their prowess and scarcity has been accounted for this. [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]Increased Sentry Bot Action Points, Action Point Rate & Carry Weight [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3]Adjusted Sentry Bot overheating to occur less often [/size][/b]
[*][size=3][b]Added another Sentry loadscreen appropriate for the occasion. If you spot it you can mention it in a comment if you want. [/b][/size]
[*][b][size=3]Misc small tweaks to Sentry's offensive stats [/size][/b]
[/list]
[b]v1.1.1 - Bugfix: [/b]
[list]

[/list]
[b]I suggest everyone to download and use the latest version[/b]


[b][img]http://i66.tinypic.com/2ewo8cj.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]This mod requires Fallout 4 and all DLCs.
An optional non-DLC version is provided.[/b]


[b][img]http://i64.tinypic.com/10eeyy8.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]1. [/b]
[b]Download the appropriate file depending on whether you have all of the DLCs, or none of them.[/b]

[b]2. [/b]
[b]Install with NMM / MO, [/b]
[b]or manually [/b]
[b]by extracting the downloadable archive contents and pasting the "data" folder into the main game folder: ~/Steam/Steamapps/Common/Fallout 4[/b]


[b][img]http://i64.tinypic.com/x4lus0.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]Clearly the mod is incompatible with other mods that alter robots / synths / turrets. [/b]
[b]But it should be compatible with everything else. [/b]

[b]You may have to wait for some in game days for all creatures to be updated (or just start a new game). [/b]


[b][img]http://i63.tinypic.com/2n6zrkj.jpg[/img][/b]

[b]For optimal gameplay, combat & immersion i strongly recommend to use this mod in conjunction with the following: [/b]

[*][b][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27734/?]Fire, Grenades, Explosions Enhanced[/url] : for a realistic overhaul of all fire, grenades, mines, missile weapons, nukes etc. [/size][/b]
[*][b][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/13822/?]Deadlier Deathclaws[/url] : Make deathclaws challenging too with this mod [/size][/b]
[*][size=3][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/27623]Global Damage Multiplier for all Difficulties[/url] : Increased damage output - highly recommended [/b][/size]

modInfo.name: Stronger Robots Synths and Turrets
modInfo.summary: Boosts robot, synth and turret attributes. Sentries become proper robotic sentinels of great power.

modInfo.author: MG
modInfo.description:
[center]
[font=Comic Sans MS][size=4][b]Realistic Melee Range[/b][/size][/font]

[font=Arial]Several edits to melee range for both player and npcs. The game default setting is far beyond realism, which basically makes a machete to an invisible long spear and enemies can kill you from the air. It is extremely immersion breaking and also difficult to predict and dodge. If you are playing a difficulty that you can only take 1 or 2 hits before going down, this is exactly what you want in your load order.[/font]


[font=Comic Sans MS][size=4][b]Disable Enemy Killmove[/b][/size][/font]

[font=Arial]The optional file is made for Frost users mainly, what it does is disabling Human enemies' killmove. The default game setting is that if one hit takes out more than 50% player's hp, there is a chance a killmove will be triggered. Left killmove enabled basically makes melee combat in Frost frustrating as enemy will constantly execute you even you have a lot of health. This mod gives you the chance to fight back even though you still gonna die a lot, in a satisfying way at least. Bigger enemies such as Death claw left untouched as they are supposed to kill you in one hit.


[/font][font=Comic Sans MS][size=4]Compatibility[/size][/font]

Some edits to game default records, no script involved, should not cause any problems. Put as low as possible in your loader for maximum compatibility.
  [/center]
modInfo.name: Realistic melee range and killmove (Frost supported)
modInfo.summary: Several edits to melee range for both player and npcs. The game default setting is far beyond realism, which basically makes a machete to an invisiable long spear and enemies can kill you from the air. This mod changed that.

fileInfo.description: [img=right]http://i.giphy.com/g3pDikSjbmMh2.gif[/img] New in 1.3: [center] [/center]   [center] [/center] - Improvements to cover-side switching responsiveness [center] [/center] - Improvements to right crouched cover camera settings [center] [/center] - Major improvements in controller support for side-switching [center] [/center] - Support for direct FO4Hotkeys integration [center] [/center] - Misc improvements [center] [/center]   [center] [/center]  [center] [/center]   [center] [/center] Existing users: [center] [/center] After installing 1.3, make sure to open the Config once for the update to be applied BEFORE entering cover! 1.3 will apply new default camera settings that will replace your custom settings (if you have changed them). If you have them, re-apply your custom camera settings after upgrading!
fileInfo.name: Take Cover 1.3 BETA

modInfo.author: registrator2000
modInfo.description:
[line]

[size=12][center][font=Courier New]TAKE COVER[/font][/size]
[font=Verdana][size=5]Bringing 3rd-person cover to Fallout 4![/size][/font][/center]

[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/g3pDikSjbmMh2.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](Pop out of cover by aiming down sights.)[/size][/font][/center]
[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ About ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Take cover behind objects and automatically lean out to shoot when you aim down sights!
I've always found taking cover to be inadequate in Fallout 4. In first person, if you tried to utilize cover tactically, you'd be staring at a blank wall most of the time. In third person, all you can do is crouch behind some rock or furniture, occasionally walk out, and hope enemy bullets don't hit you.

This mod hopes to give you a true cover mechanic.

Integrating third-person cover hasn't been a trivial task at all. Thank you for your patience and support![/font]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ How to Use ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]OPTION 1. AUTOMATIC/INTEGRATED MODE[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=4]☢ [/size] With your weapon drawn, sprint into a wall to take cover behind it.
[size=4]☢ [/size] [Beta version only] Double tap the forwards movement key to enter cover. 
[/font]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]OPTION 2. HOTKEY MODE[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Activate assigned hotkey to enter cover mode. 
[/font]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Both automatic mode and hotkey activation can be used interchangeably.[/font]

[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/1xrLCzZp0Vx2E.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](Sprint into a wall to take cover behind it.)[/size][/font][/center]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Details ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]HOW TO CHOOSE YOUR COVER[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]You have two cover options - a standing cover, and a crouching cover for low objects.
When entering cover,
[size=4]☢ [/size]Point down (crosshair below eye level) to enter a crouching cover.
[size=4]☢ [/size]Point up (crosshair above eye level) to enter a standing cover.[/font]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]HOW TO EXIT COVER[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Move backwards to exit cover. The activator also can be used to exit cover (default) or configured to swap between standing and crouching covers.[/font]

[b][font=Courier New][color=#6d9eeb][size=4][u]HOW TO VAULT OVER LOW OBJECTS[/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]In crouching cover only,
[size=4]☢ [/size] Hold forward and activate the hot-keyed Take Cover activator.
[size=4]☢ [/size] [Beta version only] Double tap the forwards movement key. (Turn on this option in the Config)
Make sure Cover Vault is enabled in Configuration - it's off by default.[/font]

[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/jxtcxTfGLAjAI.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](YES YOU CAN COVER-VAULT)[/size][/font][/center]

[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Installation ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Install the mod with your mod manager or manually by copying the files in the archive into your Fallout 4 Data folder.

Once installed, on first load, you will see a message box saying that Take Cover is active. If you don't, then the mod was not installed correctly. See [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Fallout_4_Mod_Installation]here[/url] for instructions on how to set up Fallout 4 for modding.

You will receive Take Cover and Take Cover Config in the AID section of your inventory.

At this point, the cover system is active. Sprint towards a wall with your weapon drawn to take cover.

You can also hotkey the Take Cover activator to a quick-key in your favorites to quickly enter and exit cover at any point in time, or use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/11664/]FO4 Hotkeys[/url] to bind it to any key on your keyboard or any extra mouse buttons you may have. I highly recommend binding Take Cover to Shift+Aim with FO4Hotkeys so that you have cover available at the touch of your mouse.

Use Take Cover Config to configure various aspects of the cover system, including whether sprint-to-cover is turned on and whether cover-vaulting is enabled.[/font]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Notes ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]
[size=4]☢ [/size]It wasn't easy to do, but yes - it works great with VATS! VATS traditionally roots you to the spot and gives you no movement control, but this mod lets you "pop-out" of cover even in VATS. After entering VATS, tap V (view-change key) to pop out of cover. You automatically re-enter cover when VATS ends!

[size=4]☢ [/size]Did you know that Fallout 4 has [url=https://imgur.com/a/EGwRQ]first-person cover[/url]?[/font]


[center][img]http://i.giphy.com/lC9tAjmxeytR6.gif[/img]
[font=Courier New][size=1](Vanilla VS Mod)[/size][/font][/center]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Known Issues ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Weapons switched while in cover using a favorites hotkey will be invisible. Switch weapons with your Pip-Boy, or pop into VATS and back out.[/font]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] You cannot move directly rightwards in cover. To move right, you must move diagonally front-right or back-right, or you can face the right and move front.[/font]
[size=4]☢ [/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode] Not compatible with melee weapons, heavy weapons (miniguns) and sniper rifles that bring you into first person scope.

Without animation tools, it will be difficult to address the first and second issues as these are limitations in Bethesda's animation files.
If you are an animator and you'd like to help with the animations, please do get in touch!

Integrating third-person cover hasn't been a trivial task at all. Thank you for your patience and support!
[/font]


[center][color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ Video Showcase ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Thanks to Mudcups for being so amazingly quick to have a video up![/font]

[youtube]zg2dIh_N3Xw[/youtube][youtube]urljxpsdBDQ[/youtube][/center]


[color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ FAQ ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

Q: What's the best way to use cover?

A: [color=#cccccc]Read [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/articles/263/]Protips for Taking Cover![/url] for some tips to enhance your cover experience.[/color]

Q: Does this work in first-person?

A: [color=#cccccc]You have an option in the Config to set whether you want a first-person sprint to activate cover. It's off by default. If turned on, you will automatically enter third-person and go into cover when sprinting up against a wall in first-person. From 1.1 onwards, you'll also automatically return to first-person when leaving cover if you entered from it.[/color]

Q: Sprint-to-cover is not sensitive enough / too sensitive! (entering cover when you don't actually want to)

A: [color=#cccccc]Every system is different, and you might want to tweak the sensitivity of cover-entering yourself! I've provided a couple of preset options in the Config - you have Default, High, and Very High to specify how still you have to be while sprinting before you enter cover.

You can tweak these values beyond the presets that I've given with this console command:
[font=Courier New]cqf cover setsensitivity <your desired value here>[/font]

The preset values in the Config are:
Default: 2
High: 10
Very High: 20

To make entering cover less sensitive, you can type [font=Courier New]cqf cover setsensitivity 0.5[/font] to lower the sensitivity below the default.[/color]

Q: Blind-firing?

A: [color=#cccccc]Yes! You can blind-fire around cover by just hitting the fire button without aiming down sights.[/color]

Q: How do I see if the mod is working for me?

A: [color=#cccccc]Compare your cover experience with those in the linked video showcases! That's what you can expect from Take Cover.[/color]

Q: I want to uninstall Take Cover.

A: [color=#cccccc]Run the console command [font=Courier New]cqf cover uninstall[/font]. This will unregister all events and prepare the mod for safe removal.[/color]




[center][color=#f6b26b][font=Courier New][size=5][b]★ More Videos ★[/b][/size][/font][/color]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Tyrannicon features Take Cover (beta) at [url=https://youtu.be/H2G5zyy7BO8?t=1m23s]1:23[/url].[/font]

[youtube]H2G5zyy7BO8[/youtube][youtube]cWSE4d23K5A[/youtube][/center]

[line]

[u]What I did:[/u]
[list]
[*][size=2]Reduced 4k textures to 2k (with exceptions).[/size]
[*][size=2]Reduced 2k textures to 1k (with exceptions).[/size]
[*][size=2]Reduced 1k normals and speculars to 512 (with exceptions).[/size]
[*][size=2]Kept 1k diffuse at 1k resolution.[/size]
[*][size=2]Reduced 512 Terrain to 256 resolution.[/size]
[*][size=2]Kept all other 512 and under at normal resolution.[/size]
[*][size=2]Changed lightness, sharpened, reduced resolution, desaturated, replaced color, selective color, changed hue, changed saturation, black and white, HDR toning  and/or other things to all files.[/size]
[*][size=2]Converted non-alpha files that were saved as alpha to non-alpha.[/size]
[*][size=2]Saved non-alphas as BC1 , BC3 or BC5. Saved alphas as BC3 or BC7 formats.[/size]
[*][size=2]All files have been sharpened.[/size]
[*][size=2]Generated new mipmaps for all files that have mipmaps.[/size]
[*][size=2]All 40,962 textures have been modified and saved with Photoshop.[/size]
[*][size=2]Any files I keep at the original resolution I still modify in Photoshop.[/size]
[*][size=2]Archived all files in DDS optimized archives with custom single mip chunk area.[/size]
[/list]
Mainly used Photoshop with Intel Texture Works plugin.

Batched what I could using a programmable mouse, PS4 controller, wireless mouse and keyboard.

I did the rest manually.

I did this all from bed, doing what I could, when I could. (I have a autoimmune disease with heart and lung problems.)

[size=3]Please do not use in any repacks.[/size]

Features:
- event history on mods and plugins screen
- option to limit download bandwidth used by Vortex
- option to automatically install mods after download
- option to bring Vortex to foreground when starting a download from the browser
- option to copy files into downloads when using "install from file"
- ability to search (mod) conflict editor or to only show unresolved conflicts
- ability to track/untrack mods
- ability to batch-edit mod rules
- ability to sort categories alphabetically
- ability to merge multiple mods into one
- ability to change mod highlight (the user-defined colored icon column) on multiple mods at once
- ability to stop managing a game (effectively removing all profiles for the game, use with care!)
- ability to remove related mods (e.g. other versions of the selected mod)
- ability to create windows shortcuts to start Vortex with a specific profile (and game) directly
- ability to filter mods by author
- can now show (and group by) mod type as a column in the mod list
- can now start filtering in tables with ctrl+f
- can now use .jpg and .ico files for tool icons
- can now use filter category column by arbitrary text
- profiles can now be given a description
- can now set up Vortex to shut down the computer once all active downloads finish
- button in downloads page to directly open the download folder
- mod description and author can now be edited
- (gamebryo games) support for "ghost"ed plugins
- (gamebryo games) displaying bash tags
- (gamebryo games) added column showing whether a savegame is an auto-/quick- or manual save
- (gamebryo games) warning if using incompatible archives (BSA/BA2 intended for a different game)
- (gamebryo games) notification about "mod contains multiple plugins" now has button to show those plugins
- (Resident Evil 3) support added
- (API) requireExtension can now specify a version pattern to limit which versions of an extension are compatible
- (API) game extensions may now provide their own mechanism to determine the game version
- (API) more convenient & robust functionality to deal with load ordering for games
- (API) support for game stubs (required so we can turn bundled into separate extensions)
- (API) support for multiline input in standardised dialogs
- (API) can now query whether a game store is installed

- various errors caused by system/filesystem corruption will now have more informative messages
- ensure qbms temp paths are writable
- (Fallout 3) will now also report incompatible archives
- (Witcher 3) improved priority assignment method
- (Pillars of Eternity 2) support for XBox Game Pass edition
- (Untitled Goose Game) moved to using BepInEx library
- (Mount & Blade 2) improved auto sort algorithm to use BUTRLoader metadata

Bugfixes:
- crash under certain circumstances if extension tries to report error
- rare exception upon closing Vortex
- attempt to install BepInEx when game not active (yet)
- (Mount & Blade 2) crash on load order page if can't iterate staging folder

Bugfixes:
- failure to load modules (e.g. winapi.node) if vc runtime not installed
- mod cycle graph dialog crashing when removing/flipping rules
- (rare) exception on first start of a new Vortex version
- (rare) error messages about script extender errors linking to wrong log file
- no placeholder displayed in Dashboard banner if nexus account has no avatar
- window position not aways restored correctly
- exception upgrading certain game extensions if the user is no longer managing that game
- error if checking for updates and mod from the 'site' domain installed
- the "Games" tab offered non-functional options for some games
- missing meta-information for locally imported archives
- no ticks in download graph (if bandwidth limit had been set and later unset)
- (BepInEx) injector installer error when bix package is missing unitydoorstop
- (RE Engine) incorrect validation error claiming filePaths missing in game arcs
- (RE Engine) crash during validation operations if mod dir can't be found
- (DMC5/RE2/RE3) "missing filepath" errors due to case insensitive files
- (Witcher 3) crash if user removes active profile during LO presort
- (Mount & Blade 2) fixed startup crash when mods with invalid metadata are installed

Improvements:
- clarified notification about automatic application state backup (e.g. how old the backup is)
- errors installing script extenders now get reported
- ability to check for BepInEx pack updates
- (DMC5/RE2/RE3) no longer offer usvfs deployment (if that extension is installed)
